review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Great location with easy access to transportation to get to all areas of the city. All staff was helpful, friendly and eager to assist. Full service, clean market across the street for extras. Concierge set up a tour which was great. Food was excellent . Rooms were good sized and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Good size rooms. Location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was pricey for everyday, maybe just fruit or Danish for a slight fee with the complimentary coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location...1 block from transportation to anywhere in the city, and 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location, dated property, no hot water
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location close to Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were excellent and gave us a room straightaway even though we arrived in the morning. Nice bar with happy hour cocktails. Room was on the small side and it was difficult to get hot water without running tap and shower for ages.

review.title: Nice time in San Fran
review.reviewText: Well located for Fisherman's Wharf experience. Rooms are small but adequate. Place is clean & staff is friendly & helpful. You get free coffee & tea, in the morning, which is nice.
review.negativeRemarks: It could use a renovation, which they told us will begin in Jan 2017.
review.locationRemarks: All the Fisherman's Wharf stuff (Boudin's, Pier 39, Boat Tours of Bay, Ripley's) & within easy walking distance of Lombard St.

review.title: Great Place In The Bay Area
review.reviewText: This hotel has very friendly and courteous staff.  The location is excellent.  You are in walking distance to anything you wish to do along the famous bay area, from Fisherman's Wharf to Alcatraz.  The trolleys are just a few blocks away.  The hardest thing is getting to the Golden Gate Bridge, but even that is pretty easy if you take a tour bus or even a city bus (bus 30 with a transfer to 28 which takes you right to the bridge).  I definitely will use the Best Western Tuscan again.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Joyce-

Thank you for staying with us!  Unfortunately traffic around the bay area can be a bit difficult at times, that's why we encourage public transportation whenever possible for travelers.  We hope you will come back and visit San Francisco again!

Cheers,
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.reviewText: This was just an overnight stay.   If you are coming from the airport stay on 101.  Plan extra time from the airport (it took us 2 hours).

managementResponses.response:
Hey Traveler-

Thank you for the review.  We are excited to let you know we will be doing a complete renovation of the hotel next year, be sure to come back and see us next year after the renovation is completed!

Cheers-
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hallway ,the rug, the paint need to be updated.

managementResponses.response:
Hey Traveler-

Thank you for the great 5 star review!  As you mentioned our location is so close to all of the great activities in Fisherman's Wharf from Pier 39 to the Alcatraz launch there is a lot to do. Please come back and see us again soon!

Cheers-
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Everything was great.  Staff was very helpful and location was great.
review.locationRemarks: Within easy walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and all activities

managementResponses.response:
Hey Traveler-

Thank you for the great 5 star review!  I may be biased but I think our staff is awesome also! I will be sure to share your accolades with MJ and Nelson.  We look forward to having you back next time you are in town.

Cheers!
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.title: Close to many amenities
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our stay. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, Nelson was extremely friendly and Mary Ann was helpful too. We were happy to see how close the hotel was to Pier 39 and how easy it was to maneuver around with our little toddler in tow. We visit the city very often and will be coming back the next time we're in town. Parking was a little overpriced, but the valet guys were super friendly and great helpers for when my husband needed the car brought around. Thanks for the great experience!

managementResponses.response:
Hey Traveler-

Thank you for the great 5 star review!  It's great to read you loved our location and staff, we look forward to having you back next time you are in San Francisco.

Cheers!
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.title: Awesome location!
review.reviewText: It was close to many tourist attractions, easy checkin and great staff! We'll be back!

managementResponses.response:
Hi Nick-

Thank you for the 4 star review!  It's great to hear you enjoyed our location.  Parking is based on supply and demand in San Francisco we have limited parking spaces, we always encourage guests to use public transportation as we have several convenient modes to get travelers to and from the airport.

Warm Regards,
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.title: Easy walk to Fishermans Whatf and Cable Car
review.reviewText: Convenient location and easy in and out parking. However, parking is expensive and cost more to park than the daily cost of the rental car.

managementResponses.response:

Thank you for taking time to share you experience with other travelers.  We value all of our guests feedback and use it to improve our operation.  I am so incredibly disappointed that we missed and opportunity to surprise and delight you for your birthday.  It is truly our pleasure and enjoyment to celebrate special occasions with our guests and I am sorry that this did not occur.  Next time you stay with us we would love to make it up to you!  

Cheers-
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.reviewText: Pleasant hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf with comfortable, clean rooms and efficient, friendly service.  I was there on my birthday and my son talked with the hotel desk staff to have flowers delivered to me but it was not done so I was put off by that but would stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf nearby as is the Powell cable car, makes it easy to walk or ride around without having to use expensive cabs.

managementResponses.response:
Hey Traveler-

Thank you for the review.  When you mention internet is an add one after the first day, I am not certain what you are referring to.  We offer complimentary internet daily for all hotel guests, I apologize if this was not communicated to you.

Warm Regards,
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.reviewText: Parking at $55.00 a day is just nuts. Internet access is an add on after the first day.

managementResponses.response:
Hey Traveler- 

Thank you for the great 5 star review! We are delighted to read that our staff took such great care of you and the accommodations exceeded your expectations.  We are lucky to be in a great location that allows for our guests to easily walk to so many local places. We look forward to having you back in the future.

Cheers-

review.title: Very nice hotel close to the Fisherman Warf
review.reviewText: Just ahd one night to stay in town and the rating's were great so choose this hotel and loved the cleanness and close to the Warf.
review.positiveRemarks: Very Clean and staff was friendly and helpful
review.locationRemarks: In walking distance of a lot of place on the Pier

managementResponses.response:
Hey Emma-

Thank you for taking time to write a review upon your departure from The Tuscan.  A good nights sleep is one of the most important parts of travel and I am disappointed to read that ambient city noise prevented you from doing so.  Next time you stay with us please request an interior room, unfortunately these rooms do no have a view but they tend to be more quiet.  Our staff is some of the best in the industry and I am delighted that they took such great care of you and made you feel at home.

Cheers-
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.title: Central hotel
review.reviewText:
The Tuscan is a lovely looking hotel.
Our room was on the front of the hotel and so it was noisy at night and the windows were not double glazed to prevent noise from disturbing my sleep.
We did not have breakfast here but had dinner one night in the adjoining restaurant which was expensive but we had the family pasta meal which made it better value.
The location of the hotel was good for the main attractions near Fisherman's wharf and a short walk into downtown San Francisco.
The staff here were very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Windows at the front need to be better glazed to stop street noise disturbing sleep.

managementResponses.response:
Hey Alison-

Thank you for the great 5 star review!  It's great to hear that we exceeded your expectations and were your favorite hotel during your travels.  We look forward to having you stay with us next time you are in town.

Cheers!
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the hotel.  Out of all 4 hotels that I stayed at on my vacation the Best Western Tuscan was my favorite.  We were there for 2 nights.  It was walking distance to all of the tourist attractions, the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The internet was great and when we went to the next hotel we wished that we were back at the Best Western.

managementResponses.response:
Hey Traveler-

Thank you for the review.  It's great to hear that you enjoyed our location.  Our goal is never to mislead our guests, it's disappointing to read that the room accommodations did not suite your needs. We do hope you will give us another try next time you are in San Francisco.

Warm Regards,
Nikki Carlson
General Manager

review.title: Room Size

review.negativeRemarks: Accuracy of room description.

review.title: Clean, comfortable, good location.
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel to be greeted by Ed, who was the friendliest receptionist we encountered during stays at eight hotels while on a road trip from Seattle to San Francisco. The hotel, which is just a couple of blocks away from Pier 39, is nice and our room was clean, bright and comfortable. All the staff we had dealings with were pleasant and friendly. I might have awarded it a five if the wifi hadn't been rubbish, though I wouldn't let that put me off staying here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, great location, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Sort out the wifi, guys.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, shops and attractions close by. Just along the road from the cable car stop.

review.title: Very convenient to all the touristy San Fran stuff
review.reviewText: Great staff and great location. It was close to downtown, the Wharf, running trails and the Golden Gate bridge.
Waling distance to fisherman's warf. Great restaurant, great service. Pleasant, friendly staff. Room was clean and roomy enough. View of the ships from our window. I would stay here again.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Warf.
review.reviewText: What is nice about this hotel is it is close to Fisherman's Warf, and we didn't really need a hotel.

review.title: Mother and daughter birthday celebration
review.reviewText: Just a few things to tweak would make it a great place, for the price
review.positiveRemarks: Good bedding, linens and towels.  Close to the Wharf.  3rd floor was quiet, for a hotel. Nice bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't run credit card (pended status), with projected costs outside the stated charges, on arrival.  Keep at LEAST one elevator running at all times.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is available from this location.

review.title: Great Location! Great Staff!
review.reviewText: We were greeted by Anthony who gave us excellent Customer Service and he was hilarious, made us feel like we were his priority. Loved that it was walking distance to a lot of what we wanted to do. The only negative was that our window faced a wall that was orange, which my husband pointed out was my favorite color, so there was definitely a positive in that negative.  LOL!

review.title: Very nice great service and close to restaurants
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel and the location. It's near lots of restaurants and attractions.

review.title: You should stay here.
review.reviewText: Awesome location, super comfortable if small room, helpful concierge, opportune outdoor seating & pool.  Did I mention the great location?
review.positiveRemarks: Small room but very well appointed including fridge.  Comfortable bed & bath.
review.negativeRemarks: In room coffee -- 1 pack -- really?  1 of 2 elevators in our area was broken; ever a problem but I could foresee an issue. A bit expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to most things in SF.  2 blocks from water -- just enough to insulate from the noise at night.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Room was clean but small. Great location  - close to wharf and dining.  Helpful staff. Wifi was weak. Restaurant had great food.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman  wharf. Pier 39. Close to tour pickups.

review.title: Convirnent
review.reviewText:
Good and close to all!. We enjoyed 
having breakfast at two different 
locations with in walking distance!

review.title: Nice hotel and centrally located
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our accommodations and will definitely stay here again. The hotel room was extremely clean and this is very important to me. The hotel stuff was wonderful and very helpful. We had a really great experience and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Right at Fishermans Wharf. Hotel is older and dated. Rooms are pretty beaten up. Common area are dated. Taken a lot of wear and tear with little improvements in recent times.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, close and neatly situated. Convenient too.

review.title: Enjoyable Stay near Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and Cable Car access. Great staff encounters as well as valet attendants. I will definitely keep this place marked for possible future stays.

review.title: Needs to be updated
review.reviewText: Not enough places to charge electronics that were in working order.
review.negativeRemarks: Nicer people at the front desk

review.title: Perfect distance from the sights of the city
review.reviewText: We felt safe during our entire stay at this wonderful Hotel! Check-in was a breeze and all employees were incredibly Pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Nice location and pleasant staff
review.reviewText: Good access to Fisherman's  Wharf and other sights.

review.title: Great kocation
review.reviewText: Room to small and carpets throughout were very dirty. Room had an unpleasant odor? Not pet related. Bed was fab!!! Staff great! Thanks for being dog friendly!!! Only one elevator was a great inconvenience at check out!!!

review.title: Not impressed & pricey
review.reviewText:
I thought to give it a try staying at this hotel, since it has a mix reviews and it was a last minute trip. Hotel is dated, looks dirty, due to old carpet on the halls. Our room was ok, first thing we noticed bathroom door wasn't working (wouldn't closed properly & lock was broken) called front desk someone came right away to try to fix it but it wasn't an easy fix. Door was fix the next day. Parking was very pricey we paid $65 per day due that our car is an SUV. :(
We stayed 2 nights so it was ok, noticed this hotel is pet friendly. Hotel is within walking distance of Fisherman Wharf. Beds were supposed to be Queen size, but I had to verify them with front desk, because they felt like double beds, they are pretty narrow for Queen size.
review.negativeRemarks: Correct bed queen sizes, curtains, cleanness, update carpet & furniture in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman Wharf walking distance, restaurant conveniently next door.

review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly.  The hotel was easy to find and located by San Cruz and only 20 min from Monterey.  The rooms are clean and the breakfast was very good.

review.title: Great staff, excelente Location
review.reviewText: Staff Was very helpful, friendly, and polite at all times. The location was excellent with in walking distance to all the fun and access to more fun. Wifi. Internet room... No cable though.

If you're interested in staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area, this hotel is perfectly situated. It is within a 5-minute walk to the wharf and all of the fantastic offerings, such as restaurants, an array of tours and a little something to take home to remember your trip.

review.title: Dirty, Dirty, DIRTY!!!
review.reviewText: Location is GREAT! Arrived late in the evening. After checking into our room I did the usual bed bug checks and everything was good. Upon further inspection of the room the walls throughout the room and bathroom had mold growing on them, the carpets did not look swept, the bathroom tile floor grout was filthy with a clipped toenail on the floor as an added bonus, the fixtures in the bathroom were rusted from humidity, and the shower was equally disgusting. I would honestly give this hotel 2 stars just because it is in a great location ONLY. I was advised by Expedia, that because it was so late that I should try to hang in there for the night and to do an early check out in the morning so that they could get me another room at a different hotel for the remaining 4 days of my trip. No one slept that night and we wasted almost the entire next day looking for another room and fighting for the remaining 4 days of what we paid upfront for that room. WHAT A JOKE!! This hotel would make for a nice stay if it were taken care of but that is certainly not the case here. Hire a better cleaning staff. It was not a great feeling to be 2000 miles from home with your family and not have a room to stay in. Fortunately it worked out, we found a nice room but had to pay a little more.
review.negativeRemarks: Hire a new cleaning staff to actually CLEAN the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great.

review.reviewText: Great location. Nice little restaurant and bar in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is so expensive!
review.locationRemarks: Near the pier, restaurants,trolley.

review.reviewText: Good and accessible and fine good good good good gpod goos
Great staff and even helped with returning my rental car closer to hotel rather than near airport.

review.title: Great location for tourists.
review.reviewText: We had a great three day stay. It's very walkable area and so was easy to get to the waterfront and cable cars.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking is very expensive when compared to like hotels in Seattle and Portland where we were a few days before.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, hop on hop off bus tours, pier 39, Fishermans Wharf all near by.

review.title: Two blocks from the wharf.  Market and drug store
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable.  Room had refrigerator but no microwave.  Based on price, surprised breakfast was not included.  The only perk was free coffee for a couple of hours each am.
review.negativeRemarks: They should have a complimentary breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from the wharf.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Location is great only 5 min walking to Fishermans Wharf area, lots of restaurants bars and museums and many other entertainment venues.  Overnight parking at hotel kind of expensive at $62 per night other than that great place to stay

review.title: great hotel in a great location

Great hotel in a great location for exploring San Fransisco.
Close enough to all the amenities and facilities at Fishermans Wharf but 2 blocks back back so quiet to rest up. Excellent location to visit all the sites
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Great hotel, very friendly and superb location
review.reviewText:
Only complaint was poor wifi which was a challenge, very slow and kept dropping out.
Otherwise is was really great
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi definitely

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: I was expecting a upper class Hotel for $400. The carpet was very stained and room furnishing was extremely dated. Woke up to the homeless screaming at each other below our window. This place was at best $100 room. Spent a week on California coast and this was the only property I gave a negative review.  Staff was friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Update update update and replace carpet. The rate was very deceiving I was expecting a nice motel not a tired old 1.
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz

review.title: Close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: I requested a room with view but the only view was internal comprising other hotel rooms. The concierge service was very good providing me with a number of options to sightsee on my last day.

review.title: Convenient location and nice hotel
review.reviewText: The Tuscan was in a great location for walking or using public transportation to get around San Francisco.  The room was very comfortable and the staff was always helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfort, reasonable price for location
review.negativeRemarks: A second luggage rack in the room would have been nice (altho we didn't ask).
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf - close to eating, shopping, public transportation, etc.  Pier 39 was just a few blocks away.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Tuscan for one night during a 10-day California vacation. The hotel staff was very friendly (especially Mary Jane) and the room was clean. The hotel was situated where we wanted to be within a few blocks of Fisherman's Wharf. Thus, our primary reason for choosing this hotel was its prime location. We were a little surprised that this Best Western did not even offer a basic continental breakfast (all the other BW hotels we stayed at on our trip did) and that they charge a high fee to park your car in their hotel garage in addition to the room fee which was nearly 3x more than the other BW hotels we stayed in.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer amenities (continental breakfast, no parking fee, upgraded room decor, etc.) provided at other Best Western hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Two or three blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, across the street from a CVS & Safeway, near numerous restaurants.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and a lot of tourist attractions. If your expecting someone to grab your luggage and open doors this is not the place for you. Staff were courteous and helpful. Our stay was enjoyable. Some minor repairs and maintenance needed. The power point in bathroom did not work, the water control in the shower handle fell off.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance
review.locationRemarks: All major tourist attractions

review.title: Close to locations on the wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to the wharf and other connections in the city.  Staff very friendly, and helpful.   Rooms nice and clean.  We had a king room which was small, otherwise everything was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Good location close to the wharf and connections to area sites

review.title: Great location, great price
review.reviewText: Checked in late at night.  I tried to call ahead to tell them, but although a person answered the phone she spent a lot of time telling me she was too busy to take my message about late check in.  In the time it took her to deflect me, she could have accomplished what I needed.  Room was clean, spacious with desk and extra easy chair.  Refrig in room.  Ventilation system (AC and heat) was too loud, but not roaring.  Just hard to ignore and makes a clicking sound when it turns on.  I tried to just turn it off, but it still made the constant noise.  Bed was way too soft for my taste.  I need more support and ended up with some back pain after a 4 night stay.  The room was very clean and spacious for my needs although closet very small and not much drawer space.  So if you were staying for awhile it might be difficult.  Suitcase does not fit in closet.  Water pressure was very good.  Restaurant on premises (with full bar) was very convenient.  Grocery store and pharmacy across street also very useful.  Front desk staff very responsive and knowledgable, and they helped me get back to airport by making all the arrangements for me at no extra charge to me.  They also give you the chance to opt out of daily cleaning.  I think they give you some sort of gift certificate for it, but for me it meant that I could set up a work space and not have the housekeeping staff mess with my set up until I was ready for them.  I loved this option.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, quiet neighborhood.  Great staff.  Great price.
review.negativeRemarks: Squishy bed and noisy HVAC.
review.locationRemarks: Location right at Fisherman's Wharf was great.  They are also very close to streetcar line, bus lines and pedicabs so it's easy to get anywhere.

review.title: A great location if you can find it.
review.reviewText:
We got there early and they checked us in early.  So far, great!  So me and my 2 traveling pals went upstairs to our room.  Three carry ons, one major suitcase and three large purses later we were cramped.  We got out of the room pretty soon though so it was okay for a few days.
The only real complaint was that the hot water was not always hot.  I took one cool shower that was really quick when I could not get warmer water.  Oh well, it makes me appreciate home a little more.
The cleaning staff was great. The concierge was a lot of help getting our tours together for us and the front desk guy, Anthony, was a great help printing out our boarding passes while we waited on a car to take us to the airport.  I would have to say that the staff almost made up for the cold water.  But not quite.
Also the outside signage is awful. I would have to say if your depending on their sign to find them, forget it.  Look for the Sheraton sign and then look for a Ross store and you will locate their place with a small black and white sign that is hard to see, even walking.  We finally decided it looked like a parking garage from the outside
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were comfortable and it is close to the activities and the bus lines.
review.negativeRemarks: We only ate breakfast in the restaurant, but I would not eat breakfast there anymore.
review.locationRemarks: Near Pier 39 and all the neat things to see and do.  Lots of food choices and fun things to do within walking distance.  Shop till you drop!

review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay! Would definitely recommend!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff great hotel 
Only issue to far away from the Castro

review.title: Great hotel very accomodating staff
review.reviewText: We arrived early and hoped to check in early. The staff very graciously found  a room that was ready and allowed us to check in and return our rental car on time. Every step of our stay the stafff was very helpful in providing information and scheduling of shuttles, city transportation and local attractions. The room itself was well done and comfortable. Cleanliness was extraordinary upon arrival and throughout our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location close to the wharf and the friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive but seemed in line with other SF hotels
review.locationRemarks: It ia=s withing easy walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39. the Ghiardelli and Cannery area as well as one of the cable car lines.

review.title: Not as good as rated
review.reviewText: Third time in hotel,last stay  years ago.The hotel is in need of renovation at least the second floor where I stayed.The carpet in the hallway is depressing.On the other hand the beds and pillows are excellent.Great location if not one of the best in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade of facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText:
Great location
Fast check-in
Enjoyed the small lounge
Comfortable bed

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Excellent location within walking distance of Embarcdero and Pier 39. Cable car only two blocks away for direct trip to Union Square and the mall. Restaurants and shopping all close by.
Friendly staff and helpful concierge on hand.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish they provided coffee all day. Breakfast is expensive and the daily parking rate is outrageous!

review.title: Good mid-priced hotel in Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel itself is very nice downstairs. Great bar/restaurant attached.  Room itself was small and didn't have all the normal 4-star accommodations/decor, but not a bad room.  Needs curtains in the rooms because it gets bright early.

review.title: Excellent trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice.  It was close to the water with plenty of places to eat and things to see and do near by.  Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating.  Our room was quite small but that didn't matter too much as we were rarely in it.  We would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel was older but in a perfect location to see the city.  Short walk to everything in Fisherman's Wharf and to a Big Bus stop.  It is noisy at night due to the busy location, but was actually a little quieter than we expected.  I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to SF.

review.title: Best Location for a great Vacation!
review.reviewText: The best time ever for get your clam chowder and sourdough bread fix.  Then take in the salt air with a bay cruise to Sausalito or looking straight up under the Golden Gate bridge!  How about sampling some great vino in the napa valley.  All this great vacation stuff and you never have to drive!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great location to Fishermans wharf enjoyed our stay, clean rooms however on the smaller size which we expected after reading previous reviews. friendly staff. car parking too expensive but had option of 2 other private car parks across the road for half the price for the 3 days.
review.locationRemarks: close to the wharf area and cable cars

review.reviewText: Would recommend to a friend because of the close proximity to the peirs, but the room wasnt very clean (something on the toilet seat, for example) and parking there was an additional $50. Which basically made this a $280 per night hotel. Room was very small.
It was good! A nice place to stay with a great location. Everyone was pretty friendly and everyone we met was a tourist like ourselves.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice location on fisherman's wharf with some great things close by.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really, it was a great stay
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, Golden Gate Bridge/Park, the beach and more.

review.title: Close to Pier 39 only 3 blocks away
review.reviewText: Rooms are small, bath room very small, paid for 4 Star but only received 2.5
review.positiveRemarks: We had stayed here before so we knew the rooms were small, but the place was clean the staff extreamly nice and helpful, this will be our last time
review.negativeRemarks: Outside area was dirty, hallway to room dirty and had musty smell first 2 days, 3rd day either the smell was gone or I became nose blind to it.
review.locationRemarks: Location was the only good thing about the hotel.

review.title: overall a good experience
review.reviewText: They booked us in early. First room stunk but they switched to a better room immediately. Close to fisherman's wharf and a lot of tourist areas.
Overnight parking rates at hotel are high. The rooms are clean but kinda small.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed the location as it is very close to Fisherman's wharf and great restaurants.
Our room was quite small as we expected more based on the price we paid.
However, the staff were excellent and very helpful.

review.title: Hotel in Heart of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all of the things you want to see and do. One and a half blocks from the warf, Alcatraz boat, lots of shops. Walking distance to beach, Golden Gate Bridge views. Park at the Safeway store next door or use the hotel valet. Lots of great restaurants nearby too. Very friendly staff, helpful, clean rooms. Would stay here next time we are in town.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, location. Easy parking, close to all you want to do and see.
review.negativeRemarks: No much.
review.locationRemarks: Warf and shopping just 1 1/2 blocks away. Great restaurants nearby as well as attractions and shops.

review.title: A Peaceful Oasis Near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The Best Western Plus The Tuscan provides friendly and helpful staff along with a cozy, quiet sitting area in the lobby along with refreshing water, coffee and newspapers.  Making our first impression feel as if we had discovered an oasis in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco. We had a very enjoyable experience and would certainly highly recommend this accommodation to family and friends.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff from the minute we drove into the driveway throughout our stay, right up to the minute we departed were very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: Lots of attractions to see. Lots of restaurants. Close to all the action of famous sightseeing opportunities along the Embarcadero.

review.title: Nice city hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff very friendly. Could use more checking staff when backed up. Room was clean and smelled fresh. Bed was very comfortable. 
My only complaint is valet parking attendant in my opinion, should load and unload luggage from vehicle as part of service.

review.title: Great location on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
The staff was excellent!
The room was clean, a bit European in size (small) but comfortable. It was quiet and clean!
Our king size bed may need an upgrade as it felt a bit on the soft side.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was pretty soft.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great for visiting Fisherman's Wharf, the Golden Gate Bridge, riding the cable cars, going to the National Park sites and walking.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, great value!
review.reviewText: From the moment we checked in until we left we had every need met.  The staff was wonderful and friendly, and the rooms were perfect!  The beds were comfortable, the bedding was crisp and clean and the bathroom was impeccable and well stocked with plenty of towels and toiletries. The hotel is two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf so it was super easy to walk to the Wharf and shop, dine, and watch the famous sea lions, or to Ghiradelli Square for fabulous ice cream. We booked a tour of San Francisco and Alcatraz with Gray Line and our departure site was literally one block from the hotel. Right next to Gray Line is the best breakfast place we found (we tried 4 different places). We will absolutely book with this hotel again!
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything, reasonably priced, and super clean.  Also, the lobby is beautiful and there is a full time concierge on from 7:30 - 7:30.
review.negativeRemarks: Expand their breakfast menu in the on-site Pescatore Restaurant to be more kid friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is two blocks away; Ghiradelli is four blocks away, and there you can catch street cars to China Town or Union Square.

photos.caption: Enjoying a cup of coffee in bed!

review.title: Wonderful hotel, Wonderful location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very luxurious for a Best Western and the location was perfect!  Very clean, nice, just 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf and a block away from where all our day tours left from.  Staff went above and beyond.  The concierge was a huge resource and planned a last minute day tour for us that was actually one of the most memorable parts of our trip.  The only thing was that the bed was a bit small, but it was very comfortable and didn't cause any problems for us.

review.title: Hotel is in a good location, close to the beach et
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at The Tuscan, it was close to the wharf area n the room was clean, bed was fantastic, however the room was a little small.  The staff were friendly n helpful also, top spot.

review.title: Great place near Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: We had to be at Pier 39 at 7:30am Monday for a whale watching trip birthday gift from our kids. Since we live in the East Bay we didn't want to try to maneuver through commute traffic & risk missing the boat. So this hotel was perfectly located near public transportation & a few short blocks walk from Pier 39! Wonderful staff, clean, comfortable and good price! Thank you!

review.title: Nice Hotel and close to all the action
review.reviewText: Close to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. All the action is near by as well as tons of restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: Reduce the price of in room movies. 17.99 is way to high. 4 stars is acceptable based on the comparisons but being from Vegas, it is a 3 star
review.locationRemarks: All the action and great restaurants

review.title: Good location , walking distance
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and helpful.  Not noisey .  Good location.  We could never get the switch to work correctly on air conditioner, they came to fix but never could.  The coffee in lobby was moved away too quickly

review.title: Great location right near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Spent 8 days here with our toddler. Very comfortable. Close to Pier 39, Fishermans, grocery shops, and some great eating spots too.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location to the Wharf. Able to walk to everything, including our tour buses and to the street cars. Very nice, clean comfortable quiet room. Staff was very helpful and the doorman Jun gave excellent suggestions on local eateries within easy walking distances.
review.negativeRemarks: The price for a small double queen bedroom was high for a hotel showing some wear, plus there was no beverage or snack machine in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Tour buses for everything from touring the Napa Valley, Yosemite to city tours. Plus the Wharf was just 2 blocks away.

review.title: Great location for Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Easy walking to all sights near Fishermans Wharf, including Ghiradelli Square and Cable Car. Restaurants galore high end to fast food. Comfortable hotel. Looks upgraded and clean.  Can easily see some old aspects of the hotel.

review.title: Hotel in a great area.
review.reviewText: Easy excess to everything we wanted to do. Room was VERY small and looking out at a condo out our window at there bedroom window and patio.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy excess, walking distance to everything we wanted to do. We even turned in our rental car after one day.
review.negativeRemarks: ROOMS.

review.title: Good location close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Air conditioning rather noisy and noise from other units on enclosed courtyard and roof.
review.locationRemarks: Close to major attractions, hop on off buses and tram stops

review.reviewText: We were very happy with our stay. The room was very clean and quiet. They were also very dog friendly. The staff was amazing.  My son had saved his burrito to eat later and the staff heated up for him and served it to him on a plate with utensils.  We would definitely stay again if we go back. I loved that we were just 2 blocks away from the wharf.

review.title: Great location to many of the major attractions.
review.reviewText: Great staff. Location conveniently located for walking to all immenities, Wharf, Pier 39, Lomard St.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location was great.  The hotel staff was okay, not extremely helpful when questions needed to be answered.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf, Alcatraz...

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel in a great location. Easy walk to Fishermans Wharf. Room was beautifully presented and beds were comfortable. Bathroom was a bit tired and dated but quite usable.

review.title: Great stay for tourists!
review.reviewText: Although we've been to the city many times, we chose to stay close to Fisherman's Wharf with access to the ballpark.  This is a lovely hotel and we're very pleased with the accommodations; the bathroom (toilet/shower) area is very small and requires alternate standing for the door.  The windows open (YES!) to a small courtyard that is lovely.  And the cost for breakfast at the hotel is about equal to anything nearby.  We expected the parking fees but that plus the tax for parking put us over our budget.  Next time we'll plan better.

review.title: Best deal in the area
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel. The room was huge and very comfortable. The free breakfast was perfect after a day and night of wine tours!

review.title: Good location but very outdated and dirty
review.reviewText: Stayed at few nights this past week. You can't beat the location. Walking distance to just about anything you want to do.   The lobby looks nice but the rooms are very outdated and our bathroom had quite a bit of mold and was generally dirty. Not even close to my expectation for what we spent on the room.

review.title: Good location in North Beach
review.reviewText:
The hotel worked well for our family's brief road trip to the Bay Area. The location was very good to explore the nearby sites (e.g. Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Lombard Street, Coit Tower, etc) by foot. I have teenage kids and they like (or agree) to walk when we explore different cities. I enjoyed visiting during the off-peak season as I know there are huge crowds during the summer months.

The front desk and valet staff were helpful and friendly. Parking is expensive but that's the price you pay for bringing a car into SF. The bathroom and beds were clean. The only negative was that the room was quite small and felt cramped for the 4 of us (would've been fine for 2). In my opinion, the hotel is a 3.5 star facility.

review.title: Real nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: Warm welcome, comfortable lobby, we had a late flight out of SFS.  But entertained ourselves very nice, in the front lobby until it was time to leave.  Everyone very nice.  Good restaurant and fantastic bar staff.
review.locationRemarks: GREAT LOCATION VERY CLOSE TO THE MAIN INTERESTING POINTS OF SFS...AND MANY, MANY RESTAURANTS TO CHOOSE FROM.. Very close to the wharf.

review.reviewText: Unaware construction was taking place.  Bed right next to air/heat so the person sleeping there was either too hot or cold to make others comfortable.

review.title: Too small of a room
review.reviewText: Room was small and cramped.  Windows didn't open so it got stuffy when we showered.  The location was great, but I would not stay there again.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Hotel location was great. Within walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf. However, the room I was placed in seemed to lack proper ventilation. As soon as we walked in, there was an old water odor. Also, the arm chair in the corner of the room was a bit smelly too (smelled of water odor as well as B.O.). When I called down to the front desk, they said they would send someone up. After about an hour, I called down again and told them I'll just place the chair in the hallway for pickup. The bathroom was pretty dirty. It looked as if there was black mold on the ceiling due to the lack of ventilation. After taking showers, the steam would sit in the bathroom and the rest of the room. Thank goodness the window opened and the weather was decent because I ended up keeping it open my entire stay to make sure the air was nice and fresh.

Overall, I don't think I'll be coming back here again regardless of how close it was to the wharf. For being advertised as a 4-star hotel I expected a bit more. I thought I was getting a deal on this place from Expedia but you get what you pay for, I guess.

review.title: Great place in SF!
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful and nice. The location is wonderful and is close to everything in Fisherman's Wharf. They even helped us book an unforgettable tour bus! The rooms were snug and clean.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
My husband, our 2 teenagers (14 and 15), and myself vacationed for 4 days, 3 nights in san Francisco this past weekend. We originally booked a room with 2 queen beds. When we arrived, we were given the option of upgrading to a king suite for free. We took it and although the bedroom and separate sitting area (with sofa bed) give you more privacy, there rooms were still quite small and did not have enough storage space.  My king sized bed was comfortable, but my kids complained about how uncomfortable the sofa bed was. 
Our room was right on the corner of North Point St and Mason (4th floor - room 415). It was so noisy!  You can hear every truck pass by, at night you can hear all of the drunk people yelling as they walk down the street. I wondered if it would have been quieter had I kept the original room I had booked. 
Across the street from my room is a Longshoreman's Hall which is where you can see several homeless people staying. We weren't bothered, but I wouldn't feel very comfortable walking past there at night. Despite this hall being across the street, the hotel itself is conveniently located near several key locations such as Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, tour locations, cable car routes, etc...
Overall, room was clean, my bed was comfortable, and the staff was all friendly and appeared eager to assist with all my needs. I'd recommend this hotel and probably stay there again.

review.title: Hotel fairly close to pier 39 & cablecar,
review.reviewText: CHARGING $150 to room for prepaid rooms was an outrage and management was not interested in my complaints. Poor!

review.title: Great Location, Friendly Service
review.reviewText:
We had a great experience from check in to check out.
The location was great - not far from Fisherman's Wharf.  Our room was very comfortable, we appreciated the quality of the coffee services in the room.
The layout of the room was great, nice furniture, easy to move around.
We did have an issue with our hot water - that turned out to be a problem with the dial in the shower.   The reception staff were helpful and gave advice.  I was pleased that they also followed up with a visit to the room from the maintenance man.   It turned out to be a simple fix - so we were happy with that.
Tried the restaurant - the service there was awesome.  Friendly and professional.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, lots of shopping and restaurants.  Walking distance to the Alcatraz Ferry.

review.title: Cute hotel with a convenient location
review.reviewText: Check in gentleman was terrific, extremely kind and funny, overall hotel was so cute, room could of been a tad bit updated but very cute and a convenient location, hotel restaurant was delicious

review.title: Great location in fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Only complaint is noise early in the morning from the street woke us up each day and mini bar not restocked
Room smelled musty, had to ask for robes. Proximity to fishermans wharf and pescatore restaurant happy hour are the best parts.  Overpriced.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We spent 3 nights in February 2016 before our cruise and 1 night after our cruise.    We took the Wine Country Tour Shuttle of Napa valley w/Mondavi which was excellent.  Also did  the government tour (which is not combined with anything else) of Alcatraz with the use of the head phones.  Used Go Lauries's shuttle from the Airport to the hotel at a very reasonable cost.  We had a very enjoyable stay at the Hotel and would recommend it  to anyone.  The location is great and it is easy to walk around the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff were very helpful in answering questions in regards to finding different places.
review.negativeRemarks: The way happy hour is explained. We didn't know that if you sit at the bar, you get "happy hour" prices, but if you sit at a table you don't.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a 20 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf, a 30 minute walk to the |Market Place and a very short taxi ride to the pier for the cruise ship.

review.title: Great location to all the activities in area
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly and responsive to our needs. We enjoyed the ice water in the lobby.
Did like that there wasn't a place to buy water or soda.

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel needs updating. It is an old building however the carpeting looked dirty. Rooms are small, bath was good size. Staff was great. For the location and price it was ok for one night.

review.title: Great location for the Bay area and the City
review.reviewText: Had three days in the Bay Area and the hotel was exactly what we had hoped for.  Nice clean comfortable room and the all of the hotel facilities worked.  Food in the restaurant was great if a little expensive by our standards.  Links to the city were very good.  You had the option of cable cars or trams along the bay front and our tourist travel card worked well.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice clean comfortable rooms slightly away from the bustle of the bay area.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish that the hotel and all US businesses would state their prices more clearly and reduce this obsession with tipping to make up wages.
review.locationRemarks: The location was really good.  We walked to the Golden Gate bridge on one morning and hopped into town by cable car the next.

review.title: Great hotel and staff and location
review.reviewText: I enjoy this hotel and location and the staff were very helpful.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Love the location, room offered no amenities.  The restaurant downstairs is great.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a little cramped.  Also, some of the staff could learn from Lateef and the maintenance guy that assisted us.
review.locationRemarks: Every thing is within walking distance from this hotel.  Of course, I don't mind walking in San Francisco. There is so much to see.

review.title: great location to the 'Wharf'
review.reviewText: Great spot for our weekend to visit the Wharf, and enjoy the simple pleasures of San Francisco

review.title: Close to many things
review.reviewText: Close to pier 39 and 33,China town and ither things.  Walking distance to pretty much all even golden gate of you don't mind the walk.   Traffic sucks though coming or going out of the city depending on time so be prepared!

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was a nice surprise after such a horrible airline experience.  Hotel staff were very caring and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner room
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location. Right at the heart of the piers!

review.title: Hotel was very clean, quiet, conveniently located
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful letting us store baggage until able to check-in.  The entire hotel and attached restaurant were spotless, and the staff were all very helpful and professional.  The room was a bit larger than expected, very quiet, and the view scenic.  The parking staff was very polite and helpful (we needed something from our car, after it was parked in their garage, and they quickly retrieved the item and brought it to us).  All charges were explained up front, in a clear and informative manner.  The morning coffee in the lobby was excellent -  not watered down.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, fair price, courteous staff, comfortable, quiet, and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in room was weak when only one coffee pod used.  Would have preferred a darker/stronger roast.  Coffee in lobby in morning was much better.
review.locationRemarks: There were shopping, tour service, restaurants, and scenic locations (Pier 39 & 33, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square) all within walking distance.

review.title: Unfriendly & condescending reservation desk staff
review.reviewText: I reserved this room using my credit card as a gift for my son & his wife. Due to my credit card being used, entered my name. At check-in, the desk staff (male) was suspicious and very condescending to my both of them, making them extremely uncomfortable. All it took was a quick phone call to the phone no I left on record to clear it up. Desk staff should be trained to treat guests with respect.

review.title: Great location to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Did not sleep good every night as our room was next to the street and very noisy.  The people next to us opened & closed their door constantly & it sounded like our door was being opened.
The beds, however were very comfortable.

review.title: nice hotel, walking distance to attractions
review.reviewText: the hotel was very nice, great staff.  the hallway carpets looked really dirty and the rooms was a bit cramped.  no views except for a residences back yard.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaner hallway carpeting
review.locationRemarks: everything was within walking distance

review.title: Nice location near pier.
review.reviewText: This hotel is way over priced for the age and grade of room it was.
review.negativeRemarks: Thought it was ridulous that we were charged to park our car at the hotel when we were staying.  No mention of this fee when the reservation was made.
review.locationRemarks: Near the piers and convenient.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: We were able to walk everywhere that we wanted to go from the hotel. The staff were very efficient and helpful. Good food at the restaurant. Very comfortable bed.

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: I was a bit leary about booking at a Best Western but read so many great reviews that I went with and was glad i did!  The room was clean and very comfortable.  Location was walkable to many sites and the staff was great.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Fantastic staff and big comfortable rooms. Only issue was very expensive parking. Would recommend.

review.title: Quiet hotel,close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: I requested a microwave and blanket on my way out,when I returned the requested items were neatly place in my room.

review.title: Decent hotel near the warf
review.reviewText: The worst thing about the hotel was paying $62.00 to park the car for 1 night.

review.title: Very small room. Awful view.
review.reviewText: We also couldn't even open our blinds because our window faced an apartment and their patio was right there for them to see in. We did not enjoy anything about this stay besides the convenience to the Wharf.

review.title: Great location but hotel staff not very helpful
review.reviewText: I had constant problem with Wifi access and 4 front desk staff weren't helpful. They also had problem with movie rentals. The safety bar in tub was positioned outside the shower curtain and of no use during shower and impossible during bath.  No shower cap or mouthwash & minibar key didn't work. Beds ok

review.title: Nice, clean and convenient
review.reviewText: Enjoyed staying here. Would recommend even with the expensive parking

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Close to everywhere nearby Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance to all the restaurants and shops. Staff were very helpful and kind. Room was amazing. Good price.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to all the shops and restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf and everywhere in the areas in all directions.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location on the Warf. Very helpful staff! Easy to get around.

review.title: Noisy aircon funny smell but great room
review.reviewText: It is a bit weird to enjoy a room despite its failings but the odd smell (dank but not mouldy) and noisy aircon could not spoil the good location and pleasant staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Aircon needs servicing

review.title: Close to the wharf.
review.reviewText: The rooms are very small, but nice.  The hallways smell like cigarettes.  Maybe they need to change the carpets.  Staff was very good.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Had a slight hassle getting the room that I had reserved . Took 3 moves to get it right. The manager did compensate with $100 hotel credit. That was appreciated
review.negativeRemarks: Leave coffee out at least till 10 am
review.locationRemarks: The warf is only 2 blocks . Plenty to do

review.title: Nice boutique hotel right at Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: Last minute booking to go to Super bowl.  Had never stayed at this hotel previously, but they had a cancellation so we took it.  Great hotel and great location!!!

review.title: Nice hotel in Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Easy check in, friendly helpful staff, clean and comfortable. Near the wharfs with plenty of attractions.

review.title: Very nice Hotel,
review.reviewText: Convenient location. The Resturant "Pescatore" very good, we only had breakfast twice but it was excellent

review.title: Nice hotel in the right area
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel having read a few of the reviews and was not disappointed. The hotel is perfectly located for seeing SF and is within walking distance of Pier 39.  The facilities are very good and the local restaurants excellent, the room was excellent and the staff really top notch.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location, an on site restaurant, excellent rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for pier 39 and the cable cars.

review.title: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel and staff, only spoilt by noisy and not very good a/c

review.title: Ok hotel.
review.reviewText: Close to Fishermans Wharf. Free tea and coffee on the reception area. Average room. Very slow wifi. Very expensive to park your car. Staff were very polite and helpful.

review.title: Convenient to the Pier
review.reviewText:
Great location for visiting the waterfront area.  All kinds of restaurants and shopping within a short walk (1-block).
nice Italian restaurant just off of the lobby.  Parking was incredibly expensive given the price of the room.

review.title: Close to the pier and in walking distance to food.
review.reviewText: The staff was great and the hotel was clean and comfortable. The only exception was that our room wasn't cleaned for the day by 3 pm. When housekeeping knocked on the door to clean, she asked if we could leave so she can clean before her shift ended.
Great Location walking distance to grocery store and pier. There were bus stops right outside the hotel. safe and comfortable.

review.title: Great staff!
review.reviewText: Aiyaz, the Concierge was fantastic!!  Perfect location!
Great hotel! Official rating is 3-star but it feels a lot more

review.title: Close walk to everything
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Close to Pier 39 and many eating places

review.title: Fine hotel, nothing fancy, extras were all 'extra'
review.reviewText:
We had a comfortable stay at the Best Western Tuscan. Bed was very comfortable, but the pillows were mediocre. Coffee service was over before my husband awoke at 9:30.  Coffee in the room was mediocre. The place was super clean and all you would normally expect. They also have an agreement with 24hr fitness next door, and I had a GREAT workout. Much better than in most hotel gyms.

The AC fan in the room was a bit noisy.

The parking was extra. $55. I had not expected to pay $55 extra when I booked the room. I discovered that once I received my confirmation. Also, the breakfast was not included.

The hotel is really nice and all you could expect. Just understand what is and is not included when you book it.
review.positiveRemarks: The access to a great gym. The location.
review.negativeRemarks: Include parking and breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: We did a lovely walking tour: Up Lombard Street, down to Ghiradelli Square, out to Pier 39, to the Ripley's Believe It or Not Museum, Aquarium.

review.title: Nice hotel and close to North Beach attractions.
review.reviewText: A great experience, overall. I've stayed here before and found everything to my liking. Great location, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is in walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and all the nearby attractions and dining.

review.title: Good location nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is nicely decorated and in a good location. The staff are friendly and accommodating. The valet parking is very expensive (66US/96 AU) per night. The wifi was very temperamental in rooms and often only one device would work at a time. The rooms are small but have all that you need.

review.title: Back to my roots as a tourist
review.reviewText: Was fun to return to SAn Francisco as a tourist. I am a fourth generation San FRansican whose great grandfather came to the city in 1856.  I know the city pretty well but it was fun to come back as a visitor and do tourist things.
review.positiveRemarks: staff was extremely helpful, particularly Anthony at the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: small room size.  NOt much that you can do about this and most everything esle was fine.
review.locationRemarks: well located.  easy walking distance to many attractions.  Cannery, Ghiraldeli Square, fishermans wharf, cable cars, and good restaruants.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Great location, nice hotel, disappointing room...The staff was nice and accommodating. The location is great, close to many attractions. My only complaint was the room was tiny. For how much we spent I thought the room would be much nicer / roomier. Overall a good experience,  I would consider this hotel to be 3 stars.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was tiny, it fit the bed and that was about it.
review.locationRemarks:
Pier 39
International Sports Lounge (Cheap Drinks)
Akiko Sushi (Great Food)
Shopping

review.title: Nice hotel, great location, helpful staff
review.reviewText:
The hotel communal areas were very nice, the rooms a bit basic but generally comfortable. 
Staff were very helpful and gave tips on places to visit, marked areas of interest on free map & gave advice on public transport routes. 
Fantastic location, just a couple of streets down from Fisherman's Wharf piers and within 5 minutes of bus & cable car stops. Easily walkable to some city tourist hotspots (as long as you don't mind hills!)
Good happy hour on the adjoining restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Modernising the bedrooms
review.locationRemarks:
Fisherman's Wharf
Alcatraz Cruise
Cycle Golden Gate Bridge
Coit Tower
Lombard Street
Ghiradelli Square

review.reviewText: Great location! Very quiet and excellent amenities for the price.
great time even if it was raining. enjoyed hotel & SFO
review.locationRemarks: lots to do nearby

review.title: Great hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel before so we knew it was a great hotel.  The location at Fisherman's Wharf is perfect, close to all the transport links and near some great restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: It is well maintained, rooms are cosy and clean, the staff are excellent and the location is perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Opening hours at the adjoining Pecatore Restaurant could be extended as it currently closes at 10pm, which is a bit early.
review.locationRemarks: Close to numerous restaurants, shops and other attractions.  Close to all transport links.

review.title: Walking distance to pier 39
review.reviewText: Hotel was in convenient location.  Hotel staff friendly and helpful.  Restaurant food was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 39 and Pier 33(?) Alcatraz boat departure.  Walked everyone we wanted to go.

review.title: Close to all attractions
review.reviewText: A nice hotel, with coffee and hot chocolate free service early in the morning.  You can walk toPier 39.  Good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Close proximity of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: There was very few amenities at this hotel. No microwave in room, no pool or spa room, no exercise room and the parking should have been free during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that it was so close to the wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Offer continental breakfast and put microwaves in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf

review.reviewText: toilets in bathroom too low to floor other than that it was an excellent

review.title: Great hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText:
What can I say, this was a very nice hotel. It's location was near to the fisherman's wharf area which was great as it meant I was close by to many tourist attractions, shops and restaurants. There was also a nearby cable car stop and a bus stop so very easy to get around but if I'm honest it was very easy to walk around aside from the hills of San Francisco. 

The staff were very nice with one member of staff extending my check out time from the usual 12pm to 1pm as that was when my taxi was booked for to take me to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very nice and welcoming. The room was a good size and clean.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near many shops, restaurants and tourist attractions such as Madame Tussaud's, Pier 39 and hop on hop off buses.

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText:
The front desk staff were very, very friendly and accommodating. They had a map of the area which was free and offered to me when I checked in. The only thing I didn't like was the cost of the parking which was 55.00 for the night, but I understand this is a usually thing in most big cities with limited parking space, so not a ding on the hotel itself. 

The room was old but clean and the bed was nice and comfortable. A fridge with a mini bar and snacks for purchase. Coffee in the lobby plus a 4 pot coffee machine in the room. 

The business center had an ATM machine which I thought was nice. The hotel is within 2 blocks of Pier 39 to see the seals and 2 blocks to the Cable car. Ghirardelli Square is also within 3 blocks.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff, the closeness to Fishermans Wharf and the Cable Cars

review.title: Not worth the money.
review.reviewText: all of the staff were friendly except one who unfortunately was the receptionist who helped us check in. Sadly that was our first impression of the hotel. Maybe some customer services seminars would be useful. Also to valet your car overnight is $55.00. So unless you want to drive all over the city looking for parking plan on that expense!

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: From the minute we walked in I was impressed with this hotel. The Lobby was very welcoming and Andrew who checked us in was efficient and friendly managing to make recommendations for dinner and where to rent bikes for the Golden gate bridge ride while all the while not delaying the check in process. The room although a little dated was nicely equipped and clean. The beds were so comfortable is was hard to drag ourselves out of them in the morning to go sight seeing etc. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Would definitely book this hotel again, it was near to everything we wanted to see and do.
review.positiveRemarks: It felt safe and inviting and was near to all the attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything major, maybe update some of the furnishings.
review.locationRemarks: So many restaurants and shops and attractions close by this really is the best location to be in.

review.title: Great hotel close to North Beach and family.
review.reviewText: Very good experience, clean, efficient staff and great location. Easy walk to North Beach and Embarcadero.

review.title: Well located and pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: Many good points and we'd stay again.  Good wifi, good restaurant attached (Pescatore's), very comfortable beds (even my kids commented on this), rooms pleasant.  Location excellent for Fisherman's Wharf.    However, on this our 4th stay we noticed quality of reception had deteriorated: long delays in checking out (one person on duty at peak time) and they had no idea we'd stayed before so we got the full explanation of facilities etc.  They also seem to have abandoned the free drinks which used to be offered in the evening.  Nevertheless we will stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve reception staff availability and teach them to recognise returning guests
review.locationRemarks: 5 mins from Fisherman's Wharf, 10 mins to Pier 39.

review.title: Close to Beach, Port
review.reviewText: Excellent staff and hotel especially for anyone who wants to be close to the beach or when taking a cruise that is going out of the port.

review.title: Great Trip
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location.  About 1 block from the Trolley stop.  About 2 blocks from the Grotto.  About 4 or 5 blocks from ghirardelli square.  Everything was in perfect walking distance.   The cable car stop called the F train was i street away and it takes you down the embarcadero and on through downtown San Fran.  The staff was friendly and the hotel lobby was nice.  The restaurant was also very nice for cocktails before heading to bed.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location, staff, the overall appearance of the hotel, and the overall perceived value for staying there.
review.negativeRemarks: I would like to have had better pillows.  The pillows were a little hard for my taste but after a few cocktails, I was out like a light.

review.title: Pleasant but no wow factor
review.reviewText:
The location was very close to the Fisherman's wharf. The room was small but clean and had a comfortable bed. Had free coffee and tea in the mornings in the lobby but did not make use of this so can't rate it. 
The staff were efficient but unsmiling.
The free Wifi was very slow though and sometimes did not work.

review.title: Excellent hotel with perfect location
review.reviewText: We stayed during the Christmas holidays and had a great experience staying there. Staff, room cleanliness and room comfort was just right.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking validation.
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is within walking distance from Fishermans Warf and many local attractions . Transportation runs outside your door. The room was clean and comfortable , one improvement that would be beneficial is more space to unpack , limited drawers and tiny closet. Overall Great Place. Would recommend .

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Short walk to fisherman's wharf and other tourist attractions like the Lombard St, little Italy and Chinatown.

review.title: Lovely hotel very close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay with great staff.  Enjoyed the morning coffee and the concierge was super helpful. Front of the house staff were exceptional and courteous.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the location, so close to Fisherman's wharf and great eats.
review.negativeRemarks: One upgrade may be a cookie with the coffee in the a.m.

review.title: Great location at Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Although the room was on the small side it was comfortable and clean.  It was very convenient having Pesactores Restaurant attached to the hotel.  The crab stuffed pasta was excellent, we also enjoyed our breakfast and one cold night after an open top bus light tour the hot toddies went down well!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the very helpful, friendly and courteous staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, fisherman's wharf, pier 39, easy access to a number of hop on hop off buses and bus tours.  Close to Ghiradelli Square.

review.reviewText: Great location, nice staff, we stayed two nights, it was excellent !
Great location! Very comfortable room, cute decor. Very clean. Close walk to the wharf. Would def stay again.

review.title: Nice hotel in nice area
review.reviewText:
I was very pleased with the rooms.  Got 3 rooms with 2 queen beds. Rooms were extremely clean and well made up, beds were clean and comfortable, bathroom is nice and comfortable as well.  Lobby area is very nice with free water, a bar, and lounge area.

Close to shopping and the pier.  Convenient on-site valet parking.  Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location, bad service
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great, next to great restaurants and the hop on hop off bus. Yes, the rooms were clean, however they were TOO small- and the service was bad which didn't help. Would I come back to this hotel for the good location? No, there are other hotels nearby.

review.title: Weekend Get Away in San Fran
review.reviewText:
This hotel met our needs and expectations for a weekend stay in San Fran.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  It was nice to have the front door staffed 24 hours.  Every time we returned to the hotel, we were greeted by a door man opening the doors for us. A nice touch.  The room was average, a soft queen sized bed, a small desk and chair, and two oversized seats.  There was also a small refrigerator, a small safe and a hair dryer. I believe a microwave is available, but for an extra charge.  Although I wouldn't consider this hotel fancy, it did feel clean and safe and was very comfortable.
There was free coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby during limited morning hours (6am-10am??) as well as an on-site restaurant which we did not eat at.  Also, Safeway and Trader Joe's is one block away if you need to grab snacks or drinks for the room.
Overall a safe and comfortable hotel in Fisherman's Wharf area with a friendly staff at a decent price.  We would stay again.  Aloha!!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Only bad note was front desk forgot to follow through on our request for a car for early departure after being asked to do so.

review.title: Hotel near fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Only spent 1 night at this hotel, seems like it is in a good location.  Room was nice but small.

The room was a little smaller than what  I'm used to but the bed was so comfortable that I didn't care.  The only negative I have would be that the restaurant affiliated with the hotel was less than par.

review.title: Nice hotel Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Customer service is outstanding. Rooms are small, but if you are in San Francisco why would you be in your room other than to sleep and shower? Convenient to Alcatraz, North Beach and Chinatown. I'd stay here again.

review.title: Hotel close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel... clean, friendly staff, nice rooms, great coffee  in the lobby, even lent us an umbrella because it was raining outside...overall great experience!

review.title: Safe and Quiet Hotel by Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText:
Hotel entrance is tricky to find.  The entrance is on North Point just a few yards from the Pescatore restaurant, which is on the corner of North Point and Mason.  Stayed for a week and found everyone on staff friendly and accommodating.  I liked that the front desk and entrance were staffed 24 hours.  I felt very safe.

Room was a double queen and faced the courtyard.  It was VERY quiet - no street/city noise. The room itself contained a dresser with locked mini-fridge, 32" flat TV, a night stand between the beds with a phone that doubled as a phone charger/music speaker.  There was also a work desk with lamp/chair/device charging station.  The wifi was free for guests for as many devices as you need.  The bathroom was small and contained a full tub/shower as well as a toilet.  The shower had great pressure and the water was HOT.  Oddly the vanity/mirror were located outside the bath/toilet area but shared the same light/fan switch, which lit up the room in the middle of the night.  There was also a hair dryer/iron & board, and small room safe.  The room included an AC/Heater unit that worked and added some white noise. Windows did not open.  Beds/pillows to be extremely comfortable.  Not hard or soft.  The bedding included a down comforters which kept us cozy.

The hotel is located near a great breakfast place (Pat's Cafe) and cable car/trolley lines on Taylor.  Just a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf and other restaurants as well.  

I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Safe and Quiet.  Conveniently located to trolley/cable cars/restaurants. Shower with HOT water and excellent pressure.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if the windows could have been opened for fresh air.
review.locationRemarks: Buena Vista Cafe for great food and Irish Coffee.  Pat's Cafe for excellent breakfast.  Fisherman's Wharf, bike/Segway tours, many activities.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Good location near the action. Polite staff. Nice bed.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Our stay here was very pleasant.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Location is great!  Walking distance to Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39, and many other restaurants and attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Update/renovate facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Loved the location.  Many, many things to do and see in walking distance.  Great, excellent restaurants all around.

review.title: Convenient location but room was always stuffy
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed here early December. The location of the hotel is close to many of the tourist attractions (e.g. Pier 39, Alcatraz, Cable Cars, Golden Gate Bridge) so it's very convenient to get to where you need to go. The room was a little smaller than expected, but we weren't spending much time in the hotel so this wasn't an issue. We really liked that the hotel had water in the lobby for guests to make use of as well as free tea and coffee in the mornings. The only drawback was that the room's heating/cooling wasn't great in that it was hard to find an optimum temperature and the room was always stuffy.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, good service and great location.
review.negativeRemarks: It was hard to reach a good room temperature with the room's heater/cooler system and the air circulation could be improved
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location for tourist attractions - Pier 39, Alcatraz, Cable Cars, bike hire for Golden Gate Bridge, GoCar tours.

review.reviewText:
Good vacation, perfect for visited, near all and the bus also
Thank

review.title: Overpriced, typical for S.F!
review.reviewText: For the money you spend, the fact that they charge $12 more for parking if you have a suv -ridiculous. Just the nickle and dimming you shouldn't expect from a Best Western. Won't go back for over $250/night - with a published rate of $165.  By the time you spend $62 on parking per night, tax, and fees it is over $250 and by no means does this hotel warrant that price point.
