They took the coffee away from the lobby at 9:30am on a Sat. morning. Why?  Even cheap 2star hotels have coffee/tea for patrons all day.  There was no complimentary breakfast, unlike most other BW's...disappointing. $13 per person for a cheesy breakfast in the restaurant..too pricey for families!  Asked the concierge for help with the charging bar for my cell phone, said "You will have to ask the from desk" - Does anyone know service these days, she was doing NOTHING at her computer and only feet away from the front desk.  Could she have asked the front desk???  WiFi was free, but poor.  First room smelled like an ashtray so had to move upstairs, not next to our family.  Just unlike any other Best Westerns...must be the city, they rake everyone over the coals on everything and think nothing of it..adios BW, won't be back or recommend it to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: Warf

review.title: Great location for easy access to city
review.reviewText: Great staff, spacious rooms, clean hotel with everything you need for a great stay.  Would return
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could benefit from a microwave. Bathroom too small.

review.title: Close to Wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great location. Service is excellent!

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText:
Location is good, 5 min walk to Pier 39, 5 min walk to Cable Car station.
Personally I prefer Fishman's Wharf to Union Square.
Hotel itself is a bit old, but staff are very nice and helpful
Great hotel , staff excellent, close to pier 39. Clean shops near by

review.title: Great choice
review.reviewText: Close to Pier 39....2 blocks...extremely helpful staff....worth the price difference when I seen the other hoteI l ALMOST reserved....
Stayed for business.  Great location and helpful staff.

review.title: Very helpful and courteous staff.
review.reviewText: We stayed here this week for four nights. The location is outstanding for access to everything that is interesting about San Francisco. The hotel staff was extraordinarily courteous and responsive. We especially appreciated the advice provided by Daniels and our housekeeper's efforts.

review.title: Great Hotel In Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable and welcoming hotel. Staff very helpful. NIce touches like coffee in the lounge in the morning
 and chilled water later in the day. Great beds and the room was quiet so slept so well. Easy access to all the trolleys and streetcars. All in all excellent.
review.locationRemarks: In Fishermans Wharf. One block away from street car stop and trolley stop.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice.  Rooms were clean, but a bit dated.  Could use some sprucing up.  The staff was great.  Very friendly.  I would recommend this hotel.  I was expecting it to be a bit nicer from looking at the pictures and website.  Our stay was nice and the room was quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was good.  Close to the streetcar.  Staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were small and when the bathroom door was open, it blocked the exit.  The rooms could use some updating.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf, Ghiradelli square and tourist sights.

review.title: Nice hotel - staff were very helpful
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay - staff were very helpful and would stay there again.  My room was a bit older but it was clean and had everything I required.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, within walking distance to everything
review.negativeRemarks: Was pretty far from Airport so wish I would have known about the shuttle services.  Area can be scary in the evening so just be careful.
review.locationRemarks: Safeway for groceries, tour company, fishermen's wharf - loved the area

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Fisherman's Wharf and stores
review.reviewText: Staff was welcoming and helpful.  Check-in/Check-out was quick.

review.title: Nice hotel & great location
review.reviewText: Convenient location and clean, quiet place to stay. Those beds are superb after a long day walking! You avoid downtown hassle and get there in 15 min tops. Would stay again.

review.title: location was great
review.reviewText: prices were reasonable and the location was good. easy to get around. parking was $50.00 a day which is over priced and the rooms were very small. staff was warm and inviting.

review.title: Not 4 stars.
review.reviewText:
The bed was OK. Room very small.
Restaurant no exciting.
review.positiveRemarks: Price. Close to a grocery store.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete updating.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the piers. Close to a few restaurants. Next to a super market.

review.title: Nice hotel with a good location !
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in fisherman wharf ! Expensive, but the price for the location !

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Very good location n friendly staff, will come again for sure!

review.title: Location, location, etc
review.reviewText: The location is excellent for sightseeing.  It's a few blocks from Pier 39 & Fisherman's Wharf.  Our concierge recommended some excellent spots for dining nearby too.  We loved Beach Street Grill for breakfast, Pier Market for lunch, and the Fog House for dinner.  It's easy to catch a bus or cable car for further off spots like Golden Gate Bridge Park.  Hop on the ferry and you're in Sausalito!
review.negativeRemarks: I'd like to see hot beverage service all day instead of just the mornings.
review.locationRemarks: Everything!

review.title: Hotel close to my race
review.reviewText: Location was very close to Fishermans Wharf. Hotel was very clean and accommodating. Cost was reasonable and affordable. Staff was amazing! Very professional, helpful and friendly. I will definitely stay again and recommend to others.
great location reasonable price courteous stafff.  and the rooms were adequate in space
review.negativeRemarks: no
review.locationRemarks: perfect 2 blocks from the wharf

review.title: Close to fisherman's wharf and all the cool thing
review.reviewText: It was a nice room the carpet in the hallway us need to be changed

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Best Western Plus the Tuscan is a very nice place to stay in San Francisco. Room very nice, quiet and clean. Staff very friendly. Close to Fisherman's Wharf and other attractions. Would stay again.

review.title: Excellent choice for sightseeing in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Perfect location, walking distance to Wharf, restaurants and shopping.  Beautiful and very comfortable accommodations, staff/service could not have been more friendly and helpful.

review.title: Memorable birthday
review.reviewText: The staff helped my sister and my daughter arrange to have two gift baskets, flowers and a ballon in my room on my arrival.  They couldn't have been nicer about it.  The room was comfortable, clean and quite.
review.positiveRemarks: Older hotel, but very well kept.  Staff very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind
review.locationRemarks: Right near Pier 39 on Fishermans Wharf, close to shopping, dining, cable car, ferry, or you can take a trolley to the Embarcadero and rapid transit.

review.title: Great location, good facilities, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Good location, good facilities, friendly staff.  Concierge helpful.

review.title: NICE HOTEL FISHERMANS WHARF
review.reviewText: Easy check-in with friendly staff.  Our room was very comfortable very clean. Hotel location great short walk to the attractions of Fishermans Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant that is attached to the hotel need a more varied menu.
review.locationRemarks: excellent location close to all attractions of the wharf and good transport links to union square

review.title: Perfect location close to Pier 39
review.reviewText: The room was very modern. Beds are comfortable. Plenty of towels. Very clean. Would stay again.

review.title: Great hotel close to most sites
review.reviewText: We stayed here because we wanted to be in the city for the few days we were in town for the football game.  The first night we walked to Little Italy for dinner.  It was an easy walk with lots to see.  We also walked the wharf area as it was just two blocks away.  The hotel was comfortable and the staff was friendly.  We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Nice hotel close to board walk in Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: My wife and I had a great time in San Francisco and this was a great hotel.  The staff was very friendly and the room was comfortable.  If you forego the maid service, you get $5 in credit that can be used in the hotel restaurant with a 3 to 6 happy hour.
review.positiveRemarks: Great happy hour from 3 to 6 each day.
review.locationRemarks: The boardwalk at Fisherman's Warf is two blocks away so much to do.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Right across the Street from Old Town, good selection of restaurants and bars all within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be updated
review.locationRemarks: Old town across the Street, right on capitol mal next tothe river

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and thank you for the feedback. I'm sorry that we fell short of your expectations. Hopefully you had a fabulous time in SF. We wish you safe travels.

review.title: Not a 4 Star Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel has a good location.  The hotel staff is nice.  The room is clean but its as big as closet.  We were very disappointed for the price we paid.

review.title: Walking distance to wharf
review.reviewText: Overall great experience, very clean. Let us check in early. Parking is expensive so you can just park across the street. Not the cheapest in price but you get what you pay for

Toilet paper is in a awkard position. In the shower there is no place to put wash cloth and soap.The little tray just doesn't do it. Street side needs some curtains to block out the street lights,wooden shutters don't do anything. For the money one spends on the room,the hotel should offer a free continental breakfast. Put it back where it used to be.

review.title: Nice hotel to expensive for amenities.
review.reviewText: Great experience, hotel is nice and on par or slightly better than other Best Westerns I have stayed at with a grossly inflated price per night.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, friendly staff, close to everything
review.negativeRemarks: The price should be more in line with other Best Westerns
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, per 39 and Alcatraz were all with in walking distance.

review.title: Great hotel in the wharf!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and clean.  Close to high end dining or slices of pizza.  Darren's has great breakfast just around corner.  Grocery store next door. All tour stuff just a block away.  Other reviews complained about street noise, it was a little loud on Sunday night, but rest of week was no problem.  Expensive to park at $50/day and min. $65 to get to airport.  Would definately stay here again.

review.title: Good location. Unfortunately too many homeless .
review.reviewText: Pescatore. Great restaurant,great service,good food.
review.locationRemarks: Cleaning staff. Sheets not changed for a week.

review.title: Overpriced for what you get
review.reviewText: Nothing special about this hotel. Rooms are very small, felt like we were staying in a closet, and the nice view they said they would give us was of a wall. We didn't have a bad experience, but I would recommend saving your money and staying further away from the pier.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: When Roy, the young man that checked us in, found out that it was our 25th anniversary & that we had spent our honeymoon there & had returned to spend a night celebrating this anniversary too, he sent a bottle of champagne & discounted our parking rate. Such wonderful service from the time you pull into the valet parking lot, until you leave. Our valet was Matt & he was very helpful too. Roy recommended a wonderful nearby restaurant where the service was impeccable too. The Tuscan is a special place to stay with lovely, soothing decor with a wonderful staff.

review.title: Walking distance to almost everything.
review.reviewText: Don't rent or take a car.  Use the shuttle. Use the bart, cable cars,  or buses. ..parking per night is $50..Ridiculous.  plus everything is within walking distance. Parking meters are worse! That's my only complaint. .the hotel should at least give a discounted rate on parking if you stay more than a few days.

review.title: Close to the wharf
review.reviewText: If not necessary, don't take a car.  No reduced parking fees. $35+ without in/out privileges. This hotel was $50 with in/out privileges.  Had a few issues with keys and parking but the staff worked to resolve all issues. Hotel was conveniently located to the wharf and restaurants, all within walking distance. Hop on bus was also close.  Worth the money to take you to 16 different destinations in the city.    Make sure you check out what is going on in the city before you go.  We thought we were going on off season but ended up in SF during Fleet Week - a million people estimated to be there.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the wharf.

review.title: Very small room
review.reviewText: Staff were not friendly; helpful but not friendly; room was clean but very small.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: There were mixed reviews of this hotel online.  Disregard them.  I recommend this hotel. Solid 4 star hotel with great location, great staff, nice food.  Fully recommend this hotel.

review.title: Enjoyable, right where we wanted to be.
review.reviewText: Lots of walking and things to see and do.  Traffic was very congested.  Difficult to find parking but overall experience good.  Must allow more time, at least 3 to 4 days.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was very small.
review.locationRemarks: Good, lots to do and see.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Overall room size was a bit small, need more space for clothes, yet clean & comfortable. Lobby was nice as was the staff. They no longer offer a "wine reception" in the evening. The new owner did away with it. It was replaced with a 3-6 happy hour everyday at the bar in the restaurant. Which included drink & food deals. Food was good as were the drinks.  Cable car stop/turn around was right behind the hotel! Many things to see within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant & bar had a great staff. Eddie was a awesome bartender! Food was very good and happy hour prices were a great deal.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower price for parking. Increase space for clothes!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Warf & Cable car stop.

review.title: Hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Fast check in & out with quiet room to back of the building.
review.positiveRemarks: Free access to drinking water at the lobby for hotel guests. Roomy elevators. Friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to the cable car turn about, especially during the morning hours where there is no line up to contend with. Steps away from shopping area.

review.title: Wonderful Location!!!
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel!  Great location, clean rooms and friendly staff!  Fabulous Italian Restaurant on corner!!!  Highly recommended!
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi connection was not that great.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf just two blocks, our bus pickup right around the corner and lots of good food in the area!!!

review.title: Conveniently located,  great value
review.reviewText: Older hotel, however room was pleasant. Hotel was located close to attractions. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Concierge very helpful.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Been to San Francisco a number of times and prefer the location of fishermans wharf area and hotel right in the middle, very convenient. We had a room with a great view of the Coit Tower on the forth floor. Room not massive but very clean and bright, didn't go there to sit in the room anyway.  Noise from outside could be heard but didn't find it exceptionally noisy at night.  Tea and coffee available in morning at reception and great to have a complimentary glass of wine after sight seeing all day. Very nice hotel and would not hesitate to book when hopefully back in San Francisco in future.

review.title: No views out the window just a solid brick wall
review.reviewText: The best feature of this hotel is its location. It's close to the trolley, the tour buses, and all the perks of fisherman's wharf.  Most of the staff were Okay some not very friendly.

review.title: Great accommodations near Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Clean hotel with very friendly staff. Complimentary newspaper along with tea and coffee in the morning .  We enjoyed the ready access to Fishermans Wharf. Lots of dining options nearby.

review.title: Great location, tiny room.
review.reviewText: Tuscan Inn is in an excellent location if you want to be within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square.  The standard room with a King bed is very tight so you won't want to spend a lot of time there.  Room was nicely furnished and we'll maintained. Parking is expensive at $57 / night but you are paying for location. Overall, a nice place to stay.

review.title: Pleasantly Suprised with reduced cost hotel
review.reviewText: This hotels is not your typical Best Western that you visited as a kid. It is very sophisticated, nice decor, friendly staff and cozy rooms. The bed, although a little too firm for me, was mostly comfortable and the pillows were comfy after a long day running around SF. Got a great deal for under $300 per night which was better than most others in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: An included breakfast in the rate.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance to Peir 39, Maritime museum, sailing trips, Girardelli Square and Trollies

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We only stayed 1 night but the room was clean and the staff was great. We got into town early and were able to check in around 12:30 pm which gave us more time to enjoy the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: We did the Red and White Fleet boat tour of Alcatraz and The Golden Gate Bridge and would recommend it if you are looking for a quick tour of the bay.

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to fishemans wharf.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Love the wine hour. I only wish it had a complimentary breakfast. Otherwise awesome!!
Toilet clogged and it took staff 24 hours to fix it. We had to use the public bathroom on the main floor.

review.title: Good location for Alcatraz ferry
review.reviewText: Asked for a quiet room and had one. Really comfortable bed.

review.title: Nice hotel in Perfect Spot.
review.reviewText: Good Bad, clean and close to everything. Perfect!!!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was very accessible and close to the Wharf. The room was small but who cares as we were only there to sleep. The room was clean however the toilet barely flushed. Overall it was a good value especially with the daily wine hour!

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: We came to SF for my birthday weekend, and The Tuscan was a perfect choice for our hotel.  From the time we arrived until our departure the staff was warm, welcoming, and helpful!  The hotel is in the perfect location.  We walked everywhere.. the piers, the Ferry House, Chinatown, Russian Hill.  The bus stop was right by the hotel with Trolleys a few blocks down.  Great restaurants were only steps away!  The room was super comfy.  Everyone was friendly!  Loved the glass of wine we received at check in and the wine reception every night.  The restaurant was very good also.  I would go back to this hotel the next time we are lucky enough to go to San Francisco!!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was so gracious!  They did everything to make us feel at home!
review.negativeRemarks: The heating/cooling system.  The room was warm, and could only be made cooler when we turned the temp down to 64.  Then it was too cold.
review.locationRemarks: Everything you would want to do:  shops, restaurants, tours of SF, boat tours of the Bay, wine bars, seafood in little stands.  Fun things!

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: down by fisherman's wharf; but transportation to everywhere close by  quiet and clean..
review.negativeRemarks: could have breakfast instead of wine in the evening.
review.locationRemarks: two blocks from pier39, with buses and tours for everywhere.  one block from trolly ride downtown.

review.title: Great location, great staff, & nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was small but very neat and clean.  I have stayed at the Tuscan for both work and pleasure and highly recommend staying there.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is really nice. Location is great. The staff was wonderful. From the doorman, front desk staff and the manager on duty we were treated like royalty. My wife and I highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf. Nice restaurants.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText:
Right in the middle of everything and so close you can walk to just about everything
Restaurants, Sightseeing, Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great hotel close to everything
Happy Hour of free wine a real bonus!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a couple blocks off of the main street that runs along the wharf. Can walk to several different restaurants and points of interest. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was on the smaller side, but very clean and comfortable. Would recommend.

review.title: Great Hotel, very close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, went out of way to make sure stay met our expectations.

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf but expensive!
review.reviewText:
Stayed here after a lot of research into reviews of hotels in the area. The prices are expensive in this area. I expect a Sydney CBD 5 star hotel with breakfast, valet parking and dinner/drinks to be included. I was pretty disappointed at the room and some things about the hotel. The person who checked us in was very friendly and helpful, cant fault him at all. The valet fee (plus tax!) was excessive and would honestly expect it to be included for the price per night of this hotel. There was no breakfast included, one day we did go to the restaurant and have some. It was reasonably priced but the menu layout was confusing. I thought it included toast, eggs, bacon and sausage or another item. But alas, it was bacon or sausage or other item. Did not realise until it arrived.
Free tea and coffee each morning in the foyer and wine reception at night. Hotel is close to Fishermans Wharf but there was a lot of homeless people around walking to/from here.
The room itself was quite small and no blockout curtains so the sun came in at the crack of dawn. Only Plantation shutters were in there. The bathroom had a showerhead that was about to fall out and extremely noisy fan. The rooms need updating, the cupboards are old and tired. The TV had a line down the screen of dead pixels and several channels didnt work.
review.negativeRemarks: Room style, curtains, showerheads not falling out.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39

review.title: Great hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: Attentive professional staff who responded quickly to any requests and issues

review.title: Near Warf
review.reviewText: Overall very good. Adjacent Pescatore Restaurant was excellent.

review.title: Great Fisherman's wharf location
review.reviewText: Overnight stay with kids. Great location within walking distance of wharf, Ghiradelli Square/Cannery. Trolley/cable car lines one block away. Very clean and comfortable with friendly welcoming staff. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Getting ready for a dinner cruise

review.title: Perfect location with great staff!
review.reviewText: This is our 2nd time at this location & it was just as great as the 1st! This is definitely our place to stay when visiting SF. The staff is awesome & helpful & remembered us from our last visit. During our previous visit we left a pair of binoculars in the room & they were kind enough to mail them to us. It's a perfect location & we love the wine hour where we get to mingle with the guest & meet great people!
Enjoyable stay, location meant easy to return to during day if necessary

review.title: Rude staff.. No views. Expensive parking.
review.reviewText: Was treated poorly. One of the managers was very rude when I asked a question.

review.title: Older hotel, close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText:
This older hotel was just okay. Our room was very small. I would rather have free breakfasts than the wine at happy hour, since the attached restaurant was very expensive. Our window looked out at a wall!
The location was great though, since it is 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: My husband and I have been to San Francisco a few times for vacation and seem to be drawn to this area of town.  It's close to the Pier 39 area, as well as the famous Buena Vista bar/restaurant (known for their whiskey coffee).  There's a grocery/Walgreens nearby, as well as a wash/fold laundry close by (for those who do not like to travel back home with dirty laundry......drop off your clothes and have them back same day).  Oh and don't forget the Hollywood Cafe!  They serve breakfast/lunch and give you ample portions.  Don't ever let the wait deter you....they will take your order while you wait in line and the food will be ready when you sit down. The restaurant attached to hotel is great and the wait staff as well.  Ask for Marlo! Enjoy!
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the happy hour each evening, the restaurant, the front desk, maids, and guys who open the door with a smile each time!
review.negativeRemarks: We found our experience to be perfect.
review.locationRemarks: Stated above.

review.title: Convenient location to fishermans wharf, cable car
review.reviewText: Parking is an extra 50 per night   Close to Golden Gate Bridge and Sausalito.

review.title: Hotel was clean and close to wharf
review.reviewText: I felt as if I was in a prison cell. The rooms are too small for the price charged.

review.title: Amazing Staff
review.reviewText: This hotel has an amazing hardworking and friendly staff. The hotel is itself is nice and my room was larger than I'd been prepared for. After moving from the 4th (top) floor because of cigarette smoke odour, I was given the same room on the second floor #236. There nothing wrong with the hotel or room except that you can hear EVERYTHING outside the street. Every word of conversations as people pass by. Yelling and screaming at 2am. Drunk people passing by at 3am. People leaving for the airport at 5am. Footsteps from the room above me. It's too bad since I liked the location at The Wharf; you should know that there is a noticable number of homeless and travellers begging in the Wharf area though. You also have to take a cab to non-touristy dining, with the exception of Albona Italian nearby, according to the concierge. Albona had delicious cuisine with average service but it's not a scenic location. I'd like to give it a higher rating as the bed was comfortable, the room was charming, the staff was excellent and there was a free wine and snack reception 5-6pm every night - and the Chardonnay was not bad - but being kept up all night by noise ruined it. Sound proofing - better windows maybe? There has to be a way to fix this. I should mention the noise was a problem only the second night. Maybe less people were out Monday night.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, service, room look and bed comfort, cleanliness, location. Close to transportation - bus and trolley.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing! Noise from the street was a big problem all through the night on Tuesday.
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf, sea lions, art, expensive waterside dining (but good). Near Trolley and hop off and on bus. Touristy shops. Great views of the bay.

review.title: Great hotel in location to many attractions
review.reviewText: Very clean and nice rooms. Beds are very comfortable

review.title: nice stay by the pier
review.reviewText: small clean room, free wine and pizza in the lobby 5-6, no pool, yes fridge, hallways are a maze, near everything, china town, trader joes, food by the pier, shopping, trolly, very nice staff, nice stay overall.

review.title: Very convenient location. No breakfast provided.
review.reviewText:
Valet parking only. $50 a day. No self parking. Room was fairly small for the price. Only one queen bed.             








.........

review.title: Great weekend
review.reviewText:
Checked in on Friday early and everyone was great.
rooms were nice , every thing was close by . We will be staying there again.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of stuff to do , very clean around the hotel

review.title: Good location...comfortable...great breakfast
review.reviewText: Everything was as I expected..I .would stay again. In particular I liked the morning breakfast. I also liked the supply of towels available for me and my grandson..

review.title: No points
review.reviewText: They would not give me Best Western points because i booked through Expedia

review.title: Great find on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, very kind & helpful staff. Room was very clean. Hotel Restaurant was great with delicious food.

review.title: Clean/comfortable hotel close to Fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay, courteous staff, clean and comfortable room, nice touch with free coffee in the morning, water coolers in lobby and free wine in the evenings in the lobby. Hotel is very centrally located and within  walking distance to many sights. Pretty quiet area.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, free wine in the evenings in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be a bit larger and we did have a small leak in our bathroom under the sink that never got fixed although I had told the front desk.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in the Fishermans Wharf area. Walking distance to many sights, restaurants, shops, etc. Very good location.

review.title: Nice hotel with good restaurant.  Staff helpful.
review.reviewText: We had a nice time.  Hotel was nice, with good food in their restaurant and very helpful staff.  A great location at fisherman's wharf.  So convenient.

review.title: Nice hotel close to wharf.
review.reviewText: Wharf area remains very dirty with trash and dirty sidewalks. Hotel is located at a nice jumping off point for buses, walking to non tourist restarants.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby much to small.  No outdoor seating

review.title: Hotel was close to Big Basin National park.
review.reviewText: We stayed here in order to close to Big Basin.  Check was easy.  Staff was very nice.  Landscaping and pool were nice, but rooms need some renovation
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a little worn down.
review.locationRemarks: Santa Cruz, Monterey & Big Basin.

review.title: Close to the Wharf and all the action!
review.reviewText: We used our hotel primarily just to sleep or rest between outings.  It was so easy to walk down to the Fisherman's Wharf area, to get to Pier 39, or to walk to Lombard street.  The room was clean and felt updated and met our needs perfectly.

review.title: its a nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Located near the portal. The room is big and clearn

review.title: 21st Birthday Getaway!!!
review.reviewText: Fabulous time with best friends!!!  Comfortable room, very clean and close to Pier 39 and walking distance to great tourist attractions!

review.title: Parking wY too expensive!
review.reviewText: Very small rooms. The location is convient for Fishermans Wharf but not worth the price. Parking is $50 plus $7 in tax per night. Crazy to pay $57 to park for one night.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf close by.

review.title: Wine tasting
review.reviewText: In the evening, they have a wine tasting which was so nice. Also it was our 25th Anniversary and they made it even more special by giving us champagne. Special touches are so nice!
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the staff....so helpful, kind and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.... The gardens were beautiful.
review.locationRemarks: We walked all over....so much to see!

review.title: The Tuscan-warm and friendly; fun location
review.reviewText:
We (wife, husband and 23 yr old son) were visiting our daughter and boyfriend, newly moved to San Francisco. We wanted to be somewhat close to their new place and The Tuscan fit the bill. The reviews were encouraging, so we booked it for 5 nights. It was a very pleasant surprise! The staff, accomodations and ambiance were lovely. The guests were from all over the globe,making it feel very cosmopolitan.We particularily enjoyed the morning coffe bar (free) and the 5pm wine bar with fresh pizza (free). At both times, the warm, comfy lobby was filled with happy guests.
 Located a block or so from Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero (the only "flat" area in town), the area is very walkable. Cabs and street cars were readily available nearby. Yes, the area was crowded,but we were there at the peak of the tourist season (August). San Francisco is a "sanctuary city" so be prepared to find people living on the streets.
review.positiveRemarks: Just about everything! We didn't eat in the restaurant,but it was busy and the food and wood-fired oven smelled great.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no view from The Tuscan, but the warmth and charm inside makes up for that. Go out for the beautiful views!
review.locationRemarks: The location is excellent for tours of Alcatraz,the bay and bike rentals. The old restaurants on the wharf are worth a try. Avoid crowds,eat inside.

review.title: Rip-off ...I'm sure there's better value out there
review.reviewText:
Last minute booking, wanted Fisherman's Wharf; but ended up paying over $500 a night (the price leapt $100/night whilst I was booking) .. so I guess that's my own fault. However it's the only hotel we've stayed in the US that doesn't have slippers and a gown and the bath-room set-up was a joke: to switch the light on to use the toilet flooded the bedroom with light (no door to the sink area); if you came out the (world's smallest?) bathroom the door would knock into anyone standing the in the (world's smallest?) shaving/sink area.

But it was the valet prices ($50/nt plus tax) that were the real shock!! It's the most expensive we've seen, and we've been in Vegas, LA and New York.

The staff made up for the Corporate-greed and were light-hearted and helpful.  The valet brought the laundry ("the same guy will do both") and the room cleaners hardly spoke English.

Has put me off Best Westerns (world wide)
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly valet and lobby staff
review.negativeRemarks: The size of the bath-rooms, put a sliding door to keep light out the bedroom.  The carpets were very dirty looking. Provide options for parking
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is good to walk-about

review.title: ok stay
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were not personable except manager. Hotel lobby was nice and fruit water was nice touch. Some days our room was cleaner than others, one day we had dirty pillowcase and hair on bathroom floor.  The door men were always polite and helpful and most consistent w good service.  The homeless people sleeping on sidewalk few steps outside the door was unnerving and there was a constant smell of urine.
review.positiveRemarks: Fruit water and it was quiet in rooms. Close location to walk to many restaurants, sites and shopping.
review.locationRemarks: Wharf but it was to crowded in afternoon and evening.

review.title: Very comfortable & close to wharf!
review.reviewText: Perfect location for us. Walking distance to wharf, Pier 39, shopping, dining, and across the street from Budget rental car office so we were able to drop car off and walk to hotel. Staff was friendly & helpful, attractive, clean rooms & beds were very comfortable. Enjoyed our stay very much! Will stay here again!

review.title: very walkable to wharf area and farther if you so
review.reviewText: we were only there briefly so as to meet up with others so location was important
review.locationRemarks: Wharf

review.title: Pricey
review.reviewText: I've stayed in much nicer hotels for a third of the price close to pier 33, ghiradelli square

review.title: Close to wharf   we walked almost everywhere.
review.reviewText: We loved being able to walk to so many locations.   Wonderful stay.  Staff was very helpful in direction to different places.  Would stay there again anytime.

review.title: Wonderful location!
review.reviewText: We loved the location near Fisherman’s Wharf, bus tours and trolley line. Small but very comfortable and quiet room, great bedding. AM coffee and PM wine in lobby.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Decent hotel. Clean room and helpful staff. Hallway carpet looks real old. $50/night parking charge if you have a car. Park in a local lot to save a few bucks if you don't mind the hassle. Nice location close to Wharf.

review.title: Close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Our hotel was perfect for our goal to be close to everything "touristy". We walked Fisherman's Wharf, road bikes across the Golden Gate, went to the beach, took the ferry to tour Alcatraz. It was such a perfect hotel to put you just close enough to all the action. It's only two short blocks from the crowded Wharf. There are hotels closer, but then you truly never get a break from the commotion. This hotel has a fantastic restaurant. The staff were very helpful. Hotel rooms were quiet, comfortable and clean. A perfect place to stay!

review.title: Great location. Staff was exceptionally helpful.
review.reviewText: Morning coffee and newspapers in lobby, also cold water with lemon or orange flavoring available all day a nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Staff friendliness, desire and ability to help. Hotel cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Large bathroom is good, but needs more counter space around the sink. Also, shower is level with the bathroom floor, which becomes wet and slippery.
review.locationRemarks: Located at Fisherman's Wharf. Lots of transportation and city tours available.

review.reviewText: the room is very small and bathroom is very small too

review.title: Location thats all
review.reviewText: Old hotel with very little to offer other then location. Not very much in the area as far as good hotels. It lives up to the standard. The room smelled of cigarette smoke. We told the people at the desk but all the sad was ok and offered no concession. Overall it was just ok.

review.title: Nice hotel for price and location
review.reviewText: I reserved 2 rooms for one night. It was unfortunate that they were on separate floors. Each room was small but with a very  comfortable bed. The kids slept well on the sofa bed, but there was no space between the bed and sofa bed when it was open. it was in great walking distance to many activities. The valet parking was less expensive than most hotels downtown. I would stay here again.

review.title:
Close to Fisherman's wharf
Streets rooms are noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a convenient location. Quick walk to Fisherman's Wharf and easy to catch the trolley.  If you get a room overlooking the street I would ask for another room not facing north. The street is ridiculously noisy at all hours with traffic and trucks etc. also, they charge $50 a night parking.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice and said they would switch my room but the place was sold out.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure
review.locationRemarks:
Fisherman's Wharf
Cable cars
Grocery store
Starbucks

review.title: Great location.  Lots to do in the area.
review.reviewText: Visiting friends who showed us around the city.  Location of hotel was very convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs new carpet

review.title: Nice hotel close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: My family really enjoyed our stay as hotel staff were always pleasant and helpful.  Hotel has average size rooms but were clean. Has a nice lobby where they serve free (and decent) coffee each morning and have a wine service each afternoon. We had some cool evenings so it was nice to sit by the gas fireplace and read while enjoying the wine.  The on site Italian restaurant serves a great breakfast and has large sliding windows so we had great breezes even eating indoors.  There is a concierge to assist with local activities though we did not use this service.  For any future trips this would be my first choice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was within walking distance to many attractions, transportation, and restaurants. Rooms were nice and well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: Not all rooms have street views. We had a view of a courtyard which was not interesting but it had flowers and plants so it was at least pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from the Wharf but we often walked to attractions like Coit Tower. Lombard St. and some great little restaurants in the neighborhood

review.title: Consistent Quality
review.reviewText: My cousin and I took our mothers on a four-day trip to San Francisco and we stayed at the Tuscan because of its location. I had stayed there during a business trip in 1991 and I had enjoyed my stay. It did not disappoint this time around. The staff was great, especially our concierge Hadia who made our trip memorable by booking the best excursions for us. The hotel is elegant and inviting with its warm Italian decor. Wine hour was a perfect segue to dinner, and they even served pizza snacks with the wine. Overall it was the perfect home base as we explored the city by the bay.

review.title: Location!
review.reviewText: Location was everything about this hotel. One block from Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, Trolley and numerous shopping and restaurants. The room was very nice and the beds were comfortable. Valet was super easy even though it costs a fortune. The hotel staff was nice, but we didn't have to deal with them other than check in/out. Rooms were clean and I loved the bay window that you can open up to fresh air.

review.title: Great Fisherman's Wharf hotel.
review.reviewText: Room was small considering how expensive hotel was.  But, believe price was in line with other hotels walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf.  Easy walk to Pier 39 and all tour buses.   Loved wine reception in the evening.  Staff is exceptional.  Pillows were soft and plentiful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  Also, sink was outside bathroom and made it easy for multiple people to get ready at same time.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and a few blocks down from Pier 39.  Shopping opportunities and views are everywhere.

review.reviewText: Nice lobby, quick check in. Staff pleasant helpful. Rooms clean on arrival but the daily clean up while you r there was not so great. Bathrooms not cleaned well and shampoo , soap etc not replaced despite the obvious empty container.  I also find it rediculous that a room that occupies 4 would supply one tiny container of shampoo and conditioner. I was so annoyed that I finally complained and they were very appologetic and gave me a bottle of complementary wine. The location is good for the activities which depart from the pier but the area is way too crowded and full of tourists.  The first half of our trip we stayed in union square which we enjoyed much more.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and thank you for your feedback. I'm very sorry that we fell short of your expectations. While we are a 3 Star property, based on Expedia ratings and feedback we have been given a 4 Star Expedia rating. I'm sorry for any confusion or misunderstanding. We wish you safe travels.

review.title: Great loc., outdat. noisy room - fooled by Expedia
review.reviewText: Room too small, lacks double pane sound proof windows in rooms facing street. 80's decor. Shaby for $350 per night. Fooled by Expedia by using the Mystery hotel feature advertised as 4 star hotel, more like a 2 1/2 star.

review.title: Very small room had to pay for upgrade.
review.reviewText: Not great. Very limited facilities. Over rices for what was on offer.

review.title: Smallest Room
review.reviewText: This is the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in.  The only upside to this hotel is the location.

review.title: Disappointing Vacation
review.reviewText: Rooms were too small and in need of painting and refinishing.  I was told I had adjoining rooms with my granddaughters when checking with the hotel 2 weeks prior to our vacation and when I arrived we had 2 separate rooms and we were not happy.  I did not like being away from my granddaughters in a strange city, even though they were 2 doors down.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are in need of updating
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants and food

review.title: Great location, small rooms, dirty carpets
review.reviewText: First impression- nice lobby, friendly staff, perfect location to fishermans wharf. Room was small but sufficient, carpets could really stand to be shampooed or replaced to freshen up the smell and appearance- there were many stains. Room service is limited and very expensive.
We had a small but very nice room. Great access to the wharf, restaurants, shopping, cable cars

review.title: Great hotel at a convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel is at a great spot.  You really don't need a car after you checked in.  You can walk to fishermans wharf, coit tower and the trolley station.  Once you get to the trolley station, you can take the trolley to go to Chinatown etc.

review.title: Location and Experience
review.reviewText: We spent two nights and had a wonderful time, the hotel is located right next to Fishermans Wharf which seems to be the central hub for all of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The complementary wine was excellent.  The rooms were comfortable and nice,  a little small, but we weren't there much.  The staff was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: My wife missed the complementary breakfast the other Best Westerens had. The car parking was a little high, but the car was safe.
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't ask for a better location ,  the hotel sites a couple of short blocks from Fishermans Wharf San Francisco.  Our car stayed in the parking lot

review.title: Nice hotel walking distance to Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel location, bonus cocktail hour, helpful staff and clean.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Union Square

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Spacious room, bathroom a little small but adequate. Typical wall air conditioner noise and when off there was a little dull roar from their air conditioning unit on the roof. We had an inside room so no street noise. Refrigerator in the room with small amount of drinks and eats but still room to put in your own stuff. Check in clerk did not tell us at check in that they add 20% to the cost of the room for "security fee" but when we saw the charge on our card that night we asked and they said it was for "incidentals" and we would not be charged if we didn't have any. Never had that done in advance before, but no problem, it was taken off promptly on checkout and charged the correct amount. $50. fee for parking. Coffee and Teas in the lobby each morning. Free newspapers except on Sunday it's $3.00. Very easy walk to the Wharf and good restaurants. Actually a good restaurant right at the hotel. Very happy with the room, would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: spacious comfortable room, and comfortable bed. Coffee and Tea in room (actually no tea bags, might be an oversight, but I had my own)
review.negativeRemarks: One bad thing was to turn on the bathroom light it also turned on the light over the outside sink and woke me up at 4 am when my husband turned it on.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from the Wharf and Pier 39. About a mile and a half from Union Square. museums, Aquarium, Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Awesome place to stay.
review.reviewText: Location is perfect for easy access to all the best attractions in town.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel helped us book all of our bus tours, bike tours, and many other attractions and restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: The bike trip across the bridge and ferry ride back to town was the best. I will be planning to do that again the next time we go to the Bay area.

review.title: Perfect location and comfort
review.reviewText: Walking distance to restaurants & activities. Very comfy bed. Not huge room, but adequate. Attached restaurant was nice with delicious food.  Would return again!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located two blocks from Fisherman´s Wharf and turning point for street car. People at the front desk were friendly and nice. We stayed two nights and everything was ok. Even housekeeping personnel was very nice, and left extra bath ammenities for us.
Beware of the parking cost, not only in the hotel, but in the surrounding area.
Trader Joe's and Safeway are close to the hotel, so you can safe some in meals/drinks.
review.locationRemarks: The location is excellent and the area seems to be safe. Parking cost in the surrounding area is really high.

review.title: Greasy location close to everything in Fisherman's
review.reviewText: Concierge gave us wrong information on 2 occasions. Disappointing!😒

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO FUN
review.reviewText:
My daughter, 4 month old granddaughter, and I spent 2 days and a night in San Francisco just to have a girl escape. 
 This hotel provided location, comfort, friendliness, and security we were looking for. Having happy hour wine tasting was a plus. We met several families. We walked from city center through China town, North Beach and ended at Pier 39. Woke up next day and we walked across the Golden Gate. Great hotel experience.

review.title: Good all round hotel
review.reviewText: Free wine between 5 and 6pm is a great touch. Romms are not the biggest but served a purpose. Good location easy 5 min walk to the sea front or opposote direction to get on a tram/cable car to the centre.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast could be cheaper as although it is very nice you can get the same at a local cafe for less.
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz pick up/drop off point is 15 min walk away. Pleanty of resturants nearby however be prepared to be disapointed by the quality of local food!!

review.title: Nice hotel easy to get to anything,
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly & helpful. Hotel location is prime. A block off the beaten path, close to any transportation you could want. I must mention the beds were comfortable. Room had a bit of a musty smell, but not bad, didn't notice it until we walked in in the evening. Housekeeping did a graat job as well. Not really there a whole lot but to cleanup and sleep. Enjoy the town, it's awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower the price a bit or offer free breakfast or something,
review.locationRemarks: It is 1 block off the main drag, which is great, because the main drag is busy and you don't want that.

review.title: Excellent location, very clean, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Overall a great hotel. Rooms are a little small so expect that but I would stay again.

review.title: Walk to everything
review.reviewText: Great hotel but hidden parking charges of 57.00 a night don't park there

review.title: Super nice hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing, the room was amazing, and it was at a great price! I will definitely be going back!

review.title: Decent motel close to Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location, but did not get the room that is pictured in their ad. Only 1 room has a fireplace and did not have a separate living space as pictured in the ad. Fee to park was very overpriced.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms and friendly staff. Location is good.
review.negativeRemarks: No parking without paying a large additional fee. Rooms are not as advertised, they show a suite but you get a basic room.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf and everything San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: 4th of July 2015
review.reviewText: We arrived early and figured we would try to check in early. We asked and without batting an eyelash we had our room keys in hand. Very pet friendly! Treats everywhere at the ready. Then there are the beds! Best beds ever, I really get a good nights rest when staying there. This will be our second time there and will stay there when ever I'm SF.

review.title: stay was perfect
review.reviewText: One night stay was perfect. Made us wish we would have stayed for more. Only down side is they only have a valet parking option.
Hotel was clean and staff was helpful. I was a little disappointed with the small size of the room and the $50 parking fee that was not included in the price of the room.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
Check in : Waited in line for close to 10 mins. as there was only one check in person. 
Rooms: Good size, comfortable bed, air conditioner worked well. Furniture shows age!
Bathrooms: Needs updating, shows age, needs overhaul. Bathroom amenities 3 out of 5.
Staff: Friendly and helpful
This hotel does not offer breakfast packages, but a la carte is available at their restaurant Pescatore.
review.locationRemarks:
5 min walk to Fisherman's Wharf
2 min walk to Greyline tours
Starbucks Trader Joes & Ross around the corner

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a very tourist area so there are always people around. Its a short walk to Pier 39 and if you're up for it you can walk all the way to the Embarcadero. There's a CVS and Walgreens very close to the hotel for any neceseties.

review.title: Very clean and convenient,with helpful staff!
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 days in late June.  We loved the location at Fisherman's Wharf.  The area seemed safe and it was in close proximity to all the restaurants, shops and activities at the waterfront but it wasn't noisy at all.  The staff was pleasant and very helpful.  The room was small, but that seemed to be the case everywhere and it was very clean..  We loved the complimentary apples,and water and took advantage of the coffee and hot beverages offered for free in the morning.  We would have loved to have a work-out room, but space is at a premium in SF and we understood that!
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the cleanliness, staff, frige in the room and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: We would have loved a complimentary continental breakfast and a work-out room!
review.locationRemarks: The location was good-it seemed safe, there was a Trader Joes and a drugstore nearby to get essentials.We could walk to restaurants, shops and ferries

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf. Friendly staff. Happy Hour.

review.title: My first stay at The Tuscan- excellent.
review.reviewText: There is only one word for my stay at The Tuscan. EXCELLENT in every way.
review.positiveRemarks: everything all the history, location, comfortable room.

review.title: Convenient and stylish with a great price tag!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay here. It was very affordable compared to other hotels in the area. Rooms were small but very nice and well equipped. (Perfect for us!) The staff was very helpful and friendly and you just can't beat the location. We were able to get anywhere and see lots of sights during our very short stay!

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location on fisherman wharf. Cordial, helpful staff.

review.title: Great style & attention to guests
review.reviewText: Tremendous value for the money with. Sense of true hospitality usually seen only in hotels of much higher price. The Kimpton sensibility is very present here-with fine results!

review.title: Nice basic hotel close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: The Tuscan is in a very convenient location. The rooms are small, but clean and the beds are comfortable. Nothing special, but not bad for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was the best aspect. Hotel staff were helpful. Room was clean, but nothing special. The bathroom was tiny.
review.negativeRemarks: Tried to eat lunch at the restaurant. We were seated and then completely ignored for almost ten minutes. We finally got up and left.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the Fisherman's Wharf. There are many activities and restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Great location in Fisherman's Wharf area.
review.reviewText: Great location near Fishermans Wharf.  Room was a bit small but ok. Front desk and concierge very helpful
review.positiveRemarks: Evening wine reception, coffee in lobby in the morning - nice to  have some free amenities.

review.title: Great location, but very busy.
review.reviewText: Ideal location but rather impersonal. Room request ignored, and ground floor room at street level. No assistance offered to try and change the room. Restaurant fine for breakfast, but dinner overpriced and poor standard compared to other restaurants available.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, nicely appointed room with comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Reception service, better security on street level windows, safety deposit box in room, quality of evening menu.
review.locationRemarks: Right at Fisherman's Wharf and ideally located to tour on tourist buses. Most of major attractions accessible.

review.title: Pleasant Hotel
review.reviewText: Check in was fast and the staff are friendly, was a little apprehensive walking down the corridor to our room as the hall way carpeting looked a bit out dated and dirty but was pleasantly surprised when we entered the room. The Hotel offered free afternoon drinks for which I didn't attend but they also offered coffee and tea in the mornings and that I was grateful for :)  even though they had coffee making facility in room. I would stay here again if I was to return to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, Nice room and coffee offered in the lobby in the mornings
review.negativeRemarks: a separate light switch for the bathroom ( not just one for powder room and bathroom)
review.locationRemarks: it is the perfect location, close to pier 39, ride across Golden gate bridge and  ferry back, cable tram , hop on hope off bus and Alcatraz

review.reviewText: My granddaughter and I had a wonderful and memorable visit to San Francisco.  I will remember this special time forever.
review.negativeRemarks: Add another chair to our bedroom.
review.locationRemarks: Since it is located two blocks from the wharf, all of the activities and sights are readily available.

review.title: Loved
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel is perfect! Right in the middle of fishermans wharf and walking distance to many popular touristy places. Front desk and concierge were very helpful as well! Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Convenient to wharf and other touristy places
review.reviewText: We were so tired by the end of the day, we slept soundly regardless of any road noise - but there was some because you are in the heart of the wharf area. Occasionally we heard sirens or a bus, but it was not excessive. We were able to walk to the wharf, Ghirardelli's or catch a cable car easily from this hotel. We had heard a lot about the aggressive homeless people in the area, but did not encounter any such thing. Never felt unsafe walking around, even at night (although when we left the Italian district later than planned, we did ask the best way to walk back to our hotel). It's like any city - have fun but be smart about it.
review.negativeRemarks: Add some lite snacks (i.e. cheese) with the wine served in the lobby in the evenings.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: It is close to everything. It's a walking distance to the wharf, pier 39, cable car, boutiques, lombard street etc, etc
review.positiveRemarks: you feel like home. In the morning,, coffee is available at the crception desk for the early bird. In the afternoon, at 05:00 , you have wine everyday

review.title: The hotel was close to everything!!
review.reviewText: We walked to embarcadero, fishermans wharf, our alcatraz tour.  The staff was friendly and helpful with recommendations.

review.title: Birthday Getaway
review.reviewText: Needs bigger sign out front because its easy to pass up.  Parking should be included in price.  Valet is the only option but can come in and out all day.  It gets expensive to tip the valet every time.  Close to Fisherman's Wharf, shops and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf, shops and restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: Include parking with hotel rate

review.title: Uneven Experience.
review.reviewText: It was an uneven experience. Complimentary morning coffee and happy hour in the lobby was appreciated. Our room was quiet and the staff was pleasant, yet when we arrived we had no clean wash clothes and there was a soiled one on the floor. We complained and they brought some clean clothes, but did not remove the soiled one. The bathroom was poorly designed with far too few towel racks, hooks and shelves. A heavy door separated the sink from the room that contained the tub, shower, and toilet. One light switch controlled lights in both areas, so our hope to use the dimmest bathroom light as a night light was not realized and we were forced to leave on all the bathroom lights and shut the heavy door, but the bedroom was still too brightly lit for happy sleeping. If we'd turned off the bathroom lights, there wouldn't have been enough light to see our way to the bathroom. The concierge was helpful and the hotel location was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, pleasant staff, free coffee and happy hour in lobby, quiet room.
review.negativeRemarks: Design of the bathroom area.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and thank you for the feedback. We are continually trying to keep our hotel up to date and we'll be remodeling our guest rooms towards the end of 2016. We hope you liked our recently remodeled lobby and reception area and we also hope your time in SF was a fabulous experience.

review.title: Location was great
review.reviewText: Location was great but the hotel needs some updating.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for staying with us, I'm sorry to learn of your experience and hope you are doing well.

We acknowledge that all hotels have the potential for the presence of bed bugs. As of yet, there’s no x-ray machine or sensor to tell us that a particular guest may be bringing in bed bugs, but Kimpton has one of the most comprehensive and aggressive plans in place to detect and remediate bed bugs at the earliest possible instance.

• Our housekeeping and engineering teams continually undergo extensive training for detection, isolation and remediation.
• We do not wait for a complaint before taking action. We inspect guest rooms and public areas every single day for bed bugs using comprehensive and diverse methods of detection.
• Upon a sighting or complaint of bed bugs, we contact our outside pest control company which is ready and available to come to inspect and remediate on a 24/7 basis.
• Upon any indication of a potential bed bug issue we immediately implement an isolation plan which involves an extensive quarantine and abatement process.
• The entire process is monitored and supervised by our Sr. Vice President Facilities, our National Director of Facilities and a complete team of Regional Directors, as well as Area and City Directors. In addition, the plan is closely facilitated by each hotel’s Director of Engineering and Director of Housekeeping.
• We take the care and comfort of our guests seriously and welcome your feedback. Once we receive the report back from our pest control company, their findings are shared with our guests.

review.title: Great location, bed bug
review.reviewText:
Front Desk staff was nice. Next morning we found 1 bed bug and I brought it to front desk in a cup. Assistant GM told me he would get pest control specialist to check room and then share findings with me. Of course they didn't find anything. (As if they would tell me that they found bed bugs...) They actually accused me of bringing the critter into the hotel!!! Then they recommended that I go to the near (4 blocks away) coin laundromat and wash all my clothes on the hot cycle. They told us to leave our suitcases in the bathroom where there is no carpeting .Got a different type of room that also was very dusty- like the first one.
In the first room was an opened jar of salsa in the minibar from the previous guests which I told the front desk. They apologized. In the second room was a bra strap in the closet. That tells me that housekeeping supervisor doesn't do their job. They would have failed a corporate inspection on both these rooms.
All together if we would not have found the bed bug, it would have been a great stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms should be checked by housekeeping supervisor.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, CVS close, bus station across the street.

review.title: Very nice hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: We had a very comfortable room overlooking the plaza. The room was good sized, with TV, mini-fridge, queen bed, desk, lounge chair and clean bathroom! All in great condition. We were VERY pleased to find out the hotel  had a daily Wine reception from 5 to 6 pm (which we made all but 1 of our 6 days there). The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We used the Concierge to assist with tours and rental car - very helpful! The only complaint was with the restaurant. We stopped for coffee and dessert our 2nd day. I ordered coffee and the Pear Bread pudding; while my wife ordered a drink and Vanilla Ice Cream. The drinks came correct but we got the Bread Pudding a la mode.... Not the 2 desserts. When I brought it to the servers attention he apologized and brought the ice cream (took a while). Then charged us for the "a la mode" which I never ordered!!! We did have breakfast there one morning after that - but I would NOT go back there again!!
review.positiveRemarks: Good room at reasonable price. Really enjoyed the daily reception, as well as the friendliness of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to unaffiliate with the restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Lots of shopping, attractions, dining and tours nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Piers
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near the Wharf. Within walking distance of Fishermans Wharf, restaurants, cable cars etc.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay.  Close to the wharf.  Friendly staff.  Nice wine reception, comfy beds.

review.title: Good location - but a bit old
review.reviewText: I found the location to be ok I probably would have preferred something closer to Union Square. The hotel looked tired and it needed a bit of a face lift. When I checked in the lady at the desk wanted to take a $300 deposit on my credit card which I thought was quite a bit considering I didnt have a car and had already paid for the room. My room was on street level and every morning at the same time the cafe which is joined to the hotel would drag the tables and chairs outside which would wake me, it was a little noisy, so ask for a room higher up.
review.positiveRemarks: I thought it was a good initiative to save $5 on food at the restaurant in place of not getting your room cleaned each day.
review.negativeRemarks: It seemed old and needed a face lift, also, on the voucher for the restaurant it didnt say you could only use 2 at a time.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf is close by and the hop on hop off bus which was convenient. Close cable car, but expensive and long lines.

review.title: Fine boutique hotel only 2 blocks from Fishermsns
review.reviewText: Personable staff, smaller but comfortable rooms, a hidden gem of a place to stay out of the city but two blocks from the Wharf, great dining, Alcatraz ferry, and fun activities!  Near Ghiradeli Square and Crissy Field.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Right in the middle of it all, walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, tour buses, Alcatraz Ferry, Coit Tower, Lombard St, Littly Italy.

review.title: Nice hotel near everything
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel near to all the touristy trappings, Pier 39,Trams, Alcatraz cruise. A bit overpriced but not unexpected.
Well run and organised and very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The wine hour was a nice touch, room service was good.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location if you want to be walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Alkatraz ferry, on and off bus tours etc.  Rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are friendly and are happy to assist you with any additional requests.   Concierge; Aiyaz Ali is excellent at recommending restaurants etc and booking them for you as well as booking our transportation to and from the hotel and airport with what worked in our schedule.  I would highly recommend this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a direct shuttle from the airport??
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is 2 blocks away

review.title: Happy happy hour customers
review.reviewText: A great hotel in a great position. Free wine in the foyer between 5 & 6 enabled us to meet other guests and exchange travel tails. Right in the tourist area with heaps to do. Very helpful concierge desk with all of the answers open at any time we needed. Wifi was excellent without the usual hiccups.

review.title: Nice hotel close to all interesting place to see i
review.reviewText:
Exelent personal and recomended rest
S F is beatifull city but staying in great hotel as Tuscan is much better
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Nice hotel with excellent service!
review.reviewText: We were greeted with a fantastic smile and two glasses of wine by Tom who is THE most amazing host we have ever encountered. Never have we felt so welcomed and taken care of.  Always willing to go over and above.  As well as nice and clean rooms, they offered a daily happy hour which consisted of an hour of complimentary wine in the lobby.  What a delightful treat.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone!
I was surprised by the 55 dollar parking. I also was disappointed with just coffee in the morning. The view was a block wall 5 ft from the window. Overall not the best experience.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: location was good with quick access to restaurants.

review.reviewText: GREAT RECOMMEND TO ALL WHO WANT TO BE NEAR THE WHARF.

review.title: Convenient n comfortable.
review.reviewText: Carpet dirty.  Wine tasting nice touch.  Super convenient location.  Parking fees should be included.  Never needed our car.  Restaurants close by.  Fridge.  Perfect vacation stay!!!!

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Loved the location as we could walk to most of what we wanted to experience.  Highly recommend the valet parking even though it is pricey.  If you like wine, you will love the late afternoon wine gathering in the lobby.  The staff were all amazing and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower valet parking price.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.reviewText: The location was good for a lot of things. The staff was courteous and professional, especially the room cleaners and doormen.  The attached restaurant, not part of hotel, was okay, service was poor there the one time we were there in the evening.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location, comfortable rooms, walking distance to the wharf and restaurants...just what we were looking for to celebrate our anniversary.

review.title: Hard bed, no view, parking gouge, staff nice tho
review.reviewText: I knew about the 50 bucks to park my car overnight, doesn't mean I liked it. Valet only, too, now I have to worry about a tip. 50 plus tax btw, totaled 57 plus change before tip. To park my car overnight. Room: bed was too hard, view was a big red wall of the business next door, unable to squint enough to see anything else. Wallpaper peeling off at the window in 6 inch pieces. Room was tiny but otherwise clean. Staff was nice though, but we were just staying enough to rest for the next leg of our trip. Not a fan of the Wharf.

Unfortunately, this hotel is near the tourist trap of the fisherman's wharf.. Staff is nice, but room is small, outdated, dusty/dirty.. Definitely not what's expected for over $300/night.  The additional valet fee is just icing, they should just include it in the overall cost..

review.title: Walking distance from Wharf
review.reviewText: Great Location for getting around on feet, fisherman's wharf was a short walk away. Signage was a bit poor when looking for hotel sign, there was a really tiny sign on the building. Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. We ordered pizza from the hotel restaurant and it was delicious.
review.locationRemarks: There are several restaurants and activities around fisherman's wharf, so always something to do with good eats.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location friendly staff and comfortable rooms

review.title: Will come back
review.reviewText: Front desk staff were amazing. The location was close to the wharf and walkable to the sights. Clean and great beds. Rooms with views were nice but a bit noisy. Quieter facing the court yard. Food at the restaurant was great. Overall a great hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location.
review.reviewText:
Very close to Fishermans Wharf, cable car and restaurants. (Try the great breakfast at Hollywood Cafe, a block away). Nice touch with a free wine tasting every evening between 5 and 6pm.
Found the Pescatore restaurant attached to the hotel too expensive for what it is. There are better options in the area. Overall, nice place to stay in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi is terrible. Had to sit in the hallway to get a very slow service. Needs to be improved!

review.reviewText: We wanted a hotel near fishermans wharf. This hotel is in the perfect spot. It was very quiet so we slept well. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great location nice extras. Great pick for SF
review.reviewText: Location was fantastic for all the tourist spots. Staff was friendly ambiance was lovely. Daily complimentary happy hour was a nice touch and got us guests mingling. Staff should push the attached restaurant more we loved it but only tried it the last night. Would have gone there every day. Lobby area well done but upstairs was a little dated and room was small. Overall very satisfied.

review.title: Good Location, friendly staff, moderate price
review.reviewText: We were greeted on our early arrival at the Hotel by very friendly staff and the news our (inside, no view) room was ready for us to move into. Lovely for weary travellers. Our room was light, despite the fact that the only view was a wall, and was big enough for us to 'live in' for 3 days and manage our large suitcases. The location close to Fisherman's Wharf and the Hop On Hop Off Bus stop was ideal for our 3 day stay in SF. We enjoyed the drink in the Lobby for Happy Hour, and the early morning tea, coffee and chocolate was most welcome before we set off for our day out. Our luggage was stored for us after check out and the staff was very helpful in arranging transport to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a very nice, moderately priced hotel which was perfect for our 3 day sight seeing trip to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: It is what it is.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the 'touristy' area.

review.title: Very enjoyable.  Great location. Clean!
review.reviewText:
Very enjoyable great location Clean!  Staff was friendly Hotel had a wine tasting that was fabulous
Was on business but would definitely stay again and bring my family on a pleasure trip to SF and stay here
review.negativeRemarks: Parking rates!

review.title: Excellent hotel by Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for four days and had a great experience.  The room had a view over a nice courtyard and was extremely quiet.  The staff was exceptionally helpful and the concierge provided very useful and good information. I would highly recommend this hotel located in a great location in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location, the ambiance, the comfortable beds, the friendly staff and the water with lemon that was available all day in the hotel lobby.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and thank you for the 5 Star review, Glad to hear that we were able to accommodate an early check in and that you had a fabulous Tuscan Hotel experience. We hope to see you again soon...

review.title: Lovely Stay
review.reviewText: Staff let us check in early. Very grateful after a long flight from Australia. Free wine tasting hour & free coffee daily in the morning was a treat. Beds & room very comfy. Staff helpful & happy to help!

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the 5 Star review, Very pleased that you had a fabulous Tuscan Hotel experience. We hope to see you again soon...

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: We had a great time. The hotel is close to everything.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful and friendly. The evening party in the lobby was fun. We meet many interesting people. Free wine made it a winner.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for the kind comments as well as your feedback for improvement. We hope your time in SF was a marvelous experience and we hope to see you again soon...

review.title: Nice Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel was situated well, in the Fisherman's Wharf area, close to attractions, shopping and amenities. The decor was lovely and the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was fairly average, though it did not have a closet and this was a drawback. The outside street was very noisy and made for interrupted sleep most nights.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to share your review.

review.title: decent hotel for short stay
