review.reviewText: The hotel is okay.  Only needed it for one night.  Bed was comfortable, room was clean, but very small and a bit noisy. Didn't love but didn't hate it either.  If it fits your budget not a bad choice.
review.positiveRemarks: The wine tasting at 6pm was nice.  We arrived early and they had a room available for us.
review.negativeRemarks: It is an older hotel that has had renovations done.  I'm not sure they could do much more to improve.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good for walking to Pier 39 fisherman wharf's area and Ghiradella square

review.title: Great Week at the Best Western Plus The Tuscan!!!
review.reviewText:
My girlfriend and I decided to take a week vacation in San Francisco.  I spent a week in San Francisco about 9 years ago and stayed in the financial district and after staying at The Tuscan this time, I have no idea why I did that.  The Best Western Plus The Tuscan is located near Fisherman's Wharf and very convenient to almost anything you want to do and see in San Francisco.  Frankly, the location cannot be beat.  

We were an early check in an although our room wasn't ready, the staff was very pleasant and accommodating and stored our bags while we went out for some sight seeing.  They called me on my cell phone when our room was ready which was still 2 hours earlier than normal check-in.  The room was perfect for us with a kind sized bed and plenty of room for my girlfriend and me.  The restaurant adjoining the hotel had good food and very courteous staff.

I must say the staff at the hotel was always very courteous and friendly throughout our stay.  The rooms aren't real big but they aren't small either and frankly we didn't spend much time as we were constantly on the go.  I think the best thing about the Tuscan is that it is so close to everything.  I certainly will stay here again when I come back to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: It was perfect for us.
review.locationRemarks: The Tuscan is only a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and the bay.  No reason to stay anywhere else!!!

review.title: Awesome Birthday celebration!
review.reviewText: We stayed 8 nights at the Tuscan Inn.  First the Internet in the rooms is really pretty great.  The staff are mostly awesome.  Some were good but not great!  The Rooms are small, but functional.  We really didn't spend much time in the room.  We are decent tippers for but on 2 occasions we didn't get coffee or our garbage taken out.  At that point we stopped tipping.  The restaurant in the hotel is average, service was good food was mediocre. The very best thing about the hotel is the bell staff.  They went above and beyond.  I don't think I ever opened a door on my own.  I think we waited 20 seconds for them to get us a cab.  They were knowledgeable and friendly.  Great!!  The hotel is in just about the best location to be in all the action or get transportation.  I highly recommend this hotel for that reason alone!!

review.title: Charming Character & Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Had a very good 2 night stay in February 2015. Weather was not our friend but that didn't matter as there were lots of things to do within walking distance. Around the hotel the pavements were flat so waking was easy. The hotel staff were very helpful and checking in was a breeze, which was great as our flight had been delayed and we were very tired when we arrived. Spent the driest day of the weekend touring the city with a hop on- hop off bus tour in the morning, followed by a boat tour in the afternoon. Did a little shopping at Pier 39 and then took the cable car up to Union Square to explore a little more. Found an excellent Irish pub and Indian Restaurant within a ten min walk from the hotel. The de Young Art Museum was a great place to go to get out of the rain. We will be back.

review.title: Convenient location in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
review.reviewText: I was in town for a conference at the Hyatt Regency Embarcadero.  The conference hotel was full, as were the "overflow" hotels, so I opted to book this hotel.  It was clean, quiet and nicely updated.  They hosted a great complimentary wine social daily in the lobby.  They also have a town car service to the financial district in the morning which was very convenient for me.  There is not a fitness center at the hotel but they have passes for the 24 hour fitness center across the street that is far better than  a hotel gym.  There is a nice restaurant on site as well.  All in all the hotel worked out very well and was an easy commute to my conference using the town car service and the nearby public transportation.

review.title: Catering to the plugged-in

When we arrived, our reservation had been cancelled. We had a first floor room on the alley (air conditioner blocking the "view") but the room itself was comfortable, if a little cheaply redone (the corner table, for example was a plywood stand cleverly concealed by a floor-length drape).

Lots of outlets (I travel with lots of computing equipment for work, so that was very nice).  Everything was clean and polished.  Clean linens, comfy bed, courteous staff.

review.title: Super hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Lovely comfy bed (perfect for people with bad backs)!  Free Wi-Fi.  Very close walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and a short taxi ride to the Cruise Terminal.  Room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. Good quality linens and towels.  Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful.  Happy hour was very well-attended each evening and the complimentary wines were good quality. Had very nice breakfast at Pescatore's, the restaurant attached to the hotel. Have already recommended  the hotel to other people on our cruise.  I researched all the comments on various web sites before choosing this hotel and this one had the most positive rating.  I won't even look next time, I'll just book this one!  I took the advice of people on-line and booked a courtyard room and wasn't bothered by street noise at night.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is situated on a flat part of San Francisco just a few minutes walk from the famous Fishermans Wharf.  Although the wharf is a little tacky and touristy it is very lively and interesting with people and places to see and eat. It has great views of the bay, Golden Gate bridge and Alcatraz. 
The hotel was very convenient for me as the tours I had booked online met at the tour operator office just 100 metres from the hotel. Also the cable car terminus was in the next road just 200 metres away. San Francisco is a great place to visit but you need to plan your journeys and check public transport to the places you want to see as walking up the hills is not for the unfit or faint hearted. 
Things I would recommend are Alcatraz, 17 mile drive, Muir woods (all can be booked in advance) Union Sq and Market St. for shopping.  Coit Tower for the view and Lombard crooked street.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  Comfortable bed and large bathroom. Free coffee in the lobby each morning.
review.negativeRemarks: The TV / Fridge stand and the bathroom sink stand was very cheap looking and in need of improvement or replacing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: A Wonderful Honeymoon!
review.reviewText: This was our home-away-from home for our 10-day San Francisco honeymoon, and we were thoroughly and totally thrilled with the Tuscan Inn!  Everyone there was wonderful to us, attentive to our needs and respectful of our privacy.  Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable, with ample closet and desktop work space.  If we are able to celebrate our fifth anniversary by returning to San Francisco (as we are already planning to do), we will certainly stay at the Tuscan Inn again.

review.title: Great hotel! Great location! Daily happy hour!
review.reviewText: My husband and I were with another couple.  Check in was easy. Rooms were both king - comfy and clean.  Free wine happy hour each day brought the people in the hotel together which was nice.  Location of the hotel was perfect to the wharf and all the activities down there. We could take the cable cars from there as well as the street cars. We got a one day pass at the check in.  Our concierge was very helpful.  We did the Beach Blanket Babylon show which was really really good. We had dinner in Little Italy and we went to mass at St. Peter and Paul church which was just beautiful. We went to Alcatraz (amazing) Muir woods (beautiful)  Sausalito  tour.  Great location to catch the bus for tours as well. We also went on the hop on hop off tour which was very good too. The market at the Ferry dock was amazing as well be sure to go.  Little Italy had great restaurants.  The pier #3 was our favourite. We felt safe to walk back from Little Italy at night and in most areas of the city.  Rain or shine we had a great time.   We would go back to this hotel next time !

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for the kind comments. Make no mistake: Parking is without question expensive in San Francisco. The Tuscan offers Valet only parking with unlimited in/out privileges. The price for parking is $50.00 plus tax per night for standard sized cars. Some guests find other alternatives at local parking facilities or find street parking as a viable option. We do suggest that parking on the street or at local facilities which do not offer in/out privileges may have some drawbacks and involves some risk. Of course, the ease, convenience and personalized attention of using our valet parking service are well worth the expense for many of our guests. In fact, our prices are very competitive with area hotels who provide valet service parking. I actually suggest not even bringing a car to SF unless absolutely necessary as our public transportation system is awesome.

review.title: Nice hotel, but...

They also had a wine party hour each evening which we really enjoyed.  The location was excellent the staff was really good, but there was one negative thing.  Parking sticker shock!  They didn't tell us in advance that we would have to pay an outragious fee per night to park. (I don't think I'm allowed to say the exact number).  When I complained about this the front desk staff did give us a small discount off of the daily rate.  So before you book ask about parking.

Hotel staff were really friendly, greated you every morning and they had free coffee in the morning and a glass of wine at night in Lobby.  Gym facilities located off site across the road, at first thought might be a pain, but it's a lovely fitness centre a safe walk and awesome staff on duty.  Only problem we had with the hotel was the loud fridge, loud air conditioner and shutters by windows not curtains (so let some light in a night when trying to sleep).  Would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for staying with us, sorry we did know knock your socks off.

Parking is without question expensive in San Francisco. The Tuscan offers Valet only parking with unlimited in/out privileges. The price for parking is $50.00 plus tax per night for standard sized cars. Some guests find other alternatives at local parking facilities or find street parking as a viable option. We do suggest that parking on the street or at local facilities which do not offer in/out privileges may have some drawbacks and involves some risk. Of course, the ease, convenience and personalized attention of using our valet parking service are well worth the expense for many of our guests. In fact, our prices are very competitive with area hotels who provide valet service parking. I actually suggest not even bringing a car to SF unless absolutely necessary as our public transportation system is awesome.

Hopefully the rest of your SF adventure was satisfying. We wish you safe travels and happy trails.

review.title: The Perfect Location
review.reviewText: I've been to San Fran before, but hadn't stayed so close to Fisherman's Wharf last time. This hotel is perfectly located, and I think it is a real gem in terms of a boutique experience - smaller with a charming intimate feel. Loved the onsite restaurant. Could have gone out, but there was top-rated cooking right there. Food and service was great. Concierge was also particularly helpful. Only downfall was the front desk checkout experience... Called down to ask to have my bill prepared, explaining I was in a hurry to meet the town car I'd booked and catch my plane. Said I'd only used one water from the mini bar, and was told she couldn't do up my bill until I actually came downstairs - even though I'd prepaid for the room itself. Went down to checkout, had to wait for almost 5 minutes at the front desk for someone to return. Total bill was under $3, so wanted to pay cash, which took another 5 minutes! That being said, every other part of this experience was all I could have wished for, so I will be back.
review.negativeRemarks: Training of front desk staff.
review.locationRemarks: Took the jump-on-jump-off double decker bus tour, for an orientation.  Stop was one block away, the excitement and dining of the Wharf are right there

review.reviewText: As a mid 20s old girl traveling alone, first time in SF and not knowing the surroundings well, I wanted to stay in safe area and still have easy access to everything. And definitely in a safe neighborhood. I could go everywhere anywhere famous landmarks either by walking, cable cars, buses so easily without any frustration from this hotel! Golden  Gate Bridge, Lombard Street, Coit Tower, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Pier 33, FiDi, Union Square, Civic Center, Chinatown, Downtown.....etc!!!!! Not to mention, the hotel itself is very clean, well maintained, comfy bed and staff were friendly and helpful! I am definitely coming back here!!! :-)

review.title: Con Artists
review.reviewText: We initially booked a room within two queen beds as we were two single girls travelling together. Upon arrival at the hotel the man at the desk asked if we were celebrating anything. To that we said no we were just on holiday. He then told us that he was giving us a free upgrade. We went to the room which contained one queen bed and a sofa bed. We were confused and couldn't see why this could be an upgrade on what we had already paid for. We called down to reception to see what was going on and the manager Tom came to see us. He explained that our room had been given away and that it had been a misunderstandinged on our part. Basically they lied to us and hoped we would just accept this 'upgrade' and when they were caught out they told the truth. Tom seemed helpful but all we got for our troubles was $20 on the mini bar and tickets to a comedy show that we had never heard of and didn't want to use as we didn't want to waste a night in San Francisco on something we didn't want. No other refund was offered and the staff were not very concerned about the lies they had told us.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for the kind comments. Glad you found our amazing location to be a good base for your SF experience. Hope you had a fabulous cruise and we'll look forward to your next visit....

We stayed at The Tuscan because we were taking a cruise out of San Francisco. We loved the location as it is within walking distance of Fishermans Wharf. We didn't need to rely on taxis, although they were always available at the entrance to the hotel. 
We were somewhat surprised at how small our room was. There are probably much bigger rooms there. Although ours was very small, the room was very modern with extremely comfortable beds and pillows. Would I stay here again?  Yes.

Parking is without question expensive in San Francisco. The Tuscan offers Valet only parking with unlimited in/out privileges. The price for parking is $50.00 plus tax per night for standard sized cars. Some guests find other alternatives at local parking facilities or find street parking as a viable option. We do suggest that parking on the street or at local facilities which do not offer in/out privileges may have some drawbacks and involves some risk. review.title: Lovely hotel a block away from Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Arrived late in the evening, but this was no problem.  Check in process was very easy.  Very happy with our room, which had updated decor and shuttered windows.  Comfy bed with lovely clean white sheets.
Complimentary hot drink, incl hot chocolate in reception each morning which is great.  Can get as many cups as you like, we had one in our room each morning, then took another to go out.
As I said, just block over to the wharf, with loads of great restaurants etc.  and a short walk to access the cable car and trams etc.
Early evening there is complimentary wine, which they served with bruschetta/pizza from the Italian restaurant in the hotel.  Red, white and rose wine, with sparkling apple juice for the kids, with as many top ups as you like!

Would definitely recommend
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely decor, comfy beds, complimentary drinks morning and evening.

review.title: Good hotel, great staff and close to everything
review.reviewText: We stayed for nearly 2 weeks in a king superior room.  Very happy with room and large enough for us and our 18 month old.  No kettle but a quick call and we had one - nothing was too much trouble and the staff were amazing especially with our little girl - always making her feel important!  We were worried about the noise after reading reviews but seriously we were not far from the main part of the wharf and it's not a high rise so really nothing to comment about!  And we were there for the earthquake!  We would definitely stay there again....

managementResponses.response: Hi Olivia - I'm very sorry that our hotel and restaurant were not what you had hoped it would be. I apologize on behalf of the team that we were not able to deliver a truly satisfying experience. There is never an excuse for poor service and I do apologize that you received anything other than brilliant, friendly and efficient service. As a four story building a few blocks removed from the SF Bay and surrounded by other four story buildings, one of the features our hotel does not offer is view rooms. I’m sorry that this was not conveyed to you when making your Expedia booking. I've shared your open and honest comments with the staff and we will use your frank remarks to improve the level of service we provide. I thank you again for taking the time to share your experience and observations and wish you safe travels.

review.title: Not family friendly
review.reviewText: I booked and pre-paid for two nights and included my children's ages in the booking, however after being asked by Expedia my approx. check-in time and what my room preferences were several days before check-in (a view was my top priority) I was very disappointed to find out the hotel put me in a first floor room directly off the lobby and bar with windows facing a busy road and a view of a parking garage.  Everyone in the lobby or going to the bar had a full view of our door. I asked the manager to move me because I felt very unsafe and uncomfortable in that room traveling alone with two children.  The front desk attendant was very rude and said he had no record of my preferences and could do nothing about a different room. The hotel restaurant was AWFUL!! way overpriced with horrible tasting food and service.
review.negativeRemarks: be more clear about the $50/day parking fee. Check in at 8:00 pm I don't feel it's right to be charged $50.  I paid $150 for 32 hours of parking.

managementResponses.response: Hi Dale and Donna - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. Appreciate all of your kind words and I'm happy you feel the Kimpton touch. We will look forward to the pleasure of serving you again soon...

review.reviewText: Just a wonderful choice, The Tuscan.  Great ambiance, staff is so professional and courteous.  The Kimpton quality was evident the moment we arrived, until the time we left.  We'll be back, very soon and stay here again while in San Francisco.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf & Pier 39  only a 5 minutes walk
review.reviewText: Excellent base for a holiday in San Francisco. Spent 7 nights there and enjoyed every minute. Bought a City Pass which gave entry into Academy of Sciences, Exploratorium,  Aquarium on The Bay, and an hour long cruise which took us under the Golden Gate bridge! The pass also included 7 days unlimited travel on the buses, Cable cars and Street Cars - we used this to travel everywhere we could. Alcatraz was fully booked up weeks ahead unless you book online prior to going or do as we did and get it included with another tour of San Francisco or the local area.  We also took ourselves on a cruise to Sausalito across the bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely rooms, comfy beds, coffee machine, mini bar  they let you store your own items in!  Free wine 5-6pm! Very quiet for a good night's sleep.

review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf and  Pier 39 only a short stroll away. Lovely restaurant - Pescatore - belonging to hotel, good food, service and reasonable prices.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for the kind comments about Wendy and the rest of the staff, I think they are all awesome too! The world famous San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf is one of the top 10 Tourist Destinations in America. Fantastic location which includes the noise, traffic, people, life, hustle, bustle, hubbub and everything else which goes hand in hand with a major metropolitan area and urban environment. Many guests enjoy the local flavor and revel in experiencing the sights, sounds and smells of the city. For guests who have a preference of room type, location, bedding or any other preference, please let our fabulous front desk staff know and we will do everything we can to find just the right room for you. If you check into your room and are not satisfied, a quick call to the front desk will happily begin a search for a room which will be more to your liking. We look forward to the pleasure of serving you again soon...

Overall very good hotel and and location for this type of trip. Suggest driving the sights is done pre 9am or late in the day otherwise the monkeys in the 4x4's get in the way.

The window fastener was broken and the window shutters awkward to use. However, the beds were very comfortable - in fact the beds seem to be new while the rest of the room appeared dated.

The hotel offers some very pleasant added extras like a Guest Happy Hour from five to six in the evening.  This is a fantastic opportunity to talk to other guests and exchange experiences and recommendations for activities over a wine provided by the hotel.

I did not, however, feel that the hotel was value for money.

review.title: Great location just two blocks from the Bay
review.reviewText:
Recommended by me and my wife:
----------------------------------------------
Go to Nick's Lighthouse for cioppino
Go to Madame Tussaud's wax museum - yes, it's touristy!  But you're a tourist!!
Rent an e-bike
Take ferry into Sausalito 
Visit Chinatown and go to Mongolian Hot Pot (opens in fall 2014)
Ride the cable car to Grace Cathedral - it's awesome!
Drive through the Mission District and stop for a jumbo burrito.  And check-out all the murals in an alley just south of 17th
Skip the Castro - it's small and under road construction in 2014.  (Visit Davie Village in Vancouver, BC instead.)
Go to the Palace of Fine Arts - incredible!
Jog the Bay from Pier 1 to the Golden Gate's Hoppers Hands
If you're in Union Square, find Café Mason and try the Linguine Pescatore.  It was delicious.
Peet's Coffee is always good & plenty of locations
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and great location near Fisherman's Wharf.  Front desk and concierge staff were very helpful and pleasant.  Check-in/out was fast!
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet and upholstery in rooms could use updating, and fresh paint for the walls, but overall it was clean, quiet, safe, and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Rent electric bikes and cross the Golden Gate Bridge - it was awesome!  And we didn't rent the GoCars but they looked like fun too!!

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to comment. Our restaurant Pescatore serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. We do offer reservation packages that come with breakfast, however, to keep our rates as low as possible; we offer reservations for rooms which do not include breakfast so that our guests can have the option of saving a few dollars.

Some guests find other alternatives at local parking facilities or find street parking as a viable option. We do suggest that parking on the street or at local facilities which do not offer in/out privileges may have some drawbacks and involves some risk. Of course, the ease, convenience and personalized attention of using our valet parking service are well worth the expense for many of our guests. In fact, our prices are very competitive with area hotels who provide valet service parking. I actually suggest not even bringing a car to SF unless absolutely necessary as our public transportation system is awesome. The Tuscan offers reservation packages which include free parking and these packages are a fantastic value.

The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are a good standard. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

On check in, the lovely lady behind the counter upgrade our room at no cost so we could have a king bed (oh and they checked us in extremely early). The location is great. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The complimentary wine is the evenings is a bonus. This is a great hotel
And worth staying at!

review.title: Most comfortable Hotel bed we have slept in
review.reviewText:
Position of this hotel was excellent- service was always great.
In walking distance to all amenities and major tourist points along Fishermans Wharf
The complimentary coffee in the mornings and wine in the afternoon is a very big hit with visitors.
And Ross Dress For Less is right next door!
Only negative I could say is that room was a little musty smelling-even though this is a 'non smoking' hotel, the room still had a feint cigarette smell to it, as though it had been previously a 'smoking' room.

managementResponses.response: Hi Mike - Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to post your review. Glad to hear you enjoyed our nightly wine hour, it's my favorite 60 minutes of the day! Hope to see you again soon...

review.title: Good priced hotel near the action

managementResponses.response: Hi Neil - Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to share your observations. While we do offer a nightly complimentary wine hour with several selections of wines, this daily ritual isn’t about the wine at all. At every Kimpton Hotel across the nation, 5PM is our time for all of our guests to meet new friends and make personal connections. Getting together and gathering in the lobby at 5PM for 60 minutes allows us an hour to be with our neighbors from across the corridor, down the hall or even from around the world. We just happen to add a little adult beverage action into the mix. We look forward to your next visit and PS: This is not a wine tasting; we’re committed to having full glasses of wine!

review.title: A nice hotel with a great location

review.userLocation: san francisco returning to uk tomorrow

managementResponses.response: Hi Dan - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. Your kind words are appreciated. Parking at The Tuscan is valet only with unlimited in/out privileges. Our guests are not obligated to park on the property; in fact some guests find other alternatives at local parking facilities or find street parking as a viable option. We do suggest that parking on the street or at local facilities which do not offer in/out privileges may have some drawbacks and involves some risk. Of course, the ease, convenience and personalized attention of using our valet parking service are well worth the expense for many of our guests. In fact, our prices are very competitive with area hotels who provide valet service parking. We also offer reservation packages which include the price of parking. I actually suggest not even bringing a car to SF unless absolutely necessary as our public transportation system is awesome. We wish you safe travels and hope to see you again soon!

review.title: Excellent bang for the buck.
review.reviewText: Very pleasing hotel and location two blocks from the fisherman's wharf. The valet was required, so I think that should just be included as an option for the room before hand instead of adding it on at the end. Every night there was a complimentary wine tasting for an hour, and it was a wonderful thing to participate in before going out to dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the wine tasting hour and the location near fisherman's wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators were slow for only four floors. The valet should be an option with the room up front.
review.locationRemarks: Everything on fisherman's wharf.

managementResponses.response: Hi Steve - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. review.title: Excellent location and overall standard.
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Tuscan, The room was superb. There were only a couple of issues in that the in-house entertainment (pay for view films etc) didn't work at first. The hotel staff arranged for a new TV to be installed promptly. Also we had to be out at 5am one day to go on a trip and the hot water shower didn't work too well at that time of day. Otherwise no complaints, highly recommended and superb location. Safeway supermarket next door, Fishermans Wharf, Cable car station, tour operators all very close by. Would definitely recommend and use this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent facilities and in-house restaurant, excellent staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot water at 5am!

managementResponses.response: Hi Andrea - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. review.title: Perfect location, especially for first timers!
review.reviewText:
Met up for a mother-daughter trip in San Fran and couldn't have found a better hotel. The lobby and complementary wine-tasting were fabulous. Rooms were very clean, comfy and quiet. Concierge was extremely helpful, encouraging us to see beyond the city for attractions. As a result, the moms went to Sausalito while the daughters rented a car and headed to Sonoma for the day. He even facilitated the car rental!
Location was so great. Walk 2 minutes to the Wharf (restaurants, cafes, souvenir shops and street entertainers), a bit longer to Chinatown and Pier 33 (Alcatraz tour) and Lombard Street but totally do-able.
Even grabbed a complimentary apple on my way out the door! Would definitely go back!

managementResponses.response: Hi Brizzle - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. I'm glad to learn that we worked out so well for your visit to SF. We're so lucky to be right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. We hope to have the pleasure of seeing you again soon....

review.title: Very nice location to SF Pier 39 waterfront.
review.reviewText: We found it to be a friendly, clean, safe and very comfortable hotel. For us, perfectly located with a 5 min walk to Pier 39's Water front shops and dining. 10 min walk to a Cable car ride! We went back and stayed another night after driving route #1. Safe area for a walk to after a late dinner.

managementResponses.response: Hi John - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. Your kind words about the hotel are much appreciated and we hope to have the luxury of serving you again soon...(PS: Those new luxurious pillow top beds are indeed very comfortable, glad you enjoyed)

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Well located friendly hotel - 3 blocks from the famous Fishermans Wharf. Also one block away from an end stop of the famous cable car which travels to the centre of the city up and down the famous steep hills.

Very comfortable beds - quiet room - there was a complimentary wine tasting every pm at 5 - with canapés.

Free tea and coffee available in the foyer every morning.

Would use again.

managementResponses.response: Hi Al and Myrna - Very sorry to hear about the issues you experienced with our staff. Thank you for pointing out Matt our doorman as the one team member able to provide you the level of service you expected from each of our associates. I've shared your comments and observations with the team, we hope to improve and your open and frank remarks are valuable feedback. We wish you safe travels.

review.title: Good location, terrible staff
review.reviewText: PROS: good location, close to the bay, afternoon wine reception. CONS: unfriendly staff, worst view from your window, you can see the other windows, thats it!. Poor customer service, the only nice guy is Matt, the evening doorman. He told where to park cheap, and what to check out in the ciry. The people in the reception area, to think most of them were Filipinos, and i am Filipino, were not helpful at all. No goodmornings, no cheerful greetings. The housekeeping were so loud in the morning, chitchatting while working in the hallway. Woke us up everytime, reported it to the concierge, and they did not do anything about it, obviously, because they were still noisy the next morning. I think theyre chinese or vietnamese. You can skip housekeeping and they will give you $5 voucher each day to use at thier resto for lunch or dinner, but didnt mention you can only use 2 voucher at a time. Food at the resto was not great either. We left on the day there was a bike race, so we booked an hour earlier for the shuttle to pick us up. NO SHUTTLE CAME. DEFINITELY WONT COME BACK HERE.
review.negativeRemarks: Change staff in the reception
review.locationRemarks: Lots of things to see and do. Aquarium of the bay,

managementResponses.response: Hi Melanie - Thanks for staying with us on your 1st expedition to beautiful San Francisco and thank you for the 5 Star review. Very glad to hear you had a fabulous experience and we look forward to your next trip to our amazing City by the Bay!

review.title: First trip to San Fran
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel based on other reviews I had read, and it did not disappoint. The room is pretty standard, but very clean and comfortable. The staff were great and the location is excellent! The park across (Aquatic Park?) from Ghirardelli Square (a few minutes walk from the hotel) is a relaxing and scenic place to enjoy some ice cream and take in the view of the Golden Gate bridge. Oh and every night from 5-6 at the hotel, free wine and pizza!! An added bonus and a nice break in the midst of a day filled with sight seeing!

managementResponses.response: Hi Rodney - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. I'm very pleased to hear your stay was comfortable and satisfying. We appreciate all of your wonderful comments and when the need does arise, we hope to have the pleasure of serving you again....

review.title: Very nice hotel, good location for our us.
review.reviewText: We arrived at least 2 hours earlier than the advertised check in time and there was no problem regarding checking in and getting into the room, staff at the front desk were helpful in every way possible. The room was large, with 2 queen beds that were extremely comfortable. Bathroom was ample though not overly large, plenty of good quality towels. The only down side was the very small hanging space for clothes. The room overlooked the small courtyard so it was very quiet. There was complimentary coffee & tea in the mornings. The managers free wine between 17:00 & 18:00 each evening was very popular with guests. The bar & restaurant were both very good with attentive staff. We would certainly stay here again if the need arises.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked everything about this hotel, but we're not too difficult to please.
review.negativeRemarks: None enough to mention.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect for Fisherman's Wharf with all the restaurants & attractions. Getting into Union Square by bus was extremely cheap & easy.

review.title: Location was great.
review.reviewText: We were disembarking from cruise ship and could easily walk to hotel. We did take a cab as had tickets to Alcatraz that morning. Cab driver was Not pleased with such a short fare. Weather was perfect so made the tour to Alcatraz great. Make sure you get tickets in advance before hand (0nline) as it is very busy. Do not recommend Alcatraz if it's raining. Also beware of seagulls----my daughter had to find a restroom to wash off her blouse. We went shopping at Union Square-----wow------huge. Cheesecake Factory at Macys was great for lunch. Wish we had more than 2 days in San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to pier and proximity to getting trolley. ($6.00 per person each way to Union Square)

review.title: Tuscan Stay
review.reviewText:
Website describes hotel restaurant as a full service Italian/Pizza style. NOT TRUE. Very limited menue selections. Breakfast menue very limited where you can just order a basic style beakfast i.e.toast, ham, eggs, bacon ect.

Bartender at night was overworked for the number of people he had to serve. Rude and unattentive.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms. Great location near the Wharf.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. Glad to hear all was Fantastic. We appreciate the glowing comments and I’m glad you enjoyed our to-die for homemade granola. Thanks again for all of the very kind words and we hope to see you again soon!

review.title: Frantastic!!
review.reviewText: Fantastic time at Tuscan Inn, staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Very good in giving advice and directions, and booking tickets for Alcatraz. Free wine hour each evening was welcome and encouraged many interesting conversations with other guests. Free coffee in the mornings got the day up and running and the restaurant offers to-die-for granola and fresh fruit.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much.
review.locationRemarks: Great spot, Fisherman's Wharf and various piers close by. Whole city accessible with variety of near-by public transport options.

managementResponses.response: Hi Kathy - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. Glad to see you had a wonderful experience in San Francisco and at the Tuscan Hotel. I appreciate all of the kind comments about the staff, we think they are pretty awesome too. We'll look forward to seeing you again when your next California adventure returns you to SF...

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Really nice hotel. Staff were so welcoming and friendly but not over powering. Only 4floors high. Coffee in the mornings and wine reception in the evenings were very pleasant. So easy to walk to piers and bus and cable cars to Union Sq , Golden Gate park.
We got a city pass which was great value and bought from Alcatrazcruises you can swap the bay cruise for Alcatraz tour. Academy of Sciences and Exploratium are both fantastic visits and the free travel pass allows use of buses and cable cars. Cable cars are addictive!
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed and pillows. Room overlooked quiet courtyard garden-no noise. Reception staff were excellent. Wine, coffee ,ice and fridge.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to pier 39 , ferries, cable cars, maritime park, Ghiradelli square. Alcatraz. Musee Mechanique was free and fun.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to share your kind comments and feedback. Indeed it is a little more expensive to stay in the fisherman's wharf area, Not only are we the top tourist attraction in SF, we are one of the top 10 tourist attractions in the United States. Being right in the middle of fisherman’s wharf, you can’t beat the location for shops, restaurants and all the activities near the wharf and around Pier 39. Guests looking for a hotel with outstanding service, an amazing Fisherman’s Wharf location, clean (cozy) rooms, well maintained facilities and all of the freebies we offer such as wifi, coffee, tea, hot cocoa, evening wine reception, this will definitely be the place for you.

review.title: Nice hotel but expensive for what it offers
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location. It is a little expensive but is clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing of the rooms

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review, all of your kind words are very much appreciated. I couldn't have said it any better, great location, clean, comfortable "cozy" rooms, great freebies and an attentive staff that also provides great weather. We hope to see you again soon...

review.title: San Fran Break
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time in San Francisco and our stay with Best western Tuscan. We had lovely warm weather and found this hotel is steps from all the action. Don't expect a large room but the size was adequate and comfortable. The hotel provides complimentary coffee in the rooms, but also from 6am-10am tea, coffee and hot chocolate was provided in the reception area in takeaway cups which gives you the flexibility of where you prefer to drink it, also between 5pm until 6pm complimentary wine was served by the glass, which was a really nice touch from the hotel. All staff were really friendly and very helpful if you need any help or ideas with making the most of your time/stay in San Francesco.
review.negativeRemarks: Outdoor area to enjoy drink in warm sunshine which we were very lucky with our weather whilst there. There was a courtyard but not accessible,
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location in Fisherman Wharf area,easy walking distance to pier 39 & round the corner to cable cars, leading to union square, china town etc.

managementResponses.response: Hi Sally and Bob - Thanks for staying with us and for the kind comments. Very pleased to hear that your 1st time in beautiful San Francisco landed you on our doorstep and that we didn't disappoint. It was a pleasure for us to have you as our guests and we'll look forward to your next expedition to California!

review.title: A pleasure to stay at Tuscan !!!
review.reviewText: Our first time to San Fran.....with advise from friends it was hard to make a decision where to stay Castro area, Union Square and yes we made the right decision..Best Western Tuscan !!!
review.positiveRemarks: Reception staff very warm and helpful... Happy Hour a great idea...meeting people from all over the world....!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast included would be a winner ....
review.locationRemarks: Location location location just the best....walk along the wharf area very interesting day or night...

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to share your thoughts. The price of parking in San Francisco, New York and other major metropolitan areas can be quite pricey. We never hide our parking fees; in fact they are posted on all booking web sites. Parking at The Tuscan is valet only with unlimited in/out privileges. Our guests are not obligated to park on the property; in fact some guests find other alternatives at local parking facilities or find street parking as a viable option. We do suggest that parking on the street or at local facilities which do not offer in/out privileges may have some drawbacks and involves some risk. Of course, the ease, convenience and personalized attention of using our valet parking service are well worth the expense for many of our guests. In fact, our prices are very competitive with area hotels who provide valet service parking. I actually suggest not even bringing a car to SF unless absolutely necessary as our public transportation system is awesome. Sorry to hear that you were annoyed by the cost of parking, the Tuscan offers reservation packages which include free parking and these packages are a fantastic value. We wish you safe travels!

review.title: Nearby fishermans wharf.

review.title: Nice, clean hotel close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: We had a great 7 day stay at this hotel. I cannot say enough about how friendly/great the staff are! Oh and to top it off the cafe/restaurant attached was 5+ stars, & the complementary wine tasting every evening just completed everything! I highly recommend this hotel!

We look forward to you next visit, thanks again for the great review…

review.title: A Taste of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Just shared a fantastic 2 nights in San Fran with my wife to celebrate our 25th anniversary. Our stay at the Best Western Tuscan was outstanding...the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Especially enjoyed the wine tasting hour in the lobby. Awesome location to all the hot-spots of Fisherman's Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: 3 blocks from Pier 39 @ Fisherman's Wharf, SF

managementResponses.response: Hi Jessica - Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to share your thoughts. We're on the same page; we too wish our rooms were not so "cozy". Also, I'm always suffering from sticker shock when I travel and end up paying the parking prices in San Francisco, New York and even at resorts in South Lake Tahoe. Parking at The Tuscan is valet only with unlimited in/out privileges. Our guests are not obligated to park on the property; in fact some guests find other alternatives at local parking facilities or find street parking as a viable option. We do suggest that parking on the street or at local facilities which do not offer in/out privileges may have some drawbacks and involves some risk. Of course, the ease, convenience and personalized attention of using our valet parking service are well worth the expense for many of our guests. In fact, our prices are very competitive with area hotels who provide valet service parking. I actually suggest not even bringing a car to SF unless absolutely necessary as our public transportation system is awesome. We wish you safe travels!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. You said it all and there's really nothing more I can add to your wonderful comments other than thanks again for your glowing and eloquent review! We hope to see you again soon...

review.title: Exactly as advertised.
review.reviewText:
We left the Tuscan yesterday after a 3 night stay. We moved to another hotel in the city to join a tour so wanted a hotel near Fishermans Wharf to explore that area first. The location was perfect. Two easy blocks from wharf. Hop on hop off bus was on the way as well. Next door is a ' Ross Dress for Less' which I always try and go to when I visit America. Great clothes including designer clothes for incredible prices.
The room itself was smallish but quite adequate. The beds were as comfortable as any in any hotel we have stayed in. The bathroom is small but had everything we needed. Very big flat screen tv and the room was very clean. Would definitely recommend. Free internet, coffee and tea in the morning and wine in the later afternoon were all welcome touches.
A word on Fishermans Wharf as many reviewers are not all that impressed. This is my second visit with my Mum who has never been. Sure it is touristy but you can't beat that wharf and sea views. The walk along the wharf is marvellous. The Fisherman Grotto had average food but the ambience was wonderful. We walked to the Farmers Market and it was hands down the most amazing market I have ever visited! Just fabulous!
review.negativeRemarks: A sign in the corridors to indicate where the lift is.

managementResponses.response: Hi Heather – I’m very sorry to learn that we did not live up to or exceed your expectations. Although we are not a hotel which features view rooms, anytime a guest is not comfortable with their accommodations, our eager FD team works very hard to find just the right location so that our guests can enjoy a satisfying Tuscan experience. I’m sorry that your experience did not achieve our goals or meet your expectations and for that I truly apologize. I do appreciate your open and honest feedback and thank you for your kind comments as well. Hopefully one day we’ll have the opportunity to serve you again and your next visit will be comfortable and satisfying. Thanks again for taking the time to share your observations, we will learn and improve…

review.title: Not what we expected but clean and nice location
review.reviewText:
We were coming into San Francisco for a getaway to celebrate my birthday. I had read many wonderful reviews for the Tuscan Inn and was expecting a great experience. Upon check in we asked about rooms that had views, the gal at the front desk explained that the other buildings surrounding the best western were taller which limited the views from the hotel rooms. That was understandable, however I know they at least have courtyard view rooms.
After finding our room we were disappointed to find that it was tucked away in the corner between a cleaning closet and stairwell. It was very noisy with housekeeping coming in and out banging their carts and supplies around. Although the room was very small and the view was of another building we were pleased to see how clean everything was. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The morning of check out we had a maintenance issue with our room. Luckily it was close to our check out time. As we checked out we informed the front desk staff of the issue with our room and they gladly waived our parking fee. Overall I would say Best Western Tuscan Inn is in great location and I would recommend it for families or groups who are going sight seeing in San Francisco. I would not recommend this hotel for a couples getaway.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the fact that the parking provided in & out privileges and pricing was comparable. Great Location. Bed and linens were quality and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Noise & which rooms you are checking people into compared to where housekeeping is still working. We received terrible room location.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to many restaurants and stores. The Pier is a few short blocks away.

managementResponses.response: Hi Stephanie - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. review.title: comfortable hotel near Fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
The staff were very welcoming and offered us the option of a room facing the courtyard or one
facing the road.We took the courtyard one as it was quieter and we certainly couldn't hear any noise.
It was rather dark with the shutters closed but was very clean and comfortable. It was very near
Fishermans Wharf and was an easy walk to the waterfront. The coffee was nice to have in the
room and also the fridge which they said we could put our own things in which was very useful.
All in all it was a very enjoyable stay and we would certainly recommend the Tuscan.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff very friendly and made us welcome. The lounge was very cosy.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near the cable cars , fishermans wharf.The tour company was just across the road and safeways was close by to buy drinks etc.

managementResponses.response: Hi Ziget - Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to share your thoughts. I humbly apologize for my review response déjà vu. We're basically on the same page; we wish our rooms were bigger too. Also, I too suffer from sticker shock when I travel and end up paying the parking prices in San Francisco, New York, Chicago and even at resorts in Hawaii. We openly advertise that The Tuscan Hotel offers valet parking only at a cost of $45.00 per night plus tax for standard size cars. We do offer reservation packages which include parking and this is a fantastic value. Our guests are not obligated to park on the property; in fact some guests find other alternatives at local parking facilities or find street parking as a viable option. We do suggest that parking on the street or at local facilities which do not offer in/out privileges may have some drawbacks and involves some risk. Of course, the ease, convenience and personalized attention of using our valet parking service are well worth the expense for many of our guests. In fact, our prices are very competitive with area hotels who provide valet service parking. I actually suggest not even bringing a car to SF unless absolutely necessary as our public transportation system is awesome. Local calls are free for the 1st 30 minutes. I do apologize if you received poor service in the restaurant, there is never an excuse for poor service. Thanks you for your open feedback. We wish you Happy Trails!

review.title: Convenient hotel for fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: This is a well located hotel that has a number of nice features such as the daily wine tasting from 5-6pm and free coffee etc in the morning. We were fortunately upgraded to a king room, and wouldn't recommend the queen room (which was very small for two adults and a couple of big suitcases!) and enjoyed our stay-the bed was so big and comfy. It seemed to have been partially upgraded recently, although the queen room we were initially given was on the small side and a bit tatty in places as were the corridors, although the main lunge was nice. If you want reasonable value close to fishermans wharf then it's worth a stay but there are lots of other hotels close by.

review.title: Great hotel in a brilliant location
review.reviewText:
The Tuscan is a smart, attractive and comfortable hotel in a fantastic location for the sights of San Francisco! I travelled with my husband and 2 seniors and our pre-arrival request of rooms close together was fulfilled without an issue. We also had a package delivered 48 hours before we arrived (we had arranged for it to be delivered after our arrival but it came early) and the friendly staff took the package and held for us without any problems. Friendly concierge/valet who were always on hand opening doors Recommended by all 4 of our travel party.

The only downside was the $45+tax charge for valet parking (no self-park option) - we only had a car for one night but it could prove an expensive addition but I understand this is the norm in San Fran!

The beds were very comfortable and whenever we asked for more towels, the staff were very fast in completing our requests. They even sent us toothbrushes and umbrellas after overhearing that we forgot ours. Overall, I had a wonderful time visiting San Francisco and my experience would not have been so pleasant had it not been the wonderful treatment of this hotel. I recommend staying here if you would like a hotel that cares deeply for their customers.

review.title: Superb location and accomodation!
review.reviewText: Honestly I didn't start out having a great opinion of the Best Western chain in general but this hotel was fantastic. Operated by Kimpton Hotels you get all the benefits of a 4 star boutique hotel - everything from the service ( great staff), the extras ( Manager's happy hour wine service, an adjoining hotel restaurant that doesn't feel like a hotel restaurant) and the accomodations ( well appointed, classy). The rooms were smallish but hey, it's SF! The lobby is chic and actually usable and the adjoining Pescatore's is a great asset with fabulous meals and service. Finally, location, location, location. This hotel is an easy 2 blocks down from Fisherman's wharf and all the amentities, restaurants, shops and tours so that you feel in the center of all the action, but far enough away to not detract from the upscale feel of the boutique hotel ( not ovely touristy). There is a small ( hidden) shopping center next door so you can still pop into a pharmacy or grocery store if needed. Make sure to walk to the end of Beach street and check out Aquatic park, the beach, and Ghiradelli square early :)
review.positiveRemarks: As a single traveler, I enjoyed the well-appointed useable lobby and daily wine happy hour where I could hang out with my book in front of the firepl.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps a pamphlet & map detailing local amenities such as pharmacy, grocery as I heard several people asking the front desk.
review.locationRemarks: Hit up the wharf & Pier 39 for seafood & shopping (don't skip the sealions), rent bikes or take a day tour to Napa & Muir woods ( redwoods).

However, the hotel is also close to the turnaround Taylor cable car line making for easy access. We were much impressed with the near-by public transit bus connections for getting around when the legs gave out from climbing hills.

review.title: Moderate hotel near Pier 39 Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
I absolutely loved my stay while I visited San Francisco. The front desk, busboy, and housekeeping services were friendly, helpful, and professional. The hotel is slightly older, but very clean and very well kept. My room was small with just one queen size bed. The bed was super comfortable with plush white bedding.
The hotel connects to the Italian restaurant on the corner. There was free lemon water, coffee and tea in the lobby. Also complimentary wine during the
evenings.
The hotel is an easy 3 block walk to the marina waterfront with all the tourist attractions. There is an abundance of shopping, restaurants, arts, markets and services in easy walking distance. It cost about $10 to take a cab to the Union Sq area. And the airport shuttle was less than $20.
I was there on business, and grew to like being a bit away from the conjestion of the financial district. It made me feel more like a local. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure travellers.

Tip...get out and walk. When you first get to the hotel you won't notice how much is in the neighborhood because there are no billboard type signs. The area unfolds as you walk.

managementResponses.response: Very sorry to hear your experience was less than satisfying. Please feel free to contact the hotel directly and speak with the manager on duty so we can learn more about your recent visit…

review.title: Great hotel close to attractions
review.reviewText: Perfect location in Fishermans warf. After reading all the positive reviews, I decided to stay here. I am somewhat of a hotel snob, usually staying only at four or five star. I would rate this as a three and a half star, but worth the stay. It was clean, comfortable, and close to cable cars, pier 39' gharadelli Square, restaurants, and other attractions. The evening wine receptions and coffee in the mornings was an added plus. The staff was friendly, kind' pleasant, and helpful. Only negative was the parking rate and no on-site gym. I would definately stay here again.

managementResponses.response: Thanks staying with us for 4 nights. We appreciate your feedback and I’m glad to hear that you enjoyed our fabulous location and our comfy beds. We look forward to your next visit!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is not high on amenities but nice quality especially for the price. Awesome location for fisherman's warf and bus/trolley service throughout the city. Comfortable beds, which is about all our family needed during our 4 night vacation stay.

managementResponses.response: Hi Kim - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. Happy to hear that you had an absolutely awesome experience. We’ll look forward to serving you again the next time your travels return you to SF!

review.title: Absolutely Awesome!
review.reviewText:
Four of us had been traveling the California coastline from San Diego and we flew out of San Francisco to travel home. This hotel was at the end of our journey and we stayed for two nights. As soon as we checked in, we had a glass of wine in our hand as there was a wine tasting in the lobby every evening! The staff was very friendly and also helpful. We were loaned umbrellas when we went out to tour San Francisco because we visited during several days of rain. They mailed my post cards, made luggage tags from one of my business cards and had a taxi waiting when we had to leave for the airport. The staff could not have been more awesome!

The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to the waterfront sea lion pier, China Town and shops. It was clean and comfortable. It really could not have been any better. I hope to go back!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything: location, cleanliness, comfort and great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't notice anything. It really was perfect. The worst thing I could say was the umbrella I borrowed broke when the wind blew.
review.locationRemarks: China Town, the Sea Lion Center, and the best breakfast place in San Francisco, the Hollywood Cafe!

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review, most appreciated. We are happy that we played a small role in celebrating your honeymoon, Congrats and we hope to see you again soon!

review.title: Great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText:
The Tuscan is a few short blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and even closer to the F Trolley that takes you all the way up Market Street for $2. The cable car and Coit Tower are close as well. The restaurant had great breakfasts. Unfortunately I had no opportunity to sample any other meal. I also was not able to get back for the restaurant happy hour or the hotel's own wine receptions since I was working and meeting customers and friends.

The hotel layout is a little dated (while not being "vintage"), but my room was very comfortable and nicely appointed. The restaurant (Pescatori) had great ambiance. I was attending a conference at Moscone Center. Hotels around there were crazy expensive. Staying at The Tuscan and taking the F line back and forth was really convenient. I would do it again.

review.title: Nice enough hotel
review.reviewText: Arrived after 20 hours of travel, requested some tea bags and fresh milk as only coffee in room. Waited for one hour for two tea bags to come up to the room but no milk, waited a further hour but no milk arrived and fell asleep. Requested milk and tea bags again in the morning and finally got milk and was rationed two more tea bags. Later in the stay we asked at reception for more tea bags and were again given another two. Lost any faith in the hotel for the sake of just wanting a cup of tea! Not too much to expect surely.

review.positiveRemarks: Staff helpful and friendly. Room clean and well appointed. The lobby area was welcoming and guests gathered there in the evenings to have a drink.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us and for recognizing our fabulous staff. I am sorry that the rest of your experience was underwhelming as we hope that all of guests enjoy a wonderful visit. Parking is indeed expensive at the wharf; however, we checked and found that the fees are noted on Expedia's website. “ Fees The following fees and deposits are charged by the property at time of service, check-in, or check-out. Valet parking fee: USD 45 per night (in/out privileges) Valet parking fee for large vehicle: USD 50.00 per night (in/out privileges)In-room microwave fee: USD 20 per day The above list may not be comprehensive. Fees and deposits may not include tax and are subject to change.” Sorry for the sticker shock! We suggest not even bringing a car to SF unless absolutely necessary, the public transportation here is amazing...We wish you happy and safe travels and thank you for your feedback.

review.title: Underwhelming

Loud street right out our window kept us up all night. Bathroom plain. Worst part was the surprise $45 fee for parking. That should be up front, not a surprise when you pull up to the hotel.

review.title: Fab location in quiet area of Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Tuscan Inn is close to main sights yet set back a few blocks from crazy busy noisy bustle of Fishermans Wharf (esp in Christmas - New Year period). I had a nice and quiet courtyard room. It looked like new decor and room was cosy with lovely toiletries. Fab shower and bath too :) The underlying structure looked a bit aged though (eg bathroom door could use replacing, didn't shut). Corridors, doors and lifts could be freshened up too. Great dinner options nearby (Pescatore Italian next door so you can use your Tuscan wifi) and sushi. Also lots of fab cafés in blocks behind hotel. No need to hire a car for the city, public transport fantastic.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText:
We have been staying at Tuscan Inn for 10 years now and would recommend to anybody.

The only thing I have to say about the room we were in on first floor is that they have old thermostats and you had to call maintenance to come and turn it on. The next day we had to call and have them turn it on again. Once it was set the heat would run up to the temperature you want then shut off again. You had to get up to figure out how to turn it on again. You had to do this 20 times a day and then when you got up in the morning it was freezing in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the cleanliness of the rooms and the friendly, helpful staff. The bellboys are great and always willing to help.
review.negativeRemarks: Just the heat on the first floor because even the hallways by the rooms on first floor were freezing. Hallways and rooms on other floors are warm.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect. Close to muni transportation-buses, cable cars, trolley cars and walking distance to the piers.

managementResponses.response: Hi Steve - Thanks for staying with and for providing your open and honest feedback regarding your visit. We appreciate hearing the good as well as areas where we didn't meet the expectations of our guests. Thanks for taking the time to share your comments. We wish you Happy Holidays!

review.title: Small rooms for what you pay
review.reviewText:
Okay, it was Fisherman's Wharf in SF. I get it, everything's overpriced. But I've stayed in larger rooms in flea bags. It even had a wall of mirrors to make it look larger. Tiny desk with room for practically nothing, no chair. The sink and vanity were in a small alcove opposite the closet. The vanity itself was practically non-existent, with no room for whatever paraphernalia you usually want around the sink, especially for women who want more room (apology for sexist remark). If you're a light sleeper, the loud wall-mounted combo air conditioner will wake you. In summer, that's okay, because it's rarely hot in SF. It winter, it could be a problem. The restaurant was overpriced, but so are all of them in the area. Food was just okay.

Plus side: bed was comfortable, bed linen was nice, towels were not paper thin, and the proximity to The Wharf and all the attractions around it was good.
review.negativeRemarks: See the above
review.locationRemarks: See the above

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us and for the 5 star review, much appreciated. Glad to hear you enjoyed the hotel and had a great time in SF. We hope to see you again soon. Happy Holidays!

review.title: Nice quiet, clean and comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the hotel. Location is wonderful to see the city. We took the cable car which starts just around the corner to Union Square and walked back though China town and North Beach. Pier 39 and wharf activities within a few blocks. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Very quiet at night. Parking fee is reasonable and has in and out privileges. Good value.

review.title: Decent Hotel Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We had some trouble finding the hotel entrance. It is located next to World Market parking lot. Our room has a window, but doesn't have a view. You need to have key to open the mini bar. The television remote wasn't that responsive. The room service breakfast we ordered was delicious and arrived in a timely manner. However, we had a hard time ordering for dinner. We have to order from North Beach Pizza and have to wait for more than an hour for the food to arrive.

review.title: Customer service
review.reviewText:
The help from the front desk was amazing. There was one young man that was very helpful in guiding us to great sites to see. There was a curly brown haired young lady that accommodated our rooms to be close together...she was always pleasant. A dark haired lady helped us out with maps of the area. Matt the concierge helped before the trip in regards to maps, sites, knowledge and bus info.
Over all great service!

review.title: Opened the door in anticipation was disappointed
review.reviewText:
I read so many reviews before choosing this place that I am beginning to doubt the authenticity of them!
For the price I really thought it would be nicer. We checked in late evening so in the morning got our first look out the window. We had to laugh when the view was a brick wall-no view. It said they had room service but when inquiring about that when checking in they said "well, that's not exactly how it is. You can order pizza". So we did and the pizza delivery boy brought it to the room but the hotel charged us a room service fee for it. The bed was comfy. The greatest thing and the only reason our Anniversary wasn't a bomb was that the location really is great! We walked everywhere! My iphone was able to keep me updated with other hotels with vacancies in the area and they were substantially lower than what we paid for this. Perhaps lesson learned-don't buy air and hotel as a package??
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms, dated décor,overpriced
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, Pier 39, unique fun area with some shopping and many dining choices

review.title: 1st timer
review.reviewText:
For my first time to San Francisco and the Wharf, we made a great choice by staying here. We walked to the Wharf for dinner and exploring. There are plenty of shops/stores in the area for anything you need.
The wine reception is lovely, a little crowded, but that's what free wine brings about.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, amenities, VERY COMFY BED & PILLOWS!!!
review.negativeRemarks: A little more attention to cleaning details.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk to the wharf & many attractions nearby.

review.title: It could be a nice hotel with better management
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good location and hotel staff are good when available. When we arrived, there was no bell boy or any one at the reception and they showed up eventually. It took them 20 minutes to bring up our luggage since they did not have anybody to stay at the door. Concierge was very helpful and gave us good tips for places to see. The hotel room was small and our room had two queen beds that hardly fit the room. Shower curtain were short and you would have some water running on the bathroom easily. Beds were comfortable. They served coffee and apple in the morning and wine at night in the lobby that was a good touch (even though we only used that once). The hotel is pet friendly but in my opinion too lenient on the guests with pets. One of the guests had two big dogs off leash when she was in the lobby and no one reminded her to put her dogs on leash. Internet was complimentary but they charge $50-$55 for parking which seems to be the norm in most of the hotels in San Francisco. We asked for extra shampoos since there were three of us and they brought us soap since that was the only thing they had!!
review.positiveRemarks: location, valet parking, coffee and wine servings at lobby that promoted conversations between the guests
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant, more control of people with pets
review.locationRemarks: It is a block away from Big bus Hop on Hop off tours and taking it for a day tour if you are new to SF is a must. Fisherman wharf and pier 39

review.reviewText: We really enjoyed this hotel. It is within walking distance for everything you need. The wine reception is great; I also enjoyed the lemon/lime water offered in the lobby as well. The rooms a small, but not small enough to complain about. I was very please with how quite it was in this hotel, we heard no outside noise in the room. The only complaint I would have if I had to come up with one is the parking fee is expensive. But parking is very hard to find and sometimes convenience is worth it. This is definitely a great hotel! Do yourself a favor and book this one, you don't need to do any more research.

My only complaint and it has nothing to do with hotel, but apparently since I booked with Expedia (third party) did not get full benefit of my Gold Crown points. which I look forward to since I usually stay at best westerns,but was not aware of this. It might have made a difference in picking hotel, since there were so many in that area, I might have found one perhaps cheaper, but still enjoyed trip so very much..

review.title: Best Western Tuscan Inn, San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is fantastic, right at Fisherman's Wharf, close to Pier 39, and many other tourist attractions. Lots of great restaurants nearby. The only drawback to this hotel, is that the walls seem to be quite thin, and the windows are single-pane, leading to a noisy stay, as you can hear any outside noise quite clearly, traffic, passers-by, etc. Also the rooms are smaller than what we are used to in American hotels. The staff was very accommodating, and the room was very clean. Also, the bed was very comfortable. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, but not to light sleepers.

review.title: beautifully decorated hotel close to everything
review.reviewText:
i thought this hotel was just so beautifully decorated and quiet. it was very close to fisherman's wharf and other amenities. the free coffee in the morning was very nice. i thought the bellmen were exceptional! we never opened our own door. they were always right on top of it. the desk staff and concierge were also extremely kind and helpful and professional. the rooms were very nice, very comfortable. the only thing i would improve upon is that the housekeeping staff should clean under the rim of the toilets especially with the show "hotel impossible" out there now. i also noticed that the bathroom vent was very dirty. otherwise i think the housekeeping staff is doing a very good job just these details. we were in room 249.
we would definitely return.
