review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. The evening wine reception was a nice touch. Easy to get around on foot and by public transportation. Concierge was not helpful with regards to transportation , but easy to figure out alone.

review.title: Disappointing Hotel
review.reviewText: Disappointing - Room overlooked an air conditioning unit bathroom very small no windows
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel close to Fishermans Wharf. - Housekeeping staff excellent, room was cleaned to a high standard
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Fantastic Accomodations in San Fran 2013
review.reviewText: My husband and I had the best vacation ever. It all started at check in mid week for an entire week. We saw all the tourist attractions and more. Walked the pier, the bridge, China town, Little Italy and went on an amazing Wine tour. Every night we were able to come home and take an nice hot shower before relaxing and out to dinner. Staying at the Tuscan Plus was a deffinete plus. We were close to the pier therefore walked all around and enjoyed the shops, the seals, little places to have a cocktail or two, icecream and coffee shops were all right around the corner. We did not want to rent a car therefore staying at the BW Tuscan Plus was very confinent. We would deffinetly stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness of the room and atmosphere in the lobby was awesome. The staff was extremely helpful and full of fun suggestions.
review.negativeRemarks: I can not think of one thing
review.locationRemarks: Location was very close to the pier. We could walk to everything or hope on city bus and trolley cars on the next corner. Fantastic place to stay

review.title: LOUD! LOUD! LOUD!
review.reviewText: If you want to sleep do not stay here....If you want a good location do stay here. The staff was extremely helpful and kind. They have a very popular cocktail hour at 5 which fills up the lobby completely. The wines rotate every night and a manager is there to pour...very charming. If you get an inside room off the street then maybe I would stay again but the Wharf area is very touristy/seedy at night....The restaurant at the hotel was way over-priced for the quality of food....just convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Location if you want to go to wharf and close to transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Move the hotel?
review.locationRemarks: The beautiful bay and all transportation stops are close by!

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Such a great location. The hop on hop off bus is 100 yards from the hotel. The beds are so comfortable. Loved wine reception in the afternoon.
review.locationRemarks: Visit Mama's for breakfast.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel surrounded by great activities and restaurants. Staff was always helpful and friendly. Wonderful wine receptions every evening and coffee in the morning. There is a very nice Italian restaurant attached to the hotel also. Lovely comfortable room would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, centrally located, great staff and options on room service. You could opt out of room service and receive a voucher for the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the wharf and bay tours, city bus tours, shopping and in walking distance to Pier 39. Lots to do!

review.title: Every person who was in contact with us was polite
review.reviewText:
The bed was amazingly comfortable. Our room was kept clean daily. Questions were answered and accommodations made for our needs. From entry door service was available greeted us in a friendly manner. We had special need for refrigerator and it was behind a locked cabinet door. Air control worked quickly.
Having a restaurant on site was another advantage.
review.negativeRemarks: Placing more ice machines on the floor would help.
review.locationRemarks: Location 2 blocks for Fisherman's Wharf made contacting the tour/ sightseeing busses within easy reach.

photos.caption: biking across the Golden Gate Bridge
Bonnie Raitt at the Bluegrass Festival

review.title: This hotel was really nice.
review.reviewText:
We love the 5-6 pm wine and cheese hour. So nice to meet other guests of the hotel.
the hotel was in an excellent location - by Fisherman`s Wharf, bay parks and bike paths, Pier 39, tour buses, etc.
Loved the fact that Hollywood Cafe was across the road for breakfast and lunch and also liked the restaurant below the hotel. The coffee in the lobby in the morning was a nice touch and also the ice water all day long.
Staff were friendly and helpful. Liked the fact that a Safeway and a Walgreens were right across the road!
review.positiveRemarks: See above. We also liked that the hotel arranged for the shuttle back to the airport and the shuttle was only $16 pp one way. Great deal!
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Great location, close to all transport & sights
review.reviewText: Hotel staff extremely friendly, courteous and helpful. Gave us several choices of which room and floor level. Cosy welcoming bar. No hesitation in recommending this, in fact we already have.

managementResponses.response:
Ros fron London, England:

We are pleased that you took the time to let us know that you really enjoyed your stay in San Francisco and at The Tuscan.
This is our "Home Away from Home" and we try and make sure that our guests are also comfortable at the hotel and expereince our enthusiasum for what we doing. Customer service is key and that is why we enjoy what we do.
Our location and our complimentary managers reception in the evening is very popluar with our guests. Glad you had a chance to enjoy it.
If I can be of any other assistance, please feel free to contact me directly at the hotel. Best Regards, Jan Misch - GM

review.title: Good location and friendly staff
review.reviewText:
The staff were very friendly and helpful. Restaurant has good choice of food and again very friendly staff. There is a free wine reception every night which is an added bonus and complimentary hot drinks in the morning! King room was small but clean and had everything you needed (including an iron!) and it was overlooking the courtyard and quiet.
The hotel is in a good location, very close to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 where you can take a bay cruise and visit Alcatraz (if it's open - not unfortunately when we were there!) without being right in the noisier touristy part . The cable car stop is near to the hotel too.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff are friendly and helpful. Free wine reception. Rooms clean and furnished well. Restaurant has good choice of food and friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Five minutes walk from Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 and Cable car stop within walking distance too.

managementResponses.response:
Lisa: We are thrilled that you enjoyed the Tuscan's customer service, hotel and location. We are centrally located and have access to a lot of
desired attractions for our guests. It is also helpful that we are on flatter land and near the water.Hope you had the opportunity to also take one of the ferries over to Sausilito or Tiburon. Viewing SF from the water is a wonderful experience. Hope you can return soon. Cheers, Jan Misch-GM

review.title: A great choice
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location as it is within walking distance to Pier 39 (tourist area), North Beach, a hop-on hop-off bus stop, cable car stop and more. Hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. They contacted our wine tour group, provided information about bus connections to SF 49ers game, and arranged for shuttle van transportation to the airport. Room was clean and had all the amenities we needed, even though it is beginning to show its age. Restaurant at the hotel served a good breakfast.

review.title: Best hotel in Fisherman's wharf!!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Tuscan was awesome and was close to everything we needed including the wharf area, tours, transportation, shopping & restaurants
review.positiveRemarks: The room & amenities were great and enjoyed the happy hour sampling local wines and the adjoining restaurant food.

review.title: CLEAN, Convenient & Friendly staff!
review.reviewText: My husband, son & I stayed in room #359, & LOVED it! It was clean, (which was most important to me), bright, & convenient to stores, and more importantly, the Piers. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by a friendly staff & they continued to be friendly for the duration of our stay. We had such a great vacation & the next time we come to SF, we will definitely come to the Tuscan Inn. The nightly wine reception was an added bonus; it added to the already charming atmosphere of the hotel. And, the food in "Pescatore" was delicious!! We loved that it stayed open later in the evening for food & drinks. Thank you very much!
review.locationRemarks: Location was the best! Everything we did was within walking distance. Couldn't ask for a better location.

review.title: Classics US feel Hotel - Hotel Staff 2nd to none!
review.reviewText:
We was hear on our Honeymoon and they made us feel v. special, we only did part of our stay has we was leaving town for a few days and they was v. accommodating in the fact the reception staff took the time out to suggest possible places to visit while we was away and took care of extra baggage we didn't wish to carry around with us. When we arrived back for the 2nd part of our stay at 10 am they picked up on the fact we was tired an arranged a room ASAP even though official check in is 2PM this is just proof of the caliber of the staff at the hotel.

The Hotel is a good base for a visit to the city in close proximity to Fishermans wharf and pier 39 loads of restaurants and things to do. If you wish to pop downtown (Union Sq) the cable car is only just round the back the authentic transportation is the best way to travel in San Fran (All be it a bit slower). and this runs until midnight.
review.positiveRemarks: It was the atmosphere that I have to say was key to me giving such a good review, Also fact it was 2 mins walk away from fisherman wharf

The room service was nothing more than a take out from a nearby restaurant with a couple of dinner rolls thrown into the box....unwrapped and quite frankly not some tng I wanted to eat. The food, while not presented well was very good.

review.title: Good location and Clean Room - BUT...!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is all about location, but there are also at least 4 hotels within 1 block. I would look at all of them before I chose this one again.

The room was clean and bed comfortable, BUT TV didn't work on some stations for most of the time, no movie channel offered, always out of newspapers, I was on the quiet side but had to listen to the loud hum of the air conditioning at night from all the other interior rooms, a microwave costs $20 per day extra if they have one available, breakfast is extra, so it was the little things, especially at this price.

Then the last big thing is I did not get any Best Western points because I booked through Expedia. This was the reason I chose this hotel to begin with. Best Western may have lost my business for LIFE on that!
review.negativeRemarks: Free continental breakfast, Movie channel, quieter rooms, free microwave, working TV. NBC the only channel showing America's Cup and it not working
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Wharf, bus, trolley and cable cars.

review.title: Close to wharf
review.reviewText: Bathroom ceiling was painted over an existing leak causing very slippery floor. Staff moved us but right over noisy section of hotel. Horrible noises. NOT even worth the price

managementResponses.response: Hi Mary - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. I'm so glad to hear that Roy and the rest of the staff took great care of you. We appreciate all of your very kind words which I have shared with the rest of the team. We look forward to your next visit.

review.title: Outstanding Fishemans Wharf Hotel!!
review.reviewText: This was one of the best vacation experiences we ever had! We had a 5 night stay at the Tuscan Inn. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by Roy who mentioned our Anniversary and Birthday celebrations. We were given an upgrade from a Queen room to a corner King Suite! BEAUTIFUL room and very comfortable bed. Housekeeping was great and they kept us well stocked with towels and amenities. We would venture out early in the AM and the room was ALWAYS serviced upon our return. Only issue was our tub handle which came off as we turned water on and we DID let front desk know but it looked like it was not an easy fix and we really did not wish to change rooms. Water pressure and temp were excellent so we just turned faucet on slow and it was all good! ALL hotel staff were gracious, friendly and said hello whenever we passed them. I've read other reviews on this property about how NOISY the street view rooms are but we were not bothered by that a bit...maybe we were exhausted at the end of our days. Concierge did a great job setting us up with massages at Project Zen on Bay St. and one of the city bus tours. LOVED the comp coffee in the AM and the evening wine reception. We were usually out and about so we only got to the wine reception 1 or 2 times. Had dinner at Pescatore on property....really delicious!! Very tasty crab raviolis and calamari! We were SO close to the Wharf...would definitely stay here again!! Many thanks to the great staff at this lovely hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Great service, comp. coffee and evening wine reception, very nice restaurant! Friendly staff. Excellent housekeeping! Welcoming, comfy lobby area.
review.negativeRemarks: can't think of anything...they really do a great job here!
review.locationRemarks: SO close to the wharf!! 2 blocks tops...my husband has back issues which do not allow him to walk long distances so this was perfect.

managementResponses.response: Hi Steve - Thanks for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. Glad to hear you enjoyed the hotel and we look forward to your next visit!

review.positiveRemarks: The Wifi was superb in every regard. The upload and download speeds were in excess of 20Mbs.

review.title: Wonderful stay

I enjoyed the wine reception they had every night between five and six as this was an opportunity for me to mingle and chat with other guests. I can't say enough good things and would definitely recommend this to anyone wishing to stay in San Francisco near Fishermans Wharf.
