managementResponses.response: Hi Bob - Thanks for staying with us. Glad to hear that you and the family had a great visit!

review.title: Nice Hotel, close to Fisherman's Wharf, etc.
review.reviewText: Had a great stay with family. Close to all tourist sites.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. While no complimentary breakfast, restaurant was adjacent/associated with Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel could provide an equipped exercise/workout room.
review.locationRemarks: Located close to everything we wanted to experience, i.e. Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz Landing, Pier 39, America's Cup, etc.

managementResponses.response: Hi Abigail - Thanks for staying with us and for taking the time to share your comments. Happy to hear you were pleasantly surprised with the Tuscan. We'll look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to SF!

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Was pleasantly surprised with the good confition and size of rooms. Coming from a monthly Vegas traveler, that means something. Would stay here again in the future.
review.locationRemarks: Located right near Gisherman's Whatf and the center of all tourist attractions. Plenty of restaurants and good selection of fast food w/i a few blocks

review.title: Great Location at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Best hotel I have stayed at for location and the room was clean and quiet.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all attractions at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: good hotel near to main attractions
review.reviewText: Staff were excellent.Free wine at 5pm was a nice touch and a good way to meet other travellers.Rooms were clean and well maintained,and hotel was in good location
review.locationRemarks: Very close to fishermans wharf and alcatraz pier.Public transport nearby and taxis always available

review.title: Great location close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is very well located within a 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the action along Pier 39. Everything along the area is within a short walking distance including Ghirardelli Square and plenty of restaurants for food & drink. Its also a very short walk to the cable cars and Lombard Street is about a 10-15 minute walk
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location and access to everything we wanted to do in our short stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful for all of our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were fine, a little small, but you're definitely paying for the premium location.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is where the action is for dining, strolling or just enjoying the beautiful scenery like Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Great Hotel next to the Wharf
review.reviewText: We felt that the staff was very accommodating and knowledgeable regarding eating establishments and getting back and forth to the airports. The room was clean and quiet just a little smaller than we are used to. The restaurant was great with pleasant and helpful waiters. We enjoyed the wine one night and liked being so close to the wharf without all of the tourist noise and also great for getting to the trolley and surrounding attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Location Great staff Clean and Quiet

review.title: Without A Second Thought
review.reviewText: The brick wall was horrifying at first, but the room was quiet. Parking was way too expensive for a guest staying here. Staff at front desk amazingly patient and courteous. Wine reception was a very nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: THE BEDS!!!!!! These are what prompted me to book a Best Western. Have stayed at a few and all of the ones I have stayed at have the new mattresses.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking for a paying guest!!!!!!!!!
review.locationRemarks: I loved the location......central to everything
review.userLocation: Vancouver International Airport (YVR), 3211 Grant McConachie Way, Richmond, BC V7B 0A4, Canada

review.title: "great hotel in a good location"
review.reviewText:
Excellent service from a every member of staff we had contact with.Hotel was set back from main Fishermans wharf area,which was ideal ,as you could walk to tourist location in a couple of minutes,but hotel was far enough away to avoid the hustle and bustle.
Rooms were in good condition and cleaning staff were also top notch.
Wine/nibbles between 5pm and 6pm was an excellent idea and a good way of meeting other hotel residents.
In all ,I could not really pick any faults with the hotel,staff or location,and would certainly stay there again if in the area.
review.locationRemarks: ideal location near to fishermans wharf/alcatraz/boat tours etc.

review.title: Great hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay at the Tuscan Inn. Our room was very comfortable (especially the bed). The staff is friendly and responsive and the restaurant is quite good. It is a smaller hotel with a comfortable lobby to enjoy complementary morning coffee and plan your day.

The location is fabulous. You are a 2 minute walk to Fisherman's Warf without being right in the middle of all the noise. Short walk to the cable cars or street cars or the #30 bus, all of which take you to other parts of the city.

In general, the hotel description is totally accurate and I would definitely stay again and recommend to a friend.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed, nice room, great staff, great location

review.title: Comfortable hotel in central location
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable hotel. The complimentary coffee and wine were much appreciated. Fishermans wharf location was very central. Pull out bed was comfy and air con very discreet.

review.title: Fisherman's Warf walking distance
review.reviewText: This was a great location for accessing Fisherman's Warf, Ghiradehli Square, Cable cars, etc. It is also very walkable to the Embarcadero. Wine reception in the evening was nice to come back to after a day out and about in SF!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Rate, Room, attached Restaurant was awesome!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf, Ghiradeli Square, Cannary Row, Cable Cars, Street car to Embarcadero - great access to lots of attractions!

review.title: Enjoyed my stay here. Will recommend to friends.
review.reviewText: I enjoy my stay here. Good location, nice room and helpful staff. The wine-receiption between 5-6PM and coffee served in early morning in the lobby is a pleasant plus.

review.title: Clean and comfortable, ideal for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: A comfortable and clean hotel ideal for staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Our room was to a very high standard and nice and quiet as it was inward facing. The staff were always very polite and helpful if we had any queries. Would definitely stay there again if we come back to San Francsico
review.positiveRemarks:
Location
Free coffee and hot chocolate in the morning
Comfortable and quiet
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf. A short walk to Pier 33, Alcatraz pier and hop on hop off buses

review.title: Hotel very good. Checkin is far too disorganised
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel at the same time last year and liked the convenient location, quietness, very clean room, comfortable bed and excellent restaurant.
The real downside is the reception staff incompetence. We had problems last year and again this time.
There appears to be a lazy culture at checkin and no one makes any effort to do things quickly or make things happen. We were kept waiting till 4.45m before we could get into our, room. No reason was given and we werent even offered a coffee or water while we were waiting. We first checked in at 12 midday and the room wasn't ready. OK, checkin is 3pm. However we were told to come back at 2pm, then 3pm, then 3.30, then 4.30. Out of 3 staff not one followed through to sort anything out so we had to ask for the office manager. Really this is unacceptable when we had been travelling for 17 hrs.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to Pier 39 and very comfortable, quiet, comfy bed and very clean
review.negativeRemarks: Checkin staff need training. Not 4 star standard
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the water and all the action at Pier 39 but a block back from the pier area so quiet at night

review.title: Hotel was close to Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: I choose the hotel to be close to the wharf and public transportation. We liked the hotel and staff. The room was a little small but I guess for the city it was the norm.

review.title: Close to everything in the Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, quiet if you have a courtyard room. Bus lines to pretty much anywhere in the city are within a block or two of the hotel.

If you want to skip expensive breakfast, there are two supermarkets literally around the corner from the hotel. The room had a mini fridge so easy to store some basic breakfast stuff in the room.

Also nice that WiFi actually worked decently unlike a lot of other hotels we've stayed in.

review.title: A great end to our trip
review.reviewText: One of the best hotels we stayed in three weeks of travelling through the States. The only negative is the cost of parking a car which was a complete rip off at $45 a night plus tax! (Though I did barter and got $10 a night knocked off the bill) The hotel was expensive too but they all are in SF. At least this one felt reasonable value for money...and they give you free coffee in the morning and a pre dinner glass of wine if you want it.

review.title: Great Location, Great Staff, Great Place to Stay!
review.reviewText:
Great front desk staff that is always ready to help you with any problem you have. The room was clean and neat. Luggage brought up right away! Wine at 5;00 was a great time to meet people from all over the world. It was nice to sit and talk with other travelers at the end of a busy day. The restaurant on site was delicious!

I just can say enough about the great staff - always ready to do what it takes to make your vacation a little more special.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, courteous professional staff. Cleaning room was perfect. Front desk staff - Tom and David were great!
review.locationRemarks: wow!!! Location was the best- walked to the wharf and every tour just a few blocks to catch. We ate at Scomas and the Franciscan. Everything so close!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf attractions
review.reviewText: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The room was perfect, it was clean and very comfortable. The hotel was in close proximity to everything my wife and I wanted to see and do!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful and we liked the nightly complimentary wine receptions.
review.negativeRemarks: I am not sure of anything that really could be improved!
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect for us! The Fisherman's Wharf was a couple blocks away. Many things were in easy walking distance to the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to wharf.
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic time in the city. Hotel accommodations were great. It was clean and quiet. Staff was helpful and friendly. Restaurant was worth visiting, especially for the desserts.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to everything was a plus. Would definitely stay there for our next vaca. :)
review.negativeRemarks: Wished a workout room was on grounds.
review.locationRemarks: Fishing charters to go salmon fishing. Call Silver Fox Sport Fishing for charter. All the restaurants nearby are worth eating at.

review.title: Great hotel for travellers
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel with fantastic staff! We stayed for 4 nights on the first leg of our California travels. Location is perfect for transportation and the wharf. Staff were incredibly accommodating and helpful throughout.

review.title: prime location at wharf
review.reviewText: central amd close to most places. easy access to fishermans wharf and quick walk to little italy and chinatown.

review.title: Beautiful but pricey!
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect - but too expensive! we had similar or better experiences at other hotels in the city for half the price
review.negativeRemarks: Price

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText:
This a very nice, reasonably priced hotel on Fisherman's Wharf.
Good size room. The nightly wine reception was very nice &
the pizza was delicious. Would definitely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Size of room, comfortable bed, pleasant and helpful staff, and the wine reception.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a short three block walk from Fisherman's Wharf - many, many things to do there.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: 2 blocks from Pier 39! Walking distance to many great eateries & sites! Fun, friendly atmosphere every evening at the wine reception in the cozy lobby. Room was adequate, no issues. Walking distance from 7-11, Walgreens, Trader Joe's. Hope to stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, helpful staff. Nightly complimentary wine reception.
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants, Pier 39, many shops, Walgreens, Trader Joe's, Denny's, IHOP, Ghiradelli Square, cable cars all within a few blocks

review.title: attached restaurant is the best thing about this
review.reviewText:
the power went out and the staff's inability to do anything or answer simple questions during the outage was ridiculous
free parking was offered, which she already be included with your hotel stay instead of the outrageous $45.00 fee that is charged on top of a 300.00 room fee for no view
review.positiveRemarks: the attached restaurant pescatore is this hotels best feature
review.negativeRemarks: a manager on duty at all times and included parking
review.locationRemarks: close walk to wharf, coit tower and restaurants

review.title: Room size very small
review.reviewText: Hotel was very close to the Wharfs but our room was on street level and very small!! We had no window to open so room was quite stuffy. For the price the hotel was not worth it at all!! Staff was excellent!! Would not recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing as it was room size and location that was the problem and that really can't be changed. Room would be ok for 1 person only
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was fairly close to some of the wharfs. Safeway and Walgreens was across the street.

review.title: A very good stay
review.reviewText: Great location at Fisherman's wharf, good staff and very clean rooms. Would stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Very good, close to things but not noisy

review.title: SF Holiday
review.reviewText: Great location just a couple of blocks away from the pier & lots of dinning opportunities:) Very comfortable rooms with everything you need for a relaxing holiday,

review.title: Close and convenient
review.reviewText: I loved being able to just pull in and give them the keys to park the car for our stay. Underground parking a plus to us. Great location for walking. We will stay here again. :)

review.title: Nice. Close to Pier 39 and other attractions.
review.reviewText: My wife and I really enjoyed our honeymoon there. San Francisco was great and the hotel was amazing. If we ever go back to the City by the Bay, we will definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, courteous staff and close to everything to do at the Wharf.

review.title: Convenient hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice convenient hotel within a few blocks of Fisherman's Wharf and close to cable car line. However the room was extremely small for 2 people; smaller than hotels we have used in London or New York City (where small rooms are custom). The required valet parking was a hassle and expensive; literally no room to pull in and drop off car.. we sometimes had to wait out on the busy street to even turn into the valet area. The hotel staff was not very helpful with regards to directions and attractions, which is unusual for this touristy area. The single concierge was rarely available.

review.title: Walking distance to fisherman's warf.
review.reviewText: Parking was expensive at the hotel but the room was clean, a little small but it was quiet and bedding was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to fisherman's warf
review.locationRemarks: Dining, entertainment close by.

review.title: Nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: Great location.Loved the complimentary wine hour at 5pm.

review.title: great location, very nuce hotel, helpful staff
review.reviewText: Stayed 3 nights. Room was just a little small but very clean and nice. Location was walking distance to everything. Staff very helpful. was very happy with our stay there.
review.negativeRemarks: no complaints
review.locationRemarks: fishermans wharf, pier 39, telegraph hill, bay cruises, city tours, cable cars. Everything seemed nearby.

review.title: Perfect location for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Only 2 minor items. Restaurant/bar closed at 10 and room bathrooms are small and outdated.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar could stay open a bit longer

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Great location close to fishermans wharf. Staff was very helpful and knowledgable with what tours were best to see.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wine in the evening and really good coffee in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located and easy to get to.

review.title: Located near several attractions we came to see.
review.reviewText: Our stay started out disappointing, there was only one staff member on duty to check guests in. This took what seemed like forever but probably was close to 15 minutes. When we got to our room the thermostat was not working and we had to call for maintenance. The repairmen had to turn it on in a hall panel and told us we would need to reset the temp about every nine hours as they were having trouble with it. It took a long time for the room to cool and was hot again when we returned from outing and woke in the morning. For the room rate I expected quite a bit more.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: 2 blks to Fishermans Warf - was able to walk almost everywhere and obtain public transportation easily. Great Restaurant and the room was clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, friendly, great restaurant and close to Fisherman's Warf area.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf, cable cars, museums, rent bikes - Golden Gate Bridge. Tons of restaurants.

review.title: L&S's Excellent Adventure
review.reviewText:
The Tuscan has it all. Location, location, location. Excellent, accommodating staff. Although our room overlooked the courtyard, and therefor no 'view' to speak of, it was clean and quiet.
We enjoyed the free wine reception every night between 5 & 6 - great chance to meet others staying there.
Also the coffee in the morning was also much appreciated.
The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful.
Overall, we highly recommend this hotel to others, and should we return to San Fran, will stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Great hotel for San Fran
review.reviewText:
Good location and pleasant hotel to stay in.
Would recommend it.

review.title: Tuscan Inn San Fran Cisco
review.reviewText: Free wine every afternoon, friendly staff, good free coffee every morning, close to shops and restaurants, great central location. Comfotable bed. Only draw back no spa or pool.
review.negativeRemarks: No spa
review.locationRemarks: Can walk to a lot of attractions, for others catch a bus or tram easily.

review.title: Quiet and convenient
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is perfect is you are visiting San Francisco as a tourist. It is central to all of the tour companies, hop-on/hop-off buses, and steps to a variety of restaurants, shops, and even grocery stores. Our room was on the inside of the hotel and very quiet. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and not just because they hand out free wine during the wine hour.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the Wharf.
review.reviewText: This hotel was Great! Well priced. We will defiantly stay again.

review.title: Great location for Fisherman's Wharf/Cable cars
review.reviewText:
When trying to work out where to stay in SF the first thing to decide is what district do you want to be in? If you answer Fisherman's wharf to this question then I found this is a good choice.
Hotels in SF are expensive compared to other places and room sizes are often smaller so you have to take that into consideration, and therefore to compare SF hotels with hotels in other areas is folly.
However you should always expect good service, friendly helpful staff, clean and well maintained, good restaurant etc, and I found my stay at the Tuscan Inn had all of these, and I'd happily return.
It's a great position just around the corner from the Powell and Mason cable car end station so journeys to China town, Union Square are easy and fun. Pay $14 for an all day ticket that allows you to jump off and on as often as you like as its better value than the fixed $6 per journey ticket regardless of distance.
If there is a big queue at the cable car station, walk one block along the line and you'll find you'll be able to get on the next car without the wait.
The hotel is 10 minutes on foot from Pier 39, and a similar distance to the Powell and Hyde cable car station and the promenade and beach beyond. Its just 2 blocks behind the main drag through Fisherman's Wharf but I found that a bit touristic and tacky.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Good Location if Fisherman's Wharf is where you want to be it's an easy flat walk to all the local attractions.

review.title: Small rooms but worth it for the location
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for tourist sight-seeing and close to great hidden gem restaurants. The appearance of the hotel was fancy but the rooms were a bit small and hard to move around in, let alone fit just a single suitcase. Parking was pricey (although not out of character for the area) but the internet connection was worth it. i would still recommend it.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Also walked up to Coit Tower for a great view of the city. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was small, but clean and quiet. Bed was very comfy. Also, wine reception was nice. Would stay here again. Very convenient.

review.title: San Francisco City
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, loved the afternoon free wine in the common lounge area, this was the manager's treat, and was a good way of people getting together and interacting. The hotel was just a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf where there are a number of attractions, heaps of restaurants, and where a lot of the tours start from. I don't think we could have picked a better hotel or location.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: So very central to everything

review.title: Great location! It is 2 blocks from the Wharf.
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Francisco, partly due to our stay at the Tuscan Inn. The staff and accommodations were great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The accommodations were tasteful, clean, up to date, and well kept.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great for any wharf activities and for catching the cable car. The antique arcade game museum on the wharf is great!!

review.title: Perfect location!! Perfect hotel!!
review.reviewText:
Our stay couldn't have been better! I have stayed at some of the worlds most exclusive hotels, and only the best have this one thing in common: the kindness of employees, and the desire to make your stay perfect!! Best Western Tuscan has both things!
The hotel staff: Roy, and David the Manager made our stay fun, and helpful all at the same time. The entire staff always took time to answer questions, and genuinely care about what we were looking to accomplish that day in terms of sight seeing, travel, etc. The bed was amazingly comfortable, and the hotel was pretty, not over the top, but very nice, as was our room. Nothing was worn looking in the lobby, or the rooms. The location was perfect. There is a bus stop directly across from hotel, the trolley or streetcar is a block over, there is a grocery store across the street, if you want to take a day trip to Napa, etc, you can pick up all types of snacks, salads etc, and bring them with you in your rental car that you can rent at Budget, again one block away! There is on the street parking around the hotel at night, so you can possibly park there instead of one of many garages, again, all within a block!! Fishermans wharf is 2 blocks, great to catch a sunset sail tour, etc. I would not stay anywhere else in san fran. enough said!!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: perfect, see above

review.title: San Fran holiday
review.reviewText: The charge for incidentals at check in was a first for us. We have stayed at numerous hotels before and have never encountered a charge as this prior to check out.
review.positiveRemarks: The hospitality hour. Great time to meet people.
review.negativeRemarks: View from our room.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great,walking distance to lots of attractions.

review.title: Superb hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is ideally placed for Fishermans Wharf...a two minute walk but far enough away to avoid the noise.
The gentleman on reception who booked us in was the beginning of a superb experience. He was friendly helpful and professional.
The room was modern comfortable and very very clean.
The wine reception every evening was fun and the coffee available every morning was a nice touch.
A great hotel which Id recommend to anyone.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights....Excellent Location, Very clean and great staff. Daily morning fresh coffee in lobby was cool....Parking looks little high and missed a swimming pool.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent Location, Very clean and great staff. Daily morning fresh coffee in lobby was cool.
review.negativeRemarks: Could have slab rates for parking based on length of stay...instead of having flat rates....Swimming pool would be cool....
review.locationRemarks: Most tourist activities is in fisherman wharf....so the best location to stay if you are visiting SFO for a vacation...

review.title: Not great
review.reviewText:
Parking was unexpectedly $45 a night
Wine reception might have been nice but if you arrived by 7PM as we did it was all over
Room was clean but nothing special
No breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: parking is a problem

review.title: I'll highly recomend this hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed with my wife and daugther for one night. The location was excellent. The food at the restaurante was good. Roy at the desk was very friendly. The wine reception was very nice

review.title: Excellent location. Clean Hotel. Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to Fishermans Wharf and North Beach. Bus stop across the street. Hotel is clean, room was a little small but adequate. Very comfortable bed with nice pillows. Staff was very friendly. air conditioning worked well.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby are cable cars, Lombard street, Coit Tower, Fishermans Wharf, pier 39 and China town.

review.title: My First Negative Review
review.reviewText: I am someone who gives everyone the benefit of the doubt and I ignored the nasty reviews about this hotel. Apparently that was a mistake. I booked MONTHS ago and requested that one of the rooms have two beds as I was going to be traveling with my two adult children. The front desk manager was super nasty on the phone and told me I'd just have to wait until check in-I figured maybe she was having a bad day. Dealt with her again (remembered her unusual name) at check in and she was even more nasty and told us "sorry" and turned away. We checked back when she was not at the desk (there were several male front desk people who were very kind) and were told there would be availability for the room with two doubles the next two nights and to come to the desk that afternoon. Guess who was back at the desk? She told us "no". The room was the tiniest hotel room I have ever been in and was not very nice. I have written tons of reviews on Expedia after many, many trips and always tried to post positive things about the places we have stayed and I am generally a "glass half full" kind of girl...but this was really bad. The room was very dated and very dark. For the same money, you would do much better to go down the street to the Hyatt or across the way to the Radisson (which features sleep number beds). We checked out early and paid for a different hotel. Even the Holiday Inn has better rooms-truly. I took a chance thinking this would be "quaint"-my advice, don't stay here!
review.negativeRemarks: Helpfulness, professionalism, and customer service at the front desk (specifically a female employee-(L)
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is close to Fisherman's Wharf-but so is the Hyatt!

review.title: Hotel close to everything at Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel location is convenient to the cruise terminal

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: it was our wedding anniversary and the hotel had a bottle of champagne when we arrived. all the staff was very helpful. the wine reception was a pleasant end of the day and beginning of the evening. the restaurant was very good and they have happy hour mon-fri. would stay here again
review.negativeRemarks: more sitting for wine reception
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from fisherman's wharf where the tours leave from. Hollywood café within walking distance is excellent for breakfast. trader joe's next door.

review.title: Great locations, I would stay here again!
review.reviewText: The staff was great and very helpful with everything! It was very clean and everything was very nice. The king bed was amazing!! Flat screen tv's in the rooms! It was an awesome location as we only walked 2 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf and right down to Pier 39. Awesome time!
review.positiveRemarks: Modern, clean, great staff, close proximity to everything!
review.negativeRemarks: No suggestions.
review.locationRemarks: Location was awesome. We walked alot in SF so we would come back to the room frequently to rest. Pier 39, Alcatraz landing, restaurants, Ghirardelli.

review.title: nice location but bedrooms getting little dated
review.reviewText: hotel lounge redecorated since last time we visited few years ago. the bedrooms were dated, the bed line were in holes and dirty in places. the concierge arranged a tour for us and it was meant to be inclusive of a wine tour, we ended up at Muir Woods with no wine tour. wine on evening nice touch
review.negativeRemarks: dated bedroom concierge putting us on wrong tour
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Fishermans wharf stay
review.reviewText: Great location close to fisherman's wharf and cable cars. Rooms were small but satisfactory. Wine tasting and restaurant were pleasing experiences.

review.title: Great staff and great location.
review.reviewText: The front desk staff goes the extra mile to help with your sight seeing and all needs. Rooms small but that is expected in SF. The wine reception each night was wonderful and a great way to meet other travelers.
review.locationRemarks: Close to China Town, North Beach and Fishermans Wharf. It not far from Coit Tower and other great attractions.

review.title: Tuscan Hotel San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was very comfortable, close to Fisherman's Wharf etc. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was ready on arrival.

review.title: Nice hotel close to many tourist attractions
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel right by the Wharf and really close to Ghirardelli Square , cable cars, all bus tours... We were vacationing as a family with young kids and we were pleasantly impressed by the friendly and knowledgeable Front Desk , Concierge, and Valet , as well as other staff members... Location is great. The restaurant is good. Wine reception is nice... I think.!? We never had to walk more than 5-10 minutes to either A. get where we needed or B. Get to the easy transportation that would get us where we needed! With Tuscan as a base, we explored numerous tourist attractions as well as historic neighborhoods in just 2 days!! we once decided to get on the early morning tour to Muir Woods and we saw next one is in 10 minutes- just enough for us to get to Pier 39, buy 4 tickets and board ! If your budget needs a break from the excellent ( but addicting) restaurants in the area, there is a grocery 1 block away! Tuscan is not a 5 star but the service is on par with the best!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Location, Location! Friendliness of Staff Restaurant is good and available Rooms are comfortable Wine reception
review.negativeRemarks: Façade visibility is poor driving from Embarcadero- could use an updated sign. A little dated for the price expensive parking ( but all area is!)
review.locationRemarks: Wharf, Pier 39, 41, all bus tours, public transportation- 5 min Cable cars next block! Ghirardelli Square 10 min Restaurants, shops myriad around

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fishermanns Wharf
review.reviewText: I always stay here when in the city. It is safe, clean, professional but warm and friendly. Feels like home away from home and is pet friendly. One drawback is exhorbitant cost for parking, 45 per day/ night....The rooms are a bit small for more than one person with luggage etc,and housekeeping left the last guest's handtowels on top of the shower curtain which i did not notice right away so never said anything, but otherwise facilities are very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: ghiradellii, Franciscan restaurant for a delicious crab, but if you are A new englander like me, ask for their " special sauce" on the side/ butter

review.title: AWESOME
review.reviewText: THIS HOTEL WAS WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF EVERYTHING WE WANTED TO SEE. CLOSE TO ALL BUS SERVICES, SHOPPING AND RESTAURANTS. THE HOTEL IS VERY WELL CARED FOR, WE STAYED A WEEK AND HAVE NO COMPLAINTS ABOUT ANYTHING AT THIS HOTEL.
review.positiveRemarks: HOW CLOSE IT WAS TO EVERYTHING
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING

review.title: Good
review.reviewText:
The bed very comfortable and room very quiet and clean. Staff helpful and pleasant. Would stay again.
Many thanks
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast included
review.locationRemarks: very central to all attractions

review.title: Great place to stay in SanFran.
review.reviewText: This has to be the cleanest motel I have ever stayed in the rooms were a tad on the small size but every other aspect of rooms was excellent. Staff were amazingly helpful could not do enough to for us. Location was terrific close to Fisherman's Wharf, transportation and lots of places to eat. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great service and friendly staff. The hotel is in a great location also.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, Wine party at 5 pm

review.title: Mick and Pauline
review.reviewText: Great location staff were very good all ways willing to help very good hotel

review.title: Nice hotel near fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel met our needs, which was a place to rest from our busy days touring San Francisco. The bed was comfortable and even though the room was smaller than expected it still was comfortable too. Everyone of the hotel staff that we came in contact with, was helpful and courteous. The location of the hotel was nice because you could catch a bus, trolley or cable car within one or two blocks and it was within walking distance to Pier 39 and Pier 33(Alcatraz Tour). There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel, but recommend Pergamino's for breakfast located just a few blocks away on Columbus. We will stay here again when we return for another visit.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: Very friendly co-operative staff. Manager's get together each afternoon really good and meet staff and fellow travellers. Location is great.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Just 2 blocks to fishermaen's Wharf.

review.title: Nice, helpful staff. Close to water.
review.reviewText: Upside - staff and location. Downside - overall appearance of hotel, mainly corridors. Lobby was nice and room ok but approach to room was a little disappointing.

review.title: Good Stay at the Tuscan
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed staying at the BW Tuscan Inn. Would definitely stay there again and have recommended it to friends. Beds were extremely comfortable and the room clean with pleasing decor. There was a bit of road construction outside our room during the last few days, but that can happen anywhere. Staff were friendly and the concierges were all very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Enjoyed gatherings each night in the lobby for wine & cheese toast!
review.negativeRemarks: Road construction outside our room last couple of days and false fire alarm at 6:30 am - freaked us out a bit!
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Within easy walking distance to the Wharf and convenient to all public transportation.

review.title: Wonderful staff and comfy bed
review.reviewText:
Wonderful check in staff (Roy) noticed it was my birthday from my ID besides the many well wishes he was very friendly, helpful with transportation, and tourist things to do in the area. Also while we were out he surprised me with a bottle of wine and bday card. Also he always used our names when seeing us in the lobby. Those personal touches are just so appreciated. Add bonus, the bellman kept our luggage for 6 hours before we had to go to the airport. This helped us seem more at the wharf. Pictures of room were spot on.

Only complaint would be the room was 'not quite' cold enough for us, but the bed was super comfy.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to pier 39

review.title: Great stopover !!!
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel as it was very reasonable and very well situated,on arrival we were
dealt with promptly and very pleasant. Free wine,tea and coffee also Internet in the rooms,the use of a computer and printer,could not fault the hotel at all.Short walk to all the piers,walked back from union square took us a while but great to see china town,would highly recommend this hotel.only stayed 3 days as we were on route to Hawaii ,would have liked to stay longer.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the piers,the trolley turnaround was a short walk,deli's,restaurants,and a Safeway next door.alcatraz pier 33, 5 minute walk.

review.title: Comfy, stylish & well-situated hotel.
review.reviewText: No pool. Parking was $45 daily with in/out privileges. Room was small. But room was very clean, nice decor & well appointed--everything worked and we had everything we needed. Most comfortable hotel bed ever! Lovely lobby with welcoming fireplace and nightly wine recepton. We had a courtyard room so it was quiet. Complimentary coffee in the lobby in the a.m. Helpful staff. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Trolley, muni buses, Ghirardelli Square, Buena Vista bar, Pier 39, Embarcaderro, Alcatraz ferry, etc. Only rented a car so we could drive to wine country (49 mins away) on our own time. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Most comfortable hotel bed ever. Exceptionally clean room.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit small, but fine for us (a couple).
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Fisherman's Wharf close to all sites and transportation.

review.title: Good place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, lovely staff that were helpful and attentive. Would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room looked out onto a brick wall
review.locationRemarks: Couple of minutes walk from Pier 39, tram stop, Trader Joe's, etc

review.title: Nice hotel but not comfortable for me to stay
review.reviewText: I booked for two beds. But what I got was 1 small queen bed which I had to share with my adult son for 3 nights.

review.title: Second Stay
review.reviewText:
We stayed 6 nights. The beds were comfortable and got a good nights rest. Although you are a stones throw from the Wharf, it is quiet at night. You may hear the fog horn on a foggy night. But it's not loud and nothing you can't tune out with the AC on. Nice to have the trolley around the corner as well as a Starbucks and Walgreens.

This was our second stay there. We last stayed in 2008 and enjoyed our experience then.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to trolley and North Beach. Beds were comforatble. Bathrooms are clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Walk to wharf, trolley. Although near the wharf, pleasantly quiet at night.

review.title: Excellent location and place to stay for anyone.
review.reviewText: Everything was excellent (considering the total per night cost was $220 including the taxes); however, there was no microwave or coffee machine in the room. Had the room had these items, I would have given the hotel 5 out of 5 in overall rating.

review.title: A taste of excellence
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly
The hotel was close to everything and very convenient
I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and if we are back in San Fran
I will stay here again
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Tuscany in California
review.reviewText:
Very good location. Within walking distance of all the piers and cable cars. Pier 39 in particular is just around the block. Hotel restaurant is quite acceptable but eclipsed by some of the more specialised eateries.
The room (standard) was more suitable for a single person or a couple. Quite small room but comfortable none the less. You should spend most of your time sightseeing.
Loved some of the room names such as Lucca and Siena (Tuscan towns).
In the lounge it is worth talking to the concierge as they have a wealth of local knowledge and very helpful. This usually leads to queues but is well worth the wait.
Get a Muni Pass and ride the street cars as well as other municipal transport. Cheaper than taxis.
Get up early for the cable car rides!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff are particularly helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The road works cutting of the water supply for a night.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location for piers, transport and cable cars.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: Nice aforable place to stay near Fisherman's Wharf. Very comfortable. Very helpful staff. Would return.

review.title: Great base for exploring a great city
review.reviewText:
After a 12 hour flight and long queues at border control, it was not a welcome sight to walk into a hotel lobby packed with people and their luggage. Reception soon had us checked in, however, and we were able to escape to the calm of our room within minutes.
Compared to our hotel in Auckland, this one seemed older, less well fitted out and the room was definitely smaller. On entering, one was struck by the huge bed, the facing wall of mirrors and, in contrast to so many hotels, how light the room was. In our 4 night stay, however, neither of us found the room cramped, the en suite was good and the bed superbly comfortable!
Unless you have to be in the centre, on top of the shops, you will not be disappointed by its location - a few minutes walk from: buses, trams and the famous cable cars; Pier 39 and its eateries and sea lions; Pier 33 and trips to Alcatraz and, of course, great views of the bay and its bridges. Even closer is the attached cafe/restaurant, which serves good meals at reasonable prices, and is popular with both residents and non-residents.
Custom for the latter is encouraged by the tasty morsels they provide during the excellent nightly happy hour, when the hotel provides free wine for guests, and which succeeds in creating a very sociable atmosphere. Complimentary tea and coffee is provided from 6am each morning.
Not the last word in luxury then, but a comfortable, friendly and efficient base for exploring this characterful city.
review.positiveRemarks: The nightly wine reception; its proximity to the bay and to the various modes of cheap, efficient public transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of swimming pool!
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Godd location and value
review.reviewText: The hotel is we'll situated fr access to Fishermans wharf.Staff were very helpful and pleasant throughout our stay.The complimentary wine and coffee is a nice touch. the restaurant stays open quite late which was great when arriving well after 10pm and the breakfast is good value
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great location and value!
review.reviewText: Great location. Rooms are small but nice and clean. Coffee bar and cocktails and appetizers were great and included with the price of room. Trader Joes is right around the corner great for picking up snacks and drinks. Staff were very nice and recommended wonderful restaurants. Wish they had a shuttle to and from the airport but they can arrange for a car or shuttle service if requested. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Florida girls
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful experience in San Francisco, would definitely go back, hotel was perfect location, very pleasant and friendly staff. Any thing we needed or asked for we were accommodated. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
review.positiveRemarks: Wine experience was very nice to visit with other guest, nice staff wonderful atmosphere.
review.locationRemarks: Great location within close walking distance to shopping, dinning and the Wharf

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My room was over the front entrance. I was constantly checking to see if the windows were open because the street noise wasn't being filtered out by the windows or the wooden shutters. I did meet lots of great people at the wine reception. I loved the location. I would definitely stay there again but with a quieter room.
review.positiveRemarks: Waking distance to cable car, restaurant and tour buses.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise not. Eing filtered out by windows or wooden shutters
review.locationRemarks: Location was great

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, clean rooms, excellent hotel staff, very accommodating, would recommend this hotel to friends and family
review.positiveRemarks: the cleanliness and very helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!!
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located at Fisherman's Wharf. Close to Pier 39, trolleys, buses to take to Little Italy and Chinatown.

review.title: San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was within walking distance to a lot of sightseeing areas
review.negativeRemarks: Close to the Pier but realy no view from hotel

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Very good location close to Fisherman's Wharf and public transit. Most of the staff were friendly. The concierge(Matt) was very helpful. The only negative thing was that our view was facing a wall. They had no rooms left that faced the courtyard.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights. The room was comfortable and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking at San Francisco prices!
review.locationRemarks: A few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and local attractions.

review.title: Would definitely recommend this hotel.
review.reviewText: When I arrived staff were friendly and welcoming and allowed me to check in very early at 8:30am. I found the decor of the hotel very charming. The room was clean and comfortable. The front desk gave me a map of the city and off I went! When I returned to my room in the evening, having missed the managers wine reception, I found a bottle of wine in my room, a pleasant surprise! The restaurant was very busy for breakfast so there was a short wait for a table and it was a bit expensive but good quality food. When I checked out the concierge was very helpful and immediately hailed me a cab. Very good stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. On the doorstep of Pier 39 with seafood restaurants, shops and amusements. Very close to cable car stop.

review.title: A get away for couples.
review.reviewText: The front staff were friendly and very knowledgeable about the city of San Francisco and how to get around. I highly recommend this hotel for couple to get away without breaking the bank.
review.negativeRemarks: The area with a large number of homeless harassing the tourists.
review.locationRemarks: Five blocks away from Fisherman's Warf. But two blocks away is a street stop which helps.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very helpful and considerate. Love the location, its close to everything you want and need. Had a great time.

review.title: A pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Location is good , within walking distance to Fisherman Wharf. Staff are friendly and helpful. The room is clean . A pleasant stay.

review.title: Convenient hotel in Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Convenient, good clean rooms, with very handy restaurant next door. Not a lot of extra space in our room (2 queens) but adequate for our group of 3.

review.title: Amazing place with amazing staff
review.reviewText: This is an absolute wonderful hotel to stay. It is very clean and updated. The staff is amazing. There is nothing that they were not willing to help with. The restaurant was great with amazing food and staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. As well I would more then happily stay there again. Thanks for the amazing stay.

review.title: Great for touristy couples!
review.reviewText:
Pros:
The front desk staff are very helpful and friendly.
The rooms were very clean - on the smaller side but that's to be expected.
It's nice that they have a wine reception for guests and I loved the C.O. Bigelow bath products.
The proximity to the Wharf is great, just a quick walk.
Taxis are readily available and the doorman was also very helpful.

Cons:
There was road construction going on that started at 8am and was very noisy, but that's not the hotel's fault at all.
review.negativeRemarks: Smaller rooms but well laid out
review.locationRemarks: GREAT!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: From the time we arrived through our departure the hotel staff was attentive to us as guests. We arrived a bit early, around noon, and were given a friendly greeting and assigned a room. The rooms may be a bit small for some, but it was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in an excellent location for tourists (which we were) and the staff helpful. We made use of the concierge, Hugo, who arranged a last minute trip for us to the Muir Forrest. The hotel furnished wine for guests in the afternoon and we met a number of other guests in a laid back setting that was a nice break from the days activity. I think the hotel and its staff added value to our stay, and we plan to return on our next visit to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The attentiveness of the staff to guests in a bustling tourist area.
review.negativeRemarks: The room door opened outward - which I thought was unusual. I almost bumped another guest when I went out to the hall, but no big thing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf. Convenient to public transportation. Shops nearby. Our room was on the courtyard and very quiet.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Standard of hotel in general is what you'd expect from a Best Western; nothing exceptional, but clean and tidy.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: It is a great location !! The staff was fabulous very helpful
review.locationRemarks: Great walking distance to all sights

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: They stored our bags for us 2 days in advance of our checking in. Nice! Central to Embaradero streetcar and Mason cable car.

review.title: Love Fishermans Wharf area
review.reviewText: Great location .easy access to city centre by cable car and within walking distance also. fishermans Wharf area is a really great spot.

review.title: Great clean hotel
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and comfortable! Exactly what I was looking for. The location is right by the wharf and incredibly convenient. The staff was very friendly and housekeeping never missed a spot.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the wharf

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Everyone at front desk very friendly and helpful. Room was small but mirror on wall behind the bed made it seem larger. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable.

review.title: worth your money
review.reviewText: Worth your money. friendly stuff, close to all the piers

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The location is perfect, price was more reasonable that other hotels in the vicinity (due to a sale) and the staff were very helpful and professional. Our room was clean and quiet. The nightly FREE wine reception was a great way to unwind before heading out for dinner. The only thing we would have like is a pool to relax in after a long day of walking the city, but the money we saved by booking here instead of a hotel with a pool was worth it.

review.title: Hotel Experience April 2013
review.reviewText: Average - like the morning beverage (coffee, tea) at lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: Like the morning beverage at the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning - noisy, not efficient.
review.locationRemarks: Good location - minutes walk to Taylor/Bay cable station; two super markets right at the corner; 10-15 minutes walk to Pier 39.

review.title: Superb
review.reviewText: Lovely room though a little small. Really comfortable bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Meet and greet at 5.00 with wine
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Superb. Right near pier 39.

review.title: Nice and very friendly
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the hotel and everyone was so friendly and helpful. The only downside was the construction noise that was outside our window, but I realize that was out of their control. I would absolutely recommend the hotel and would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the wharf

review.title: I would go again!
review.reviewText: Comfortable and provided what it advertised. Found the bellhop to be extremely friendly and helpful - lots of good advice. I thought the wine tasting in the evening to be very "cultured" and generated a warm atmosphere. Although a bit more expensive than I wanted to spend, it was well within the average price for the area and as a result - very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf. Surprisingly quiet at night so easy to sleep (after 2 weeks in Las Vegas!)
review.positiveRemarks: Warm comfortable feeling and the wine tasting.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Two short blocks from Fishermans Wharf, walking distance to Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Very positive experience
review.reviewText: This is a well maintained, very comfortable boutique style hotel in a great location. It is within walking distance of many interesting sites (Coit Tower, Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach...) and lots of restaurants, cafes, etc. The staff was great; always friendly, very accommodating. Each evening there is a wine hour where guests mingle while enjoying CA wines in front of a fireplace. The morning coffee and paper was always a nice way to begin our day. The coffeemaker in the room and the refrigerator made it possible to reduce food costs by sometimes eating in (there is a Trader Joe's next door). There is a comfortable business room where use of a computer was available. Overall, we had a lovely experience here during our stay in S.F.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: STaying at the Tuscan Hotel was a very pleasant experience. The location is perfect. The staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. The wine tasting and coffee in the hotel lobby creates a great opportunity for meeting other residents.

review.title: Great place close to the wharf
review.reviewText: Room was a little on the small side and couldn't open a window, but that's the only complaints. Quiet, nice location, good food in their cafe. I would stay again.

review.title: Best Location Best Service
review.reviewText:
Recently spent 10 nights in San Fran, was originally going to stay in the union mission area. I am so glad I stay at the tuscan instead. The Tuscan is located in the fishermans wharf area, that is the hub of activity.You can walk to so many spots or have access to transportation to get anywhere.
The hotel has the most supportive and polite staff. The ladies at the front desk, namely Wendy were extremely helpful. Enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to reccommend or stay there again. AAA
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing bad to say
review.locationRemarks: Location is the best, value in real estate is the number one factor, this hotel is in the ultimate location.

review.title: family holiday.
review.reviewText: The staff made our stay very pleasant.Good location for everything.xx
review.negativeRemarks: No gym
review.locationRemarks: Very good.

review.title: THE BEST STAY ON THE WHARF
review.reviewText:
The staff was very helpful and knowledgable.
We never had a question that was not answered in a timely manner.
The room was very restful and kept clean.

review.title: 1st visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The location was great, only a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. So much funstuff and activity. Happy to find a starbucks a block away as was the trolley station.
disappointed that there wasn't any type of breakfast, no bagels fruit or anything other than coffee. They do have a nice free wine social each evening from 5-6pm.
Rooms are small but that's not too big of a deal as you don't spend much time there.
review.negativeRemarks: no breakfast

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Great hotel and perfect location especially if you are not interested in big downtown hotels
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: very small room, noisy
review.reviewText: Room was very small. We were on the 2nd level which is the first floor facing the street and it was very noisy with passing people and traffic. Bed was comfortable and staff were very helpful Wine tasting late afternoon was a good way to meet other people Close to Fisherman's Wharf Shame about the small room
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and ferry to Alcatraz
review.negativeRemarks: Very small room and noise from the street
review.locationRemarks: Great location Two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Very happy to have found this hotel. Perfect location. Small rooms, but comfy beds.
review.negativeRemarks: the wine served at happy hour was terrible.
review.locationRemarks: perfect location close to everything!

review.title: nothing great ....
review.reviewText: very disappointed about the location ... really wasn't what it said it was. staff was nice but the valet was pushy and somewhat rude. nothing fancy .. wanted something special .. this hotel was not it!!!

review.title: Great hotel for family or couples only.
review.reviewText: Staff very professional and courteous. No complaints with the facility and would highly recommend this hotel and location to major activities.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Exceptional

review.title: From Toronto Canada
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and location. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Spend four nights with my daughter and would highly recommend to anyone. The beds were extremely comfortable and always had more than enough towels. We were on the fourth floor and over looked the street but had great views of the city and pier. The free wine from 5:00pm to 6:00pm was a very nice touch and also got to meet fellow guests. I had read other comments that the room was small but didn't find that compared to other cities I have stayed.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: I had a great experience from this hotel. Very friendly and professional staff. Hotel location was perfect for my needs. Only issue was the room location, as my view had me staring at a huge red wall, so not much sun light.

review.title: Best Western Tuscan Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Very warm and friendly staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them. They were always willing to help and advise.
The room we had was very clean, modern, and well appointed. with efficient and quiet air conditioning.
Only two negative points for us: 1. The room was a little small.
2. The bathroom lighting was arranged so that it was impossible to switch on the lights without waking your partner.
All in all though. If all your are looking for is a comfortable place to lay your head after a busy days retail therapy or sightseeing, this hotel represents excellent value for money.
It is well situated for Public transport and Fisherman's Wharf (Pier 39). Each being just a few minutes walk away.
There is also free coffee available in the Lobby from 0700 - 1000 and a free glass of wine here in the evening

review.title: Time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Check in was efficient. Rooms were small and at times noisy. Wine in the afternoon was an excellent touch. Foyer with couch and seating was extremely pleasant. In a good position.
review.negativeRemarks: the size of the room
review.locationRemarks: Good position.

review.title: Positive experience
review.reviewText:
* Helpful Staff
* Good location
* Meet my expectations

review.title: Good, but pricey.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is in a great location! Extremely close to Fisherman's wharf and the main tourist waterfront bun - literally a 5 minute stroll from there. Close to the restaurant on Fisherman's wharf, close to pier 39 and Ghirardelli square. Union square is a bit of a walk.
Hotel staff was okay - some great and some not so great. This wine reception was a nice relaxer to the whole day.
Overall a good experience. Just pricey for what we got.
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Awesome!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very well taken care of and in the perfect location to walk to a lot of tourist sites. My only complaint was that it sits on a noisy street and if you have a room facing the street like we did, the noise of the cars and buses will keep you up all night.

Otherwise it was friendly and well kept and I would stay there again. I would just ask for a different side of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise

review.title: excellen but overpriced
review.reviewText: Only reason why i did not give 5 on all was the price. It was litlle more tham i am used to pay for Best Western even in the big cities
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was excellent as was the location for my purposes this weekend
review.negativeRemarks: price

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Great experience. Friendly, nice and accommodating staff. Will go back!
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great stay at the Tuscan Inn, comfortable rooms, nice and quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful. Really enjoyed the wine reception the hotel holds every night. Restaurant attached to the hotel was also fantastic. Hotel is central to all the tourist attractions, although difficult to get to from the airport/bart without a taxi. Would stay here again and recommend to others!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great for exploring the main tourist attractions.

review.title: 3 days in San francisco
review.reviewText:
great location near cable car and fishermans wharf
great breakfast cafe just up the street

review.title: e.g. "Great location.Great hotel for a family"
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful. Facility nice for the cost.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the wharf -- easy walk around the area.

photos.caption: The biggest, nicest bed I've ever slept in.

review.title: This is the only place to stay......awesome.
review.reviewText:
Best Western Plus Tuscan Inn was an absolute pleasure.

The little things like the maintenance staff stopping to say "Hi, where are visiting from" to dashing to the elevator a head of me because my hands were full to push the buttons. Even the cleaning staff shouting "Good morning" when we stepped out.

The wine reception was something we made a point to get back for every day to meet up with other guests to see how they're day went. We met so many interesting people because of this that we normally would not have had the opportunity to do so.

Front desk were so helpful, this was such a warm & welcoming place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: "ALL" the staff, no matter what they're job was, we were always acknowledged in passing. Wine reception, was great meeting other hotel guests.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything I didn't like, it was such a wonderful experience.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything , streetcars, cable cars, Starbucks, grocery store which was so handy. Right smack down at the Wharf.

review.title: Awesome hotel for the price?
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our stay at the Tuscan Inn. Check-in was fast and easy. I had requested a quiet room away from the elevators with a courtyard view-we were given a room away from the elevators but when we opened our shutters in our room the view was not of the courtyard but a wall! Not too thrilled with that but it was very quiet? My main complaint was that the room was very small-not much room to move around. The bathroom was a nice size though. The best thing about the hotel is the location. We did not rent a car so had to walk everywhere. The location of the hotel to Fisherman's Wharf made it easy to walk to all the attractions we wanted to see. Our walk to the Alcatraz Pier was only about 15 minutes. There is also a bus stop right across the street and the cable car was only a block away. Northpoint Shopping Centre is right across the street, which has a Safeway and a Walgrens. We bought our bus pass at Walgrens so that made it quite easy to get around. We had breakfast every morning at the the restaurant in the hotel-Pescatores-and it was very good. There is a free wine get-together every night in the lobby from 5-6 which was enjoyed by many. I would definitely stay again but would specify that I want a "courtyard" view.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of our room
review.locationRemarks: Location was awesome-walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz Pier, and Pier 39.

review.title: Crisp linens, Friendly staff, close to everything.
review.reviewText:
Loved the crisp white linens on the beds. Rooms were clean. Make sure to adjust your thermostat if just dropping your bags and heading out. One of our rooms was set on heat 74 degrees and the other on cool 69 degrees, so make certain you have it set to your liking so it will be comfortable when you return.
4th Floor rooms 438 and 439. 439 was perfectly quiet and nice, 438 across the hall had a constant humming sound from AC or something.
Front desk staff was wonderful all 4 days we were there. The first 3 days there was a male concierge who was friendly and efficient. Last day when we needed assistance with boarding passes, front desk sent us to concierge desk and the female there did not even look up and just said go to the business center. So I had to get a key for that and run over there, the link to AA was not working, so back to front desk. Front desk guy was fantastic as usual, though.
I would absolutely book here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have preferred more traditional room service: be able to order up coffee or tea by the pot.
review.locationRemarks: Within half mile or less of everything or Streetcar/cable car pick ups.

review.title: Absolutely perfect in every way
review.reviewText:
The staff was wonderful and the location so perfect to get to everywhere on the Wharf or to the cable car location. WIne celebration each night and very delicious appetizers in the gorgeous lobby with glow of the fireplace.
Our room was exceptional .
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect spot to enjoy all the wonderful options on the Wharf.

review.title: Cozy and great staff!
review.reviewText: Staff were very helpful and even let us store our bags there for the day we checked out. The conceirge was very helpful and gave us great advice about what to do during our short stay. The room was very small but comfy and nice. I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great hotel for a few days get away
review.reviewText: Very affordable - nice hotel - friendly, helpful staff - close to Fisherman's Warf - will come back to stay here when next in San Francisco

review.title: Good location, close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Good location, close to Fisherman's Wharf. Twin room was a bit of a squeeze but otherwise a good quality hotel.

review.title: Surprisingly nice hotel at Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: This Hotel is kind of a hidden gem in Fisherman's Warf, Rooms a little small but adequate, nice flat screen TV's , New Matresses...Fresh Free Coffee and Tea in the Morning, Complimentary Wine Reception in the evening. Walking distance to North Beach area, Grocery Store and Walgreens within a block. Staff is great.

review.title: We'll be back again
review.reviewText: Central for most tourist interests, such as our own. A brief stroll to the exciting attractions of Fisherman's Wharf, pickup for sightseeing pleasures, bike rentals a block away for adventurous rides over the Golden Gate Bridge, easy access to the Alcatraz ferry for a few hours on The Rock, and a supermarket/mall around the block to stock up on essentials! This was our second stay, and we'll be back again on any return to San Francisco.

review.title: San Fran. Fisherman Warf's Best Hotel except.....
review.reviewText: I left a 5 "superb" rating for all categories, except when I rated the hotel overall, I only left a rating of 4 "pleasing" because:- of their deceptive "valet-only" parking practice, which costs you $45+ per night. I understand "now", that this is the norm for downtown San Francisco, but for guests traveling in from out-of-town, which I would presume is most of their guests, this should be revealed somewhere during your booking through Expedia. Except they keep it a "dirty little secret", until you arrive, and then this secret is revealed to you, and they know there is no reasonable alternative for you to park your car downtown in San Fran, so they just "stick-it-to-you" - SORRY! - sarcasm. BUT I must say: the Hotel is beautiful, well maintained, perfectly located, staff are polite welcoming & professional, dog friendly, and there is a nice private computer room with full free 24hr internet access for guests, so you can handle some business whilst visiting, in an office environment.
review.negativeRemarks: The Mandatory $45+per night Valet Parking Fee
review.locationRemarks: The location is just perfect for visiting San Francisco, CA

review.title: Confortable
review.reviewText: Very nice bedrooms, with more than reasonable space. Free coffee in the morning and a nice glass of wine each afternoon. Good location.
review.locationRemarks: Very good
review.userLocation: São José do Rio Preto - São Paulo, Brazil

review.title: Satisfaction Guaranteed!
review.reviewText: The hotel was welll situated, close enough to Fisherman's Wharf to pop down to eat or wander, but far enough away to be able to escape the crowds. A block the opposite direction of The Wharf and you were able to pick up the cable cars. The staff were informative, friendly and helpful in every situation and they created a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Our room overlooked a small garden area, was a sparkling clean, and the beds and bedding were soft and welcoming, after a long day of exploring! I particularly liked that each bed had four comfy pillows and a soft bolster! The rooms are not overly large, as others have noted, but we weren't in SanFrancisco to stay in our room, so we found the size more than adequate. We were in a double with two beds and two people, three people would have still worked...four might have made it feel crowded. It was a great experience and I would definately return to this hotel!

review.title: Nice hotel, helpful staff, alright furnishings
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a nice location. There are lots of touristy things nearby, and many good restaurants. There are less pubs than the Union Square area. The hotel is close to the cable cars and some big bus routes for getting around the area. The hotel was newer and in good condition. Our room's mattress was not very comfortable - very 'springy'. There was a sketchy cloth chair in the corner - always questionable. The one wall had a nice mirror and the bathroom was larger than expected. The staff was friendly overall and the 5 o'clock manager's wine and cheese was well put together. Overall a good stay as long as you aren't super fussy about the room furnishings.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was way too springy
review.locationRemarks: Optimal location for the super touristy San Fran experience

review.title: Nice Hotgel for a Stay to see fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Our Stay of two nights was very pleasant,the rooms were small butg very nice, no view though
But the location was great,close to everything at the Wharf.Most everything was in walking
distance. We even walked al the way through china town up to Union sqare. The Hyde St
Trolley is just a few blocks away, and the F Cable line is just blocks away, which takes
you all the way to market st. Hotel Staff was excellent and helpful,
Our only downside, was when we arrived the entrance was partially blocked by Semi Trucks
unloading new bedding for the facelift. We Couldn't get in and out very well to check in
for about a half an hour. We simply hit our arrival at a bad time. I thought they could have
had better arrangements for supploies and deliveries, the mattresses were actually being
transported to the floors on the regular guest elevators. But in turned out to be a minor
inconvenience. Overall, very nice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: location, cleanliness and staff was pleasant and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: No real view, some street noise, not bad. parking fee is expensive
review.locationRemarks: Locaton is excellent, near everthing at fishermans wharf
