review.title: Happy with our stay
review.reviewText:
Hotel in a great location. Just a couple of mins walk to Pier 39, 10 minute walk to Alcatraz ferry and has a Safeway across the road to get essentials. Half hour walk to Union Square or catch the tram.
Hotel was clean. We had adjoining rooms for our teenage children which worked well.
Wine tasting late afternoon was a nice touch.
Overall quite happy with our stay.

review.title: A pleasant stay in a Fisherman's Wharf locaction
review.reviewText:
This hotel was selected on the basis of previous Expedia guest's experience. It fully lived up to our expectations of comfortable and clean accommodation and we would certainly return there if we visit San Francisco again.
Tourist attractions of Fisherman's Wharf, Cable Car and inexpensive waterfront Tram line were only a short walk away. Finally, we were able to walk the three blocks or so to the cruise terminal wheeling our luggage for the next part of our holiday (and we're unfit and well beyond retirement!) The cruise terminal is another story - its inability to efficiently process disembarking passengers is a blight on the city of San Francisco!
Our arrival at the hotel was dealt with quickly and as it was a little after 5.00 pm we were invited for wine and nibbles in the adjacent lounge - a very pleasant start to our stay. We enjoyed it so much we returned for further refreshment on subsequent days!
Breakfast in the hotel's adjacent Italian style restaurant was our only disappointment, so after our first morning we chose to walk one block to the Holiday Inn that includes a Denny's franchise supplying traditional fare.
review.positiveRemarks: A friendly atmosphere, particularly at 'Happy Hour' - a couple of glasses of wine and nibbles between 5 and 6
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast in the Italian style restaurant was less than substantial - but Denny's a block away at the Holiday Inn provided more and better for less.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Fisherman's Wharf and ideally located for the cruise terminal - walking distance even with a wheeled suitcase and carry-on

review.title: AWESOME and REASONABLY PRICED PET FRIENDLY HOTEL!
review.reviewText:
This place was just perfect. Close to all the fun at the Wharf but still had a nice residential feel to it in that we could walk the couple of blocks back to the hotel and feel like we were out of the congestion and hub bub of the Wharf.

We traveled with our two small dogs and from the moment we arrived, we felt extremely welcome. The hotel is impeccably clean, the staff is efficient and super friendly and the added extra touches like the wine reception every night and a special doggie treat bag for our pups really set this moderately priced hotel way above the competition. And there was NO PET FEE. Wow. That was another amazing bonus. :)

There is also a wonderful restaurant attached to the hotel that has great food and a cool Italian Bistro vibe.

Overall - I can't recommend this place enough!
review.positiveRemarks: The wine reception every night was a delightful surprise. They gave us cute doggie treat bags for our pups. Great atmosphere created by amazing staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of any. Was really blown away at the quality level of this hotel for the price.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very good. Room was large and comfortable. I found the heating hard to adjust so was cold sometimes. Hotel has a wine conference between 5 and 6pm every day which means free wine tasting and finger food. Was very good. Got to meet lots of people this way. Hotel is very centrally located. Our room was very quiet and dark at night times, which was excellent for sleeping. Very happy with the decision to stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wine tasting, quiet comfortable room, good price
review.negativeRemarks: Heating hard to adjust
review.locationRemarks: Central, very convenient

review.title: Very deserving of the high ratings.
review.reviewText:
I was undecided about whether to stay at Fisherman's Wharf or Union Square. I'm very glad I decided to stay at this particular hotel. Everything is close by e.g supermarket, pharmacy, cable car, hop-on hop-off buses, tourist info office. It's good to be able to come home to a quieter area after exploring the city centre. I asked for a quiet room and was given one. It didn't have a view but that didn't matter as I was only there at night. The street rooms might have an outlook but they could be noisy. I am female and was travelling alone for this part of my trip and I always felt safe, both in the hotel and San Francisco generally. My room had two double beds and would be crowded if there were two or more people and both beds needed to be used. You might like to think of upgrading if this is the case. My only problem at the hotel was promptly sorted out by the manager/assistant manager - I don't drink coffee, only tea, and there was only a coffee maker/coffee supplied in the room (common in most U.S. hotels). A kettle was purchased so that I could boil water for a cup of tea ... now other guests will be able to request a kettle! (Don't try to boil water in a coffee maker. No matter how many
times you 'flush' it through, you cannot get rid of the coffee taste!) ALL staff were very polite, friendly and helpful. Thank you.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

Have stayed here before, like the location, like the hotel, like that it is dog friendly, restaurant on site is very good. It really is in Fisherman's Wharf area. Good business center (computer room), wifi.

Quibbles: the air-conditining heating unit seemd to be a little our of whack - it worked a littel too well on heat, we had to keep turning it down to be comfortable. Also, the room has attractive and very nice wooden louvered shutters with a chain operated shade above so you get good control over natural light levels - the only problem is that the stop on the shade chain is set too low, so the shade can't be raised high enough to not interfere with opening the shutters or louvers.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff, don't need a car in San Francisco.

Very close to cable car station to go to Union Square etc. as long as you don't expect a 4/5 star hotel or a massive room, this more than does the trick. Front desk staff are more than helpful! We'd come back and stay here again for sure .

review.title: Friendly staff. Great location.
review.reviewText: Stayed for 3 nights. We arrived from the East coast very late (2am) and so I call ahead to make sure they know we are coming. The lady I spoke with on the phone was lovely, very courteous and assured she will note it down on our booking. Our flight were delayed and when we arrived, the reception staff were expecting us and noted our delay. The room was very nicely presented, clean and comfortable. Our room had disability access so the bathroom was really big, not sure if this is the case for all the rooms. The location is fantastic, only a couple block from fisherman's wharf and very close to cable car station so very easy access to all the attractions. If you are staying at this hotel, I highly recommend breakfast at the Hollywood cafe - it was the most delicious breakfast I had in US. The portion was generous and the service was prompt and friendly.

review.title: Second time here and still very happy
review.reviewText: This is the second time that I have stayed here and i was just as happy the second time round. You cant ask for a better location. a street back from Fishermans Wharf. The staff are super friendly and it's just a really nice cosy hotel.

It was located perfectly for our Alcatraz tour the next day and local shopping was superb. Would definitely stay here again!!!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the Tuscan Inn. Great location, could walk to most things we wanted to do along the pier area. When we wanted to venture further, bus lines, cable cars and the trolley all pick up within a couple blocks. Grocery store right on the corner was very convenient if you wanted an item or two for your room. Room is a bit small as compared to other hotels I've been too, but seems consistent with many rooms in the SF area, and was very clean and comfortable. The entire staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. They answered all my questions and were extremely helpful in giving me ideas and directions around. The wine reception every night was very nice and i looked forward to it after a long day out and about. I have no complaints about the hotel and i would go back there again next time.

Extremely helpful staff. Very coimfortable room, and very convenient to have a restaurant on the premises. Handy to Fishermans Wharf and other facilities, close to the Port for cruise ship passengers.

Very unique for a hotel to provide a "Happy Hour", and this was obviously much enjoyed by other guests.
Reception staff very helpful indeed. A special mention for the Maintenance Man who helped repair a broken case handle with a smile. If we visited again we will definitely stay at this hotel .We have no hesitation in recommending thjis hotel to other travelers.

review.title: Comfortable hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: While I have never stayed in the Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco in the past, I was pleased with the ease and accessibility to all the activities that the Wharf has to offer. This hotel had a comfortable and relaxing, contemporary, urban feel in a neighborhood that is a bit like the midway of a fair. Once in the front door, you could enjoy a glass of wine during "wine hour" in the beautiful lobby or sip on a cup of coffee and read the newspaper in the morning before the day's activities began. Our first night was spent in a room overlooking the street out in front of the hotel, and was extremely disruptive. After a word with the manager the next morning we were promptly moved to an inside room overlooking a courtyard where there was absolutely no disturbance whatsoever.
review.positiveRemarks: Attentive staff, comfortable rooms, beautiful lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms overlooking street out front are extremely noisy.

review.title: A wonderful place!!
review.reviewText:
We arrived several hours before check-in but were given a room immediately! All of the staff was wonderful. The room was clean, the beds comfortable and the food at the restaurant attached to the hotel was very good. The only complaint would have been a lack of view from our room.
The hotel is an easy walk to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square and many other attractions. Although we checked out early in the morning, the bell man put our luggage in our car for us even though we were leaving it parked there for the better part of the day.
I will gladly reccomend this hotel to anybody who asks me for one and will happily stay there again in the future. Even my grandaughters were happy there.

review.locationRemarks: Ideal

review.title: Great location in the heart of Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
This hotel was very good. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was spotless. We slept well every night as the bed was so comfortable. I found a couple of the housekeeping staff did not speak sufficient English to understand my request for some bathroom scales to weigh our luggage but they did find someone who did speak English. The hotel is in an excellent location close to Pier 39, restaurants, shops and tour companies at Fishermans Wharf. It was easy to get into the city too. We ate at the hotel restaurant a couple of times and the food was very good. We booked a day trip to Monterey and Carmel for $75 p.p through Extranomical tours. This trip shouldnt be missed. The driver stopped at Pebble Beach golf club for the golfers to have a look!
Research tours yourself rather than ask the concierge. We found she lacked local knowledge.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and very good location
review.negativeRemarks: lack of a guest laundry
review.locationRemarks: very convenient location close to the water and Pier 39

review.title: Great place for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was situated in a very good location (approximately 5-10minutes walk to Pier 39 where a lot of the restuarants and shops are). The rooms were small but comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. There was complimentary WiFi, tea and coffee and an hour wine reception in the evening which was a nice touch. We were on the side nearest the road which was slightly noisy however there were rooms away from the road. The staff were all very pleasant. I would recommend this hotel and I would return.
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows to improve noise from the road if situated on this side.

review.title: Fine but no breakfast
review.reviewText: Our stay was fine; We would have been much happier if the hotel had been consistent with Best Western's tradition of providing a breakfast with accommodation.
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf if you are seeing San Francisco for the first time.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: Room was very tiny with terrible views. Overpriced, would stay someplace else!
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room, amenities

review.title: central and nice but watch out the parking cost
review.reviewText:
Super central and very nice hotel. The parking is an additional 50$ and it's a rip off. Public parking immediately close to the hotel actually have lower overnight rates, but I didn't know.
Hotel personnel however was really kind, and they have a free wine tasting for guests before dinner, nice!

review.title: Stylish, Clean place to stay.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location and has a beautiful feel to it. Each staff member was very courteous. It would have been nice if they provided a complimentary breakfast in addition to the coffee, but otherwise, zero complaints.

review.title: Great locatiom
review.reviewText: Brilliant location, right on Fisherman's Wharf. But, unlike other US hotels on our recent trip, you are always going to have to make some sacrifices because of that location. The room, although having 2 queens, was on the small side and, since there were 4 of us, it was a bit difficult to keep it tidy. No breakfast, but coffee available for a couple of hours or so in paper cups on a morning. Bonus was the daily wine reception every afternoon, which got loads of people into the lobby and chatting. One or two had dogs too, so I guess the place must be dog-friendly. Major drawback, as with many SF locations, is parking. We paid for 4 days vallet-parking and, with the tax, that came out at about 200 bucks. On reflection, it might have been better to have terminated our hire at SF on arrival and the to have taken out a new hire when we left. A car in SF is pretty much a liability for tourists anyway and, since the city is pretty small, taxis are always going to be an option if it's just too far to walk.
review.negativeRemarks: the cost of parking
review.locationRemarks: right on Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: FIND ANOTHER HOTEL IMMEDIATELY
review.reviewText:
The hotel was not adequately vented and air-conditioned, even though San Francisco's air is a great temperature. The room was too small for our family even though I had called repeatedly to inquire about another room, the hotel staff insisted our one room would be just fine. There was a clerk staff gentleman who harassed and embarrassed my children regarding their participation in the happy hour in the hotel lobby. My children are all over 21 (ages 21 and 25) yet the staff member kept saying they were lying to him. They did not have their id's on them as we had just put our luggage in the room and we were re-packing for a long trip to China. Since I was the Mother and I was standing right in front of all of them while this harassing was going on! It made the experience horrible.

The connected bar and restaurant is a little long in the tooth and smells bad. Also, the concierge booked us on a city tour, with a later Muir Wood tour with a Sausalito dinner stop to include the ferry back to Fisherman's Wharf. She completely underestimated the first tour and we were unable to participate in any other tour that she had suggested and also she had BOOKED with a prepaid fee. It was stressful and absolutely no fun. ON my BIRTHDAY.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was the main draw to the hotel from someone looking on the internet. It was quite expense for such a run down hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff, condition of building, small bedrooms, information that was faulty, in bad need of repair, and on and on. Do not stay at this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The location is not the best on Fisherman's Wharf if you need this location. There are many better hotels very close by. It would pay to shop around.

review.title: walking distance to everything,
review.reviewText: Staff was great. My only complaint was the layout of the room.....strange.
review.negativeRemarks: the room layout
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf....san francisco ca

review.title: walking distance to everywhere
review.reviewText: great location near the wharf, easy food shopping at trader joes
review.negativeRemarks: no real flaws the staff were a bit snooty
review.locationRemarks: near everything touristy

review.title: It is was Just OK
review.reviewText: Hotel a little tired. Rooms not much more than basic and need better quality sound proof glazing from road outside. Parking very expensive. Not too sure where Kimptons influence comes in to the quality of this hotel. It was Ok!
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Great hotel for couples.
review.reviewText: Wonderful lobby. Good staff. Of 4 pillows ALL were too firm for us. Please give us 1 or 2 softer.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Close to wharf and many attractions. Close to sightseeing tours.

review.title: $45.00 a night parking
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay but very overpriced. I would rather have free parking then free wine. We drove down from Canada and found other hotels with better scenery and for alot less of the price with complimentary drinks and snacks.
review.negativeRemarks: no parking
review.locationRemarks: couple blocks away from wharf

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn has been updated and remodeled to some extent. I was very impressed with the Lobby redue. They can seat a lot more customers now. The hotel room has also received a face lift. Nice contemporary decor, but beds are a little too hard. Bathroom ceiling showed signs of too much moisture and some mildew on wallpaper. Could use some bleach and scrubbing during the daily cleaning process. Other than that, it was an enjoyable experience. Staff & housekeeping are very efficient.

review.title: Can't speak highly enough about this hotel!
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel in a great location. Highly recommended!

review.title: Excellent hotel in every respect.
review.reviewText: A brilliant hotel in every respect. Great room, helpful staff, free wine reception between 5-6pm every day. What's not to like? As a sole female traveller I felt very safe here too.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wine reception, helpful staff, mini-bar, cleanliness of room.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for fishermans wharf. Close to f line, bus and tram services.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us and for the 5 Star review. It was our pleasure to serve you and we hope to see you again soon!

review.title: Great hotel for any traveler
review.reviewText: This was the perfect hotel for us to spend a night in San Fran. Absolutely nothing could have been better. Thanks to the staff for the great and courteous service.

review.title: Great hotel for Fisherman's Wharf touring
review.reviewText: This hotel is in walking distance to all major attractions and area restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was friendly. The rooms are a bit small, but cozy, clean, and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Could use some shelf space for guests in the bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Fisherman's Wharf...close walking distance to attractions

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great place to stay if you are looking for a hotel neat the wharf. Good access to both lines of the cable car and trolly which can get you to downtown as well as along the piers.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean with such a friendly and helpful staff. When I had questions about how to get to specific places a woman sat down with me and outlined on the map what streets to take. Room was small, but this was not a problem because we only slept, showered and dressed there.

review.title: Parking Woes
review.reviewText: I think the parking charge, which is not even mentioned when booking the room, is exorbitant, $100.32 to park a standard sized car for only two nights, (plus a modest tip for the car parker and retriever. When rates are quoted the parking fee should also be mentioned, at the very least. I would not have taken this room if I knew it was going to cost me $50 a night to park my car.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking my car!
review.locationRemarks: OK

review.title: Great Location,Clean& Comfortable
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised how nice everything was. Location,cleanliness and comfort were all perfect . Close to Fisherman's Wharf and all modes of transportation Will be staying here on our next visit and would suggest friends do also.Did a lot of research on line before hand and this hotel was a great choice for us turned out better than anticipated.
review.negativeRemarks: cost for food, but you are in San Francisco, expected
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, very close to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf and transportation

review.title: Nice, but pricey hotel
review.reviewText: Nicer than the average Best Western. Great location, but you pay for it, like all hotels in the area. Tacking on valet parking made this a very expensive stay. If I had it to do over again, I probably would have stayed more outside of Fisherman's Wharf, at a less expensive hotel, and just paid to park at a lot for a day, which would have been much cheaper.
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Convenient. Within walking distance of everything you'd want to see at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while in town for a concert. The hotel was very nice, well kept and nicely decorated. The room was cozy, and had everything we needed. Location was great, close walking distance to fishermans wharf. Free wi-fi! Would stay here again for sure.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The room was on the 4th floor and it was still noisy at night. The room was small for the furniture that was in it, we moved some things around and it was better. Great location for the Warf area. Local transportation waqs close also. Would stay again but found one 1 block over just as nice for a little less money.
review.negativeRemarks: size of room, noisy at night...and cost.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Fishermans Warf

review.title: DREADFUL STAY!!!!
review.reviewText:
I was not told that we would need to pay $100.32 for parking. I could not get to my car when I needed to i had to WAIT!!! i paid way too much for the room that was filthy!! I will NEVER stay at this hotel AGAIN!!! The chineese girl at the front desk was very RUDE!!!!
NOT WORTH THE TRIP OR THE MONEY!!!!!!

review.title: very handy location!
review.reviewText: Everything was great except the noise level outside, which made it very difficult to sleep at night. Noise didn't end until after midnight and trucks, motorcycles, cars, conversations, and beeping garage arm started up at 6 the next morning!. Not even ear plugs were able to block it out. This hotel is in bad need of double pane windows!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and ease of getting around by public transportation!
review.negativeRemarks: Pretty noisy at night if you have an outside room.
review.locationRemarks: Location was ideal and compensates for lack of sleep!

review.title: great stay in frisco
review.reviewText: we really had a great experience at the best western tuscan inn. service was great and very polite staff.
review.positiveRemarks: free wine from 5 to 6 pm and clean rooms
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: close to fishermans wharf
review.userLocation: Harbor City, Los Angeles, CA, USA

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: It was in a very nice neighborhood close to all the things we wanted to see. The room was very clean and comfortable. If we go back to San Francisco would stayed again.

review.title: Great hotel for both families and couples
review.reviewText: Our room was ready early and all the staff were friendly and helpful. The wine reception was a pleasant bonus in the afternoons!
review.negativeRemarks: Double beds, not queen
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Good space, decent location,rested really well
review.reviewText:
Hotel very close to transport, tourist attractions, supermarkets and banks. in itself the hotel is comfy and staff were very pleasant (I didn't need much of them though),

room was comfortable, after long day walks i slept really well, everything was clean and space was sufficient so not to be stumbling over suitcases or other people. nice that wi-fi in the rooms was complementary.. for the price i expected a gym or a pool (i did not check before.... i only imagined for the price it would be normal, but no, you are paying for location and how easy it is to go everywhere)

usual complaint, parking is excessive from my point of view (usual in San Francisco Hotels as space is prime)

i was glad i booked there
review.locationRemarks: mason and North Point, super easy access to everything

review.title: Pleasant stay. Helpful staff.
review.reviewText: One of the main reasons I chose this hotel was that previous reviewers' comments had responses from the hotel management. That concern for guests' opinions is reflected in the care that I was shown in may two-day vacation stay. The room, while a bit small, was comfortable. I was in an "inside" room with a window on the "courtyard" (landscaped, but not used for any other purpose that I could see). The A/C worked fine (but was a tad loud). The TV remote seemed slow and there were no channel guides (I asked - they just switched to a new system -- guides on the way!). My main criticism is the attached restaurant. While the food was good (a bit pricy), there were no seats without arms. For large persons such as myself, this poses a bit of an embarrassing problem (we don't fit!). Since the hotel does not offer breakfast, I'd have preferred a better eating option than this inconvenient restaurant (although the Hollywood Cafe down the street was delightful!). For those travelers who like to explore using public transportation, this hotel's locale is ideal - several bus and trolley lines (including cable car) within a two block walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: limited breakfast/food options (especially for "big guys")
review.locationRemarks: on the 47 bus line (Van Ness), 1 block from the 8 line (North Beach, Chinatown..), 1 block from the F trolley, 2 blocks from cable car.

review.title: Solid choice
review.reviewText: Great location. The room was clean, updated and comfortable, but not the largest hotel room I've ever been in.

review.title: Charmed
review.reviewText: What a fun stay we had! The rooms are super-cute, the building is quaint and charming, and the service was amazing. Location is fabulous, too!

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Clean and quiet hotel in Fishermans Wharf. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We couldn't of had a better stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Good Service from Staff, Clean room, Great Location, Quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Not great for Breakfast, not much choice and expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Great, it's at Fishermans Wharf, close enough to all the main attractions but far enough away from the Pier 39 Area to be quiet.

review.title: Nice Rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel is located 2 block from Fisherman's Wharf. Great location. The room we had were a little on the small size but not bad for 2 adults. The rooms are clean and quite. We asked for a room facing the court yard vs street side. My only complaint was the parking cost. The hotel charged $44 a day/night to park. Really??? We found a garage across from the hotel that charged $35.00. So if you drive look around for a better price.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location, close to tour bus pick up areas and to the ferry terminals.
lots of good quality restaurants nearby, both at Fisherman's Whaf and in the surrounding streets.
review.positiveRemarks: We enjoyed the free wine tasting available in the Lobby each evening.A good chance to get together with fellow travellers to compare notes.
review.negativeRemarks: Chamber maids lack of attention to details.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the great review, I'm glad you had a wonderful experience in SF.

review.title: Good Location and Value
review.reviewText: This hotel provides good value in an excellent tourist location. The complimentary wine tasting from 17:00 is a good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Excellent tourist location

review.title: Comfortable Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: This is a comfortable, clean hotel in a location that is extremely accessable to the Fisherman's Wharf area. Evening wine tasting is a nice touch. Staff are very helpful and friendly. I don't think it would be particularly suited to children, but would strongly recommend for couples. I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, and room was well appointed and comfortable. Also a decent shower with reasonable water pressure. Hotel quiet despite the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Not really any complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Located comfortable walking distance from Peir 39, plently of shops and cafes around. Great location if you want to be in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Hidden treasure....
review.reviewText: We received excellant service from the conceirges. Everyone was very friendly and accomodating. Hotel is within walking distance to everything on the wharf. Will definitely return!

review.title: Comfortable, convenient and relaxing...
review.reviewText: We have been staying at this hotel for the past 5 or 6 years now - it is beautiful - great location, wonderful staff and very comfortable rooms. We are able to book our wine tours in the lobby and the renovations to the lobby are fantastic - lots of open space - more room to sit and the beautiful garden off the lobby - the flowers are so well kept. The hotel location is terrific - we can go to the Wharf, walk to the Ferry Building, walk to Chinatown and Little Italy - North Beach and always look forward to walking back to the Tuscan Inn - and if we are too tired to go far for dinner - the Pescatore is right there - the food and service are so comforting and it is such a relaxing atmosphere - then we cut through the lobby and off to our room - how good is that! We would recommend this hotel to everyone and have done so for a few of our friends already. Thank you for a great stay - we will be back sometime soon!

review.title: Bestwestern Plus Tuscan Inn
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay here. The location is close to everything we wanted to do. The staff was very helpful at all times. My only complaint is that our queen bedroom was small. Otherwise our stay here was perfect and we will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Favorite things about this hotel was the friendly and helpful staff. Also enjoyed the coffee each morning.The Location as perfect for our adventures.
review.negativeRemarks: The queen size bedroom and bathroom was small.
review.locationRemarks: Location optimal for sightseeing and great food!

review.title: Get what you paid for
review.reviewText:
We booked the 2 Doubles and Wine reception. There was no wine reception. No mention of it by check in staff, no mention throughout our stay.
Great Location, Staff were great

review.title: Quiet room
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying here. The location was great (near the water and with two grocery stores nearby). Getting around was also easy - several bus lines stop close to the hotel.

review.title: Disappointing roomkeeping....
review.reviewText:
They did not refresh the linens of the room everyday during our stay.
Certainly, some hotels do not refresh linenes for the reason of environmental conservation. But they did not show their "linen policy" clearly, but they did not changed bed-cover at all.Returning from sightseeing tired, we were very disappointed to find it even though we put some tips for roomkeeping! (Of course, the roomkeeper got the tips!)
When we complained at registration desk, they say "Roomkeepin is roomkeeping business, but we tell them to do so." They said as if it was not thier fault. They have no consistence as a hotel between officers, terrible sectionalism.
With small baby and child, we expected clean room, but the roomkeeping was...
They should explain their policy at check-in, at least show the policy clearly in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location for sightseeing, and has lots of restaurants and shops near the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: terrible roomkeeping and sectionalism of officers.
review.locationRemarks: near to the fisherman's warf and easy to ride alcatraz tour and famous cable car!

review.title: Tight squeeze for 3!
review.reviewText: there were 3 of us, my husband, our 17 year old daughter and myself. we had a king size bed and a pull out couch. the room would have been fine for 2 people but when the pull out was folded out it came in contact with the side of my bed thus making it difficult for me to get up in the night. the wine reception was lovely although it concerned me that it was written up in the "what to do" in San Francisco book. One did not know if the others present were hotel guests or just people who had read about it and decided to take it in. The hotel is very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf and the cruise ship terminal (where we were leaving from). It is a bit pricey for what you get but that seems to be the norm in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the wine reception and made some great new friends!
review.negativeRemarks: When the pull out was out you couldn't move in our room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Fisherman's wharf and the cruise ship terminal.

review.title: Great Location for the peer and street cars.
review.reviewText:
We found the Motel to be in a good location for the places we were visiting. It would have been great to know that the Motel was being remodeled. The entrance to the Motel was
always messed up. The elevators were, to say the least a challenge. The room was always hot, the air system would shut off and return to a pre set temp. If the bed in the room was a queen It must be a mini queen. The staff was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room and small bed no AIR
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: great location, decent hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, 2 min walk to Boudin's bakery/the piers and 5 min walk to Ghiardelli and trolleys. Clean, w/ good concierge service and friendly helpful staff.

review.title: small yet clean and friendly
review.reviewText: the Rooms are small but vary clean and well kept. the Staff is vary friendly and accommodating It is a great location for visiting the fisherman's wharf, ok location for pier 39, but it is 3 miles for AT&T park with no shuttle service so Giants fans, don't stay here without a car
review.negativeRemarks: the size of the room
review.locationRemarks: vary close to fisherman's wharf, walking distance to pier 39, vary far from AT&T park with now shuttle service

review.title: Nice View
review.reviewText: the hotel was located perfectly for wharf access via walking. It was clean the staff was friendly and other than the room being a littly tiny and that there is only valet parking available it was definatley a place we will book twice.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Location, Location, location and the restaurant was simple but good for a quick bite to eat!

review.title: No Complimentary Breakfast.
review.reviewText: It was just ok. It would be nice if they offer complimentary breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: the smell, epecialklky, in the hallway.
review.locationRemarks: very nice location, just a small walking distance to PIER 39

review.title: Nice room and close to the Warf.
review.reviewText: Hotel was undergoing a remodel, but the staff was very pleasant and the rooms were clean. The bed was not too terribly comfortable, but not awful and the room was a little small. Again, not awful, but cozy. Would stay there again....great location....within blocks of the Warf and next door to a great (expensive) restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was not very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for those who want to walk to the Warf and explore.

review.title: Great locale & staff, uncomfortable room
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, very attentive, warm, friendly, & professional! The room decor and furnishing were a disappointment, the king we booked was smaller than any room I've state in. We'd have had more room in a double queen I suspect. We booked 4 nights and wished we had changed hotels after night one because the bed was terribly uncomfortable & even though we kept hoping we'd adjust to it it never happened and we ended up sleeping poorly every night. They look to be in the middle of a reno though so hopefully a furniture upgrade is in the budget! Great location if you want to stay near the Wharf & North Beach!
review.negativeRemarks: Beds

review.title: Well I slept there
review.reviewText:
Stayed for a weekend in San Francisco. Hotel location is not an advantage because all of the hotels are in the same area - where you will want to be if you are wanting to see the sights. The hotel had been decorated and was nice and the room I had was not large but had a big mirror which gave the impression. Big TV, big fridge ok bathroom a window with no view. AC a bit clunky.
Ante rooms nothing much to speak of. Reception is really cluttered and you have to queue. Did I like it - ok - would I go back - no.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice location for tourism - but no different than the other hotels
review.negativeRemarks: Reception
review.locationRemarks: Near to the Fishermans wharf and the emarcadero.

review.title: good place to stay (when it's finished)
review.reviewText:
our stay was affected by the building work on reception (not notified to us in advance), resulting in there being poor facilities for relaxing in the hotel and one of the lifts being out of order most of the time. We were given a room facing the wall of an adjacent hotel, but were moved to a courtyard facing room on request - which was much better.
Staff, with one exception, were very helpful, pleasant and polite. hotel location is very good, and apart from the above we spent an enjoyable week at the hotel and in SF
review.positiveRemarks: its location and the comfy beds
review.negativeRemarks: the disruptive building work
review.locationRemarks: a couple of blocks from the wharf, away from the bustle but very convenient for streetcars, buses and restuarants etc.

review.title: Grandma goes to SF
review.reviewText: There was maintenance going on (painting) but the staff was more than friendly and I thought the location was great. A good value and if I go back to SF I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Just a two block walk to the water and right near Boudin Sourdough bread. You could smell the bread baking just a block away.

review.title: Spring Break at the Tuscan Inn
review.reviewText: Apparently, we booked right when the hotel was renovating it's front desk and lobby area. This was only a minor inconvenience and the staff went out of their way to make the best of the situation. A very pleasant stay, overall.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the hotel staff.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of fine restaurants and the attractions of Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Not Kimpton
review.reviewText: Very old rooms. Not Kimpton quality. Offered an upgrade and the room was tiny and basic, nothing special.
review.negativeRemarks: Room, no amenities that we could see I.e. gift shop, bar, coffee shop.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Worth staying here again and again
review.reviewText:
Although the hotel was undergoing renovations, the staff was easily accessable and there
was a minimum of problems.
The concierge was most helpful and was able to assist us in all our neesl
The restaurant adjoining the hotel is outstanding. We ate there three times during our
7 day stay.
We have stayed at this hotel before and found it convenient, quiet and pleasant.
I recommend it highly.
review.negativeRemarks: Easy to walk to many locations and transportation
review.locationRemarks:
DConvenient to transportation, the wharf, shopping, grocery store, drug store and
restaurants

review.title: Not Good Under Construction
review.reviewText: We were not told this hotel was under construction and the hotel tried to make it safe, I would not have stayed there if we had known... We had two rooms and one of them, the large window did not have a screen and it was a long one and someone could have accidently fell out....
review.negativeRemarks: Construction.....and the fruit was very old that sat out
review.locationRemarks: Very good location

review.title: Great for a weekend getaway
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was under construction during my visit and the elevator service was limited. Fortunately, we had no problems using the stairs. This is probably the nicest Best Western I've stayed in. Great location, easy access from the airport on Bart and the trolley system. Walking distance to the Wharf. Staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the wharf and attractions.

review.title: TWO STOPS EACH YEAR 2006 - 2012
review.reviewText: At time of stoppng repairs to reception were ongoing,but service unimpaired.
review.negativeRemarks: Separate restaurant (Pescatore) rather expensive compared to local alternatives.
review.locationRemarks: The best for class of hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.Also for transportation.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Renovation in the lobby was a little weird and it didn't have the big hotel feel I'm used to, but the staff was super friendly, efficient, and the rooms were kept clean. Requests were fulfilled the first time we asked. No complaints and you can't beat the location if you want near transportation and the wharf.

review.title: Careful before booking
review.reviewText:
Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Front lobby was undergoing renovation and there was not enough signage to inform people that the wine at 5;00 was still on but located in a separate area altogether.

Big problem ...very intermittent hot water for showers and bath. We gor very wet and cold on a rainy day and when were both looking forward to a hot bath ..but guess what? No hot water!!! Also 2 out of four days ... not hot water in the morning for showers! Not good.
review.negativeRemarks: No hot water
review.locationRemarks: Quite good ...close to Fisherman's warf and trolleys

review.title: Loud
review.reviewText: It was nice but they had construction and it was loud
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great location, friendly accommodating staff
review.reviewText: Stayed here just one night on a trip through San Francisco. They let us check into our room at 10:30 am since we were there and they had a room available. within walking distance to the Wharf and North Beach, where we discovered some great restaurants. Chinatown is also within walking distance if you are feeling ambitious. Hotel staff was very friendly, brought hot chocolate up to the room for the kids. Room clean, very nice, recently remodeled. Valet even took us down to our car when we needed our umbrellas.

review.title: Would recommend to anyone
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, 2 minutes from Fishermans Wharf. When we went there was free coffee (available to go) and a Wine Reception in the afternoon. The staff were great, friendly and attentive. The attached Cafe was equally as nice and value for money. Was being renovated as we left so can't wait to go back and see it!

review.title: Great, pet friendly hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great time. We have a large dog and wanted to bring her with us. It worked out great for all of us. The staff gave her lots of attention and we felt right at home having her with us. The hotel is well situated near lots of great restaurants, walking/running areas and the water. The price was very reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: A lobby remodel started as we were leaving - not too much of an impact to us though

review.title: great room
review.reviewText: Room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Corridors a bit dull and uninspiring but some renovation was underway. Lobby staff very helpful.

review.title: Cosy room
review.reviewText: The room had a nice feel about it although it was quite small. The bed was large and really comfortable. The bathroom was well equipped and well lit. The heater/air conditioning unit was noisy. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The location was good too. Overall the hotel was in need of a facelift in the corridors and main areas. I would probably stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks:
Cosy room
Large comfortable bed
Friendly and helpful staff
Good location
review.negativeRemarks:
Noisy heater/air conditioning unit
Poor view
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and the North Beach area. Bit too far to walk into the centre of San Francisco (45 mins)

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and convenient to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf. The staff were friendly and helped us with any questions we had about the area.

review.title: Ticks all the boxes
review.reviewText: Great location near Fishermans Wharf, plenty of space in room with large LCD TV, comfy bed fridge and safe. Could walk from Cruise ship terminal (was quicker than waiting for a taxi). Room was ready early which was great as had tour to Alcatraz that morning. Adjacent to Safeway and Ross for shopping and a block from cable cars. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Wonderful Stay at this Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location on Fisherman's Wharf - it was nice to be out of the city centre with the major attractions still within walking distance. The room was very nice and really clean. I had a great stay here, and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. The staff were also very helpful and attentive. There is not a bad thing I can say about this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing - Would be nice if breakfast was included.
review.locationRemarks: Amazing - Close to everything.

review.title: Worth staying here
review.reviewText: Great hotel and close to Fisherman's Wharf! The Italian restaurant is GREAT-food, drinks and staff!!
review.positiveRemarks: Italian restaurant, complimentary coffee and wine in the hotel lobby
review.negativeRemarks: room size-very small
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Convienent location and Clean!
review.reviewText: The hotel is awesome! It was only 2 blocks away from the Pier, around the corner from the Trolly Station, and the Bus Stop. as soon as you walk in the doors you are greeted, and the hotel it's self was clean and warm. They provide a very clear map that was used to get around the city, Very quite and peaceful and the Beds are clean and Comfortable, Bathrooms are well and they are stocked up with Toiletries. They offered a City guide in the rooms too. I would def stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: within Blocks of Every Attraction!

review.title: Short stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the location and atmosphere of the hotel. Quite charming. Rooms are a little on the small side but all the amenities are there. Beautifully decorated and great, helpful staff. One block from Fisherman's Wharf. Would stay here again.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Checking in and out was fast since there were no lines. The bed was comfortable but there were green stains on the comforter. The pillows were too high for my liking. The bathroom is small and the toilet paper was a backward reach for me. The toilet required holding down the handle during flushing. The in room safe can fit small laptops and the Wi-Fi was fast. We stayed in an interior courtyard facing room and it was quiet. The hotel is in a convenient location close to many restaurants and shops. Pier 39 is just blocks away where we enjoyed viewing the sea lions. We parked at the shopping center across the street on Mason since we don't like to valet our car (and it's cheaper).
review.negativeRemarks: Room's bathroom

review.title: Comfortable and convenient hotel to stay.
review.reviewText: I felt comfortable staying at this hotel. I've visited San Francisco 2 times and stayed at this hotel most of the time.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. They answered all our questions and made suggestions about where to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: The free wine was a nice touch. We had a room facing the courtyard and it was very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel does not provide service to and from the airport. There is no free breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Everything in Fisherman's Wharf was an easy walk from here.The bus/light rail stops were close.The beds were very comfortable and had lots of pillows.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: I was worried when I first walked in because they have construction in the lobby. It was unwarranted. There was no noise or disruption at all during the stay. And....we weathered a 4.0 earthquake with no damage! Excellent location and service. The free wine from 5-6pm is also a fun draw.

review.title: Fabulous location!
review.reviewText: Fabulous location--walking distance to EVERYTHING we wanted to do. Had a lovely view of Coit Tower from the window.

review.title: Overall excellent hotel.
review.reviewText:
Very satisfactory! The quality of a Best Western hotel depends so much on the attitude and expertise of the owner; this one is terrific! They are remodeling the rooms; I got one newly redone: very attractive decor, comfortable bed and furniture. Very helpful and cheerful staff. Within 3 blocks of Fisherman's Wharf and a block to a Safeway market.

If only they had the option of down pillows... theirs are in the category of polyfill balls.

I did not have a car, but heard some folk muttering at the overnight garage charge of $35... sounds excessively high to me. You really don't need a car in that area. There are buses and cable cars, and its very walkable.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows!
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for Fisherman's Wharf, yet away from the milling crowds.

review.title: nice hotel friendly staff
review.reviewText: nice hotel, friendly staff. saw a cockroach in the bathroom but it's san francisco. a blood stain on the bed skirt, but they are remodling and very nice people.i think it could have been slightly cheaper, but once again it is by the warf and a very short walk to all the sights. i would stay there again...
review.negativeRemarks: the slight cleanliness issues
review.locationRemarks: very good if you want to hang out on the warf and pier all day

review.title: The wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was a wonderful experience. We came from out of town and had a wonderful experience.

review.title: Tuscan was great.
review.reviewText:
Hotel was very nice. Close to local transit and the Wharf.
Coffee in the morning in the lobby was great....the coffee was really good.
No complaints!
review.positiveRemarks: The nice hot coffee in the morning in the lobby!
review.locationRemarks: Location was fantastic. Very close to the wharf, the transist .

review.title: Tuscan Inn
review.reviewText: The hotel is comfortable. It's right near fisherman's wharf, if that is what you are looking for. Parking is expensive, but that is typical for the area.

review.title: Good location, clean, but beds are stiff
review.reviewText: Good location, use parking lot across the street for lower fee. Room was clean and quite. The beds are a bit stiff for my taste though.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed wasn't too comfortable
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the pier

review.title: Pretty... pretty good.
review.reviewText: The atmosphere and cleanliness of the hotel were top notch, but more than anything the friendliness and hospitality of the staff was above my expectations.

review.title: Love this Hotel
review.reviewText:
Great Location. Great Hotel.
We got a little bit of street noise, from trucks at about 6am .
Mostly, it was fairly quiet.
Regardless of this,I would stay here again.
We ate in the restaurant a couple times.
review.positiveRemarks:
Easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf.
The Staff were helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Little bit of early morning truck noise.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Business trip to San Fran
review.reviewText: I had a great stay. It was very accommodating and so were the staff and location. The room was great except that hot water was limited for some reason when showering or it would have been 5's across the board. Overall it was a great value and I look forward to staying there on my next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText:
Great location. Easy to walk around Fisherman's Wharf and easy to take Cable car or even drive to Union Square.
Parking lot is very expensive - the only negative problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Price of parking lot
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Easy to walk around Fisherman's Wharf and easy to take Cable car or even drive to Union Square.

review.title: Family stay at Tuscan Inn a little dissaopointing
review.reviewText:
Exceedingly helpful concierge did help make our SF break great fun.

Hotel itself was a bit of a dissapointment... small rooms, small beds, tired decor, stale smoke smell.
On the upside, they have renovations underway. I know, because the hammer drills woke me up!
The attached resteraunt looked nice, but the food didn't live up to the appearances. Overpriced for what you get.

Great idea to have some free drinks in the evening - which would have been an oportunity to showcase their resteraunt (if possible).
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, and close to all the action of Fisherman's wharf + a short tram ride to the centre of town.
review.negativeRemarks: Tired decor and rooms
review.locationRemarks: excellent, central location. Plenty of homeless to entertain the kids.

review.title: In for a night
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Everything we wanted was within walking distance. The rooms were small but very comfortable and clean. Bed was very comfortable. All staff members we conversed with were friendly and helpful. For the price could not be beat in relation to surrounding accomodations. The complaints about parking (both the price of $42 and hassle of valet only) were worth it for us considering we walked to everything. Would indeed stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and easy access to wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room
review.locationRemarks: Easy in / out and again access to wharf

review.title: Excellent for a weekend to enjoy San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable, friendly staff, excellent location one block to Fisherman's Wharf and close to main attractions.

review.title: Not a good hotel
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel after checking it out on web site, the room did not look anything like what was described. The parking was also way to expensive and room was very small for price paid. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room and cost of parking.

review.title: Excellent hotel for visitors
review.reviewText: the wireless access is good, the valet parking efficient but not cheap. The double bed room lacks one foot in width. The location is perfect for visiting the bay and Columbus street or Chinatown, using the famous cable car or short walk.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to all visitors attractions. Concierge,
review.negativeRemarks: Car parking
review.locationRemarks: great for tourist

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText:
Small cozy hotel. Location was great. We were able to walk everywhere. Safe area. Rooms were small but had everything we needed. Staff was always very helpful.

The only problem was the cost of the mandatory valet parking-$42 per night PLUS a $6 parking tax/fee? per night. Somehow I didn't notice this during the booking process.
review.positiveRemarks: Small and cozy feeling with a great all around staff
review.negativeRemarks: Mandatory Expensive Valet Parking
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Not the best place to stay.
review.reviewText: The room was clean, and the hotel was in great quality. My only beef is that when I went to get back into my room (room 238 located next to one of the maids storage areas) there were two maids talking and they saw me coming with multiple bags and coffee in both hands. They had there huge bin in the middle of the walk way. I tried squeezing around the bin and all they did was look at me. I couldnt get through so I put both my coffees on the ground and moved the bin. They continued talking, not once to help. After I moved the bins I picked up my coffee and went into my room which was right next door. That was the only beef I had about the place. Everyone at the front desk was amazing, and all the other staff were nice. I would not stay here again, which is unfortunate because I stay in SanFran all the time.
review.negativeRemarks: Rude service of the house keepers.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for tourists.
review.userLocation: Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, CA, USA

review.title: Good location; serviceable hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located within easy walking distance to all of the attractions around Fisherman's Wharf and a slightly long, but doable, walk to Union Square and Chinatown. The hotel's location was perfect for us and we never had any qualms about the neighborhood.

The staff upon check-in were quite abrupt and the doorman during the day was also a little rude. Housekeeping was very good though and the rooms were very clean and enjoyable. In all honesty though, the negatives of this hotel were only minor inconveniences to us as we set out for long days exploring this wonderful city.

review.title: Nice accomodations for a reasonable price
review.reviewText: I would recomend this hotel for families or for the business traveler on a budget
review.positiveRemarks: being close to Fishermans has benefits and the cost was reasonable
review.negativeRemarks: very touristy---location
review.locationRemarks: distance from Union Square

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText:
First of all, hands down fantastic location to be in to experience San Francisco! Only minutes walk from the Pier (where all the action is); yet still accessible to other areasapproximately 20 minutes away or a quick cable train ride. Fisherman's Wharf has fantastic seafood, and something you mustnt miss (it may sound silly) is the clam chowder- YUM! Also, super close to the Alcatraz tour and plenty of bike rentals to cross the Golden Gate.

The place was quaint- which I loved. Spacious room and kept very tidy. Only downside to room service was on our first day, people came in on 3 separate occassion to fix/change things in the room (should of been done all together). But this only did happen once.. Service overall was what I would call 'meh'. Staff didn't attempt to help nor were they rude. For us it wasnt a big deal- we preferred to be left alone.

Overall, I cant wait to go back to experience the city more!
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Chinatown and find a small alley called 'Ross'. There is a tiny store which sells fortune cookies. Best kept secret ever! It is a MUST!

review.title: Best price for a perfect location
review.reviewText: Had to wait 20 minutes in line to check in. The front desk was severely understaffed. Great location and excellent value.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, modern. Valet parking is efficient and friendly, albeit quite expensive. The afternoon wine pour provided is for 2 buck chuck (charles shaw wine) but they allowed us to take the glasses to our room so it wasn't bad. Rooms are spacious and decently furnished. Bathroom is large and quite accommodating We had a window into the courtyard so no view, but I assume some rooms have some sort of view. The restaurant (Cafe Pescatore) was quite good for lunch and I'd assume most other meals. Very close to the wharf and a safeway is right around the corner if you want to pick up snacks or drinks. I plan on staying here again.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised in 'Frisco'.
review.reviewText: I've travelled a lot, both on business and for pleasure. For business trips I've stayed at several Best Western Hotels and have always been satisfied. For personal and vacation travel, I stay at higher end hotels. Since we booked our hotel stay kind of "last minute" this trip, I wasn't left with many choices. I was wary to book a pleasure trip at a Best Western, but I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was great and the hotel was fine, for the price. It may not be "high end" but I would definitely stay there again. Hotel was clean and I booked two rooms; a King with a sofa sleeper (our older "kids") and a Queen for my wife and I. Both rooms were adequate in size. The only negative (if you want to call it that), was that all Best Westerns I've stayed at always have a Continental breakfast and this Hotel only had coffee and tea in the mornings, but it was not that big of a deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, pleasant staff and cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: No Continental Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Great location at Fisherman's Wharf. Close to everything at the Wharf and very close to Cable Car and Bus pick up.

review.title: Great Time for a Short Stay
review.reviewText:
My wife and I are frequent single-night visitors to SF where our son goes to school and generally go for utilitarian lodging. This means we go for value and stay away from tourist zones. The Tuscan Inn proved to be an excellent departure. The staff were incredibly cheerful, helpful and welcoming. The room was quiet and perfectly appointed for our needs. We loved the idea of the free wine social, but couldn't stay though the crowd seemed very convivial. The location near Fisherman's wharf should please most tourists, but we most enjoyed exploring Telegraph Hill, Coit Tower and North beach which are also nearby.

Other things: I was impressed that dogs can stay free -- something we may consider at another trip. I also appreciated that the hotel chain supports the Trust for Public Land.

The main disappointment was the cost of parking ($50 when gratuity is factored in) which was not mentioned in the website and added significantly to the one-night stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice room, friendly, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking was expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great spot to explore the wharf, Telegraph Hill, Coit Tower, North Beach..

review.title: Comfortable but dated
review.reviewText: Staff was courteous and helpful. Hotel room was clean but furnishings were clearly dated.

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: Hotel is within walking distance of the wharf. It's close to F Trolley and cable cars. Room was clean and updated.Maybe we're spoiled but we expected a little larger room. It was cozy with our luggage and 3 adults. Staff was very helpful with all of our questions.Ice machine location is not clearly marked so we had to wander a bit. It was a good place to sleep with comfortable beds so we would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to wharf and bus lines. Clean room and bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit small for 2 full sized beds and 3 people.
review.locationRemarks: It was about two blocks off the wharf, close to many restaurants and the bus lines.

review.title: Great place to stay..and pet friendly.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay and the location is great. It was a walking distance to Pier 39. My 9 year old son was not a fan of walking so he was very happy. I like their afternoon wine tasting and OJ for kids.. what a surprise. We did not bring out pet but I saw other families brought theirs.

review.title: Safe bet with this hotel.
review.reviewText: Good hotel, nice location, nothing to complain about ... it's not 5 star, but nor is it "iffy" or a "bad experience".

review.title: Mini vacation
review.reviewText: Good location fair pricing, parking is expensive but it is SF after all. Staff was very nice and helpful. The concierge was very knowledgeable.

review.title: Very close to fishermans warft and ok.
review.reviewText: Everythink was fine, just the waiter at breakfast was a bit unfriendly.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: For a relaxing time in a convenient location, easy access to wherever you want to go at a fair price this is one of the best values. We have stayed at a number of hotels in SF at the Wharf and Embarcadero. You can go and return and go again as part of any SF plan. We love SF and we will come back to the Tuscan again...often. Thank you to the Tuscan and its employees.
review.locationRemarks: The city is great, the more time you can spend the more wonderful adventures you will have. Walk Columbus (North Beach), see China Town, Tour the Wharf, and don't miss the DeYoung Museum (and their Cafe). Also, walking (tough if you have an infant) from the Palace of Fine arts area to the Disney Family Museum (carefully plan your transportation to an from and expect to spend 3 hours it is great). The Saturday morning Farmers market at the Ferry Plaza Clock Tower Building at the Embarcadero is not to miss. You can pick up breakfast and a portable lunch to take wherever you want to go (bring a bag to carry the stuff you will want to get several items as there is a lot to pick from for food). Wishing you a great time. The MD family.

review.title: Would definitely return to this hotel
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our stay at the Tuscan Inn. The hotel is located in a very convenient, safe area, and is approximately two blocks from the Fishermen's Wharf area. The hotel staff were very accomodating and knowledgeable about the area. We would definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Trip was super
review.reviewText: First trip to the Fishermans Wharf. Super location will return for sure

review.title: San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: Great location, staff was great would return again

review.title: great hotel & friendly
review.reviewText: could not have made a better choice all staff were great

review.title: great location - decent rooms
review.reviewText: This place doesn't have frills in the rooms, but its comfortable and located close to fishermans wharf.

review.title: Great Location .... Terrible noise
review.reviewText: Hotel is great overall, location, clean and service. However the windows are too thin and you get terrible traffic noise throu out the night including an alarm from the Safeway parking lot whenever a car exits. Its terrible. Our window didnt shut properly so it was even worse. If you can sleep through that then this hotel is great, if not you will be frusturated and sleepless.
review.locationRemarks: Fish Warf , Market and downtown

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel was great. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable and close to everthing at Fishermans Wharf. The happy hour was much appreciated.

review.title: Charming Hotel. Great location
review.reviewText:
Was impressed with this hotel. The staff went above and beyond on any request. Cannot recommend the restaurant attached to the hotel. Ate breakfast there and it was overpriced and below average. The room was small but very clean and attractive.

Will definitely stay there again if we're back in San Francisco.

review.title: Love this place. Will definitely be back
review.reviewText: Great hotel! The rooms are small but very comfy. The staff were completely welcoming and helpful! Close to Fisherman's Wharf & Telegraph Hill, and right next to public transit and bike rentals. The wine reception every evening was fun. No doubt I'll be back, and I'll recommend this place to anyone who asks.
review.locationRemarks: We walked everywhere. Just start walking and see where the route takes you. Loved the Castro and Haight-Ashbury neighborhoods, but don't limit yourself to the usual tourist areas.

review.title: Lovely hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: I can't wait to go back in April and run the other half marathon!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay there. Great location, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Parking is expensive. We will use this hotel again.

review.title: Great Hotel - forget the restaurant
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel stay, very comfortable, cleanliness especially excellent, warm and inviting atmosphere, very helpful hotel reception, wonderfully decorated room ... don't bother having anything but breakfast at the attached restaurant, especially dinner, you can do much better down on the wharf area or other areas of SF.

review.title: Comfortable, clean and great location!
review.reviewText: We found the hotel was in a great location and easy to walk to everything we were interested in and easy access to transportation. The staff were great! The wine reception was well attended and the wine selection was great. The room was clean and we loved the decor - the bed was really comfortable. There is a wonderful restaurant attached to the hotel - fantastic meal there! We would definitely go back and would recommend this place to our friends. The rooms may be considered a bit small for some people, but it met our needs for sure.
review.locationRemarks: We only had a few days in San Francisco so we centered our attention on the Fisherman's Wharf area. We found this met our needs for sure - we took an excursion to Muir Woods from the Wharf, caught the boat to Alcatraz from there. We could see Oakland, Marin County and the Golden Gate Bridge and Bay Bridge from the esplanade along Fisherman's Wharf. Lots of places to eat and easy to get around. As well, we caught the famous Street Car a short distance from our hotel - everything was within a reasonable walking distance to get to what you wanted. Lots of great places to eat too!

review.title: Great Place to stay!!!
review.reviewText: Hotel was located where access was easy, Staff was friendly and warm, room was clean and bed wonderful place to rest. Close to attractions, would stay there again, and again!!

review.title: Would definitely return!
review.reviewText: We had a great Mother/Daughter stay at the Tuscan Inn. We just wish there was a coffeemaker in the room and free use of the refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: A nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to Pier 39.Staff were friendly & the wine tasting each night was a good way to meet people.

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: Highly recommend The Franciscan for quality meals at a reasonable price
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText:
Very friendly hotel with a European flair and separate of San Francisco’s high rise jungle and congested traffic.
Excellent hotel for seasoned travellers seeking to get away from five star hotel fluff to enjoy a few days of relaxation in the SFO bay area and surroundings or conduct business.
Location offers fast and cost effective access to and from SFO airport with hotel limo service, and to public transportation, tour buses and boat cruises, as well as shopping with just short walks.
Morning coffee or tea, the evening wine reception and the information desk, all in the distinctively furnished lobby, are exceptional.

review.title: Terrific Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We just stayed here for 4 days on vacation. Wonderful hotel, thoroughly enjoyed it. Great location, minutes walk from most of the Fisherman's Wharf entertainment and convenient to other attractions. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, particularly Ed, the general manager. They also have a concierge who can help you with just about anything. Room was nice and well appointed, though in truth, we we out most of the time. Also, the free wine social and mixer every day at 5pm was a great idea and a great way to meet other travelers from all across the globe who were also staying there and with whom we were able to exchange ideas and tips on best things to do for your stay. All in all, had a terrific time! thank you!

review.title: Ideal Location
review.reviewText: A really nice hotel in a great location. We only had a couple of days to see San Francisco and being located right on Fisherman's Wharf was ideal.. All the staff we encounted were very helpful and the idea of a free wine tasting every evening at 5.00pm was a perfect wind down from a day packed with sightseeing. The bedroom wasn't large and the wardrobe was quite small but otherwise it had everything we needed - including free wifi. We were even told at check in to move any thing out of the fridge to make room for our own stuff and told where the nearby supermarket was to buy supplies. Our room was at the back with no view but after initial dissappointment realised that it was probably the best place to be for peace and quiet when you're right in the centre of a major tourist area.

review.title: Very Enjoyable !!! Great Location near the Wharf..
review.reviewText: Loved the room, it was a little small but very clean and well organized. Hotel staff was very helpful.

review.title: Aussie Recommendation
review.reviewText: Good location and easy access to transport.

review.title: worst experience, don"t do it
review.reviewText: I have never had such a small room in the states(maybe europe). valet parking damaged the car. I would never stay there again.

review.title: Loved the 5 pm wine gathering in the Lobby
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff. It was nice to be offered a glass of wine at 5 pm in the lobby and meet other guests.

review.title: Great hotel, location , and value!
review.reviewText: Spent considerable time evaluating online reviews of hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area before selecting the Tuscan Inn. We were not disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and well appointed, and the location was terrific. We were just two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and about four blocks from Pier 39. The hotel was also convenient to all public transportation and we were able to visit other areas of San Francisco with ease. Would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a vacation/visit to San Francisco.

review.title: A bit like home
review.reviewText:
Stayed here with my mother recently. The hotel was really comfortable and homely. Conveniently located close to Fishermans wharf and cable cars. I would recommend it for families or older travellers looking for somewhere comfortable to stay away from the business of Union Square. Wine reception daily was a great idea too.
Only criticism was the room smelt a bit musty/damp, but the rooms were comfortable and more than adequate for our needs.

review.title: Had all that I needed
review.reviewText:
We recently spent 3 nights at Best Western Tuscan Plus, we couldnt fault the service or condition of our room. The staff were helpful and plesant room was clean.
We found the location great easy access to resturants sightseeing, tours and shops.
Would recommend at any time.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Good hotel, walking distance to lots of attractions, clean, safe.

review.title: can't complain...
review.reviewText: Room was small and the hotel decoration is dated. Hotel staff were helpful and courteous. The location was excellent!!! you can walk to and from the fisherman's wharf and the surrounding pier. Hotel was also close to nearby affordable restaurants like IHOP and Denny's and the best of all it was just across Safeway, so you can buy some grocery items like water, bread and snacks that the hotel would charge you double if you use the bar or order room service. The bus stop is just on the other side of the street so buying a city pass, 3-day pass or 7 day pass is well worth it as u can use it in any city transportation except for the bart. We always take the cable car which is just one block from our hotel when we go back and fort from our hotel to downtown.

review.title: Well worth it
review.reviewText: Quaint hotel. Staff always very personable and willing to help with anything. Location great to Fisherman's Wharf. No bar or restaurant immediately in hotel but next door. Complimentary wine each evening very nice. Met some nice couples during that time.

review.title: We will be back!!!!
review.reviewText:
This is a quaint hotel with lots of character....making you feel right at home even making sure your pets are comfortable they have a bowl put out with doggie treats - a very nice touch.
Every evenning they serve wine in the reception area where you can mingle with other guests and again feel at home.
Location is excellent close to everything you could possibly want to do.
We travel quite frequently and I have to say this has been one of my favourites. Just a very relaxing - welcoming feeling.
WE LOVED IT

review.title: Only Two Small Problems
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the service, and cleanliness of the hotel, but was surprised to learn there were so few channels to select from. It seemed the TV was adjusted to promote the pay movies/events with very few other choices. Disappointing. Further, the wording regarding leaving a card on the door handle to not clean up our room was somewhat vague. Otherwise we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel.

review.title: If you don't mind paying for location.
review.reviewText: This hotel in almost any other town would be a $49.99 a night hotel. What you pay for is the location which honestly is great! One this to point out that I missed on other review is that the hotel only has 1 parking option and that is valet which costs $50 a night after tax.
