The hotel itself is nothing to write home about, the room is beautiful looking except very small and the bed we had was very old and not comfortable at all and the shower made a horrible screeching noise that im pretty sure woke out neighbors up. With all that being said it was the least expensive hotel I could find that close to the wharf. There are tons or restaurants around (Id recommend Hot Spud if you love potatos they are AMAZING),the staff was friendly and they offer a wine reception at 5:00. All in all you want to be close to the wharf your gonna have to pay for it just dont expect much and you wont be dissapointed.

review.title: First Visit to SF
review.reviewText: The hotel and room are quaint, but a little outdated. The hotel staff are accommodating and willing to provide advice on places to see. It's in a great location, but parking is OUTRAGEOUS.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco, maybe in USA! Friendly, good maintenance, clean excellent Managed!
review.reviewText:
I can not belive that in those times a Hotel is so good an custommer related.
We are Germans and live in Dubai where we have the biggest concentration of 5 Star Hotels. Every Hotel out of Dubai is mostly a disapointment for us as the standart is always lower. So was The Palace- Sheraton on Market Street last year. JUst by coincedence I booked the Tuscan and I was suppriced how good they were. The Hotel is excellent Managed. It is cozy and profesional. They made us feel good. For me this Hotel is a Promotion for the Best Western Group. When I go back to San Francisco I will always take the Tuscan Best Western and from now on I will check Best Western Hotels where ever I go.

I thank the Genetral Manager from this Hotel for doing what her did, he takes his Job serious and the Hotel Guest has nothing to complain!

review.title: A FINE PLACE TO STAY
review.reviewText:
Best Western Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf is a fine piece of lodging. It is clean, comfortable, accessible and reliable. The staff is well trained and friendly. Evening wine receptions and free coffee/tea setups each day add to the overall experience. The parking is steep but the valet service is so worth it.

The Inn could stand a few upgrades. I expect they are coming soon -- flat-screen TVs, better radios. The WiFi worked flawlessly and well and is free.

No better location for a San Francisco tourism experience, and well worth the price.

review.title: Great experience.
review.reviewText: We had a very nice four day stand. In addition, at the end I inadvertently left a box of jewelry in my room when checking out. The hotel staff returned it to me by overnight Fed Ex and nothing was lost or damaged. I think these folks are great.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with great location, cozy rooms, chimney in the lobby, free coffee in the mornings and wine in the afternoons!

review.title: Convenient Location - pleasant hotel which was close to Fisherman's Wharf .
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. It was close to Fisherman's Wharf and the cable cars into downtown. The hotel is of an older style and the room was comfortable with a pleasant outlook over a courtyard garden. However there was probably some rejuvenation of the decor required, and we were asked to recommend what we thought should be done to the rooms on this occasion so we understand they are about to refurbish. This would be very worthwhile although the room was quite adequate and comfortable even so. The bathroom ensuite appeared to have been updated more recently. The hotel offered complementary coffee/tea every morning in the lobby and wine/drinks in the evening also in the lobby. This was a nice touch, but did make the lobby somewhat crowded when we were there. A nice touch is the log fire in the lobby - staff on reception and the consierge were all most helpful. Would recommend this hotel as a convenient stop in beautiful San Francisco.

review.title: Great location good price clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: Would stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Great Place To Stay In San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel 2 blocks from the hustle and bustle of Fisherman's Wharf, conviently located one black from the Trolly trains and right next to the bus lines, as well as close convenience shopping: 7-11, Safeway, Walgreens and a neat organic store called Trader Joes all within a block.
Hotel is comfortable, a bit old, but the service was first rate. Check in, Concierge, and maid service was top notch, I would defiantly stay there again.

review.title: Close to main attractions in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is very close to the big attractions like Pier 39 at Fisherman's Wharf, and served us very well. It was noisy at night from street noise (can't do anything about that), but apart from that no complaints. There was no breakfast, pool, etc...but we knew that when we booked and did not want those amenities. If you are travelling here you won't need those things anyways. Great value for location, if we visit SF again, we'll stay in the same hotel.

review.title: Best Western Tuscany - Great Location, Tiny Room
review.reviewText:
We chose the Best Western Tuscany for its location, as we planned a "touristy" stay, including the Alcatraz tour and a North Beach dinner. As a native of San Francisco, I knew the neighborhood and wanted to steer clear of anything on Lombard Street, where experience has shown that the hotels are a bit run down.
Service was good, the lobby a bit small and crowded, with many guests lounginh there, so seats are hard to find. Our room was on the first floor, up a few steps from the lobby. It was tiny for a family of four, with barely room to walk around the beds. The refrigerator must have been an "honor bar" as it was locked, so we had nowhere to chill our beverages. The street noise, even on early Sunday morning, was quite obnoxious, with garbage trucks and honking horns at a very early hour. If you decide to stay here, I recommend requesting a room on the upermost floors to avoid the noise. Overall, a decent and clean hotel in a convenient location, but quite expensive (including $40 for parking) for a minimal accomodation. Next time we will try the Sheraton, hoping for a little more "elbow room".

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a great location for access to Fisherman's Wharf and surrounding areas. It is 1 block from the docks. The hotel has a lovely wine reception in the afternoons. The attached restaurant is very good.
My only concern was our request for adjoining rooms was not accommodated. We were told they had no adjoining rooms in the hotel. But what they meant was they had none available. Our request was made more than 9 months in advance to accommodate a wheelchair bound parent. Going between rooms using hallway doors was very cumbersome and disconcerting. Otherwise our stay was most enjoyable and we would return again.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText:
The convenient location of Tuscan Inn to Fisherman's Wharf and piers for special cruises is a real asset.

The room was clean, although a bit small (single, queen bed). The free wi-fi was a definite factor in choosing this hotel for us.

The only issue we had was in some of the instructions in the room, which should be updated. Examples: the room instruction said we didn't need a password for wi-fi, but we did. The ice and vending machine arrows were confusing. I had to call the front desk. Once they told me to look for slatted doors and follow the hum, I finally found it. We also had a phone message, so we punched the "message retrieval" button on the phone, but when it didn't get to our message, the front desk told us to call 700. So they need to make sure the directions/instructions are updated/corrected.

The hotel restaurant is expensive. We found a wonderful place for breakfast and lunch at a reasonable rate at the Hollywood Cafe not a half block away.

Would we stay here again? Absolutely.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Easy access to all the sites at Fisherman's Wharf...rooms are small though for a group of 4

review.title: Good Wharf area hotel
review.reviewText: Close to eatiing establishments, cable car turn-around, tourist shopping, & in a nice area. The hotel restaurant served great breakfasts & the service was very efficient. We ate our other meals with family. The only drawback was that we were unable to open the window for fresh air because of the room location. The service was efficient & courteous as was the personnal at the front desk & they were very helpful with driving directions. We would consider returning there on a future visit. Thank you.

review.title: Expensive,run down,parking rates ridiculous, not a fan!
review.reviewText: My wife and I finished our Northern California trip in San Francisco end of July, staying at The Best Western-Tuscan Inn. We were given a handicapped bathroom that smelled, room was small approximately 12 x 14, if you sat in a chair next to the bed you would have to use the queen bed as an ottoman. Mirrors were placed on one wall to make the room appear larger. Decor was 80's at best! Parking rates were jacked up for the summer tourist season, your only choice aside from feeding the meters was valet @$45.00 per day! I was prepared to pay $25.00 because that the rate that was published online or in our tour book. But we were shocked at the $45.00 per day rate. I complained they reduced it to $40.00 but when I received the bill at checkout with additional fees it was almost $50.00 per night. Will not stay here again, and if this is a 4 star best of the Best Western chain will not use them in the future.

review.title: Good value on the Wharf
review.reviewText: Pros: This was a good value centerally located on the Wharf. Nice but small rooms. Cons: Little or no view in most rooms. Wine reception served 2 Buck Chuck.

review.title: We would stay there again!
review.reviewText: We very much enjoyed our stay the the Best Western Tuscan Inn Fishermans Wharf. It was within walking distance of Fishermans Wharf. The room was small but for 2 of us we managed fine. We aren't wine drinkers but for those who are, the wine tasting was great. We would definately stay there again.

review.title: A hidden treasure in the heart of Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was so european in its decor, charming lobby, tea/coffee service and ambience. I'd recommend it highly.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText:
Location, location, location! Can't beat it!
Loved the hotel. The location was fantastice, the room great (only complaint was we wanted 2 beds and all there was was a King size bed). The hotel had a daily wine reception that we enjoyed and the lobby/ lounge area was very warm and inviting.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The Tuscan Inn is located in a tourist friendly place, near lots of San Fran's attractions. It's just two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf (about 1/2 mile walk to Pier 33 where you catch the ferry to Alcatraz) 2-3 blocks from Ghirardelli candy factory, and both the Hyde St and the Powell & Mason St. cable car stops. We did not have a car and either walked or used MUNI to get around.
Both North Beach and Chinatown neighborhoods are in a reasonable walking distance and we were near enough to walk to Crooked St too.
We were in town to go to AT & T ballpark and it was just one MUNI bus ride away-- very easy to get to.

The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, telling us how to get to different places and use the MUNI and BART systems. We did eat one evening at the hotel restaurant, a VERY nice Italian restaurant, but usually we ate out wherever we were. There is also a Safeway and Trader Joe's just a block away ---we didn't realize that until our last day--- where you can stock up on snacks, beverages, water etc.

The rooms are on the small size, but were clean and attractive. The hotel has free wine sampling nightly from 5- 6 in the lobby. I would recommend this place to anyone coming to sightsee etc.---probably not ideal for families since there isn't a pool. There is parking, but again ,we didn't use it so I can't comment on the prices etc.

review.title: Best Western Tuscan Inn San Francisco
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful overnight stay at this hotel. Very accomodating & friendly staff. Room was delightful nicely decorated & comfortable. The wine reception was great to enjoy got to meet a traveling couple from England with their two sweet kids. Nice conversation great way to socialize too. Staff were accomodating at this event came around to refill guests glasses as they enjoyed relaxing. Great location a few blocks from Wharf & Pier 39. Access to bus lines to go into other parts of San Francisco. Walking distance to restaurants, stores, Pier and just to enjoy the sites. Definetely would recommend going to this hotel & looking forward to going back again!

review.title: WILL BE GOING BACK!!
review.reviewText: I love San Fransisco and plan to return over the next few years.

review.title: Not the same standards as place I stayed last year..very disappointing....
review.reviewText:
No more complimentary biscotti- only coffee
Happy hour "hor deurves/pizza" samples inferior and not refilled...never did get any :(
Wine was the same
No lotions in room
Bed was extremely uncomfortable...

We were not picked up by bellhop on time/had to call 4 times only to find out he was busy helping others...had to take my luggage myself...
Recommended taxi had to stop for air in his tires and then stopped behind a bus in front of doorways to airport
We ended up last in line for our flight due to time lost and one suitcase got left behind due to "late check in"
Disappointing...likely to choose another hotel next year...pricy for overall
experience...

review.title: Great Wharf Hotel
review.reviewText:
The Tuscan Inn is convenient to the Wharf, Chinatown, Cable Cars and North Beach. Room was clean and hotel was comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Concierge is great for answering questions, giving directions and booking outings. She helped us with bus routes to Haight Ashbury.
We enjoyed the nightly wine reception and dinner in the restaurant was good one night.
We would definitely stay here again when in San Francisco!

review.title: Best Hotel for Families in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel! I was traveling alone with our 11 and 9 year old kids. The valet parking is COMPLETELY secure in their garage so we could leave things we didn't need in our car and contents in our space case. Staff was very helpful and friendly, rooms beautiful. Only 2 short blocks to the heart of Cannery Row and two short blocks the other way to the Powell Mason Trolley start. Easy ride to the Exploratorium, Ghirardelli Square, ferry to Alcatraz....Golden Gate Park,....Chinatown. REALLY IDEAL location. Price very reasonable for what you got. The parking is $45 per night, but worth every cent to know your car and it's contents are safe in the city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we'll stay here from now on.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText:
The Best Western Tuscan Inn could not be better located. Accross from a Safeway, 2 blocks from the Wharf and 1 block from any transit you wish to take. Also close to most of attractions.which allowed us to come back to the hotel at mid-day.

On the negative front, we were very disapointed by the small size room. It was uncomfortable for 2 persons. We wonder why after booking our room and paying for it 2 months in advance through expedia.ca, we were offered a room for disabled with hardly any bathroom vanity. When asked, the staff answered that they were all sold out on the day we arrived which did not make sense to us.

Overall, since we did not spend much time in the room, it was all right. The restaurant attached to the hotel, Pescatora, is too expensive compare to others and food does not justified the price. The attached restaurant was one of the main reason we had picked this hotel.

I would recommend the hotel with reservation.

review.title: Less than we expected
review.reviewText: The room was tiny even though we paid extra for an upgrade. My mistake for not calling to confirm what they considered a Deluxe room. The bellman dumped our bags on the floor even though a generous tip was given. The location was good. The front desk reception was neither warm nor welcoming. They tried to charge us for honor bar water that we did not consume and after we settled up I arrived home to find a mysterious $61.44 charge on my credit card that I am still trying to resolve. I suppose the Price was about right for a SF hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area but I was underwhelmed and feel that we could have done better.

review.title: Nice hotel close to wharf in San Fran
review.reviewText: Nice comfortable hotel close to fishermans wharf clean rooms good size got lost in the hotel a few times while we were trying to figure our room location free coffee in the morning and free wine at night must be heaven good restaurant at the hotel food was great used hotel travel service for trip to Nappa valley all went well no problems and cheaper than on the street.

review.title: Wonderful stay in a great location
review.reviewText:
We booked two rooms for our family vacation. Both were very nice and most comfortable. Location to Wharf attractions is ideal. Better yet a Safeway and Trader Joe's is right next door to pick up snacks and breakfast foods (none provided complimentary at hotel). They will empty out the snacks and mini bar so you can put your own food in the frig. (so the kids don't drink all the five dollar cokes). Valet parking was very nice with in/our pivileges. Note: the "wine reception" is Two Buck Chuck, so don't rush back for that, however the mingling with other guests in the rustic lounge is nice.
I would stay here again. Very nice. (Note: single rooms are very small, doubles are much larger)

review.title: Amy
review.reviewText:
I couldn't sleep well everyday.
The location was good. But my room was streetside.
Too noisy after 5:30 am every morning.
I will not come back.

review.title: Hmmmmm.
review.reviewText: The bedding smelled terrible. I was very disappointed in the charge for parking but free WiFi was great.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the perfect location for anyone visiting San francisco. The cable cars are just two short blocks away. Fisherman's Wharf is also very close. We loved the lobby with a nice fireplace and friendly staff. Room was great, and the bed was comfy. On our next visit to SF, we will stay here again--no question about it!

review.title: Andy from DC
review.reviewText: For the money and location this is a good hotel. Seasoned travelers should be aware of a few things you will need to settle on to get the good price for the location, such as; non temperature regulated heating/air (the old wall units you have to set and adjust as needed, kind of hard to do with the vastly changing temperature of San Francisco), windows – at least in my room - do not open, handle was just sitting on mechanism (compounding challenge of lack of regulated heat), walls thin (when door shuts in room next to you, impossible to sleep through, rooms and desk (if you have to work while there) are smaller, elevators are very slow, door man often not around to help you get a cab (I was there a week and had to find my own cab every time except for once) and wifi seems to have a limit, on more than one occasion I received a message that the max number of users were already using the service in the hotel. Staff is very friendly and well trained in customer service. The above are things to consider and weigh the location and price against as those two things cannot be beat.

review.title: ill go back soon
review.reviewText: best place to stay

review.title: Always a good stay!
review.reviewText: Have stayed at Tuscan Inn several times while in S.F. on business. Always a great place to stay. Easy walking to Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars and lots of great restaurants. Staff are very helpful. The attached restaurant is only so-so. Not a lot of choices and quality only fair. Definitely will stay here whenever in the city!

review.title: A good place to stay
review.reviewText: A great place to stay and we were fairly happy with the hotel. The staff was great and the room was clean as was the rest of the hotel. The only negative thing that we had to say was that we were on the east side of the hotel that faces towards a 24 hour fitness and parking structure that has a siren that sounds every time that a vehicle is exiting. Also to be fair the seal on one of the windows to our room was broken so this could have contributed to how loud the room was. I would suggest that when booking get a room that faces the courtyard. This will reduce the amount of road noise and make your stay better.

review.title: Location was great, hotel was very good in every way!
review.reviewText: Hotel employees were helpful in every way. Coffee in lobby every morning with newspapers, and manager's reception every day with wine and soft drinks. Restaurant and bar had wonderful food and drink. Rooms were very clean, and best of all the location could not have been better. Public transportation was right there as well as the wharf area a block away with all that it offers. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Although the rooms are small, location was great! It was a very quiet room, without a view, but spent little time in the room except to sleep. Clean and morning coffees were welcome. I only found one concierge helpful during our week stay, the rest seemed somewhat supprisingly disinterested. Would stay again.

review.title: Would stay again!
review.reviewText: Great location. Room a bit small. Everything within walking distance. Overall, had a great time and would come back again.

review.title: Impressed san fran
review.reviewText: location(amazing) room quality(excellent) and in house concierge(friendly) , also restaurant attached to hotel (nice perk )

review.title: Extremely Satisfied
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a great area, handy to many things. Think we got a really good deal for the price we paid. The restaurant underneath/next door was very good also, although the service there was a bit crusty.

review.title: Clean, quiet hotel in a great area of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with proximity to wonderful restaurants. We walked to a number of areas -- Union Square, Mission District, Coit Tower, the Wharf easily from this great location.

review.title: Home Comfort in Elite area
review.reviewText:
A quiet oasis in a very busy San Francisco. Check In Staff were very attentive even with our 12.30am arrival.Late check out offered and early check in.Little extras such as free Coffe in room,coffee and biscuits in early morning at reception and Managers Wine/Drink at 5.00pm each night, free internet. Will certainly recommend to others.
Decor a little dated but true to Country comfortability.Great restaurant on site.

review.title: We love the wine tasting every night!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, centrally located - the staff is friendly and helpful - recommend this hotel, this is my third time visiting SF and stay here always!

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful and affordable hotel with a great location. Staff was extremely friendly and they have a great complimentary coffee and wine service. I am sure you can get fancier and more expensive hotels in San Fran, but we are the type of people who don't go on vacations to spend time in hotels, so this was perfect!!!! For us, walking distance to everything.

review.title: Older Hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel, but is well renovated. It is only two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. It is lacking in some amenities like a pool, hot tub, or exercise room. The staff are excellent, however; extremely helpful and friendly. There is a wonderful gas fireplace in the lobby with chairs and couches to sit and relax. It has an attached restaurant called Cafe Pescatore which, although it is a little pricey, has excellent food. There is a free wine reception in the evening, and free coffee in the morning. Overall, we were quite comfortable and satisfied with our stay.

review.title: Cute Little Boutique
review.reviewText: Our room only had a "small" queen sized bed and was very small but cute and clean. It was only the two of us so it was fine. Hotel is located in a great area where we only had to walk less than two blocks to Pier 39. Hotel offered many activities and was very helpful. We had a busy but exciting time in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location but rooms are lacking
review.reviewText: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Powell-Hyde cable car turnaround, etc. but our (King) room was exceptionally small with no view. It felt VERY claustrophobic and we could never get the temperature comfortable. Fortunately, in San Francisco, it is normal to be out of the room most of the time! Try Boudin's, Caesar's (Italian) and Buena Vista Cafe (have an Irish Coffee after a cable car ride). I would definitely stay in this location again but I would not stay at this particular hotel again due to the room size, price of parking and no breakfast options included (have to pay a fortune for breakfast at the Cafe Pescatore, which is attached to the hotel).

review.title: Going away party
review.reviewText: We all stayed at the hotel for a going away party for son who is leaving for Iraq and they treated us great the staff was friendly and helpful. The wine reception was so nice they gave my grandaughters wine glasses with water and they felt specail. I would recomend this hotel to everyone it is in walking distance to everything in the area.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: the hotel was in a great spot, easy walking distance to fishermans wharf and a short walk to go on the cable car to union square. plenty of choices to eat out - try Ricos Mexican - 10 min walk from hotel. good access to bike rentals and we did the gps go car which was located on hyde street. rooms were nice, tidy and clean, and staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Very close to the embarcadero and trolley to downtown etc. Stongly suggest renting bikes to see GG Bridge and beyond. Afternoon wine tasting was good, met lots of interesting folks. Rooms were very quiet and staff extremely helpful. Many restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great Trip
review.reviewText: From the outside, it did not look like a hotel. I was very impressed once inside. The staff was very helpful. When I needed extra towels; done. When I need directions; done. When I needed ideas; done. It is walking distance to many locations; fishermans wharf, pier 39, etc. I will definitely be staying there again.

review.title: Tuscan Inn is Great
review.reviewText: We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Excellent location and a good value

review.title: Happy Brit
review.reviewText: Perfect location. The staff at the hotel were pleasant and extremely helpful. The room itself was comfortable.

review.title: Decent hotel close to wharf
review.reviewText:
I was very satisfied with this hotel overall, mostly due to the decent rooms and location. The location was a few blocks from the wharf and some major touristy attractions. It was easy to walk to dinner each night. Although I have to say that the hotel was super lacking when it came to any really useful information.

We asked the front desk what they recommended for a restaurant and they sent us to an ok place, nothing extraordinary, but nice and close I suppose. The next day, however, the concierge was pretty underwhelming. Although he was able to direct us on a map to the trolly routes, the concierge, was completely unhelpful with any recommendations for the union square area. He was basically just like, "Well, um there's lot of stuff down there, um..." I could get better info googling it myself.

The rooms were clean and updated, and the bathroom was nice. Overall the space was great. I do wish that they had provided a breakfast though, as most Best Westerns do. I also wish that parking wasn't $50 a night after tax. I know most places int he area have pretty ridiculous parking fees, but $50 was pretty ridiculous.

review.title: Friendly and helpful staff, great location and price!
review.reviewText: Hotel is beautiful, clean and located within walking distance of Fisherman's Warf. Hotel has reasonably priced restaurant next door with good food.

review.title: Awesome Stay
review.reviewText:
My husband and I went to SF for our 38th wedding anniversary, 4-08-11 stay. This hotel was awesome! Very clean, nice size rooms. VERY QUIET! Thought we were the only ones there! Super friendly staff that were very helpful with directions and suggestions of things to do during our stay and good places to eat..
So close to the harbor, nice neighborhood with a grocery store just across the street.
We would most certainly come back here and will tell others about our wonderful stay..

review.title: Hotel staff need customer service lessons
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location, however this was about the only positive. Hotel staff were unfriendly and rude. It took three trips to concierge to get correct information on the best way to get out to the golden gate bridge. Was a breath of fresh air to actually have a staff member welcome u with a friendly smile. The rooms were comfortable and clean and served their purpose as bed to spend the night. I personally wouldn't stay there again and I wouldn't recommend I to a friend

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good price and location.

review.title: Small rooms
review.reviewText: Rooms were small, street noise was bad.

review.title: Great location in a great city
review.reviewText: Walking distance to pier 39. Go see the seals! Walking distance to the cable car station...splurge for the $13 all day passport that let's you use the cable cars and public busses all day. Don't do the $5 one way pass it's silly. The front desk sells them. The rooms are big enough. People that complain about the size of the rooms must be smuggling extra people in. It was plenty big enough for two people. Parking is steep but it seems to be the case for every hotel in the area. Restaurant next door had an amazing breakfast. Would def stay again!

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Only thing I didn't like was the size of the room. If your not in the room for a long time its ok. If you want to relax for the day or more then acouple hours its not to comfortable.

review.title: Great location - excellent price!
review.reviewText:
The location is perfect!! This is our second stay there. The first time was in 2008. The hotel is within walking distance to so many places. The rooms were clean and the hotel staff was very friendly. It is across the street from a Safeway so we bought our water and other essentials there.

We walked everywhere - to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, the cable cars, Little Italy, Russian Hill, etc. We also did a double-decker tour bus - the first stop is a block away from the hotel. We negotiated and got a reduced price. The bus took us all over, including the Golden Gate Bridge. We got off at one end and walked across. Amazing view!

The restaurant at the hotel (Pescadore) is excellent. We had appetizers one night and a full meal the next. I have travelled a lot and enjoy food - the food there was excellent.

I recommend this hotel highly and will stay there again.

review.title: A very good hotel at a very reasonable rate(for San Francisco)
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, and the staff was friendly. The parking was pretty steep though.

review.title: Good SF Wharf lodging
review.reviewText: A garage gate outside buzzed everytime it opened briefly, so it was a bit noisy, but everything else was as promised. Check the overnight parking rate.

review.title: Friendly staff, Great location
review.reviewText: Staff was very attentive and friendly. The room was small, but clean.The hotel is in a great location. - about 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and 1 block from the Hop On-Hop Off Tour buses. There's also a Walgreens and Safeway on the next block which was super convenient. Parking costs extra, but that seems to be the norm for that area. The nightly wine reception was also a nice touch. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Loved San Fran
review.reviewText:
The hotel was excellently located, very friendly and clean. I was travelling on my own and the staff were really helpful on where to go in the evenings and how to get the best out of my time. The wine reception in the early evening was great and very welcomed.

Would recommended getting a bus ticket as the transport system is so easy, the street cars were fab too. Also try to go on a bus tour if you're short of time as you get a whistle stop tour of all the musts.

As for Alcatraz, try and go early, there is a garden tour at 9.30am and well worth it, get to see a different side of the island and the volunteers know so much.

If you can get down to Pier 39 early morning then it's quiet and a bit more special and try Johnny Rockets for breakfast.

Enjoy!

review.title: I can't wait to go back and stay there again. Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Real close to Peir 39 and everything is very walkable. We walked everywhere. The people at the front desk were great. We had a great stay.

review.title: Nice and comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel was located perfect for transportation and sightseeing. Hotel service was very attentive, we were upgraded without any charge or hassle. Nice accommodations, clean, neat, lobby was clean, neat, warm and friendly.

review.title: Unexceptable Bedding
review.reviewText: I have traveled all over the world for almost 40 yrs..in all kinds of conditions--this Hotel calls itself a Boutique Hotel & Kimpton usually does a nice job... but the Bedding was absurd--NO fitted sheet-& the mattress cover was just a tiny square in the middle of the mattress--I had to call the Housekeeper because they had the wrong size sheets on a King size bed--absurd--! You are bascically sleeping on a matress-very unsanitary ! Not acceptable. Very Third World and Stingy !

review.title: Clean, Comfortable and Convenient!
review.reviewText:
Loved the big fireplace in the lobby and the proximity to everything at Fisherman's Wharf. Also, the Bay Bridge was close for easy travel to the motocross races in Oakland. Friendly and helpful staff, nicely appointed rooms and a nice touch outside our window with beautiful trees and flowers which made an otherwise unattractive area, pleasing to the eyes.
We will stay there again!

review.title: Good price for tourist central
review.reviewText: Ordinarily as Bay Area natives, we wouldn't choose to stay in Fisherman's Wharf overnight, leaving it for the tourists. But once a year we attend an event at Fort Mason, and for the last 5 years we've stayed at the Tuscan Inn. The location is ideal, the hotel is excellent, have never had any problems. They've always accomodated me with early check in and the rooms are clean and comfortable, if a little small. Oh, and as long as you don't pay rack rate (who does?), the price is right too. The Best Western/Kimpton relationship works really well at this place - you get a Kimpton look and feel at a Best Western price, the perfect marriage.

review.title: Excellent choice for business or pleasure
review.reviewText: Great location, exceptional price, clean and cozy room. Rapid response by maintenance to request for new light bulb upon arrival, and considerate house-keeping staff throughout my stay. Convenient shopping for food and essentials and easy access to vintage street car line within a couple of blocks. My only complaint--and it is major--is that I returned one night to find indications that my computer had been turned on and a mass-storage device attached. The night agent immediately expressed concern and took a note. That was the last I heard of it, so I brought it up with the woman at the desk the next day. She was utterly disinterested. While I should have remembered to engage the password protection, it was as if someone had entered my room, opened my briefcase, and copied all its contents while I was out. I thought it deserved a better response.

review.title: Great Pier Area Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed 3 nights for a conference in the Convention Center. Hotel was fine - clean, quiet, comfortable. Only negative was one of elevators was out. Close to the Trolley that runs to the Convention Center and Market Street area.

review.title: Great pick for a hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Our expectations were exceeded for this hotel. It is a very nice property in a great location. Can walk to Ghiradelli, Pier 39, even the Ferry Building if you don't mind a bit of a stroll. Rooms are much nicer than the price point would indicate. Beds are heavenly. Bath is very nice as well. Entire property very clean, staff well trained and pleasant. The attached restaurant is VERY good. They are upfront about the $44 per night parking fee (in/out privileges). If you don't want to pay this much there is a $15 lot across the street. However, being Fisherman's Wharf area, the neighborhood is a bit dicey so I wouldn't park a nice car there.

Will definitely return.

review.title: Great location, stinky rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a good location, very close to Fisherman's Wharf. The complimentary wine reception was lovely. The only negative thing I have to say is despite being a non smoking room, it smelled consistently as if it was. Everything reeked of smoke.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the Tuscan Inn. Staff was very friendly, room was clean. The location is perfect, near restaurants, Fisherman's and Trader Joes. Will certainly return.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: We felt very welcome. So did our dog.

review.title: Very pleasant great service!
review.reviewText: We arrived late in the evening due to weather conditions coming from Southern Calif. We had no problem with check in. We were not in the room much but to sleep and get ready for the day. I would certainly stay there again and again. Rooms were very comfortable a little small but really how big does a room need to be just to sleep and shower!!

review.title: Take the good with the bad
review.reviewText: The parking at this place is very high $48. Also the shower was horrible, it was very cold and absolutely no water pressure. Luckily we had went with friends and got two joining rooms because i had to stop my shower and go to the shower in the other room to finish taking it. It was still a little cold but atleast it had better water pressure. Other than that the location was great and the hotel was pretty nice.

review.title: Located in a good spot, I loved it!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very closed to Fisherman's wharf and tram station, although everything closes pretty early(8pm) around this area but the neighborhood is very quite. Room was very clean and a cute little note from housekeeping ladies made me smile. I'd love to go back to this hotel in the future!

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Location was great. Everyone attentive. Very clean.

review.title: A lovely stay
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my stay at the Best Western. The staff was extremely helpful which I really appreciated especially since I was traveling on my own with two small children. The room was very clean and roomy. The location was also excellent and easy walking to Pier 39 and Ghirardelli. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Wharf Visit
review.reviewText: See above comments.

review.title: tuscan inn
review.reviewText: 2 blocks from fishermans wharf. excellent value for the money. other hotels 1 block closer but seems run of the mill or run down a bit. parkings expensive but everyone charges that. comfy bed and i like that the windows actually open!

review.title: Kimpton standards for a great price
review.reviewText: This is a very well run hotel and lives up to the Kimpton reputation. Quality and the rate was excellent.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf's BEST BARGAIN!
review.reviewText:
Top service for budget prices! Great rooms and service in a prime destination location at a phenomenal price, all with a complimentary wine mixer in the lobby every evening. The Wharf is 2 blocks away, with a slightly longer walk to Pier 39 (~5 blocks), and public transit to suit many needs, as well as other attractions (Aquarium by the Bay, Fort Mason, Ghiradelli Square, etc.) in the area, and great dining. It's also an easy walk to Chinatown and North Beach if you are so inclined.
Compared to other hotels in the area, I don't think that you will come close to this hotel without either 1) being in a sketchy motel room, or 2) paying a WHOLE LOT more.
I intend to stay here every visit from now on.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Other than the unexpected additional substantial parking fee @ the hotel, we were happy with our stay. They are pet friendly which was nice and the hotel is very clean.

review.title: Not so sure about this one...
review.reviewText: This hotel is in need of repairs, updates, etc. The wine social was a nice touch, and the fireplace seating area is a must-try. Our room was a suite with a living room, and it was extremely outdated. Then again, a lot of the hotels along the Wharf also appeared to be in poor condition as well. So, this may be the norm for the area. Customer service was wonderful, in that our room was upgraded for free after a minor error in booking, which was quickly corrected. The staff recommended some great places to eat, too! However, I will stay at a neighboring hotel on my next trip to the area in search of more up-to-date accomodations for the steep room price!

review.title: Execllent Location
review.reviewText: Comfortable and clean. Walking distance to all Fisherman's Wharf attractions. Very good restaurant. Loved the wine reception every night. Would stay again.

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in mid October 2010. We arrived at the hotel about 9.30pm and our room WAS NOT ready for us even though check in was available at 3pm !. We had to wait about 15 mins for our room to be ready. Hotel is in a great loaction at Fishermans Wharf. Would definately recommend this as the area to stay whilst in San Francisco. Short walk to Fisherman's Wharf. So much to do in this area. Rooms were not large, but quite adequate for your needs. Clean and tidy, Street parking is available overnight in streets surrounding hotel, just check which days the street sweepers come through as you have no parking on street between 2am - 5am on those days. We had a room on the ground floor and we didn't have any problems with street noise. Large supermarket across the road is very convenient.

review.title: Great location close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Great place to stay that is very convenient walking distance to the Wharf, Alcatraz and other attractions near by and close to stops to get on the trolley if you want to go anywhere else. The room we had was pretty small which was fine since we didn't send much time there. Took the wine country tour set up by the concierge, and we both agreed we would probably pass on that the next time due to feeling like the whole tour was a sales pitch to join wine clubs, etc, which would have been fine had we not paid to go on it.

review.title: wharf area
review.reviewText: substantial homeless problem

review.title: Can"t wait to go back!! Everything exceeded expectations.
review.reviewText: Clearn, comfortable rooms with everything you need. Bathrooms are great, nice fixtures and good size. Staff very accommadating and nice. Location great for tourists... everything is close by. Tours, ferries, trolleys etc. Although only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, room was very quite. We stayed 7 nites and never heard one sound from either room. Wine tasting in evenings a nice touch, it would be nice if it were an hour later. Would highly recommed this hotel to anyone. Can't wait to go back!!!

review.title: "Great place for couples"
review.reviewText:
All the staff were more than helpful. Everything you would expect when you enter one of the better hotels.

Though, the valet employees could have been a bit nicer. They walked around like they hated their job. And I, being 21 yrs old, probably seemed like a person who wouldn't tip, so they treated me like a person who wouldn't tip, therefore, i didn't tip. Sometimes they were even rude when they were bringing my car around.

Other than the valet, I was more than satisfied with the Hotel.

review.title: Lovely Hotel, would go back!
review.reviewText: This was our first visit to San Francisco and I planned the trip for my husband & I and my sister and brother-in-law from Ontario who were meeting us there. I did lots of research and this hotel seemed to fit what we look for in an hotel and our budget! We were not disappointed. The rooms are not very big but are very clean and had everything we needed...2 things in particular: the most comfortable bed with great bedding and a window that opened for fresh air! The mini bar had lots of room for the water and various food items we purchased. We really enjoyed the wine reception each evening and coffee in the morning. The lobby is spacious and comfortable with a lovely fire creating warmth and ambiance. The location of the hotel was perfect and we found staff extremely helpful with directions and suggestions. The one thing we all felt would be an added perk would be a cheese/cracker platter of some sort at the wine reception. Small pizza squares were put out each evening but it was not very tasty and not enough as the lobby was filled each evening for the wine event! Overall we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and absolutely loved San Francisco! We will go back and would most definitely stay here again.

review.title: simon
review.reviewText: good hotel / good lcation / good room / recommend it

review.title: LOVE this hotel!!
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel many times, and it never disappoints. The staff is very accommodating. The location is GREAT! And a new feature they've added is that for any day you're willing to forego the Housekeeping service, they will give you a $5 voucher for the excellent Italian restaurant on-site!! Be sure to try the homemade tiramisu!

review.title: Charismatic!
review.reviewText: A fun hotel , close to Fishermans Wharf and lots of access to shopping and restaurants

review.title: recommended
review.reviewText: Great service, nice room, nice & helpful employees

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: Hotel in convenient location; staff very helpful; comfortable rooms; well maintained and spotlessly clean. Adjoining restaurant offered good food too.

review.title: Quaint hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Our room was small but quaint. When you're in a city like San Francisco you don't spend much time in the hotel room anyway. We were never at the hotel to take advantage of the wine reception unfortunately. There is a computer to use for airline check-in which was great. There is also a grocery store across the street which was very convenient.

review.title: Cozy, Comfortable, Conveniently-Located Hotel
review.reviewText:
Although they did not have my reservation when I arrived, they took it up with Expedia while I went to breakfast. When I returned, it had all been ironed out, and I was allowed to check in even though it was about six hours before their check-in time. The desk personnel were friendly, courteous, competent and welcoming. The room was very comfortable - not overly large, but more than adequate. There is an adjacent restaurant / bar, but we did not try it.

The location is extremely convenient for access to the North Beach waterfront (Fisherman's Wharf and the ferry landing). Lombard Street is just a short walk away, though San Francisco is anything but an "easy-walking" town.

My whirlwind, two-day stay in San Francisco was very enjoyable, and the comfortably hotel room was a big reason for my having such a delightful visit to the Bay Area.

review.title: Second stay and it was a charm both times.
review.reviewText: Great in all respects, except for the cost of the parking garage. However, the valet service was very efficient and friendly with in and out privileges. All in all, I thought I got a good deal and it was a great place to spend the weekend with my daughter and grandchildren who had never been to San Francisco. We did it all and the hotel was great place to stay.

review.title: Great Location, Reasonable and Cozy
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and the location. It's very cozy and comfortable, good location and reasonable for the location. Located just blocks from Pier 39, Fisherman's Warf and many shops. Drug and grocery store next door. Second time staying there and would stay there again.

review.title: Fantatic location, would go back in a heartbeat
review.reviewText: Fantastc location, We were only a minute from the tram turnaround walking distance to fishermans wharf and restaurants, a short walk to lombard street and felt totally safe i the area. We easily found our way to the hotel after a 12 hour fligt from NZ and our room was ready and inviting. Very clean, and comforable. The glass of wine on the evenings coutesy of the hotel was also a great way to meet new people and talk about things to do and see. A little walk from the ferry terminal but nothing that was not within a 10 minuite walk. Would definitley recommend hotel. Staff also very helpful. Rate was reasonable and no worse than others in the area

review.title: wonderful
review.reviewText: The staff as well as the hotel itself were wonderful. We were there nine days so we really got a good feel for how well things were ran. I had never stayed in a Best Western before but would now!

review.title: Wonderful experience in San Francisco- loved it!!
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, staff was awesome, rooms were very adequate and clean. Loved everything about it! Continental breakfast would make it perfect since we were always out during the wine in the afternoon!! Great location, couldn't have asked for more!

review.title: Wonderful travel experience
review.reviewText: We were hesitant about traveling with our elderly parents, but our group had a wonderful travel experience. The spacious and inviting hotel lobby, room accommodations and location to the sights of San Francisco were excellent. The helpful and courteous hotel staff were always ready to answer questions or meet the needs of our group. My only complaints concern the slow and distracted service at the in-house restaurant and the poor quality of the sofa sleeper in the "upgraded room". Other than that I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco.

review.title: great loc.very good room for the price.people were great.
review.reviewText: PEOPLE AT HOTEL LET US KNOW WHAT A GOOD DEAL EXPEDIA GOT FOR US.WINE TASTING WAS FUN.GREAT CENTRAL LOCATION.THEY EMPTIED THE FRIGE.FOR US AND WE USED IT ALL WEEK FOR SNACKS FROM TRADER JOES AND GROC.STORE [BOTH WITHIN I BLK].ITALIAN REST.,AT HOTEL WAS GREAT.COFFEE IN LOBBY WAS NICE TOUCH. ABSOULTLY WILL USE EXPEDIA AGAIN AND WOULD GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL,

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText:
This was my family's (4 teenage boys, husband and myself) first visit to San Francisco. We have relatives in California that recommended different areas to stay but we wanted to do the "tourist" things and decided to stay in Fisherman's Wharf. I chose Tuscan Inn because of location and because they could accomodate 6 people the best - room/money. We rented 2 rooms, each having a king size bed and a fold out couch so everyone had plenty of sleeping room. The rooms were next to each other but did not have an adjoining door which wasn't an issue with our group. We stayed 3 nights. The maids were friendly and courteous. Our 3rd day I just asked for clean towels so they wouldn't have to work around the boys clothes piles. Concierge Staff was extremely helpful with directions, where to catch the Bart or other transportation, making reservations, etc. We also went to Oakland A's vs. Yankees game. The concierge gave us instructions on taking the quickest route (bus and Bart) and recommended taking a taxi from Embarcadero on the trip home if the buses weren't running anymore.
The location of the hotel was great. A Walgreens and a grocery store across the street. The Wharf a few blocks away. Lots of sidewalk cafes close by. Complimentary wine from 5-7 pm was a nice way to take a break before heading out for the evening. The only negative was the street noise which was only an issue on the night of July 4th - lots of people yelling on the streets that night. Would stay again.

review.title: Would you believe no real negatives. Except, the morning coffee in the lobby wasn't the greatest.
review.reviewText: Considering the great rates, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel. The rooms were tastefully decorated & extremely clean. Staff was very accommodating & courteous. AND the location was great & we could walk to just about every place we wanted to. My one not real complaint, was that the morning coffee served in the lobby was not great, & should have included, perhaps, some danish, etc.

review.title: Happy from Vancouver, Canada
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful, our room was cute and comfortable. Location of the hotel was great within walking distance of many attractions, The only problem we had was it was extremely noisy you could hear everything happening on the street, but you get used to it. We would stay here again.

review.title: Everything we wanted!
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, comfortable and staff was friendly. GREAT location, we were 2 blocks from the Wharf and about a block from the trolly stop. A main bus stop was right out front. Was everything we needed! There was a grocery store within a block and the wine reception was nice as well. Overall fairly quiet.

review.title: San Fransisco,s best location
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 5 nights and enjoyed the stay ,5 minutes to Pier 39, one block from cable car and RestarantsWould stay there again

review.title: Good place near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
This is a convenient hotel near Fisherman's Wharf and worked well for our short stay. Great room, nice wine reception, friendly staff, expensive place to store the rental car! Expedia made reservaion easy.

A continental breakfast would have been nice.

review.title: Perfect spot near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The hotel is conveniently located to Fisherman’s Wharf and all the activities there. Easy to get the F line to other parts of the city. Great that there is a Trader Joes and Safeway close by for easy/cheap breakfast and snacks. Wine in the lobby was a nice touch, but it was Two Buck Chuck - Charles Shaw from Trader Joes….but free wine is free wine! Since we read how expensive parking is in san Francisco, we used Zip Car which was located only 2 blocks away....very helpful.

review.title: Excellent location and service
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, although the room was very small for me but I did stay there a long time. The only negative was that housekeeping were always very early and I kept forgetting to put my do not disturb sign out. I just didnt expect to be chased out of my room at 9am every day! ON the plus side I had a great stay and the staff were always very helpful. The attached restaurant is excellent. NOTE - its worth haggling over the parking charge which is completely ridiculous. I actually hired a car daily from Budget Car Hire (right next door) for less than the parking rate (even after I haggled a 30% parking discount). All SF hotels charge outrageous parking fees!!

review.title: A trip to Italy (in San Francisco)
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn was recommended as being gracious, comfortable, affordable, and ideally located. We found it all of these and more. The room is not large but big enough and very comfortable. The restaurant was very good. And the staff were extremely accommodating with anything we asked for. It was far more fun and memorable than the vanilla chain hotels that are all the same no matter what city you're in. We will be passing along to others the recommendation that was given us to stay at the Tuscan Inn.

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed very much our 3-night stay at the hotel, with two glitches: our room overlooked Mason Street. Because we sleep with open window, traffic noise even during the night was annoying. We will ask for a room overlooking the inside courtyard for our next stay. Also, and I do not know if the hotel has any say in this, we could not get served at breakfast one morning. The waiters all ignored us, and we left after waiting approximately 20 minutes to even be acknowledged.

review.title: Great location for San Francisco's sites
review.reviewText:
My rule when travelling is don't expect to much and then you won't be disappointed. However the Best Western was very good at nearly everything it did. Very helpful staff able to issue advice and maps for the local area, free internet in the lobby and wine reception each evening between 5 and 6pm.
Staff at reception were polite and unassuming if a little rushed. Other down sides included very expensive on site parking and a restaurant that just failed to offer value for money. Best place for breakfast Mama's near Washington Square, go mid week to avoid the queues at the weekend. Great location for Fisherman's Wharf with plenty of places to eat and drink. Overall a good hotel with a comfy bed and hot shower.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful hotel, one of the nicest I have ever stayed in. The room was very pretty and the the decor modern and updated. The location is perfect for almost anything you want to walk to. Cable car line is 2 blocks away. The Safeway grocery store across the street is convenient. The hotel restaurant was pretty and we had a delicious breakfast. The staff was helpful and friendly and very knowledgeable. We enjoyed the wine reception at night. Everything was clean, quiet and wonderful.

review.title: One of the best values in 2010! Would defineitely stay again!
review.reviewText:
Great little hotel--Convenient to Fisherman's Wharf. Staff extremely helpful. Complimentary cocktails in the evening. Rooms pleasant and very reasonable.
Parking too expensive--other options available nearby

review.title: not impressed, but will probably go back
review.reviewText: the Best Western Tuscan Inn is a nice hotel, little old but clean,rooms could be a little bigger. centrally located and nearby many attractions. Many at a walking distance.It was my first time in San Francisco ,although not impressed with the hotel I would probably go back . Price could be a little better.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded my expectations.Although the rooms are quite small they are nicely decorated and very very clean.The cable cars,buses and trolleys are all withing walking distance.There is a safeway market and starbucks across the street.Fishermans warf is about a 5 minute walk!! I would not park in the hotel parking the charge is very expensive just park across the street they have cheaper overnight parking with in and out privileges.I would very much stay there again.

review.title: Great location; good bargain for Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: The room was on the small side (the bathroom was big), but who goes to San Francisco to stay in a hotel room? Great location on Fisherman's Wharf. Concierge service was very helpful. Public transportation was very convenient from this hotel; cable car start/stop point was less than 2 blocks away; bus stops were close by.

review.title: LOVE THIS HOTEL, but a little small for a family trip!
review.reviewText: I love this hotel... but the rooms are a little small for a family trip. We recently traveled there with our young children (so four of us total), and the hotel was wonderful but the rooms are a little small for four people. If me and my husband went back to San Francisco, though, I would absolutely stay there again. I loved the condition of the hotel, and the room was immaculate! The beds and linens are super comfortable! And the hotel is located within easy walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Loved every minute
review.reviewText: I loved the location 2 small blocks away from pier 43 1/2, 5 min walk to pier 39. A grocery store directly across the street. The hotel was small but thats what we loved about it, Housekeeping was friendly, there really is no closet space, plenty of hot water and water pressure, bathrooms were bigger than i thought, the beds are firm which I loved. We didnt hear any other ppl thru the walls, but we could hear there doors closing, but thats normal. We didnt really here street noises, Theres alot of shops and street vendors which was cool to see.

review.title: Great location and great place for a family to stay to see the city.
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean and decorated nicely. It was nice to have a free class of wine every night. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to go to the city with their kids. It was within walking distance to all the activities and resturants around the pier.

review.title: Small rooms, Very clean, inquire about Valet service.
review.reviewText: We got in the room and immediately notice a smoke odor in our smoke free room, the manager was polite and apologized and moved us to better quarters. The rooms are rather small but everything was clean. I was very disappointed with the valet service, I found my vehicle in the public parking lot across the street parked next to the sidewalk were anyone could break in or damage it.

review.title: Hotel was great - parking was unreasonably high
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was great. The rooms were comfortable and clean. There was even a wine tasting event one evening in the lobby. The location was superb, short walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Found a good price on Expedia for the hotel. But was surprised by the extraordinarily high parking fee at the hotel. It caused some inconvenience as we ended up meter parking our car, which is a much more affordable option.

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel. wine hour in the evening. close location to wharf and bus/trolley stops. the only down side is the cost to pay for parking, however, all hotels have this charge. Would prefer if they would just add this cost into the price of the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Great location. Great hotel. Very expensive parking.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great value and very clean.

review.title: Great place, good location!!
review.reviewText: The location is great. All the staff went out of their way to be helpful. Short walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Safeway grocery store across the street-convenient. The price is great and the service was as good as any 4 star hotel. Save your money for fun things and stay here!!

review.title: I live in the Bay Area, and would definitely go back to this hotel.
review.reviewText: The Best Western Tuscan Inn is a quaint hotel on the Wharf and within walking distance to all of the activities. Union Square is close, you can take a cab or hop the cable car near Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Great area, expensive parking and no help from anyone at Check inn
review.reviewText:
when I arrived tehre was nobody to help to unload luggage from car, or door boy to get a troll and load with luggage as well nobody to take it upstairs ( i did it all my self)
No reply for calls at room phone about any question
No help also to find not very expensive parking places
Besides people, hotel is good, great area, nice room ( remember to ASK for refrigerator keys, complimentary but not for open usage)

review.title: Super Chic!
review.reviewText: The rooms very chic, and clean. The staff was very helpful,a nd the lobby was very pretty. We will totally come back!

review.title: lISA
review.reviewText: iT WAS A NICE HOTEL TO STAY AT FOR THE PRICE AND DOWN THE STREET FROM PIER 39 AND LOTS OF STORES AND RESTARAUNTS TO SEE!!

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel, good staff and concierge sevice, short walk to the wharf . Parking was expensive - nearly half the cost of the room per night.

review.title: Watch out for Parking
review.reviewText: We drove up and were greeted immediately by staff who were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very nice and inviting. However, we were stunned when we found out parking would be $50 a night. That was a shock.

review.title: 1 Slight Problem
review.reviewText: Our room was a little small, but we could live with that. however we had no hot water for a shower. A call to the desk got a maintenance person who proclaimed it fixed. It was not. A second call was made and a new room was requested, and the staff made it happen immediately. Overall a 4 out of 5 star visit. 1 star off for the water problem. I would like to see a second guest computer in the lobby, but that would just be picking nits.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Great location

review.title: Love San Fransicso
review.reviewText: San Francisco is one of our favorite places to visit. We have been visitng there since the late 80's. We enjoy everything about the city, the fog, misty rain, cool mornings, walking the hills, walking from Fort Point. Taking pictures of the Golden Gate and all the other wonderful places the city has to offer...and did I mention the seafood!

review.title: Not the same
review.reviewText: we stayed at the Tuscan Inn Best Western 5 years ago and the room was beautiful and the staff was very friendly and nice, Our room was just ok this time and the staff wasn't friendly nor courteous. At 1:00 in the morning they had construction workers sanding in an adjacent room which of course should not be happening at that time. I really don't know if we will go back.

review.title: Tuscan Inn San Francisco Wharf
review.reviewText:
The quality of the room was outstanding, the front desk services was quick and friendly, the hotel is walking distance to the wharf and one block from a local trolley to the financial district.
Great place to stay for business or vacation!

review.title: Enjoyable stay at Tuscan Inn
review.reviewText: We have stayed here several times, and it is one of our favorites in San Francisco. The resturant is good, and the location is excellent, with cable cars and the F trolley each a block away, and our grandchildren four blocks away. The rooms are slightly small, and for two of us we would like to have another chair in the room. We did have two luggage racks and the mini-bar refrigerator, which are very helpful. There is a manger's reception every night with wine and snacks, and a very helpful conceierge. Our major complaint this trip was that the front desk was out of the advertised coupons for the off site fitness center.

review.title: Enjoyable
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location. It was clean, safe, and comfortable. The wine reception was closed the first night I checked it but I got to enjoy it the next night. It lasts from 5-6 pm. The only down-side was my room window was so close to the street that I was woken up by partiers on at Fisherman's Wharf on Friday night. Beware and ask for a room away from Mason street.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic hotel in a great location. Well worth the visit! Everything was perfect!

review.title: Carrie H.
review.reviewText: Good location, close to pier 39. Parking was a little expensive @ $35.00 a night, which they said was a 'discount' at check in. Nice little bar/cafe downstairs that was very good and convenient.

review.title: Great Hotel - Not so great staff
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel...clean and comfortable with a great location. If we stay in the wharf area again, we would definitely stay here. Hotel staff that checked us in was friendly; however, the staff for the remainder of our 5-day visit seemed almost "put out" that we were there; not really rude but certainly not very friendly. Pescatore food was overpriced for quality (spaghetti & crab ravioli were very bland); much better food at wharf restaurants for the dollar.

review.title: Going back next year.
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn is in a great location with an overly friendly and accomodating staff. From the housekeeping to front desk and consierge to the parking valets all was exceptional. The complimentary wine hour is a unique and great way to meet the other traveling guests.

review.title: Very nice experience
review.reviewText:
Arrived later than expected in the evening after security checks at Heathrow had delayed the flight by a couple of hours---unfortunately the weather wasnt very good and it it was cold and it was disappointing my room wasnt very warm when I arrived.I had difficulty adjusting the controls--probably me !

The hotel reception area is very inviting and it has a lovely restaurant attached to the hotel which I used a couple of times.The staff were all very helpful and accommodating.The room was very adequate and was clean as was the bathroom.The bed was particularly comfortable.

It was useful having free access to a pc in the lobby area which also had a printing facility.

The wet weather continued and on one occasion I got quite wet but a call to Housekeeping resulted in my jeans being dried and pressed at no charge.

review.title: Milton
review.reviewText: Exellent location near to all attractions and restaurants.

review.title: Nice stay, reasonable price
review.reviewText: Frequent visitor to the City, usually stay near Union Square. This was a suprising value for a Fisherman's Wharf hotel. Appeared to be udated recently, facifility was in good shape. Room comfortable for two, as we didn't spend much time there. Friendly staff, over worked valet during check-out, but that was not unexpected. Liked the fact that many guests were walking their dogs through the lobby. Wasn't disturbed at all by the animals..either by noise or odor. Convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, Peir 39 and related tourist stops. Would stay again.

review.title: great choice, great location!
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel over the internet, not knowing anything about it or the surrounding neighborhood. We were very pleased with the accommodations and the hotel is within walking distance to any and all attractions in the area. There is a close-by Safeway store and Trader Joe's and Walgreen's if you are in need of something. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would recommend this hotel. Oh, and the restaurant attached to the hotel is VERY good. . .we ate breakfast there 2 times and dinner once. . .great! Keep up the good work.

review.title: Only if you have no other choice
review.reviewText: An average hotel. VERY noisy refrigerator and heating/cooling in room. Do NOT valet park with the hotel. $42 a night and it took 45 minutes to get the car after an 11:45am checkout. Parking lot across the street far cheaper and more convenient.

review.title: Gem of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. Perfect location, great staff, clean comfortable room, and a very nice restaurant. This hotel helped to make my first trip to SF memoriable. When I go back I will stay there again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great customer service, clean rooms, nice and quite rooms too. I would highly recommend to others. Close to everything you want to do in San Francisco and close to public transportation or easy walking distance to all of the things great about San Francisco. Had the best vacation I have had in a long time. We loved everything about our stay and the hotel.

review.title: Love San Fran but enjoyed last stay at Hyatt better
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and recently redecorated but some parts of the hotel are rundown and really showing their age. Bed was too hard for me I would put memory foam on beds to make them more comfortable. Decor is nicely put together and room was clean.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location, fantastic price, beautiful hotel, luxurious room very clean and quiet, dog friendly!

review.title: On the whole a good place to stay both location wise and price wise.
review.reviewText: A boutique-type hotel in a good location to Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms were attractive and comfortable. The wine receptionmwas nice and you had the chance to meet your fellow travelers.

review.title: The Hotel was central for us! It was great, staff very helpful and accomodating!!
review.reviewText: The one draw back is that packing costs more then the car itself.

review.title: GO BACK EVERY YEAR
review.reviewText: THIS IS A VERY NICE, CLEAN HOTEL WITH FRIENDLY HOTEL AND CLOSE TO FISHERMAN'S WHARF. WE HAVE BEEN GOING THERE FOR THE LAST 8 YEARS AND ALWAYS STAY HERE. ROOMS EVEN HAVE REFRIGERATORS WHICH IS A PLUS.

review.title: Very convenient location at a great cost.
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff; clean and comfortable hotel, conveniently located and rates are very good. Parking is pretty expensive though.

review.title: Convenient, good bang for the buck
review.reviewText: I walked into this place thinking it was rated 4-5stars! The front desk employees were very nice and the lobby was very welcoming. The rooms were better than expected too! Everything is nearby.. Grocery across the street, restaurants all over the place, Fisherman's Wharf down 2 short blocks. Great hotel!

review.title: A breath of fresh air
review.reviewText: We checked into the Best Western Tuscan Inn which we found on Expedia. We could not fault the Tuscan Inn. All staff were very pleasant and helpful. We loved the 'happy hour' of sitting in front of a warm fire with a glass of wine and meeting other guests from around the world. Congratulations to the Tuscan Inn.

review.title: NO HOT WATER, OLD RIPPED TOWELS...WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!!!
review.reviewText:
Portion of letter I sent to General Manager and to Corporate Headquarters, with no response:

We stayed for three nights at your hotel, in two different rooms. The reason why we had to move rooms was because we didn't have hot water in our room, and after taking two lukewarm showers we were fed up.

When I started the shower we let the water run for 15 minutes. I called the desk, who sent an engineer up to fix this. He ran the water in the shower, sink and flushed the toilet for another 15 minutes before it finally got hot enough to use. The reason he gave for this was the fact that because of the low occupancy on the second floor, it takes longer for the water to reach the rooms.

Upon receiving our complaint, your front desk agent "upgraded" us to a suite on the third floor, with a lovely view of a brick wall and a bathroom door that couldn't open all the way because the bed is in the way.

The agent sent a bellman to assist us with changing rooms. When the bellman arrived, he merely handed me a key. I said "You didn't bring a luggage cart"? He should have brought that cart up automatically, as we had already been extremely inconvenienced.

In addition, in our original room, some of the clean towels left were ripped and should never have been utilized for guest services. That it completely unacceptable.
It was an extremely disappointing experience for our honeymoon.

review.title: Tasteful but Tiny
review.reviewText: Lovely older Hotel, a Big Plus is that it is very fido friendly!! unfortunately the room was fairly small and I couldn't open the window. Although I'm not a big T.V. watcher I do really hate having to pay outrageous amounts to watch a little bit while I settle down after traveling. All in all if I wanted to spend some play time in the neighborhood I'd go back.

review.title: perfect location to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: hotel staff very helpful and the hotel was just in a great location to fishermans wharf thanks again expedia

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to everything

review.title: lovely hotel and conveniently located
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL HAS A VERY WARM ATMOSPHERE AND INVITES GUESTS FOR COCKTAIL HOUR IN THE LIVING ROOM ATMOSPHERE LOBBY. THE ROOM WAS MODERN EUROPEAN STYLE AND KEPT VERY CLEAN. I WAS IN WALKING DISTANCE TO FISHERMANS WARF, LITTLE ITALY, NEIGHBORHOOD RESTAURANTS, DRUG STORE, GROCERY STORE AND CLOSE TO A BARNES AND NOBLE. I WOULD DEFINITELY STAY THERE AGAIN.

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: The location was great. However, the bed was uncomfortable, and the view from our room was of a wall.

review.title: Favorably impressed
review.reviewText: Great location, terrific staff, hotel gives you vouchers for use at many nearby restaurants, restaurant in hotel was great, and staff was friendly, helpful, and always willing to answer questions and give valuable suggestions. I would definitely use this hotel again.

review.title: Comfortable, Great Location, + Nicely priced
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the comfort, location, and price of this hotel. We were within walking distance to a grocery store, starbucks, the pier, and even ventured into the little italy part of town. All very convenient! and the price was great!

review.title: Great place to stay to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText: I travel on business to SF 3 or 5 times a year for the past 10 years. I've stayed all over the city and suburbs and The Tuscan Inn on Fisherman's Wharf is a hotel I'll go back to next time I travel. Right from the start of my visit when the parking attendants took immediate care of me and my car, through check out, the staff was efficient, friendly and accommodating. The King room I had (for one person) wasn't big, but it was well laid out. The WiFi worked perfectly, the bed was very comfortable and it was well decorated. I didn't take advantage of the nightly wine tastings as I am in the wine business already, but there was always a group of people sampling wine and talking and having a good time in the lobby in the late afternoons. It is a very convenient location, you can walk to North Beach and Chinatown, a good parking garage is right across the street; simply put, it is a good value in a good location.

review.title: Location is the Only thing going for this place.
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a nice getaway from home then this is not the place for you. This is a place to sleep and that's it. The elevators were broken when we got there, the staff was abrupt and unhelpful. The bathroom towelrack was broken, the hallways smelt like cigarettes.
