The hotel attached was way overpriced and the food is disgusting. Parking cost a fortune. Literally the only thing going for this place was that it was close to fisherman's wharf. Which we saw everything there in 2 days. So we packed up and spent the next 4 days in Union Square. If you're gonna spend time in San Fran, then stay in union square.

review.title: Reasonable
review.reviewText: For a hotel close to the tourist area this is pretty good. Valet parking add $50 per day. Stay during the week reduces rates significantly. Rooms are clean though quite small, I took the deluxe king size and found it about half the size of the best western king in a smaller locale. But still for a decent bed close to everything it was fine. Deluxe package entitles you to the biscuit and coffee in the morning and the glass of wine in the evening if you like as well, for those who like to schmooze. Just one block to the cable car line and with a nice little restaurant attached makes for less bumbling about. It is just three stories though, so no real view rooms.

review.title: great time
review.reviewText: great service

review.title: Great location, great service
review.reviewText: We stayed here with our two kids (ages 3 and 4 1/2). The location was just a few blocks away from pier 39 - we didn't even need a stroller. It is just blocks from a Trolley Car stop - a must experience in San Fran. The room was a modest size, but comfortable. Our room was located on the street side, so it was a bit noisy (we heard cars driving by and the garbage truck bright and early that morning!) The bellhop was extremely courteous and helpful with our luggage. We heard there was a complimentary happy hour with wine & cheese every evening, but we didn't get a chance to attend (no doubt that it was nice). The surrounding neighborhood was great - we found a great place right down the street for breakfast where we could people watch.. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText:
Staff were excellent, room clean with sufficient space good central location to Fishermans Wharf, Trolley and Cable Car. As with most hotels in the USA the room lighting is terrible, table lamps with shades are not good for reading.Also it was the second hotel we stayed in that not only the lighting was bad outside the lift and in the hall it also had a nasty smell. Plumbing standards leave a little to be desired.
Overall though we would certailny go back.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Great location, couple of blocks from the Fisherman's wharf. Close to all amenties like cable car (only a block away), shopping (Food or gifts). etc.

review.title: Confortable
review.reviewText: We asked for an inside room and it was quiet and comfortable. Clean. Pleasant staff. Only 2 blocks from the wharf.

review.title: Would not return
review.reviewText:
When we arrived one out of the two elevators did not work.
We stayed for two nights. On the second day, we did not receive any towels. NONE. We called twice, finally at 9:30 PM the staff brought two bath towels. We had to request hand towels and wash cloths separately. In all our travels we never had such an experience.

review.title: Ugh
review.reviewText: Our "non-smoking" room reeked of smoke - had to wash everything that was in my suitcase when I got home because it smelled like smoke. Awoke in the middle of the night to police shining flashlights into our ground floor window which opened onto a lightwell shared by other rooms and breaking up a party next to us. Took the precaution of using the safe after that only to find out they charge extra for that. Expensive valet parking ($42/night) was the all they offered.

review.title: Good location. Nice lobby. Great little restaurant.
review.reviewText: The price of the room was competitive. The lobby was lovely. The room decor was a little funky, but it was clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed our meal in the restaurant. The atmosphere was cozy. The service was friendly. The food was good.

review.title: Convenienant location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient to all the piers and shopping was in walking distance. Parking was expensive, but that is to be expected anywhere in the city. It was clean and check in/out was a breeze.

review.title: Too expensive for what it offers...
review.reviewText: The hotel is a couple blocks off the main waterfront street. The rooms were very small even for two people. Italian theme, where? We didn't see it. We asked the valet to get a taxi and ended up spending almost 20 minutes waiting for one. We finally started walking and flagged our own down a couple blocks away. I would look for another place to stay next time.

review.title: Good Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is just 2 short blocks from all the activity at the wharf and pier 39. The room was very nice (it is small but nicely decorated). The hotel parking fee is high but there is a public lot nearby. We missed the complimentary wine but all the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: My sister recomended this hotel very highly and we are in agreement with her. Location was great, and the hotel was very helpful concering all of our questions and making reservations.

review.title: Excellent Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our arrival at Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were very friendly and the hotel was clean and comfortable. The daily wine tasting at 17.00 was good and also the free tea and coffee each morning in the lobby was a nice touch. In all, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, although don't forget to budget for overnight parking!! But there again, where can you park for nothing in San Frncisco??

review.title: Excellent location - close to all amenities at Fishermans' Wharf
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable accommodation in the heart of Fishermans' Wharf.

review.title: Absolutely loved this place!
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly located for anyone coming to SF. My only caution is to request a room not facing the street as it is quite noisy at night. Also, there is no room service,but a fabulous restaurant connected to the hotel. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Maids did not replenish ammenities..

review.title: Great hotel, close to wharf
review.reviewText: Ok.. so the room wasn't overly big; but it was very nicely decorated; newer furnishings; very comfortable. The hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. We checked out on sunday and were able to leave our car in their parking lot till later after we came back from breakfast.

review.title: Too expensive!
review.reviewText: $48 to park the car for one night. We didn't use the car even once $1.65 to use the room safe which I thought was ridiculous. They didn't have the San Francisco Chronicle, the only local morning newspaper available. I had to walk 3 blocks to get a copy. Went for coffee in the lobby @ 0800 and the coffee pot was empty.

review.title: Very nice & totally enjoyed the wine reception each evening.
review.reviewText: Everything was better than expected. The lobby was nice and the rooms were, too. Every employee was friendly and helpful. And the location is perfect.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: The BW Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco was an excellent experience. The room was a bit on the small side, but that wasn't an issue, didn't spend much time there. The location of this hotel is its greatest asset. Room was clean. Hotel was quiet - even though there was roof work being done. And, with the discount and promotion from Expedia, it was, for San Francisco, a real bargain.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for the price...the location is perfect, rooms are small but clean. Our room was over the drop-off/pick up valet area and was noisy when buses pulled in, but otherwise...an excellent choice!

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The Tuscan inn is in a great location. Rooms are a litte small but very nice. The hotel has a very luxury type feel even though it has the best western name.

review.title: Great Time!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for the 2 of us, although it would have been too small for our family of 4. The wine reception was fun (we were already expecting 2 Buck Chuck so it wasn't disappointing). Great location and friendly staff. Parking was expensive.

review.title: non-smoking room stank of smoke the entire trip. unreliable staff.
review.reviewText: we were given a non-smoking room. there was even a note that if you smoke in the room there would be a $1500 cleaning fee. as soon as we entered the room the smell of smoke was extreme. i called the front desk, they said they didn't have any other rooms but they would clean the room and get rid of the smell. a few days later, it still smelled just as strong. i called again and was told the same thing, they would send someone to clean. that time i stayed in and no one ever showed. i am not going to say that it ruined our trip, we spent little time in the room anyway, but coming back to the room after a long day of walking and public transportation it just wasn't very welcoming to come back to that smell every day. also, the room service was actually a separate restaurant so that was a little annoying when we had to call and tell them the room number and hotel phone number. the place was there in the lobby, so it would have been nice if they worked together a bit better. parking was valet only, and expensive. there were several hotels in the same area that had their own parking lots and advertised free parking with stay. overall, i think you can get a better deal across the street. if you are thinking about this hotel, please consider other options in the area first.

review.title: Nice, but you pay mostly for the location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice overall, but the rooms are very small. Parking is also very expensive ($40+/night). Its location is very convenient to many attractions.

review.title: Great location....close to all major attractions.
review.reviewText: I was surprised that the hotel had a daily fee for using the in-room safe. In all my travels, both national and international, I have never had to pay a fee for the safe. Coffee and tea were available in the lobby each morning, which was a pleasure. However, since guests arrive at all hours, I think coffee should be available at all times. The wine/snack hour each evening was very nice and well attended. It was a very nice bonus. The lobby was very comfortable with a fireplace going all the time, beautiful flowers outside the French doors, and comfortable furniture.

review.title: Best Ever!!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed this hotel for a number of reasons. We were greeted by the concierge and he helped us right off with the drop off of our rental car. It was right across the street instead of returning to the airport (20 miles away) and finding our way back again. We could easily walk to everything from this hotel and did so often. Only two blocks away from all the action yet the hotel was very quiet. Thoroughly enjoyable in this location. By the way, we are older seniors and this hotel fit our needs very nicely.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Great location! Very clean. Staff was very accommodating. Because we went back for a second visit, there were little extras added to our room as a surprise. They have a free wine tasting from 5:00 - 6:00 in their lobby. I don't know if it was every day or just on the weekends. Would definitely go back. The only bad thing is if you have a car, it's about $42 plus tax per night to park in their garage. But all hotels charge that fee. We parked our rental car at the rental car garage (which was within walking distance) for $15.

review.title: Highly recommend. great location. Great resturant
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the city. Close to attractions. Good resturant at hotel would recommend even if you chose not to stay there.

review.title: excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: excellent hotel only complaint was for some reason the alarm clock in room went off for no reason at 4 am i guess the person who stayed there before me woke up early. other than that excellent hotel.

review.title: A lucky find
review.reviewText: Excellent location, unique decor in rooms, daily wine mixer in lobby, helpful staff including conceige service to book tours.

review.title: Nice accomodations
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights on a beautiful weekend in San Francisco. The room was small but nicely adorned. We did not take advantage of the wine reception the first night but did the second. Good idea but we were not impressed with their wine selection, "Two Buck Chuck". Overall, a very pleasant stay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location if you are looking to be able to walk to the wharf & all of it's many restaurants. It was also clean. The only complaint we had is that the room is awfully small! Cute, trendy decor, but so small, that it was hard for two people to move around in. Smallest room I've ever stayed in.

review.title: Best location on Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in San Francisco and our stay at The Tuscan Inn was perfect! It was so convenient to all attractions and the staff was friendly , efficient, courteous - very clean hotel with many amenities to make our stay wonerful!

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText: I have always been very sastified with any hotel under the Kimpton operation .

review.title: Great stay at Tuscan Inn
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but very cozy. It is in a great safe location. Fisherman's wharf is very touristy. Its a lot like Myrtle Beach. I would recommend staying in the Financial district where more shops are if you're looking for a good time. There was no problem checking in or out. Everyone was very friendly and they had a free wine hour everyday from 5-6. The attached restaurant would bring in a pizza for everyone to share. The best part of the room is the shower! Enjoy!! :)

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff, 5pm lobby drinks and early morning tea and coffee,nice cafe next door for breakfast, close to Fishermans wharf, sightseeing busses and trams. First night we had a room in the centre of the hotel which was noisy from all the airconditioners. Next morning we asked to be moved and were given a king room across the hall with street views. Much nicer and quieter. Staff very helpful and moved our luggage to new room while we were sightseeing. Would recommend and stay again

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff, no matter what shift it was were kind and helpful and a pleasure all around. Our room was spotless and comfortable.

review.title: Ecellent hotel for the price! Great Area!
review.reviewText: This hotel's italian theme was great. They give you food coupons to eat at the restaurant next door upon arrival. The hotel is only two short blocks from the Warf and about 15 blocks to union square. My wife and I actually took the walk to Union Square and it wasn't a bad walk at all. Along the way we passed through North Beach (Italian district), an area full of young local night life, bars, restaurants (recommend The Stinking Rose), and coffee shops; next was China Town which was pretty much like any China town. Small asian themed shops with numerous unexpensive restaurants. Right across the street is a Safeway (nice for getting some fresh fruit in the morning), Radio Shack (just in case you left a power cord for something back home), and 1 block towards the Warf is a 7-11. This place was excellent, location was superb, and the staff was all very friendly! They do not have a pool or hot tub, so don't worry about bringing your bathing suits.

review.title: Okay, Good Location, Small Rooms
review.reviewText: I stayed with my family and the room was very small. I had a deluxe room with a pull-out sofa and even this was crowded and not sufficient space for luggage or family members to move around in the room.

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay in San Francisco if you want to be near the water. The hotel was tasteful and utilitarian. We didn't eat there as we were too close to great restaurants. I had some issue with one of the concierges who seemed a little grumpy and made stuff seem like an effort. Everyone else in the hotel was very pleasnt and extremely helpful.

review.title: Will definitely return here next visit!
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. Great staff - always helpful. Someone always there for questions. Location is great - so convenient to everything. The room was so clean and neat - can't say enough about this Tuscan Inn. We recommend it so highly - you won't be disappointed.

review.title: Good Location, Nice Rooms
review.reviewText: Stayed for 2 night at the end of May. Great location, only two blocks to Fisherman's Warf. Nicely decorated rooms and very clean, although a bit small. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Friendly well located hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel is showing its age but overall a great place to stay - wine reception excellent.

review.title: Met our minimal expectations.
review.reviewText: The best thing we could say about our hotel is location, location, location. It is showing its age with signs of wear and tear. The staff was kind and helpful, especially the concierge. Despite the fact that breakfast included is so standard in the industry, it was not at this hotel. They offered free wine around 5 or 6, but of the 5 nights we stayed here, it never benefitted us as we were always out and about during that small window of opportunity. With all that being said, we would consider staying again, but I would research the other hotels in the wharf vicinty first before booking. We received a considerably better per-night pricing using Expedia than booking directly with the hotel.

review.title: Not Impresses
review.reviewText: Very noisy, I could hear the trash truck going beep, beep, beep at 7:00am! The rooms have wood shutters instead of drapes, so the sunlight is beaming into the room at 7:00am. My husband and I do not recommend this hotel. FYI-The Wine reception consists of Chettos and Charles Shaw wine.

review.title: Very nice hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: Close to the water front and all attractions. Free daily wine tasting. The only thing that was a disapointment was the cleaning staff did not appear to replace used drinking glasses with machine washed clean ones. We had one glass that was soiled that kept being set out as clean for the 5 days we were at the hotel. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful setting up day trips etc.

review.title: Would like to stay at this property again.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the daily newspaper and good coffee in the lobby in the morning. The wine reception daily was nice. The restaurant was good ~ we had breakfast there every morning and tried their wood oven pizza for dinner one evening. Definitely one that I would recommend to others.

review.title: So cozy
review.reviewText: Our room was very nice, cozy, extremely neat & clean. I loved the decor. The lobby is oh-so-comfy. The hotel is near everything; the wharf is a couple of streets north and a cable car station is just around the corner. And the pier for Alcatraz tours is only half a mile away; not a bad walk at all. There's a an awesome restaurant adjacent to the hotel, with an etrance through the hotel lobby. I really liked this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf was a great place to stay. Close to all the shopping and restaurants on the wharf. Not to mention the ease of accessing the public transportation. We used the trolleys and of course the cable cars, which where both within 2 blocks walking distance. I'd go back in a heart beat.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: We were there for our honeymoon and it worked out perfectly. We were within walking distance to the wharf, pier 39, and pier 41 (to go to alcatraz). Also lots of restaurants and shops (alot of souvenir shops). But we were also within walking distance of the main bus lines and cable cars and trolleys. We'd also written a line when we booked on expedia that we were coming for our honeymoon, and the 1st full day we were there, we came back to the room to find a bottle of sparkling wine with two glasses and a note. It was a really nice touch. The attached restaurant is a little pricey for breakfast, so we usually walked down half a block to a little place that was delicious:) Would definitely stay there again!!

review.title: Love it....
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn for 6 nights. It was awesome. The location is outstanding. The service was incredible. We travel a lot and we were extremly pleased with every aspect of the hotel. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant. Service was very good. Food excellent. There is a great little breakfast shop two blocks down.,.California Restaurant, I think..anyway.,we ate there 3 mroning. Good cheap food. We would go back to this hotel in a hearbeat.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location for our guests from overseas. Request a room on the courtyard as the street side is noisier.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: A very friendly hotel. Brilliant location - handy for Fisherman's Wharf attractions but also strategically located for MUNI connections to explore San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location!
review.reviewText: This was a superb hotel for both quality and location. I will definitely check availability for my next trip. Only one thing to watch out for is the cost of parking, it was a bit of a surprise when we had to pay $42 plus tax per night for valet only parking!

review.title: Would go back and we did!
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel with lots of Tuscan charm. Staff was great, rooms were very nice. Location was great. Walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Trolley stop, Starbuck's.We stayed 4 nights and traveled south for 2 nights and liked it so much we headed back and stayed our last night there again. Excellent price for a nice hotel. Restaurant in hotel was nice. Only one recommendation- Need coffee in lobby in afternoon and serve something with am coffee even Buscotti in lobby. Afternoon wine hour was nice. We would love to go again and would stay there and nowhere else.

review.title: CHECKING
review.reviewText: We arrived about 3 hours before check in time and they had a room ready so we are able to put out stuff in the room and leave. That was very nice,

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Tuscan Inn was in a good location to the Wharf. I would stay here again. Very clean, friendly and comfortable. Although the rooms were a little small.

review.title: Better than I had expected. Cablecar and bus routes close. Walk to Wharf.
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy and quick to check in and out. The staff was quick to help if you needed a cab or directions. The hotel was quiet for sleeping, the beds were comfortable with stylish room decor. The hotel has a great Itallian Restaurant for eating and drinks. It has a 5pm wine tasting get together in the lobby. Its really close to everything near the Wharf. Walk up two streets to pier 39 to eat, watch the seals, or rent a bike and explore.

review.title: Great hotel - will stay again.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our hotel. Very centrally located close to wharf. Could walk (or other transportation) to almost all attractions. Hotel was very clean, comfortable and quite. The wine hour was a treat and we enjoyed meeting other guests.

review.title: Great location, helpful friendly staff
review.reviewText: This was a fun place to stay. We arrived late the 1st night so we ate at the adjoining restaraunt.Witty fun waiter good food. Walking distance to everything from the wharf to tshopping(Trader Joe's, Safeway). Stayed in Deluxe king room, comfy, well appointed. Have a wine happy hour, met other patrons, very fun!

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: In addition to the quality and cleanliness of the hotel, it's location was convenient to all areas of attraction within the city and public transportation. The cocktail hour of wine and pizza was an added treat between site seeing during the day and fine dining at night. The Inn Keeper was highly hospitable. Delightful experience.

review.title: Good Service
review.reviewText: Well situated

review.title: Charming and Convinient
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff is quiet professional and very helpful. Located Fisherman's Wharf near to all tourist spots in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Excellent location for people looking to be close to restaurants and the shops on the waterfront. Close to public transportation to/from downtown.

review.title: Loved It!!
review.reviewText: We recently stayed here for our 25th anniversary. We were extremely happy with our experience!! As soon as we checked in we were upgraded to a suite in honor of our anniversary, the fireplace burned real wood, NOT gas!! We were sent up a bottle of champagne by the manager, which was greatly appreciated after a long day of sightseeing. Everyone was very friendly, including the maids who looked up, smiled and said hello every time we entered a hall! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco!!

review.title: We'd go back to the same Hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel is a gem. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room was clean and tastefully decorated. The nights in the hotel were quiet. They do a breakfast coffee in the lobby area near the fireplace every morning, and a wine sampling event just before dinner in the late afternoon. A great way to meet other guests from all over the place each night.

review.title: very nice accomodations with great price
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and well kept. Hotel staff very helpful in acquiring reservations for Alcatraz tour. Valet knew his directions well in helping to get us to other destinations.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Excellent location.Witin walking distance to the main attractions.Breakfast could be expensive,however there are a couple of places within a block distance.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because of the Kimpton relationship. I knew the room would be an upgrade with nice amenities and I was right. King bed and a small couch along with shudders on the windows. My room was on the street. Good thing it was a quite weekend in San Francisco. Otherwise it would have been very loud and not the most restful sleep. there is a wine reception in the lobby every evening but the wine being poured was Two Buck Chuck. Not worth my time to drink it but if you don't mind... The restaurant next door was great too! Cafe Pescadore. Good food, nice wine list, friendly staff and attracts a mix of locals and tourists.

review.title: Tuscan Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Over all the hotel was great! Valet parking was expensive and the connected restaurant was overpriced for the quality of the food. Other than that, lots of good restaurants nearby, great location and service was impeccable. We plan on going back!

review.title: Great location for a good price
review.reviewText: Great location, clean, nice atmosphere. Bed was comfortable. Wallpaper was peeling a bit, which could be fixed easily and would help hotel keep it's nice feel. They had a happy hour at 5pm with complimentary wine and soda, which was nice. Also had a computer in the lobby for the use of the guests, which was great to print boarding passes and quickly check email.

review.title: Good.-but...
review.reviewText: We checked into the hotel and the found the location to be great. The next day when we came back from sightseeing...we found 2 bottles of water on our desk. Not knowing their origins, but suspecting that they were to go in the courtesy bar, we did not drink them. When we checked out, they said that "you had two drinks" and I told them no, I never even received the key so I could not open it. The lady checking us out told me that there would be no charge, but they charged me anyway. I work in Customer Service and the $4.11 that they charged me for water is now going to prevent me from returning and/or recommending this hotel.

review.title: Very Impressed.
review.reviewText: My girlfriend & I spent 6 nights at the Best Western Tuscan Inn and had a great time. The hotel is in a great location by the Bay, close to all transport links to get around San Francisco and the staff were very helpful & friendly. The rooms were very clean & tidy & the maids keep them that way. Although Breakfast wasn't included with our room there is a Italian restaurant ajoining the hotel and plenty of places within afew minutes walk. A great idea that brings all the guests together is the coffee/biscuits in the morning and the wine tasting in the evening which was free. We will no doubt visit San Francisco at some point again in the future & will definitely look to stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn. Cheers Martin

review.title: WONDERFUL stay, great location!
review.reviewText: Despite the other reviews saying the room is too small, we found ours well laid out, with plenty of room to walk around. Though that hardly mattered, as we spent little time in our room. We found this hotel was a PERFECT location! We walked to North Beach for breakfast or dinner, and we could easily access public transportation, Fisherman's Wharf, pier 39, etc. The concierge was most helpful, offering several options for solving any tourist problem we came across. I will DEFINITELY stay here again!

review.title: great location, great hotel
review.reviewText: I couldn't have asked for a better location as far as accessibility to all the attractions of San-Fran and local amenities. great restaurant too, excellent staff and quality of food. Parking was a bit Pricey. late check out was a bonus.

review.title: outstanding location
review.reviewText: Best Western KImpton at Fishermans Wharf is positioned perfectly for the tourist. Two blocks to the wharf,one block to the F-line train, from where you can get to all other transits,ferries etc in 15 minutes. Rooms are not overly large but were very clean and comfortable. Hotel staff was very helpful and knowledgable. We really enjoyed our stay!!

review.title: the parking is more than you listed Check that out.
review.reviewText: It was great location. The wine in the evening was a nice touch.

review.title: Can's wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was the perfect place to stay. Close to the cable cars and other bus lines. Walk to Fisherman's Wharf and many other things. The staff was extremely helpful. They have a great Italian restaurant at street level.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff, clean and confort room, me and my family had a pleasant time in Tuscan Inn. Recommend.

review.title: Great location. Great service.
review.reviewText: Can't wait to back

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Great everything, and handy to everything you want to see and do. Loved the decor of the lobby, the patio and our room. Also enjoyed the view of the patio from our room, and the plantation shades on the windows!

review.title: Great hotel including for families
review.reviewText: We were very happy with this hotel. Its location was excellent, just a 2 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf (the hotel is 2 blocks from the Bay) a 5 minute walk to Pier 39 and a 5 minute walk to Ghiradelli Square. We asked for a back room away from the main road and it was very quiet. Our children (8 and 12 yrs) were also happy with the hotel (they liked the hot chocolate available every morning). Staff were helpful and friendly. Valet parking was excellent and we were given a very reasonable rate. The bedroom was very clean, bright and fresh and the en suite bathroom was excellent. Our only criticism was the size of the room - for a family of 4 it was a bit small and there was not enough storage space for clothes for 4. Nevertheless we would go back.

review.title: What a Nice Surprise!
review.reviewText: Our room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The location was super, close enough to walk on Fisherman's Wharf, catch a cable car, bus, and trolley. We also had a Safeway just around the corner.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Very well maintained hotel. Service at front desk was great, staff were very friendly. Complimentary tea/coffee and internet access in lobby were an added bonus. Cleanliness of room/lobby was impeccable. An overall great experience and I would defintely stay there again in the future.

review.title: Great Hotel-Walking Distance to Everything
review.reviewText: Nice hotel-rooms were comfortable. Hotel is very old, but has been updated. Staff were helpful and friendly. Complimentary wine in lobby every night was especially a plus! The hotel was in a great location-we could walk to almost every attraction we wanted to see.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Loved the location - it was convenient to all kinds of transporation as well as a grocery store and drug stores. We walked everywhere.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very neat, quiet and conveniently located. They advertized parking was available and knew we would have to pay, was just a little suprised at the actual cost. Rooms are a little tight but it suited our needs. Nice stay in SF for the price.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location in Fishermans wharf, and a great basic hotel, would reccommend.

review.title: Nice Location, poor customer service
review.reviewText: Location allowed one to park (expensive valet parking price) and walk to the wharf/piers. Good location to walk from to take the Alcatraz tour. Rooms were a bit small for a family. Concierge service was extremely poor, she was more involved with her personal issues than assisting those needing support. Front desk staff could be inviting, however we didn't experience that. Location is the great positive here, however there are other properties with the same proximity.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Hotel room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large and well equipped. Hotel Near Cable Car to take you to Union Square and Market Street. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance through Little Italy area to Chinatown.

review.title: Poor customer service.
review.reviewText: When we got to the hotel there was confusion about our charge card and couldnt check in. The front desk rep. said I dont care if youre tired and beat from the 7 hour flight. The concierge also lied to us about features and benefits of the local tour plans he sells in the hotel lobby. Front desk people were very rude and short with customers overall. A lousy hotel. Rooms are a joke-very small and paper thin walls. Never go again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel extremely convenient to Wharf, cable cars, trolley car. Room very clean; however bathroom very small with only single small vanity (2 people could not share). Registration staff pleasant but always seemed to be preoccupied with computer screen and seemed annoyed when trying to get their attention. Restaurant in hotel has very good food for breakfast and dinner.

review.title: Small room but great location
review.reviewText: Room was very cute but small. Great for kids being only 2 blocks from pier and close to everything. Staff was friendly for the most part but did not call back with requested info. At check out they charged us for the water left in the room by the beds. But nothing was left saying it was not complimentry. Charge was taken off the bill at check out. No microwave and had to get key for fridge. Advertised they had breakfast but did not, coffee and tea only, when asked we were told to go to Safeway across the street. Very quiet, we had a good stay.

review.title: Nice Hotel - great location
review.reviewText: We recently visited San Francisco for four days and chose the Tuscan Inn through reviews on Trip Advisor. We had a courtyard room, although small as everyone mentioned, it was very nicely decorated and the windows opened into the courtyard. We heard the street was noisy so were happy to have the room we did. The hotel is a 3 minute walk to the cable car turnaround at the end of the Powell Mason line, and is 2 blocks to the water and Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: More than pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: Everyone knows that finding a deal in San Francisco is pretty tough. To find a deal and the place is nice, well that is like hitting the ball out of the ballpark. The Best Western's room were really comfortable, nice and clean. I stayed the week for business reasons and felt like I was coming back home every night. The complimentary wine happy hour is a nice touch. The only drawback is that the hotel did not have any fitness amenities and the elevators from the lobby to the room took a little too long. There was a nearby 24hr fitness gym (literally across the street) that the hotel offered discount day passes for. This obviously should not be deal breaker since who really needs the gym when you can walk everywhere. The hotel is centrally located by Fisherman's wharf so eating opportunities were plentiful. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Not for kids
review.reviewText: Hotel was in good location,but is really set up for adults with out kids. You can only use baggage cart if you get bell hops to help you.

review.title: clean, friendly and convenient
review.reviewText: definitely would go back. great location, clean and all staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Great location. 2 blocks from pier 39. free wine tasting daily in hotel.

review.title: Third trip and will go back
review.reviewText: The hotel met the basic necessities of being clean and inviting. We have stayed there several times. What makes the Tuscan special are the people and the treatment you receive. The same people that own the Drake own the Tuscan and they impart top flight customer service.

review.title: Great Location, Tiny room.
review.reviewText: The staff was awesome, the rooms were tiny. The pictures on the internet make you think you're going to be able to see more than you can. Our window over looked an apartment complex and the windows were fogged up and you couldn't really see out of them. We were crawling over each other in the room too. It was really small.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: It was our first trip to San Francisco so we weren't sure of where to stay. This hotel was convenient to everything! We will likely stay here again on a future trip.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: My husband and I went to celebrate our anniversary and we were very pleased. At first I wasn't sure I'd like it because the pictures looked outdated, but it looks nothing like the pictures. The rooms are very nice, clean and modern. The only flaw was that the accent pillows on the bed were a bit dirty, but everything else was clean. We just asked the staff for new ones with no problems. The staff was very nice and helpful and the hotel is within walking distance to the pier and restaurants. I will absolutely return!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Although not a luxury hotel, the friendliness and service was quite good. Our room was small, adequate and clean. The location of the hotel is excellent if you are in San Francisco enjoy the tourist sights. Cable car line, Fisherman's Wharf area are within 2 blocks. It is an easy walk to Grant Street Italian restaurants, Nightclubs and China Town.

review.title: good quality/price
review.reviewText: clean and comfortable close to all major tourist sites

review.title: RUDE. Not Impressed.
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel previously and loved it! Unfortunately our experience this time was so bad we will try somewhere else! The front desk was rude! They seemed bothered with having to check us in and even more bothered that there was an error with the reservation. It was easy for them to be ugly and not until I got ugly back did they seem to care. Not even was the valet or concerige courteous! Take your business elsewhere for the price.

review.title: Veru good hotel
review.reviewText: Totally recommended!

review.title: very comfortable
review.reviewText: Fishermans Warf Tuscan Inn Best Western was a haven after my work day. The hotel was not too fancy, is was very comfortable. It was not pretentious and it was clean. The room was perfect and was a perfect place to recharge with the afternoon wine reception. I will definately stay at this hotel again even for pleasure!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the bed was more comfortable than most homes. Wonderful and friendly atmosphere!! Fantastic location, you can walk everywhere and if you don't feel like it you can hop on ANY kind of transportation it is all within a block of the hotel. I did miss the biscotti though. I guess the economy has had an affect on everything ...will go back this summer.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Despite the great location and previous good experience a few years ago, our most recent stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn was not very restful. The bed was rock hard, the housekeeping stole money from the bedside (and the management claimed they probably thought it was a gratuity), and noisy neigbors in the room next door partied all night. We did call about the noise, and the partying and pot smoking continued all night. This is the 2nd Kimpton hotel we've stayed at where there seemed to be no courtesy to the guests regarding late night noise going on in the hotel.

review.title: Awesome.
review.reviewText: It was very comfortable and the full wall of mirrors was great fun.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Great comfortable bed, lovely white linens. Very quiet room overlooking courtyard.

review.title: A wonderful experience!
review.reviewText: My husband works in California and I traveled to San Francisco to spend a few days with him. We chose the Tuscan Inn and, despite some negative reviews I had read, we were absolutely delighted. The staff was superlative! The room, although a bit small, suited our needs perfectly and was clean and the bed comfortable. The wine reception every afternoon was a high point. Restaurant a bit pricey but food quality was excellent. Close to the wharf, close to the bus lines, and close to the cable car ride. We can't wait to stay there again. Kudos!!!!

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn is in an excellent location near Fisherman's Wharf . Nice clean rooms , very good restaurant, good friendly staff . I recomend it highly.

review.title: Great Hospitality
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful & knowledgeable especially the Chief Concierge who arranged tours of the area.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to the US and The Best Western Tuscan was a great place to stay. The price was reasonably. The hotel staff was very helpful and it was very clean. It was very near all the attractions. The hotel restaurant was a little expensive but convenient. Italian food, I recommend the scallop risotto it was great. Try some of the local restaurants near pier 42. We would stay there again if we were to visit San Francisco again.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Nice, clean room in a great location and it didn't cost a fortune!

review.title: One of San Francisco's secrets...
review.reviewText: The Best Western now being taken over by Kimpton (west coast boutique hotel group) offers comfortable accommodation in a prime location. In addition to the great service, the hotel offers a nightly cocktail hour reminiscent of days past where hotel guests have an opportunity to mix, mingle and make new friends!

review.title: Boutique hotel with 5-start service
review.reviewText: Our trip to San Francisco would not have been as enjoyable if we didn't stay at the Tuscan Inn. The service was what you would expect from a 5 star hotel in the city but it was much more personalised. This service continued from housekeeping, to concierge to reception to evening assistances. Wine tasting from 5 - 6pm was an additional bonus giving us the ability to taste some of the Napa Valley's fantastic drops. Having travelled from Australia, I would recommend anyone to stay here whether travel for pleasure or business!!! Awesome experience

review.title: When can we go again...
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly & helpful. Great location. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Location, Excellent Value
review.reviewText: Excellent value for location, cleanliness and amenities. Rooms and baths are on the small side, but acceptable. The attached restaurant Cafe Pescatore also a bonus.

review.title: GREAT OVERALL HOTEL!!
review.reviewText: This is a great overall hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great and the hotel is less expensive than several others in the same area. It also has a great little restaurant below and within walking distance of the heart of the Wharf.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We stayed for seven nights. Front desk personnel were great. There was a free safety deposit box to use. The bed was very comfortable, so we slept great. Coffee in the morning was good. The evening wine reception was enjoyable. Staff at the wine reception we very friendly. Very close to get to Fisherman's Wharf, the cable car stop, the bus to the North Beach neighborhood (for Italian food). Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay and would return.

review.title: Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: Hotel experience good apart from overnight noise from the roads outside the hotel. If we stayed again we would definately recommend a room that dosent face either of the roads. Free wine from 5-6pm was a nice touch!

review.title: watch out for valet parking
review.reviewText: not a bad place to stay except they hit you with a $50 overnight parking fee that you won't hear about until you are on your way out. They charged me the "oversized" rate for a Chevy Tahoe.

review.title: Second Visit and will do Again in the Near Future
review.reviewText: Love this little hotel. The rooms are small but cozy and make you fell right at home. Both my wife and I love the locality of the hotel to the Wharf and Pier 39.

review.title: Not again
review.reviewText: Parking is $38.00 a night plus tax and you aren't allowed to get to your car, valet only. One public computer in the lobby, so bring your own. Hotel staff nice but not friendly.

review.title: First visit to city
review.reviewText: This was the perfect hotel for a young couple like us (early 20s) on our first visit to San Francisco. It's right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf so all of those attractions are walking distance. The room was clean, comfortable and pretty. Our new favorite restaurant La Trappe is walking distance from here. The staff was super helpful too and answered all of our noob touristy questions. When we go back to the city (definitely going back) we're staying here again.

review.title: Quaint, Cozy Hotel on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Adorable room, though a little small. Lovely little hotel, with wine tastings every evening. Parking overnight is overpriced though at $42.

review.title: Great hotel - located in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: Overall I was very satisfied with the hotel and room accommondations. I would come back and stay there again. The only thing that I was not satisfied with was the cost of the parking, it was too expensive. I'm not sure why they charge so much. The rest of my trip down to LA and San Diego, I stayed at two other Best Westerns and never paid as much as I did in San Fransisco. The only down fall!!

review.title: Cosy and nice!
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a lovely stay for a week at the Best Western Tuscann Inn Fisherman's Wharf.The hotel is very quaint and certainly coy-looking. The lobby is beautifully decorated in a simple yet elegant way. The room we took was a Standard King room. My husband was floored by the decor of the room because it is certainly different compared to most hotels. There are little details here and there that stand out!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Great Location, staff was very helpful with information about local sites. We were on a quick trip and only had 1 night in San Fransisco and wanted to see as much as possible. This was the cleanest motel we stayed in. We stayed in 6 different hotels in 6 nights. Room was very small, so if your going to spend any time there expect to be cramped.

review.title: Walking distance to Fisherman's Attraction
review.reviewText: Staff are corteous, the place is clean. the only pros is that the heater is not working, they said they'll gonna fix it but till we left after 3 nights, it wasn't fix at all. We didn't insist on having it fixed anyway coz coming from the east coast, we can definitely stand a cold weather! It meet our needs though...its proximity to Fisherman's wharf attraction...its really just a short block away!

review.title: Clean & Convenient
review.reviewText: Stayed two nights and found the room to be very clean, with a comfortable bed, although a bit on the small side. A.M. coffee of very good quality and taste. Very convenient to F Car, buses and piers.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel to stay at. The concierge was very helpful and the wine social in the evening was fun. Plus it is a good location in relation to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: The sound isolation is poor. The deep, meaning conversation my neighbors were having was audible throughout the night. Everything else was pretty much fine.

review.title: Impressed with this particular Best Western, considering the cost
review.reviewText: This location is near everything you want to see in San Francisco and also staff is very friendly and helpful. I will stay here again for sure.

review.title: Would recomend
review.reviewText: Was very happy with the hotel it was nice clean and the room was very nice I had the king bed and was really happy. loved how close it was to the wharf and easy to find and very friendly staff

review.title: peaceful place
review.reviewText: nice place and close to almost everything you'll like to do and go in the fishermans area. employees very helpful.

review.title: Always friendly and inviting
review.reviewText: There are many choices to stay in the Wharf area, some more expensive and some less. I feel welcome and enjoy the friendly atmosphere of the hotel. There are many interesting people from all over the globe that gather around during the wine hour. It is a very convenient location, walking a couple of blocks to the restaurants. They do charge for parking, but the valets are prompt and couteous, worth it to me. I would return again and recommend it to others.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Many piers within 5 minutes walk of hotel, also the offices for my pre-arranged tours were; the first just across the street and the second within 5 mins walk.

review.title: Would definitely stay here on next visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Small but very tastefully appointed and well equiped room. Complimentary coffee and biscotti in front of the fireplace each morning was a nice touch. Close to activities at Fishermans Wharf but far enough away to be quiet.

review.title: very pleased
review.reviewText: Location was great. Great access to the Fisherman's warf area. Across the street was a double decker tour bus company which was convenient. The conceirge was extremely helpful and made our arrangements for the tour and recommended restaurants. The hotel was actually a lot nicer than I expected.

review.title: An adventure that we will never forget
review.reviewText: As a first timer to San Francisco. It was a treat and an adventure that we will never forget. The hotel was within walking distance to the wharf. The bed was comfortable, like I was sleeping in my own bed. If you enjoy fine dining, seafood from street vendors, shopping and sight seeing this is the place to go.

review.title: Love the afternoon cocktail reception!
review.reviewText: Great Location!!! Friendly staff, and the daily cocktail in the lobby was such a plus! Rooms were small, but comfortable.

review.title: Great location, very clean and very friendly............
review.reviewText: My room was quite comfortable. The location is just perfect for visiting San Francisco. It's centrally located to most any mode of transportation allowing access to the entire city. I will return to San Francisco and to the Tuscan Inn.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, great location for Fisherman's Wharf area. Computer available with internet free of charge is a great access - we weren't travelling with a laptop so this was really handy. Staff were very friendly and we had a lovely meal at the Italian restaurant next door. Only criticism is that there was a persistent noise from fans from outside the room which overlooked a courtyard (along with lots of their other rooms). We were jetlagged and slept well but if we hadn't been, I would have asked for an alternative room. Room was cleverly designed to make the best use of the space and was extremely comfortable.

review.title: Great location, but needs updates.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Tuscan BW in November, 2008. The location is perfect for visiting Fisherman's Wharf, and steps away from the cable car. We had a suite, which was small, and the window in the bedroom did not close. The street noise was bothersome if you were trying to get some sleep. The windows should really be cleaned of the bird droppings. Hotel is only 4 stories, so if you are looking for a view, look elsewhere. All and all, it was worth the reasonable price for a suite.

review.title: Good Value, Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable. The staff was nice and helpful. Also, it was a great location, near Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, Coit Tower, and Lombard Street.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel. It has all that you need. There is a bit of character, too. The coffee and biscoti in the lobby in the morning was great!

review.title: Nice hotel but small room!
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn is a good hotel to stay at if you wish to check out the local attractions at Fisherman's Wharf or Pier 39. It is literally a 2 minute walk to reach each of these places, and is well positioned amongst other high quality hotels. The hotel is quite clean and well maintained, and the staff are quite friendly as well. The only thing that we were disappointed with was the comfort of our room. Although also clean and well maintained, it was unbelievably small, with barely room to walk around the queen bed. I also felt that the bed might have been a little old as it tended to sag just slightly in the middle, which of course leaves you climbing for the sides during the night. Bag minding service was helpful though (no charge for that) and lobby was comfortable when waiting for our transfer. Overall satisfactory, but rooms could be larger and beds a little newer.

review.title: Close to Wharf
review.reviewText: Staff couldn't be more helpful in getting rooms sorted out, there were 9 people in our group. Hotel and rooms were clean and quite fresh considering most hotels are old in this area. Easy access to all of San Francisco from hotel. Good hotel if travelling with kids. Restaurants and shops close by.

review.title: great place to stay right in the middle of Fisherman's warf
review.reviewText: Very unique bontique hotel right in the middle of Fisherman's warf. Great service and very friendly staff. Only complaint was the noise from the street at night. We stayed 6 nights. The first two were in a room facing North Point St. The hotel moved us to a room facing the courtyard for the last 4 nights. Slept great after that.

review.title: Easy access to hop on hop off buss & fisherman's warf
review.reviewText: Nice accomodations. Friendly staff & eager to help.

review.title: tuscan inn- san fran
review.reviewText: I JUST LOVED THE FISHERMAN'S WHARF TUSCAN INN IN SAN FRANCISCO.THE ROOMS WERE BEAUTIFUL, THE LOBBY WAS BEAUTIFUL. WE ONLY HAD A LITTLE PROBLEM CALLING IN AND TRYING TO GET AHOLD OF SOMEONE A COUPLE OF TIMES. ALSO THE PARKING, ITS LIKE $30 SOME DOLLARS A DAY FOR PARKING AND ITS KIND OF A MUST SINCE THERES NO OVERNIGHT PARKING. IT WAS SO GREAT HAVING THE FISHERMAN'S WHARF WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE! OVERALL 1 OUT OF 5 I GAVE THE HOTEL A 4!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Best Western Tuscan Inn at Fisherman's Wharf was very nice. The room was exceptionally clean, had all of the amenities we needed, and was in a great location - within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, the cable car station, great shopping, and many wonderful restaurants. The concierge was helpful, but not very knowledgable...we were given inaccurate information. But I would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

review.title: Don't expect much
review.reviewText: From the hotel pictures and price I expected the rooms to be more clean or at least the bedding. The room is decent size, bathroom is big but the bedding felt dirty and itchy. I didn't feel like they did a great job at keeping it clean. I will not stay here again b/c of the bedding. It is a good location to visit the piers; walking distance..but just don't trust the beds.

review.title: Great location lovely hotel
review.reviewText: The location was fantastic, easy walking to all the sights on Fishermans Wharf and lots of great restaurants. We liked the complimentary tea and coffee in the morning and wine tasting in the afternoon. The restaurant was excellent. I would book it again.

review.title: Very nice stay
review.reviewText: loved the managers wine hour. concierge was very helpful. convienent location.

review.title: 2 Nights at Tuscan In
review.reviewText: Excellent location, speedy check in/out. The room was perfectly adequate & the attached Italian restaurant was a gem, if a little slow

review.title: Make sure you ask!
review.reviewText: First of all, Expedia needs to make sure their pictures of the rooms are up to date. We did not not receive a room at all like the picture. Also, after spending 4-days, at check out they asked us for the mini bar key. They did not give us one during check in and we could have utilized the refrigerator for the 4-days we were there. I know California is "Go Green" per say, but when you're travelling with a woman, you need more than 1 towell per person.....fact!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The little extras were nice - the free wine in the evening and the coffee in the morning (and it was great coffee). The room was small but nice - the mirrors helped it from feeling too small. The location was the best part, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf where most of the tours start.

review.title: Great hotel! Excellent location
review.reviewText: We had a marvelous stay at the Tuscan hotel. We were locatred in the very midst of everything. A few blocks to the main shopping street and Pier 39. A block from the cable car.In front of a nice grocery and around the corner from another large one. The hotel has complimenatary coffe,tea and biscotti every morning starting at 6. Every afternoon they have a free wine bar that many people took advantage of. The conceriege was amazing and the cleaning staff were quick to clean and did a greeat job. We will stay at this hotel every time we venture to San Fransisco.

review.title: Good price, Great hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed for our anniversary. We found the hotel to be more than expected. Because we were staying only a few blocks off the wharf I expected to pay way more than we did. The price coupled with the wonderful room was a great deal! We would recommend this to anyone wanting to escape for a "special" trip.

review.title: Wow! What a great trip!!!!!
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf (2 blocks)and all public transportation, including cable car. Concierge was great. Wine happy hour each day; biscotti and tea/coffee in the mornings. Couldn't have asked for anything more in the place!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great safe walking location to the Fisherman's Wharf, Peir 39 and Cannery Row. The hotel is very charming with an Old World Italian flair. When we return to San Francisco we will definately not stay any where else.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and polite. We needed to change rooms after the first night and everything was handled wonderfully. The lobby was a great place to hang out in the morning - reading the paper, drinking coffe and planning the day.

review.title: Great weekend at Tuscan Inn....
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Stayed there with my wife, brother and few friends. The hotel service was great, we needed some extra towels and they were at the door within 10 minutes. Overall, the room was comfortable, although kind of small. However, this was San Francisco, so space is limited. It was conveniantly located with walking distance of Pier 39, which is the heart of Fishermans Wharf. So you can drink a few beers and walk to your hotel. The only negative is the parking. There is no self park, and you must pay $38 PER NIGHT to have them park your vehicle. So plan that in to your budget if you drive or rent a car for the weekend. But I would deinitely recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys staying at a clean, friendly hotel.

review.title: Would stay there again, loved it.
review.reviewText: I would stay there planning on another trip with friends and will stay at this hotel.

review.title: Great Place & Location! Location! Location!
review.reviewText: This place is a great place to stay at. The hotel is very clean, and centrally located to everything. If you need to head to Downtown you could always jump on a cable car to get there or simply use any of the other Muni System of transportation. The hotel has good room service if you need it, as well as a restaurant with access from the hotel. Parking is $38.00 which isn't bad for hotel parking in San Francisco. I would suggest you leave you car at home and fly, because your not going to use your car at all while you are there. If you want to go on any excursions there are plenty of tour companies that you could use at a fair price.

review.title: Good hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText: Although not very promising from the outside The Tuscan Inn was much better inside. The public areas were clean and well decorated,whilst the bedroom was tastefully decorated in black and white with claret ascents. Staff were friendly and helpful. The afternoon "Happy Hour" provided a chance to talk to other travellers and swop holiday tips.

review.title: NOT IMPRESSED
review.reviewText: MY HUSBAND AND I HAD TO SLEEP IN SEPERATE BEDS THEY WERE TO SMALL FOR 2 PEOPLE TO SLEEP IN . THERE WERE COBWEBS IN BED ROOM . TV,CRACKLED,WHEN WATCHING IT , WE HAD TO REPLACE BATTERIES IN REMOTE , THEY HAD NO LAUNDRY FACILITES , FOR THEM TO WASH YOUR LAUNDRY WAS OUT RAGES.. WE WILL NOT STAY THERE AGAIN

review.title: Very comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: When we got to the hotel, they did not have the room we were supposed to have for my 18-year old son and me -two beds. They suggested a queen bed and a roll away bed. I refused and they suggested a King bed with a hideabed queen sofa. We took this which worked out fine. The rooms are small but decorated very nice. The bed and bedding is extremely comfortable. It's a couple of blocks from the wharf so it's in a quiet area. To stay right on the main drag of the wharf would be very noisy. There's a bus stop right outside the door. You have to plan to walk to eat and sight see. We used it as a central point to see all the SF sights -by bus to Haight Ashberry and Golden Gate Park, walked to North Beach, China Town, the Pier and took the night-time tour of Alcatrez, took the Trolley to Union Square and did a bus tour of Muir Woods and Sausalito. The concierge was always very helpful.

review.title: Excellent hotel. Great location. Would stay again
review.reviewText: Everything at this hotel was top notch except the concierge. They didn't seem as knowledgeable as I thought they should be. They were not very helpful with transportation or restuarant suggestions. Would not let this keep me away. Everything else was great.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn is located conveniently in the heart of most of San Francisco's attractions. Although the room was small and bureau space limited, the room was comfortable in all other aspects. The staff was very helpful, Each afternoon there is a wine/beer reception in the lobby which is a great way to start off the evening activities. The hotel is best for couples as there is little to recommend for children.

review.title: It was a horrible experience!
review.reviewText: You had to wait in line for everything, there was only one person in the lobby. The tub was not working and it was clogged. The room smelled like an ashtray and it was a nonsmoking. We paid for overnight parking and the we got a parking ticket while they were taking care of parking; manager took forever to resolve this problem. On top of everything they were constructing right in the middle of the hotel; there were drilling everyday from 7 a.m. The hotel was a nightmare...

review.title: I would stay here again
review.reviewText: great location, great happy hour..........

review.title: It was a nightmare!!
review.reviewText: WE booked this hotel and it was nicely decorated but customer service was horrible... there was only one person working on the lobby and valet... you had to wait for everything but that is not all! They are constructing inside the hotel and the noise started at 7 a.m. the room was nonsmoking and it smelled like cigarrete really bad; plus the tub was not working and it made an awful sound. You have to pay for overnight parking which it was o.k but the worst part was that we got a parking ticket because they park the cars outside... we have to wait for a managet to settle the parking ticket and he took forever to resolve this problem. If you want to enjoy your vacation don't stay in this hotel.. it was a nightmare!!

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Very nice Best Western hotel. Good location for Fisherman's wharf. Free parking from 7pm to 7 am on the street!

review.title: Location,Location, Location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was perfect for us. Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39 and shopping were all just a short walk away. Easy access to public transportation as well. We really enjoyed walking to the neighborhood behind the hotel in the evening for dinner. Lots of little Italian restaurants and cafes to choose from. Sit outdoors while you dine to experience the feel of the neighborhood.

review.title: More than Expected
review.reviewText: Much more than I expected from a best western. Rooms seemed like they were recently renovated. A little small, but for the amount of time we were actually in the room it wasn't a big deal. Wine tasting every night was a great perk!

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: Had a excellent stay at this hotel. The room was clean and in excellent condition. The staff was very helpful. The valet parking (only option for parking) was a bit pricey. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Some flaws, but overall a pleasant stay.
review.reviewText: The staff for the greater part were all attentive and good at their jobs, especially housekeeping. I had one negative encounter with a front desk clerk who was rather surly, yet all the rest that I encountered during my 5 day stay, were most helpful and cordial. My room was very clean, yet could well be updated. The bathrooms have been recently updated, yet the rooms themselves need to be as well. Not shabby by any means, just not fresh. The $38. per night parking fee is too high, yet a search of the area indicated that with it's in & out privileges, it is the norm for that area. 1 block North of the hotel is a 24 hour parking structure that is $20 for 24 hours, however you do not get in & out privileges. As the city has such great public transportation, parking your car & using that instead is a more cost effective, and less frustrating. Parking in San Francisco is often difficult to find, and many meters give you but 6 minutes for each quarter.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: Our stay was nice. The room is small, but has everything you need... it's not like you are going to SF to stay in your hotel. They do not have breakfast, but instead have an evening wine hour, which is very nice. I would recommend it again. It was nice.

review.title: Very impressive!!
review.reviewText: Had no idea where to stay at Fisherman's Wharf, but read a good review of this hotel and thought I would check it out. It was lovely! The staff were friendly and helfpul, and the location was perfect to stroll around the Wharf area. You can't beat the price and you felt like you were staying in a 4 star hotel!

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: The room, though smallish, was adequate with a comfortable bed and strong water pressure for showering. The parking fee seemed a bit high, but considering the location near the wharf, I guess I wasn't too surprised.

review.title: Would go back again
review.reviewText: Very easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf close to Ferries did not have to worry about transport. So Hotel was a great location for me.

review.title: Relax back at base camp
review.reviewText: Relaxing hotel to return to after a hard day's work walking San Francisco. Comfortable big lobby for free a.m. coffee & biscotti and free wine & Italian beer evening reception. Nice place to visit with other travelers. Easy walk to the Wharf.

review.title: Very comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: I stayed here with my kids on a little get-away and we loved it! The room decor was really nice and the beds were very comfortable. We loved the friendly cocktail hour and tea/coffee with biscotti in the morning. It is very conveniently located next to a Barnes and Nobel, Trader Joe's and a block from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Best Sleep Ever as a traveler
review.reviewText: I have tried various hotels and Inns throughout California. The Tuscan Inn at the Wharf in San Francisco had the best beds ever. I thought I was in my own bed at home. I was planning to try each an every Inn or Hotel in the Wharf area of San Francisco when I visit-- however now that I have stayed at the Tuscan Inn -- I am planning stay there when in town. Not only was the bed great- so is the service, the rooms are very comfortable -- if one has their lap top - then free wireless access Plus it is really walking distance to the Wharf and other interest along the bay.

review.title: great location for the price
review.reviewText: steps from fisherman's wharf and all the action,the tours and the restaurants.Would go back anytime.

review.title: Ideal Location
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly and helpful. Wine tasting and "nibbles" at 5pm was a nice touch. Ideal location for San Francisco attractions. Some rather noisy building works were taking place in the room above us from early in the morning which detracted a bit from the overall experience. In fairness when prompted they delayed the start time on the Sunday.

review.title: Great Value & Location
review.reviewText: My fiance and I spent four nights and it was great. The rooms were very cozy with their italian flare. The conceriege was extremely helpful and available from early in the morning until 8:00 each night to help us plan our next excursion. The location is great - it's within walking distance to the wharf as well as North Point where all of the less touristy restaurants are. A great value in Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Exceeded Expectations
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded our expectations. I can't remember what the star level was, but I would put it in the 4-star level, based on my experience.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Tuscan Inn. The room was tastful and clean, and the staff was very friendly. It's a great location for touring the sites in San Fran. We walked to Lombard St., the cablecar turnaround near Ghiaradelli Sq., along Embarcadero, to a bike rental.

review.title: hotel made for a great vacation
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was very helpful and printed out all directions for any site we wanted to go to.It was a short walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and all the restuarants in the vicinity.The free wine and beer hour from 5:00 to 6:00 pm daily was very enjoyable and you were able to meet people from all over the world. We would definitely stay again on our next visit.

review.title: Very convenient to Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, good location

review.title: Room is too small
review.reviewText: Reception in check in ,let me feel She didn't care of me

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location and close to Pier 39. Parking alittle expensive but if you want to be in the area great hotel for the price.

review.title: Great place on the wharf
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. Wine hour was fun with opportunity to meet people traveling from all over the world. Room was not spacious but very comfortable. Location was excellent. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: Very Small room, but good enough if all you want to do is sleep. Only problem I had was the $40 a night parking fee.

review.title: Garbage
review.reviewText: This hotel is relying on it's 2005 rating. the sink leaked all over the towels and I had to chase down the towels myself, the room door opens directly into the corridor, breakfast consist of cold coffee and a pile of broken biscotti, you'll wait a half hour to check in, and the valet parking cost is obscenely high. Absolutely lousy service, and when I told the person at the front desk they smiled and said I'm sorry and proceeded to wait on the next guest. Stay away!

review.title: Satisfactory Stay
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was fine. Front desk and cleaning staff were courteous and polite. Concierges were all extremely helpful with SF info and booking any activity we required. Room was always clean but on the small side which was not unexpected. Fridge was noisy. Had a hard time getting hot water from shower in the mornings. Enjoyed the complimentary morning coffee and biscotti as well as the wine and snacks each afternoon. Hotel was handy to everything including grocery store and public transportation but off the main drag so was quiet.

review.title: Tuscan Inn 2nd stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and simple to get to. close to warf, nice ombiance. two issues this time. maybe trivial but irritating all the same. one, the hot water took literally 20 minutes to get to the room. two, the remote for the tv wouldn't change channels, volumne worked but not the channels, even tried going to the tv and using it's controls the old fashion way, nothing.

review.title: Perfect Stay for the Perfect Trip
review.reviewText: My husband and I loved The Tuscan Inn. It was perfectly located on Fisherman's Wharf in walking distance to all the nearby ammenties that Fisherman's Wharf has to offer. We loved that the cable cars were located right behind our hotel. So thatmade it very convienant for us to travel down to Union Square. I personally loved the 5-6 p.m. hosted "wine hour" at the Tuscan Inn, that was fun! I would definantly stay here again when I return to San Francisco, it was the perfect stay for our perfect trip!

review.title: Id stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the best location. Walking distance to everything. The only problem we had was when we went to go to bed one night there was some stuff on our sheets. We called the front desk and they came up right away and changed them on the spot and reported the maid. They also brought us up champagne. I would recommend staying here. Everyone one was very nice and willing to help us at any time. It is newly remodeled and very comfy beds.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Right near all the tourist attractions. A block from the wharf. A short walk to Little Italy, Chinatown, Embarcadero. Super friendly staff. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Book this hotel, You will not be dissapointed. Very nice and the afternoon wine is great.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Room was relatively small, but comfortable and clean. Noise was my only complaint---coming from piping in the walls and heating units in other rooms.

review.title: Best Western Tuscan Inn Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Only suggestion is a better, more options continnetal breakfast.

review.title: Best Western Tuscan Inn
review.reviewText: The hotel was very good. The evening wine tasting was always fun because you met other guests and socialized. Location was good for Fisherman's wharf area. The only problem I would mention, they started to do some renovation on our departure day and it was noisy and dusty.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: remote( t.v.) had dead batteries,ants in the bathroom,and scattered throughout the room. left over food in the refreg. turn off water,& no hot water for about 5 hrs. and this room was a prem. delux.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I both work jobs that make the holidays a very stressful time of year. So with that we decided to go on a small getaway to San Francisco, to sort of unwind. We were only there for 3 days and weren't planning to spend too much time in our hotel but we didn't want to stay at some cheap place. The Tuscan Inn was perfect. Its right near the wharf, cable car lines, bus stops and trolley. The staff was very nice. The room was what we asked for (a smoking king). It was small but cozy. The bed was comfy. On the last day the check out is at noon but we didn't need to be at the airport till 8:30. We told them our situation the day before. They let us extend out till 2 (the latest) and after that they let us leave some baggage there for free so we could do some more sightseeing before we left. Overall I was pleased.
