review.title: All is good
review.reviewText: This Hotel was a good place to stay. When I asked for help they helped. It was close to Pear 39(Walking Distance). I look forward to my next trip.

review.title: I would stay here again.
review.reviewText: The location is great. Right near Safeway (grocery store), Walgreens & 24 Fitness. Room was very cozy. I love the coffee & biscotti offered every morning and the wine offered every evening was great. I was able to met and socialize with other guests. The hotel staff was very friendly and courteous.

review.title: Great time
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful time, great location for being my first timer. I enjoyed with no problems at all. Spent most of the day out taking in all the sites.

review.title: Pretty Good Deal
review.reviewText: This hotel was a good price for the location and amenities. I had a little trouble with variable hot water and smoke infiltration from an errant traveler, but the room itself was clean and well-appointed.

review.title: Great Spot!
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean. Very freindly staff. Decor was nice. Great lobby area and fun beer and wine social at 5-6. {included] Would go back. Nice and close to everything that Fisherman's wharf has to offer.

review.title: Amazing Hospitality / Great Location / Very Small Rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located at Fisherman's Wharf. The staff is extremely helpful and available at all hours. Easy access to trolley, the bus, stores and Pier 39. The rooms are on the small side for even a "boutique" hotel. Two of us in the room was too many with 2 pieces of luggage there was no floor space to walk around the bed. We didn't spend much time in the room so overall we would stay there again for the location.

review.title: SF Trip
review.reviewText: Hotel service was great

review.title: A bit disappointed
review.reviewText: I was a bit disappointed in that the first 2 nights I was kept awake by a noisy bar frig.I finally pulled the plug after nothing was done to fix the problem.Third night there was no hot water for a bath.But other than these problems the hotel was clean and the workers were pleasant.But overall The area it was situated in was great.Too bad they didn't offer anything to make up for my problems.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Air Conditioning in the room was not funtioning properly. Moment we entered the room noticed some dust on the floor. (might be some thing left out by previous guest). Parking charges are about 40$ a day. Overall look and feel of the Hotel is not so impressive. I have stayed at another hotel in SFO which was a nice place to be in. I would not recommend this Tuscan Inn.

review.title: Wanna Go Back
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay! Hotel is in a good part of San Francisco. Near the pier and so lots of shopping within walking distance. Great Restaurants in the area.

review.title: San Francisco Best Western small rooms
review.reviewText: The Best Western Tuscan Inn is a very nice hotel. They have the best pillows i have ever layed on. However i must say that i was a little disappointed in the room size. On the virtual tour it looks alot biggier then what it does in real life and the king suite is the same size as the queen except they give you a table and a extra chair. But majority of the room, is basically the bed. the service is great the staff is very friendly and willing to help overall it is a nice hotel but they have very samll rooms

review.title: Nice surprise
review.reviewText: Nice clean updated rooms and lobby. Pleasantly surprised at how comfortable it was. Bathrooms were clean but not as updated.

review.title: Great place to stay, parking a bit difficult
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean, very quiet, and very comfortable. Hotel is only about 2-3 blocks from the wharf. Parking at the hotel was quite pricey, but what else would you expect in San Francisco? I will definitely stay here the next time I travel to San Fran and I recommend it to others as well.

review.title: goood
review.reviewText: it is pretty good.

review.title: Overall Not Bad
review.reviewText: The room wasn't the biggest but it was still nice. There is a mirror behind the bed the size of the wall to make it feel bigger than it actually is. The front enterance to the hotel is a nice place to sit and enjoy a drink.

review.title: Tuscan Inn at Holiday time
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely well presented and the prices were very affordable. The location is great. The front desk was very efficient. All in all a fabulous stay.

review.title: Home away from home...
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great choice! The rooms were very comfortable and clean, and the "happy hour" from 5:00-6:00 for the hotel guests in the lobby (free wine, beer and appies)was so much fun (we actually met some people from Alberta who knew very good friends of ours and we felt like instand family)! The concierge was extremely helpful, booking our tours and giving us great advice. He was even willing to go downtown to pick up some boots I was going to buy the day before but never got around to it! It's located in a great area, just a block from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Best Western
review.reviewText: No complaints at all. Quiet,ideal for tram into City. Close to Piers on front. Good all round

review.title: nice-but
review.reviewText: when you have a late checkout time---maids pounding on door, when you have slept for 3 hours

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine but DO NOT get a room on the street!! It is very noisy. Our first night we had a room on the street and there were people partying in the parking lot across the street until 3:00 in the morning and they were very noisy. We moved to an inside room and it was much much better. The rooms are small but adequate. Since one doesn't spend alot of time in the room I would stay at the hotel again.

review.title: A very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We were attending the San Francisco Blues Festival and this hotel was only about a mile away from the festival. it is good value for a hotel in this part of San Francisco. Close to the cable cars and the Fisherman's Warf. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel for my in-laws for their 50th wedding anniversary and all 5 of us adult children and spouses suprised them with a visit also. The hotel staff were so cooperative, friendly and helpful about keeping us kids' "big secret" until the evening dinner. Mom and Dad were so suprised!!! The rooms were very nice and really clean and the evening reception was enjoyed by all of us. Great wine and biscotti!!! The location was superb and close to all attractions. We really enjoyed the "Tuscan Inn" experience. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Great Service, Cramped Space in Wheelchair Access Room
review.reviewText: Clean, bright rooms, great service, friendly staff. Fun happy hour 5-6 pm-all you can drink. Wheelchair accessible room very small, hard to manuever easily. No roll-in shower and tipsy shower chair. Ask for transfer bench at desk.

review.title: Still Our Favorite
review.reviewText: The ambience of this hotel more than made up for any touristy aspect of the Fisherman's Wharf. The property has been updated since we were there, but the impeccable service remains unchanged. There was a problem with an elevator being out of service briefly, but is was repaired right away.

review.title: great little place
review.reviewText: This hotel is well worth the money. If you never been to San Francisco this a great place to stay. It is right at fishermans warf walking distance to all of the atractions. We will return.

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great spot for sightseeing. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and comfortable and the restaurant was excellent. Also everyday between 5-6pm they give out free wine in the hotel reception. If I went back to San Francisco I would stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Room is little bit small for 2 adults and 2 children
review.reviewText: Overall hotel is good. Provide free coffee in the morning and wine tasting in the early evening. Concieage is very helpful.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff,comfortable rooms and well situated for sight seeing.

review.title: Excellent location at Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location, within very close walking distance to Pier 39, and just a 10 minute walk to where you can board the Alcatraz ferry (well worth a visit). It has an excellent Italian restaurant on its premises and the staff are very friendly and helpful. After visiting other areas of San Francisco, I would still choose this hotel and location if I were to visit San Francisco again.

review.title: Great location!!!
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and accomodating...room was spacious but I wish that they had some rooms with queen beds. The wine happy hour in the lobby is a nice way to meet other people. Location is perfect and within walking distance to many attractions.

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: We were quite happy with the hotel. Liked the location which is only a short walk from the Wharf and the cable car to Union Square. The Italian theme is not too pervasive and the attached restaurant was pretty good. The room was a little small but well laid out and well kept. Free drinks at certain times of the day are a nice touch as it is the hotel car which you can book to take you back to the airport. The only gripe is the single glazing with the traffic noise (tour buses often idle their engine more than they should) and the vending machine of random drinks. Overall I would recommend this as a place to stay

review.title: Honeymoon on the Bay
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located close to the wharf whithout being right in the middle of it. Upon mentioning it was our honeymoon we were upgraded by the front desk from a queen to a king bed which was very nice. The complimentary wine hour was very much appreciated and gave us a chance to chat with a variety of people, many of whom were on their 20th or 25th anniversary themselves. The only gripe we had was the hotel's restaurant which seemed VERY overpriced and the food/service was only so-so. Overall, very nice hotel and we would consider staying there again.

review.title: San Francisco's secret
review.reviewText: This hotel was by far one of the best hotels we stayed at during our holidays in California and would recommend it to anyone who wants good value for their dollar. Very impressed with room service and cleanliness and overall service of staff. Met some nice people during the hotel's daily wine tasting between 4-6pm The location was ideal, close to Fisherman's wharf, cable car. Will recommend to all of my Canadian friends.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Location, perfect. Very clean and great personnel working the desk and house keeping

review.title: Would have been okay for half the price.
review.reviewText: By far the most money I have spent at a hotel, with the worst room. Decoration was okay, but room was falling apart (shower shot water onto ceiling, toilet paper holder hanging by a thread, lamps didn't work, coffee pot dirty, windows were jammed shut). I filled out a comment card and handed it to the front desk manager, who asked me how everything was. When I reluctantly told her (I don't like complaining), she seemed to get defensive and didn't want to hear any more. Nice free wine reception every day, no pool or jacuzzi, mandatory valet parking for $40 per night not disclosed prior to check-in.

review.title: Very Comfortable and accessible to the Wharf
review.reviewText: loved the bed and restaurant with the hotel

review.title: Can't wait to go back !
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel unseen through Expedia,and hoped for the best....we got it! Great location,lovely room,superb service.Make sure you make the wine reception(every evening).The attached restaurant 'Pescatore'serves excellent food at very reasonable prices.For max quiet and a pleasant view, book an inside facing room.End your stay in style,hotel will arrange limo transport to the airport for no more than the cost of a taxi.

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: The Tuscan was perfectly located for a first time visitor to SF. We walked or rode public transportation to all the tourist sites. There were plenty of nearby restaurants to choose from. The hotel staff was very helpful. We enjoyed the coffee, hot chocolate, biscotti in the morning and the wine reception in the evening, all complimentary. We would definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: I was pleased with the location of the hotel 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf and few more blocks to The Embarcadero. I checked in after a long drive PM staff was not as friendly as AM staff. It was 5 mins past check out time and recieved a call if I needed more time. Valet Parking and Bell Hops friendly. Bed was extremely comfortable! I saw a few pets around in the lobby not sure if they allow pets in the hotel.

review.title: Would go back again anytime
review.reviewText: The hotel had a great location. Close proximity to lots of sightseeing. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Good choice in SF
review.reviewText: Stayed 3 nights here and found it to be in a very good location; rooms were the smallest of the 5 places we stayed along the CA coast but very attractive and well appointed. Enjoyed the king sized bed though the queen pull-out wasn't very comfortable. Staff was helpful; afternoon wine is a nice touch and many gathered in the lobby for it; same with biscotti breakfast.

review.title: Very happy
review.reviewText: Great little hotel, good location, room nice size. Service great

review.title: A bit of a mixed bag
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine - modern, clean and efficient. We had booked our room months before and were horrified when, on the first night, we got no sleep at all because of a vast, incredibly noisy air conditioning system right outside our third floor window. It was dreadful.! We complained vociferously through the night (12am and 3 am) and again in the morning. They agreed to move us but refused any refund as 'we had already paid'! They gave us a $50 voucher for the hotel restaurant which we didn't want. The 2nd room was quieter but also smaller. The manager said that they had had complaints before from some guests but others had not found the noise particularly disturbing. The free drinks from 5-7pm were a very good deal. Hotel staff were pleasant.

review.title: To much trouble
review.reviewText: The hotel was hot. We where given cards to get into a room that was already taken then after that they swiched our room. Well we could not get in that room either. The bell hop had to come and give us another set of cards. It took an hour to get into our room and, we got there at 2:00am. The room was not clean. Towels where hard and not "fresh". We stay in hotels and this hotel was not worth it!!!

review.title: pretty much what one would expect
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were pleasant, the rooms were very good and the location was withing walking distance of many attractions. While we have stayed at better for cheaper, the location is hard to beat and there was always someone available to answer our questions. No really positive or negative surprises either way. We had asked for a courtyard facing room which I would recommend, otherwise it could be quite noisy.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: This hotel was so convient in it's location, it was clean, staff were friendly and the morning coffee and afternoon wine were a nice touch. We would stay there again.

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: Could do better on breakfast

review.title: Very comfortable hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: Extremely comfortable hotel, in good location for all attractions. Staff friendly and helpful. Homely atmosphere and nighly reception to meet other guests and discuss attractions. Hotel good size, very comfortable and clean. Nothing too much trouble for staff. Definitely a good choice.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: I travel to San Francisco at least once a year and have stayed many places and find this to be a very comfortable, centrally located hotel at Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was very courteous and the wine tasting in the evening was great. If you are going to san franciso you can go anywhere with a muni pass from this starting point. Would definately stay here again.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel. Hotel staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable. Concierge Cliff extremely helpful. Met some wonderful guests at afternoon happy hour.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay, the staff was helpful. Our room was not ready when we arrived, they strored our luggage for us. Again when we departed, our flight was aftere check out and they stored everything. Everything we wanted to do was within a reasonable walking distance and we were given suggestions on great places to eat and tours to take. We would stay here again.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Great location, but not as high priced as other name brand hotels. Small but comfortable. Friendly people.

review.title: ok for older travellers
review.reviewText: im 21 and from england, first time travelling to san francisco with my girlfriend.the hotel is very nice and the room is very cozy. close to all attractions and tours. 2 min walk to the warf. my only moan was that the hotel staff were not very friendly. it seemed a real effort for them to change a 100 doller travellers cheque and made a big fuss everytime i asked. had to carry 4 suitcases to our room from the reception and the bell boy still waited for a tip. on ur bike pal.

review.title: Pleasant surprise
review.reviewText: A European style boutique in the middle of Tourist America, with courteous and friendly service and cofortable, if a bit pretentious, decor. Nice amenities; all around good choice.

review.title: Praises all around!
review.reviewText: The location on the wharf was great. We were within walking distance of so many sights to see. The hotel restaurant was fabulous. The room was small but very cute and comfortable. The shampoos and lotions were herbal and smelled fantastic as well as felt good when used. they had a blow dryer as I forgot mine. The hotel staff was so very nice and accomodating. I definitely would go back to that hotel. We loved it!

review.title: Won't go back, very disapointing!
review.reviewText: The room itself was very nice and comfortable, however it was located right next to a generator for the building that sounded like a pulsating boat engine that shook the room and kept us up all night. When mentioned to front desk in the morning, the response was "oh, really." The concierge service was terrible. Upon calling down to inquire about nearby places to eat and get a glass of wine, we got an answering machine that stated someone would call back when they were available, no one ever called back. In the morning we asked for a nearby coffee shop to get a good cup of coffee and a pastry, we were sent about a mile away. When we walked back, we found 2 great coffee shops about 1/2 block away, in the other direction that we were sent. Very dissapointed!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is great and it's easy to get just about anywhere you want to go within a few blocks. Everything looked new and very clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The king room however was very small which made our stay a little cramped. Overall I think this is a nice hotel.

review.title: Horrible Housekeeping Services
review.reviewText: Housekeeping was real bad. We had to keep calling the night housekeeping service for shampoo, conditioner. They actually dug the shower cap out of the garbage and placed it back on the counter. Never got a new shower cap after that. We had to call 2 days after turning in some clothes to laundry services to get them back using same day service. They lost some articles of clothing, as well, but found them later. Other than that, the hotel was fine. If you stay there be sure to pack your own amenities.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, terrific location; no complaints at all.

review.title: Happy to return
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, reasonably priced but everything you wanted or needed was available. Very clean and comfortable, lovely staff all very willing to help. Good location on Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Hotel staff very friendly and knowledgeable about area attractions and locations. Our room was very clean and attractive. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good value and great location
review.reviewText: Just a stone's throw from Pier 39 and a short tram-ride to Market St, this is a well located hotel. Nice and clean, decent sized rooms and good value. Best bit was the free wine in reception at 5pm daily! :-)

review.title: I Truly Left My Heart in San Francisco---again!
review.reviewText: My best friend and I had a marvelous time at your hotel. From the time we arrived there to the date we left there--we were treated so friendly and kindly. All those we dealt with from the frontdesk, to the restaurant, to the bell-hops to the maids was such a pleasure and we surely will recommend your hotel to our families and friends. Another great feature is that you are only two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Thank you for making our vacation one to always remember. Your location was ideal in locating tour buses, cabs, trolleys, lots of shopping, good eating places nearby and very congenial people working and living there in your beautiful city.

review.title: would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: Best Western Tuscan Inn at Fishermans Wharf is a very nice hotel. Two blocks/5 minute walk to the waterfront,as a matter of fact is an easy walk to virtually anywhere in the Northside area. Very clean, well maintained. Everything looked to be in excellent condition from carpets to wallcoverings and furniture.Staff was very friendly and Concierge was extremely helpful.

review.title: Good Hotel - Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Good service, nice wine reception daily and good location. We were traveling with our daughter so we got 2 beds instead of the King and didn't realize it was 2 double beds. Beds were small and not real comfortable. Overall liked the hotel though.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Tuscan. It was a very good location. We were just 2 blocks from Pier 39 and one block to Cable Cars. The only thing I would have liked was for the Bathroom to be larger the sink area was very small.

review.title: Tuscan
review.reviewText: Great hotel, thanks!

review.title: Outstanding hotel (but a little noisy)
review.reviewText: This is an awesome hotel! Service was prompt and courteous and our room was clean and comfortable. We had two adults and two young kids and our "Deluxe King" room was the perfect size, with a king-sized bed and queen-sized fold-out couch. In the morning we enjoyed complimentary biscottis, coffee and hot chocolate from the lobby. The location is terrific and we were able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown and North Beach. The cable-car station is right around the block. My only complaint is that the windows allow a lot of street noise in and our room was off the main street of Northpoint. The middle-of-the night garbage trucks woke us up the first night (Thursday) but Friday and Saturday nights were much quieter. We would still definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Great Location Great Service
review.reviewText: We arrived at 10am and although our room was not available, the front desk offered to call us as soon as the room was ready WHICH THEY DID! The rooms are on the small side but very clean and the beds are so comfortable. We had a room on the courtyard so it was very quiet. The hotel restaurant was great! We ate breakfast there three times it was so good. Gave dinner a try and it was equally good. I was surprised since I don't expect such consistently good food from a hotel restaurant.

review.title: Above Expectations
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly staff, close to all the tourist attractions. The complimentary coffee/biscotti in the morning, and wine in the late afternoon was appreciated - it gave us a chance to meet other tourists. We highly recommend it!!

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Cost to park not included in rate. Parking rental car cost more than the daily rental rate.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Do not stay in a room that is facing the street if you want to get any sleep at night. Very noisy with all the vehicles goin up and down the street.Very disapointed with the parking rates you have to pay at the hotel on top of the hotel rate.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Great location only 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf restaurants and shops, Cable Car, Trolleys, within one block. Standard rooms arguably a little small, but King room we were upgraded to was damn fine for the two of us for 4 nights. An enjoyable stay and for the money we paid through Expedia, excellent value. Thoroughly enjoyed the Manager's drinks from 5 to 6 each night - a good opportunity to chat with other guests.

review.title: Could not find fault
review.reviewText: I Could not find fault with the hotel. the food was good but pricy,overall very good. Well situated with a great sea view

review.title: Loved It
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The location was good with easy access to public transport. The early evening wine tasting was a nice touch and the coffee and biscotti in the reception area at breakfast time was worth getting up for. Cliff the consierge was helpful and was very knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Location, cleanliness, helpful. Conceirge was great. Clean neighborhood. Close to MUNI transportation to anywhere in SF.

review.title: tickety booooooooooo !!!
review.reviewText: friendly obliging staff, comfortable room and bed, convenient location for Alcatraz, Fishermans Wharf, public transport, supermarket and touristy type shops, excellent restaurant, would definitely stay here again - only complaint was mucky bedroom window but otherwise everthing was tickety booooooooo !

review.title: Little Italy in USA
review.reviewText: The hotel located in one of the most vibrating part of San Francisco. Clean, nice comfortable room. Each day between 5-6 pm taste of italian wines gives an unforgottable atmosphere to the hotel. We let know new interresting folks during our stay

review.title: This hotel is in a key location that gives you access to the many attractions in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: This hotel is quiet and accommodates families with young children. It is clean and in a key location which makes it convenient to do things and go back to the room to freshen up.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the evening free wine and nibbles -a chance to talk to fellow guests. Minutes from fishermans wharf/pier 39

review.title: Confortable, quiet, clean room, in good location
review.reviewText: We stayed on the top floor and it was very quiet in the hotel, didnt hear any talking or tv from next door. The staff were friendly although they did not respond to my email prior to going regarding a suprise cake for my partner and when we got there they said happy birthday in advance to him and left a message on my phone which let the game away so didnt bother! The room was pleasant and kept very clean, the tv sound kept going up and down of own accord. Def good value for money and in good location near to the Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location! Rooms were clean and updated. Beds were comfortable. Room with queen size bed was a little small but we were only there when we needed to sleep. Too much to do - only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and very close to Pier 39 as well. Close to the F line street car and a cable car turnaround. The nightly wine tasting was great! Coffee and biscotti in the morning was good too! Good staff, very friendly!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Customer service is excellent. The room was excellent. The location was excellent-very easy to get around from there. The concierge went above and beyond in every instance to make our visit more pleasurable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Wonderful room
review.reviewText: Hotel stay was very nice, cafe attacted also very nice (pricey drinks though) . San Francisco wasn't as great as I thought, rather spend my time in D.C. or a warm beach.

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel in a great location for easy access to all the attractions. Very good restaurant on site and we would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Not so impressed
review.reviewText: Don't room on the first floor. For pets and smokers only. The room smelled like an ashtray and the bathroom like a kennel. Upon moving up to the fourth floor the improvement was significant and more than welcome. The desk service was strictly dependent on who was on duty. Sometimes great, sometimes nothing but attitude. Overall I would give it a 6 out of 10.

review.title: excellent location for exploring SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was admirably run and the room on the third floor was beautifully decorated.The manager's free coffee and tea in the moring and wine in the evenings betwen 5 and 6pm was most acceptable. Just round the corner from the sightseeing buses and one cable car terminus, with plenty taxis and close to tourist shops and wonderful sea food restaurants. Wouldn't hesitate to go back.

review.title: Hotel location perfect for the majority of San Francisco attractions, cable car routes, street cars
review.reviewText: Hotel was facilities and location was excellent, staff very helpful and provided any information required. Hotel location excellent for the majority of San Francisco attractions.

review.title: We Will Definitely Visit Again!
review.reviewText: Truly an enjoyable experience! The concierge was most helpful. Location - PERFECT! We didn't even have to rent a car! We walked everywhere we wanted to go! Very close to public transportation of all sorts if need be. The only complaint we have is that we were told to mention to the restaurant that we were hotel guests and we would receive either a complimentary appetizer or a discount at the discretion of the chef. We ate there 3 times and mentioned the fact that we were guests and never got either. Our dinner meals were FANTASTIC though!

review.title: Brilliant
review.reviewText: We are a retired couple and found this hotel to be excellent. The staff were very helpful, the hotel was clean, the room was comfortable, clean and pleasant. The adjoining restaurant was good for breakfast but evening meals were not to our taste - italian food that we did not particularly like. We would have preferred to see other types of menu. Did not find any other good restuarants nearby - had to walk 10 minutes to the piers where there were excellent restuarants. We really enjoyed the kindness and helpfullness of the local people of Sanfrancisco

review.title: Would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: Everyone on the Hotel Staff was very friendly and helpful during our family stay. The bathroom could have been cleaner; starting to see some mold around grout in shower and the overflow drain of laboratory was dirty and should be cleaned to prevent bacteria.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice staff, clean rooms. Evening wine in the lobby is really nice by the fireplace. Close to Fisherman's Wharf. Very nice overall.

review.title: Felt like home
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel and felt very comfortable. They have great spa amenities and the complimentary wireless in my room was a great help to keep in touch with my family and e-mail them some photos. Evening winetastings were very refreshing and the hotel location is great. Just a few blocks from pier 39 and S. Francisco public transportation. Enjoy.

review.title: Terrific deal
review.reviewText: We got a terrific deal on a one-night stay at this fine hotel. Included were a free wine tasting happy hour and a small buffet breakfast. The on-site restaurant is casual Italian and had an active bar crowd on a week night. The hotel is a very convenient walk to Fisherman's Wharf and easy driving access to major highways.

review.title: A good choice
review.reviewText: Great location, a very brief walk to the wharf. Yes, the rooms are a bit small, but welcome to San Francisco. Walls are on the thin side, but noise isn't too bad. Very comfortable bed and pillows. For the price and location this hotel was a great deal and a nice stay.

review.title: Good Choice for Fisherman's Wharf Area
review.reviewText: Hotel was at a good location for all attractions at Fisherman's Wharf. No rental car was needed - you could walk to all attractions and lots of restaurants. Concierge was very helpful with tips for local restaurants for breakfast and dinner. Hotel restaurant was very good and not too expensive. The only negative I found was the room we had was small althogh it was kept clean and the hotel staff was very accomodating and friendly. Check in was 3 p.m. but our room was ready and we checked in at 1 p.m.

review.title: Prime location and terrific amenities. Loved it!
review.reviewText: A real find for our family! On previous trips I stayed in Union Sq area, which seems OK until you realize that everything you want to see in SF is elsewhere! Quaint, attractive and v. close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Sq and park, Alcatraz cruises (surprisingly good tour), Lombard St (view of SF bay worth the uphill walk!), and cable cars (easy trip to Chinatown or to Union Sq). My boys and I liked the hotel extras--the biscotti and coffee/hot chocolate for breakfast, and the wine/beer/soda reception every evening. Concierges very helpful--use them! We requested a room facing the courtyard, away from the busy street--very quiet! Room rather smallish but totally adequate if you'll spend your days seeing the city. ONLY complaint is tiny bathroom.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Excellent location, staff very friendly and helpful. Room very clean with comfortable bed. Enjoyed the wine tasting eary evening, very nice atmosphere with a chance to meet other guests.

review.title: hotel fine, service was poor on our stay
review.reviewText: hi, Location is good in Warf, as everyone says parking was very expensive $36 a day, started the tab whilst we was unloading with no help for porters they just stood there. Room clean, but small but adequate compared to other best westerns. Maid left our room propped open all day, not best please, staff passed complaint to management, when we cased, had an apology and bottled of wine, but was concerned about security (less said the better :-( ) Wine tasting at 5pm -6pm, make the most of it have a few, good wine great to meet other guest there can be a bit of queue Parking, of arriving at night drive around corner for cheaper parking, safeway is just round the corner, great for stocking up. Breakfast is good for grabbing coffee/tea on go (gf say take your own tea bags to USA). Best place we found to have breakfast was IHOP international house of pancakes(servers a lot more than pancakes) come out the main entrance turn right head 1 or 2 blocks, and one block north towards the harbour. You will queue in a morning but great food and open 24 hours a day.

review.title: Wwould be a great hotel if the restaurant / bar was better
review.reviewText: The decor & cleanliness was very good & in general, the staff were very helpful and friendly. However, we arrived about 10:30pm & could get nothing to eat in the hotel & the person on reception didn't know that there were 2 24hr eateries nearby(we found out later from a taxi driver). Also, I was disappointed that the bar closed at 10pm, had a poor selection & we could not get tea & toast in the afternoon, as that was considered breakfast. Apart from that, the hotel was very nice & proximity to Pier 39 is great, so I would consider staying again.

review.title: Best Western Tuscan Inn
review.reviewText: Very impressed with this Hotel, booked online from UK. Staff are very helpful, rooms are very clean and well decorated. No more than 5 mins walk from Fishermans Wharf , but away from the Hurly Burly. Good transport connections to elsewhere in the city. Overall a gem of a find.

review.title: Decent Hotel for money
review.reviewText: Very nice common areas but the rooms are a bit small. Nice towels. Mattress needed to be replaced. Great Italian restaurant attached to lobby. Close walk to everything on Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with this hotel. The room decor was very nice, the bed was very comfortable, good walking distance to the pier, and the service was outstanding. I felt very welcome there and definitely will stay there again on my next trip!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and we liked the location more than anything, The only downside is the $36 a day parking fee for your car.

review.title: perfect place to stay!
review.reviewText: just got back from a 3 night stay at the tuscan inn and it exceeded all expectations. The hotel is very nice for the price and is a 5 minute walk from fishermans wharf. The free coffee, tea, and hot chocolate with biscotti in the mornings was nice but even better was the wine hour between 5-6. They served california wines and italian beer. Overall i was very satisfied with the hotel and will definately stay here again!!

review.title: Very nice, close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to many of San Francisco's attractions. Wine tasting everyday between 5 and 6. Expensive parking. But, so is most everywhere else in this city. Decent restaurant. One block away from trolley and bus line. Staff is very helpful and pleasent. Coffee and biscotti in the morning. Honor bar in room $$. We went to the Safeway across the street and stocked our fridge. We would stay there again.

review.title: superb location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location very close to Fishermans Wharf. Staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance; buses, trams and cable cars all within easy access. We enjoyed our week there and would consider using again.

review.title: Good value for the money.
review.reviewText: Small room,as to be expected in the big city. If you are there to mainly sleep it is no problem. the bed was very comfortable. Very good hotel, friendly staff and very clean! Great location. Would recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: The consigner was extremely helpful in obtaining tickets and giving good suggestions. The hotel was conveniently located to public transit and within walking distance to many attraction.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf Value thanks to Expedia
review.reviewText: A really nice place to stay with a comfy fireplace-lobby (free wine 5pm to 6pm) plus clean, comfortable rooms which we found to be quite adequate sizes. The Valet Parking was prompt - but not cheap at $36/day (Feb '07). Although the free breakfast is minimal (coffee and biscuits), a very nice breakfast can be purchased in the attached Cafe Pescatore. Wishing to extend my stay, the hotel would only quote the "rack rate", agreeing the best deal would be through Expedia. I therefore used the Internet Computer in the Tuscan's lounge (for a fee) and saved 50% via Expedia.

review.title: very nice.
review.reviewText: Good quality for price. Located central to several key points of interest.

review.title: Good deal at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: A hotel with a friendly staff and a very good location.

review.title: San Fran Fun
review.reviewText: The Hotel location to the Fishermen's Wharf is perfect. Only a few blocks from the action. The only down side to this Hotel is that they charge for parking- $36.00 a day. This charge was not mentioned to us in advance.

review.title: A good hotel
review.reviewText: My room was small, but satisfactory. The location is close to Fisherman's Wharf, and there was a complementary limo to the financial district in the morning, which helped with transportation expenses. The F cable was easy for the other leg of my trips, and there was a variety of restaurants in the vicinity.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideally placed for seeing San Francisco. The staff were pleasant, and the room clean and in good condition. The free early evening wine hour was also very much appreciated. We would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We have been to San Francisco many times and found this to be one of our more relaxing trips. The hotel is nicely located for walking and driving. Staff was kind and helpful. Even though our room was on the first and on the street (with people walking by our window) it was very quiet and the passer-bys could not see in due to the window tinting. The rooms are on the small side and more vanity room in the bathroom would have been nice, but we have stayed in older historical hotels that had much less room and cost much more per night. The wine and beer reception is a very nice touch.

review.title: A Little Gem
review.reviewText: Have stayed at the Tuscan Inn a number of times for both business and pleasure and it never fails to delivery quality service. Yes the rooms are a little small compared to US standards but it more than makes up for it in character and decor, after all you dont come to San Francisco to stay in your room. I personally always ask for high floor rooms that over-look the central court yard, the rooms facing the street can get a little noisy sometimes during the summer.

review.title: Absolutely wonderful
review.reviewText: My wife and I, along with my first cousin and his wife stayed 4 nights. The hotel is fantastic. The location is just 2 blocks from the Fishermans Wharf, so we walked just about everywhere, restaurants, bus tours and the piers. They have happy hour every night from 5:00 to 6:00 P.M. with free pizza and several wines and Peroni beer. We just relaxed in their comfortable lobby area by the fire and had a great time before going out to eat. Alcatraz tour was really nice, as was the Muir Woods/Sausalito tour although we could have skipped the Sausalito part. We did the city bus tour and the Golden Gate Bridge tour in the double decker bus and it was well worth it also. We rented a car for a day and drove down to Pebble Beach and the 17 mile Drive. That was really nice also, on the way back stopped for supper at Half Moon Bay, a small restaurant there off the main hwy but the main street that runs thru town. It is on the inland side of the road near the very north end. The rooms at the hotel are small but very comfortable, terrific beds and pillows. I would definately recommend it.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel didn't provide body lotion, which was a surprise to me and something I would've liked to have.

review.title: Great Hotel in the middle of Action
review.reviewText: You can't go wrong with this hotel. Nice atmosphere, you feel like you're in little hotel in Italy. Wine in the afternoon. Location is just a few blocks from Pier 39. You can take a hop on hop off tour from there, or rent a bike. There's plenty of hotels in Fisherman's wharf but this is my fave. Book here if you are a tourist.

review.title: I'll go back anytime!
review.reviewText: Really good location, a small hotel but really clean and I personally loved the room decoration. Its also just a block from the cable cars and two from the fisherman's warf! I'd recommend it to everyone and I'll go back without thinking it twice.

review.title: Great location, walking distance to waterfront, cable cars, good restaurants
review.reviewText: The location and service of the hotel were great. Our room was on the small size and there wasn't much space in terms of drawers and closet space to put our clothes. Overall we enjoyed our stay and thought it was a nice hotel for the price.

review.title: Great hotel with or without a dog
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Tuscan Inn. Comfortable bed and good size bathroom. We had our dog and they were very friendly and welcoming, like they all owned dogs of their own. The room had a good size umbrella for which we were very grateful. Our room was quiet on a very busy weekend in San Francisco. A bargain for the price.

review.title: Good location.....
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel was excellent for tourists and close enough to all the Fisherman Wharf attractions to walk to them. Rooms were clean and the bed very comfortable. However, the rooms were quite small and the bathroom tiny. The conciere service needs definate improvement. I'm not sure they knew much more about getting around than we did as tourists. Nice staff but outrageous cost of parking in their garage. Better off parking in the public parking across the street.

review.title: Quaint and close
review.reviewText: Love this hotel; it's only two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, shopping, fabulous restaurants and the Cable Car line. Every evening the hotel has free wine in their cozy lobby for guests to gather, relax and chat. The rooms are a little small but clean and comfortable. For the money and convenience I'll go back again and again!

review.title: Location, Location, Location!!!! Very Comfortable beds & pillows.
review.reviewText: Very accommodating staff, bell staff very friendly. The location was prime, the room was perfect, complimentary coffee in the morning a big plus! We have already recommended the Tuscan Inn to all our family and friends!!!!

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We had stayed here once before and was impressed with the cleanliness and excellent condition of the hotel. Also the staff was very accommodating and helpful. Its close proximity to Fisherman's Wharf and reasonable rates were what attracted us the first time. Everyone should know the rooms are on the small side, but comfortable. Mattresses could be updated. Complimentary coffee and biscotti in the mornings and the wine reception at cocktail hour are also nice touches. The attached Pescatore restaurant is excellent.

review.title: It is just a special place and the location is fabulous!
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn has a unique quality about it - just a little different in decor and style that makes you feel you are really getting away from it all, but everything is so close. It is wonderful to walk just a block or so and be right at the wharf, or at the cable car starting point or to pickup a streetcar. The rooms are small, but well planned and clean. The restaurant next door is convenient,the food is good and very cosmopolitan and fun. We feel like this is "our hotel" when we go to San Francisco!

review.title: absolutely fantastic!
review.reviewText: the best western tuscan inn was fabulous. this was my fourth trip to san francisco, but my first time staying at fisherman's wharf. the hotel is two blocks from the wharf and was a great place to stay. hotel staff was friendly & helpful. my room was clean & quiet. there's a cafe next door that gives discounts to those staying at the tuscan inn. i definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Very nice for the price
review.reviewText: We had an enjoyable time, the hotel was very nice. The only problems that I could see/hear was that the air conditioner ran a little rough and woke us up a couple times in the middle of the night, but I imagine that would be a very room-specific problem. We were only 4 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39, and these are the real blocks, not the downtown 1/3 of a mile long city blocks, so it was a very easy walk to a lot of restaurants, activities, nightlife, etc. Ghirardelli Square is also within walking distance.

review.title: Nice Place!
review.reviewText: I heard hotel rooms in San Francisco were tiny...This room was certainly large enough. Bathroom space was small though, although I wasn't there to spend time in the bathroom...Nice decor,very clean. Concierge very helpful. Great location.Bed was too hard for me...but maybe better for others! I'd go back in a flash for the $$$$.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: My family loved the room cleanliness and scent of cleanliness. The location is convenient by Muni Trans to AT&T stadium and Union Square. It takes approx. 20 mins. to the stadium.

review.title: Impressed,
review.reviewText: everything is in walking distance "Perfect"!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great central location. The rooms and service was outstanding. The only negative was the noise coming from the street at night. Enough noise to wake you up in the middle of the night. I would stay in the hotel again but in one of the rooms facing the courtyard.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I wanted to stay at the Wharf because I had my child with me, but was worried about the noise. I was street side, 3rd floor, but didn't hear any noise at night. The rooms were a little small but very clean. The only issue I had, and it is small, is that the hotel uses shutters and not blinds on the windows. So in the morning the room was a little bright if you like to sleep past 7:00 AM (July).

review.title: Convenient to everything.
review.reviewText: Helpfull staff, very friendly and knowledgeable. Clean comfortable rooms and the wine tasting in the early evening is a nice touch as is the coffee and biscotti in the morning, but why they leave the New York Times, instead of a local newspaper, outside of the room is beyond me.

review.title: Great location. Walking distance to many things. Will go back.
review.reviewText: Very impressed with the hotel. Great room size with great decor. Kept clean, smelled good and very pleasant atmosphere from everyone we met there. Kids said it was the best hotel! Loved the convenient for being able to walk to almost everything - Wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli, cable car stop, restaurants, Walgreens. Used the hotel parking. Had a minor issue with parking one night but it was solved immediately.

review.title: Great weekend getaway hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very pleasant and helpful with ideas for tourist. The rooms were small, but decorated nicely. Beautiful gardens, great location walking distance to all main attractions in Fishermans Wharf area. Parking was expensive, so be prepared. Great hotel overall would recommend to others

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The wine tasting in the afternoon a nice touch. Can't beat the location.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We live 60 minutes from San Francisco and have been going there for years. We just wanted a simple get away. We were just disappointed at how run down and dirty the Fisherman's Wharf area has become. We also had a bad experience at the Hotel Restaurant. Extremely slow service and the food was not very good. I would say the Best Western Tuscany was just O.K. Not exceptional.

review.title: Very Helpful
review.reviewText: I was extremely pleased with the hotel-the location, the staff and the general comfort of the room. I would stay there again-without thinking twice about it!!!

review.title: I would stay here again
review.reviewText: This was a really nice place to stay. Real comfortable beds and a bigger bathroom .

review.title: Great Loocation
review.reviewText: Choose this hotel on a friends recommendation and it proved good advice. A nice location just two blocks from Fishermans wharf and the same distance from the cable car. Rooms are comfortable and service excellent. Added touch for our stay was the wine tasting hour at 5pm. The only negative point was the breakfast menu was a little expensive however this is easily solved by going to one of the many other establishments in the area. Overall an enjoyable stay.

review.title: After a Rough Start at the Tuscan Inn - Things Smoothed out!
review.reviewText: The Tuscan Inn was overbooked when we first arrived. We were told we had to find another hotel because we booked through Expedia there was no guarantee we'd have a room. Since I had reviewed my email showing the confirmation/reservation and billing to my credit card, I objected. The Hotel Manager moved us to another hotel for the night, upgraded our room and provided us lunch and cab fare. After a rough start, everything smoothed out as our vacation portion of our trip was looking up. We enjoyed having a courtyard room (quiet as compared to on-street rooms), restaurant was FANTASTIC! Breakfast, lunch or dinner is excellent. Location of hotel is two block walk from Pier 39 and right on the muni bus line. I would recommend returning to this hotel but make sure you get there early and confirm your reservation prior to arrival!!

review.title: A Real Gem - Location and Service
review.reviewText: Hotel staff and their helpfulness far exceeded that of 26 state driving vacation from East Coast as far west to Utah last summer. Location was great, easy walk to warf area, cable car, trolly and taxi readily available. Although room was somewat on small side, it was attended to in a very professional manner every day of our stay. This was a great tourist vacation stop. Experienced difficulty setting up printing of my boarding pass for return flight via my laptop from my room. This was overcame quickly by front desk attendant with no difficulty.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay but the room was small. We requested a blanket be brought to the room our first night upon arrival and never did receive one throughout our five night stay. Don't count on the morning coffee as a breakfast, very skimpy. The evening wine offering was nice and very generous. Overall, we would stay here again due mostly to the proximity to attractions and ease of transportation. That is of course, why we visited!!!

review.title: Will Stay There Again
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was ideal. It's within walking distance from all the attractions and sights of Fisherman's Wharf. Other sights and neighborhoods (Ghiradelli Square, North Beach, etc) are easy to get to via cable cars, taxi, or public transportation. We loved the fact that we could go out and explore and return to the hotel to drop off bags, relax or freshen up before dinner. Although our room was a bit small, it was clean and nicely decorated. The staff at the front desk, the concierge, and the housekeeping staff were all very polite and helpful. It rained one afternoon and the hotel gave us umbrella's to use. They have complementary coffee, tea, and hot chocolate in the morning and in the evening they have a complementary wine/beer tasting. It's great! Although the hotel is not that far from the SF airport, the shuttle back to the airport took an hour and 15 minutes because they pick up other people along the way. It's much cheaper than a taxi but you'll have to plan your hotel departure with this in mind. If you like the Blues, there's a cozy bar/restaurant with live Blues music every night on Pier 47. Went there every night we were in town. If you plan to visit Alcatraz, I recommend you buy your tickets ahead of time online...will save you time. We will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Could be better
review.reviewText: In a city where competition among hotels is pretty stiff, Best Western Tuscan Inn can do much better. We reserved two rooms and since there were going to be 3 adults staying in one of the rooms, we were charged extra for the third guest, but were also told that a rollaway bed will be provided for the 3rd guest. When we checked in, hotel staff told us that the rollaway bed would not be provided, so the three guests had to share two double beds in one of the rooms and we were never refunded the extra charge for the 3rd guest. The maintenance of the hotel can be improved as well -- the toiletries in our room were never replaced after we checked in; also, the phone in our room never worked (thank goodness for cell phones). The rooms are tiny and there was street construction right outside the hotel when we stayed there, so it was pretty loud during our entire stay. We were also charged an arm and a leg for nightly parking -- valet was the only option (no self-parking) and the daily rate was quite steep. The location of the hotel is great, close to all the tourist hot spots.

review.title: Very Convenient
review.reviewText: The only problem is not having a pool.

review.title: very satisfied with the Tuscan
review.reviewText: excellent restaurant next door,

review.title: Great, Affordable Place to stay in San Fran....
review.reviewText: What a great hotel! For the price, it was a great value. It has an ideal location for vacationing in San Francisco. While the room was a bit small, it was clean, and current in its decor. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The restaurant adjoining the property was FANTASTIC. Can't wait to take the family there again.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time, the hotel services are terrific. Meeting with the other guests in the evening talking about are days was great. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Good for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location. Charming for the price.

review.title: Left a nice impression
review.reviewText: This Hotel was worth the money. Hotel room was nicely decorated. and the beds were so comfortable I could have slept longer, But had too many sights to see! Would stay there again!

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Tuscan Inn in Jan 06. It's in a good location, 2 blocks back from Fishermans Wharf, and a block away from the cable car. The rooms are standard sized, tidy. They have free coffee available in the lobby in the mornings, and wine in the evenings, with a doorway through to a good Italian restaurant.

review.title: Excellent Service!
review.reviewText: The people at the hotel were exceptional! Friendly, courteous and most accommodating. Will definitely be back again!

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: Loved the location of this hotel. Easy walking to Pier 39, Wharf, Cannery, all the sights. Would have rated the hotel a 5 on quality of service if not for the concierge. He is totally arrogant and condescending. Overcharged us for the ride from hotel to airport and wouldn't even listen to me when trying to correct the situation. Every time I needed to get information from him, I left feeling angry.

review.title: Good location at the wharf
review.reviewText: Over all the staff in the hotel were all very helpful and polite. Confident having the italian cafe next door but alittle pricey. The room was quite small but nice. The toilet was not flushing good but maint came real quick. Enjoyed the happy hour in the hotel lobby. Very confident having safeway and walgreens across the street. Had a great stay.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The room was a little small, but it was a good experience. In the city, however, space is a valued commodity, so it was well worth it.

review.title: will stay here again
review.reviewText: I dont like shower curtains. You can never get rid of that musky mildew smell. Room was a little small, but it's just to sleep in.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: This is just a great little hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Close to everything. Bus stop on the two opposite corners. Just blocks from Street Cars. Grocery store, book store, and wine shops in next block. Staff went out of their way to accomodate. Hotel clean and looked liked recently redone. Easy pickup for airport transfers. Free coffee, wine in the afternoon. I would highly recommend the Tuscan Inn. And to the lady who commented that the rooms were small, she apparently hasn't been to Europe. And I loved the WIFI access for my laptop.

review.title: Tuscan Inn very comfortable
review.reviewText: A nice place to stay and convenient to the wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli etc. We would return any time. The only thing I would see different is more seating available during the 5:00 pm happy hour.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The down side: Our non-smoking room obviously was a smoking room at one time, and still had some stale aftersmell. A locked cabinet under the TV set had water leaking from it which left a wet spot on the carpet, but housekeeping did remedy the leak while we were out. The toilet stopped up twice for no apparent reason--messy, but again housekeeping responded promptly. No one followed up to see if the problems were remedied to our satisfaction. The up side: Perfect walking distance to main tourist areas--the Wharf, trolleys, Ghirardelli Square, great restaurants. Nice complimentary wine in the evening, coffee & biscotti in the morning. Small but nicely appointed rooms. I had requested help from the hotel with a small honeymoon surprise for my new husband upon our arrival, and were greeted by a (complimentary) bottle of champagne in our room; appreciated the personal touch. I would definitely recommend this hotel if guests could be sure of not getting a room with so many "issues." Management needs to follow up when there are problems.

review.title: Loved it! Highly recommend!
review.reviewText: The location is fantastic - just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, and everything is nearby. There is a grocery store and a drug store across the street. From the hotel we walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 30, The Cannery, Ghirardelli Square, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, Chinatown, and many other locations. The staff is courteous and professional, and the concierge is very helpful. The hotel has a nice boutique feel to it, partly due to the lobby with fireplace, wine tasting every evening, and biscotti for breakfast. The rooms are extremely clean and have windows that actually open to the outside. We had a courtyard view of trees and flowers. Our room was furnished in tones of dark red and black, including a bolster pillow and shams. The hallways are clean and nicely lit to add to the boutique feel. The hotel is eco-friendly, which I liked. They only change your sheets and towels everyday if you request. If you don't want them changed, they still remake and clean the room. The towels were nice sized and thick, and there were plenty of them. The shower head was up pretty high which is great for tall travelers. There was also a curved curtain which allows you more room when showering. I especially liked the aromatherapy bath soap, lotion, shampoo, and conditioner. We got a great night's sleep due to the comfortable bed and quiet. We never heard a sound from other rooms besides the door next to ours opening and closing.

review.title: Very pleased with this hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was located close to everything we wanted to see at the wharf. We walked almost everywhere.

review.title: Great location but the rooms are small!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was in a great location on the wharf. Easy access to everything. The only bad part of the hotel is the size of the rooms. They are extremely small.

review.title: The place to stay at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Although our room was not ready at 3pm check-in time, and we had to pay for a cab to get us to the theatre in time, we had a pleasant stay.

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: It was clean and nice... very close the the wharf.. walking distance to anywhere. Gentleman at the counter was rather rude to me (and I paid) but kept addressing my husband and even handed my credit card back to my husband after taking it from me. Not a nice guy.

review.title: great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We loved the location.  Coffee and biscotti in the morning, wine time in the afternoon were a treat.  The concierge was very helpful.  Our room was quite small, but we loved the hotel and the room was comfortable, just small.  We would definitely stay at the Tuscan Inn again.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The location couldn't have been better. We were near the wharf and the cable car line. The hotel was newly remodeled and the staff was very knowledgeable of local resturants, breakfast cafes, pubs, and nightlife.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is very quiet, comfortable, beautiful and is in a great location - well within walking distance to most attractions.  The staff is very friendly and the concierge is extremely knowledgable, professional, and eager to please.  The hotel drawbacks:  we chose this hotel because it had breakfast - the 'breakfast' is meager. It may be more important to stay at a hotel with a gym facility.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText:
I took the advice of another poster and requested an inside garden room . . . very quiet (except for the "active" neighbors :).

Unfortunately, we never made it to the wine/beer hour, but I overheard other guests raving about their time.

We stayed four nights and were able to walk just about everywhere.  No need to rent a car.

review.title: Small but comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very courteous and friendly - The morning coffee and afternoon wine was very nice.  The convenience to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Would stay there agian if we ever go back
review.reviewText: Great service. Great Location !!

review.title: Mixed Bag
review.reviewText: San Francisco deserves it's title of Favorite Vacation Destination in the USA. This property has a nice convenient location for Fisherman's Wharf and many business activities. Just leave the car and walk. Wireless internet in the rooms works well enough. Our room was quiet and the entire facility was clean enough. The decorations are cute, but my Italian business partner was a bit taken back by some of the corny Italian-themed items, per esampio "Cafe Pescatore" translates to Fisherman's coffee, and would an odd name for a restaurant in Italy. But this is a nice looking budget hotel and the staff are very low quality. They have a concierge and valet parking, but no one to tend to other important details. Surely housekeeping noticed that our loose plastic toilet seat moves four inches to each side and that the sink drain was jammed shut while they were cleaning. They would not give us a duplicate receipt for our business expense report, for some reason. Only the earliest guests receive coffee and biscotti in the morning, and afternoon snacks, even during the slow season. And I had no idea that Napa offered such cheap wines (for the hotel's complimentary tasting), and I have lived here for 50 years! This website talks about a special offer if a guest finds the Inn red crab mascot plastic windup toy slightly hidden in their room. Ours was broken, and the special offer was that they tried to sell it to me as a souvenir. A fitting end to our Friday through Sunday morning stay.

review.title: nice place to stay on the pier
review.reviewText: nice centralized location on the wharf.cheapest over night parking next door.we payed 15 dollars a night .half the rate of any other lot.

review.title: A merely adequate hotel
review.reviewText: Romm arrangements and decor indifferent. Tiny bedside tables. ADvertised breakfast buffet nonexistent (coffee only). Information on local attractions inadequate. Overpriced for the accommodations and services delivered.

review.title: Impressed and like hotel... can't/won't afford the parking any longer!
review.reviewText: The hotel is great...  I am a Kimpton fan and I love the wharf area...  but the parking has gone up the last three times I have stayed there.  I will not be staying there again...  because of what parking costs.

review.title: We enjoyed the stay, overall.
review.reviewText: We did not like to pay valet service in hotel, we had to pay $ 33.00 per day! We did not have alternative, but pay in he end. Very expensive for 3 star hotel. This was only thing we did not like there. Thanks Paulo.

review.title: Will defenitely go back
review.reviewText: The hotel is very customer oriented.  The rooms are large and comfortable.  They provide coffee/tea service in the room as well as coffee/tea and biscotti service in the lobby in the morning.  The hotel also provides an umbrella in the room, just in case its raining outside.  The hotel is conveniently located to the wharf and the tram station.  They have an Italian Restaraunt that serves an incredible breakfast or dinner meal.  The lobby has a comfortable fireplace with lounge chairs for reading, relaxing or having coffee.  Overall, I would rate the hotel excellent for the price we paid.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel, staff was very friendly and helpful.  The resturaunt had some of the best food in town and again the waits staff was wonderful.  The beds are the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in.  This trip was a second honeymoon for my wife and I and it couldn't have been any better.

review.title: Big Hotel Service, Cozy Inn Feel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, 2 blocks from Fishermen's Wharf, and about 10 minutes walk to North Beach and Chinatown.  Comfortable, cozy rooms and friendly hotel personnel.  Every night they have wine and beer hour in the lobby where you can mingle with other hotel guests by the crackling fire before heading out to dinner.  The hotel also has an Italian restaurant attached.

review.title: Enjoyed the wine
review.reviewText: A very pleasurable stay.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  Though the hotel and rooms were smaller than anticipated, our room was fully stocked with amenities and the down comforter was a plus.  The restaurant was excellent, although the breakfasts are a bit overpriced.  We enjoyed the nightly complimentary wine.  Not only was the wine excellent, but we met some wonderful people and had a nice time socializing.

review.title: Excelent for a Honeymoon
review.reviewText: This guys in the hotel were so kindly with us, we were in our honeymoon and the treatment they gave us was extraordinary, including they gave us a room upgrade completly free. The hotel is so comfortable.

review.title: A sweet find on Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, friendly, fireplace in sitting room, very cozy, delicious coffeee in morning, wine in the evenig, You feel like a special guest. Pescatore Restaurant connected to hotel food delicious

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to Pier 39 and wonderful restaurants!

review.title: This is the place to stay!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located so close to Fisherman`s Wharf / Alcatraz / Pier 39, you don`t need to drive anywhere.  The main trollycar line is just two blocks away as well as the old fashion trolly bus system. Ride them all day for $9.00 you can get a pass at the front desk.
Our room was very nice and comfortable. Try to make time for the free wine tasting every night at 5pm, after all the tours it is a welcome rest. Right next door is a Supermarket so you can get a snack or any need you may have. EXPEDIA made a fantastic vacation possible, my deal was super great!!!!

review.title: Perfect San Francisco Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: We returned to the Tuscan Inn in the days before Thanksgiving after visiting many years ago this time taking Amtrak from San Diego (picked up the Coast Starlight in Los Angeles) and avoiding the long drive and steep parking garage charge. The hotel staff greeted us warmly upon our very late arrival and we were in our very quiet interior room in minutes. It is a superior Best Western inn. Its location is central to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square and just a short safe walk to the North Beach area and the cable car lines. You can easily access the very inexpensive streetcar system which runs the Embarcadero area.  We cannot wait to go back again in the spring.

review.title: Great Location, close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel to stay at.

review.title: Room Setup
review.reviewText: The pictures of the room on expedia.com defy the true size of the rooms.  they were much smaller than anticipated and the funiture was set up in ways that you had to sort of slink around things.

review.title: My stay at the Tuscan
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling for business or travel. All the employees were courteous, the rooms were very comfortable, and the location is incredible. The complimentary coffee and biscotti's in the morning and the complimentary wine tasting everyday between    5 -6 was just outstanding. The whole lobby filled with guests and the atmosphere was more like a nice B&B instead of a hotel

review.title: Tuscan Inn
review.reviewText: Since this hotel is located 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, get an inside room---a room overlooking the small courtyard.  So you don't have a great view---not hearing the traffic is a much better deal!  Our room on the second floor facing the courtyard was very quiet.

review.title: continental breakfast
review.reviewText: continental breakfast consisted of broken biscotti

review.title: Very nice place
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent Oct 16-20 at the Tuscan Inn and found it very nice.The location was perfect. The room was small but very clean and nicely done. Staff was friendly and the concierge even produced a pair of "City Passes" someone had turned in and those allowed us to ride any bus, trolley or cable car for free. The biscotti breakfast snack was nice, as was the wine in the late afternoon. I would definitely stay at the Tuscan Inn again.
